review: Camera felt cheap. The plastic case was a very thin plastic. They way it was assembled allowed some of the plastic to shatter at some point in the manufacture to when it arrive. The box was not damaged but there was shattered plastic in the internal packaging that contained the camera in its protective case.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Very poor user manual. No information about lens swapping for Telephoto or wide angle, etc., instructions.,The Camera takes decent pictures overall. I have not yet  experimented with the video. The threads on the camera lenses are a little on the rough side.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: The camera is light and cute, but takes terrible pictures. There is no way to adjust anything to get sharper pictures.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: So I ordered this for a study abroad trip and once I got the camera, I thought okay looks simple, easy to use. It is, it’s also very light and made of plastic on the outside. Comes with a wide lense which is cool. So far everything is decent for the price. However when I started filming and taking pictures I was incredibly disappointed. The quality is worse than my iPhone 6s, which is saying a lot because my phones quality isn’t the greatest. That alone had me send it back for a refund because I’d rather use my cameras phone than a poor quality camera. :/ sorry, if they improved the quality on this thing, it may be worth the price. Otherwise, I’d recommend looking elsewhere. Really disappointed.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: My niece is going to Korea and I elected to get her a camera for the trip. I know most people use their phones to take pictures but I figured a camera would be a nice back up to have. I did some looking and I came across this vlogging camera at a decent price. I had it shipped to myself to make sure everything was good and user friendly and this is what I found. 1) you need a memory card. That’s pretty much given with any camera and luckily I had one laying around. 2) the extra battery is an awesome bonus! 3) the main thing is the user face is easy to use and takes decent pictures. I uploaded some to my computer to see the quality and they look great! Everything thing is super well packaged and the flip out screen is awesome for getting selfies.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I really liked the vintage feel and appearance of this camera. But the technology in it is pretty up to date. The picture quality was great and the build quality of the camera was good too. I wish it had touch screen as well which would make it even better.,It also came with an extra set of wide angle lens which is easy to install onto the camera. You can also send pictures via a wifi hotspot which is useful to quickly post pics to social media via your phone. It takes an sd card which is not included and also has hdmi cable(small port) outlet to connect to your tv.,Overall its a product that is a bang for your buck and you can get it if you are looking for a inexpensive but quality camera.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: It's a good little camera! It takes great pictures for its price,and it's lightweight and easy to set up for use.It's useful for life or take to trave, as a thankgive gift,My grandmom likes it so much.  This camera is small and lightweight,easy to put it into the bag. Would recommend it for the price and quality!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I bought this on for a trip as a very inexperienced photographer. I happily started snapping pictures until I realised that those that I took with my Samsung S9 phone were of far superior quality. I reverted to just using it for videos, but a camcorder I obtained did a significantly more fantastic job.  I ended up not using it at all for the rest of the trip, or for nothing else afterwards for that matter. Would recommend if you are not looking for serious High Quality pictures... The bundle was good though...

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Was a little disappointed, I expected it to be a little bigger. Got it to replace my Sony Cybershot because of its picture quality and hard to find replacement chargers. But the Canon takes decent pictures, just takes way too long to actually snap the picture, you are liable to lose your 'picture perfect' shot. Trying to work my way through all the menu and function options which are not being user friendly but in all fairness I have only briefly looked through the manual. But all in all, I find it a bit on the pricey  side.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: We purchased these items for our early childhood center as we are not allowed to have cell phones out, however we like to capture activities with our kids so we bought these cameras. They have worked great and come in handy in and out of the classrooms. The picture quality is not bad but of course if you are used to using cell phones it can't compare. It's a nice alternative though and of good quality overall. We bought 4 of them.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The shipping was great - well packed and arrived ahead of schedule.  Problem is I need a simple point and shoot camera to replace my old one.  This one took me an hour just to install the battery and memory card and set the date and time.  I downloaded all 111 pages of the manual to get this far.  The directions are not good - says to use the  < > keys which I can not locate -- I wish could have bought it from a camera store - none available here - so I could get in person help.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Received the complete package of camera and accessories as promised. The Canon camera was easy to set up and the pictures turned out beautiful. The easiest point and shoot camera I have ever had. Also, downloading both the operating manual and software was just as easy as downloading the pictures to my computer.,The small size of this camera makes it convenient to carry around in your pocket or a ladies purse.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Easy to use, great photos, and small enough to easily take everywhere I go. The seller is great and followed up on the package after it was sent!!!!!!  I will definitely purchase from The Imaging World again when I am in the market for similar products!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Finally a quality camera, easy to handle and understand. No fumbling around with Android, especially for us older maybe not so savvy with cell phones and also not constantly with our noses stuck into one. This is a handy little camera for those of us who are aware of our surroundings and wish to capture this very special moment, maybe even as a video. All of this at a most reasonable price!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The camera works great and takes nice pictures, BUT the drive to download them stopped working after the first time I tried it!  It is frustrating because it didn't come with a USB cord to hook up to the computer, so I had to purchase one separately, so I am pretty frustrated with my purchase!  What good is a camera when you can't do anything with the pictures!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The booklet that came with it had very little information.  To get a manual, I had to go to the Canon website and down load a 200+ page manual.  I wish that the instruction booklet had at lea some information about what each button was for and how to use them.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The accessories that came with the kit, specifically the Imaging World card reader, do not work. It does not come with a cable (although there is a spot on the camera for one) so getting the photos off the card is a challenge.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I had been looking at numerous point and shoots for the last few months. The size and price of this item was the positive, but the quality of the photos is terrible. No matter what setting and different amounts of light, the clarity of the photos does not live up to even my smartphone camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I bought this camera to replace my old Sony Cybershot which had lasted 7 years.  I should have waited and saved for a better quality camera.  I use my camera to take product photos of the hand fabricated jewelry I design.  The shutter is a lengthy distance from where I hold the camera thus, I sometimes "miss" pushing it all the way down.  It's an awkward design for my hands.  Also, the camera shell is very plastic.  I know that this is the norm now but, my last 2 Sony Cybershot cameras didn't feel so cheap.,The resolution, on the highest setting available for this model, is sub-par.  Unlike the last two Sony Cybershot cameras I have had, this model doesn't handle low light well at all.,Having written this review, I must say that if one were going to use a camera for something like casual family captures, it's probably acceptable.  I did myself a disservice by not doing more research with this model.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I read the reviews that talked about slow response times and thought I'm not taking pictures of kids, it won't be a problem. I couldn't have been more WRONG.  I can't tell you the number of photos I have missed because I had the camera in my lap, picked it up to point and click, and its little brain was still trying to determine what the lighting was supposed to be.  And don't think, "well the lighting is off on that one, I'll take another right away". Nope, it is really a 5-sec delay between photos  I invested not only in this camera but and extra battery and battery charger.  After missing photo opportunities on two "one-in-a-lifetime" trips, I'm cutting my losses.  Seriously, it's cheap but spend the extra and get a responsive camera.  You'll be happier.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The video and photos are what I would expect for a 720p, maybe less. The photos are average. Spend more and get a 4K compact because this Sony feels more like a toy and I expected more for the money. The strange thing is that the monitor showed a very blurry picture that would not auto focus but the picture file was very clear. The monitor viewing angle is too narrow. No viewfinder.,No problems using the cable to transfer pics and charge the battery.,The camera is slippery and the battery drains unusually fast, even with the 1300 mAh upgrades!,The supplied battery is only 600 mAh. Rubberized coating paint would have been better.,I would not buy this cam again.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This is a good pocket-sized, cheap camera that takes excellent colored pictures even when used by a beginner like me.,However, I've downgraded it because if you want a printed manual you will be tempted to either pay the absurd $55 that Sony charges for a disk that includes the PDF file for the current manual, or to go to a site that claims to have a free copy of the manual available for download if you will install DocToPDF software on your computer.,Fortunately, I did a search for reviews of that software before downloading it, and learned that it is basically spyware that takes over your browser and also installs malicious software on your computer. Do a search on "DocToPDF reviews," and you'll see what I mean. I can't imagine why Sony has not gone after this site to protect its customers and prevent infringement of its copyrights.,There is a workaround: Sony does permit a free download of a 2013 manual for an earlier version of the Cybershot that is close enough to the features of the current version to be usable, but Amazon won't allow me to include the link in my review.  Search on "Sony DSW830 help guide" and then click through the hits until you find a link to the manual with a 2013 copyright date.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Didn't like that I had to find specific instructions online for the memory card (YouTube). However, the pictures are better than my android. I'm very happy with this camera. It's easy to learn, and I'd recommend it to anyone wanting a simple, inexpensive but decent camera. I purchased from amazon warehouse deals. Supposedly it had some "scratches" on the bottom. Didn't notice those. Great deal, though!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Not good quality for point and shoot.  There was also a delay between taking pics and delay focusing.  I think there is something wrong with mine so I sent it back.  Not sure if anyone else had these issues.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: It's possible my expectations are too high for the price, but although I don't usually have a problem with the photos themselves, the build quality on the camera has been disappointing. It's only six months old, and the shutter button and the lens both wobble. (The lens wobble is noticeable when the camera is closed; it doesn't affect the quality of the photos.) It also occasionally struggles to find the right lighting when you're taking a picture soon after turning it on, providing wildly overexposed shots. And be warned that once it's claiming anything but a full battery (four bars out of four), it's going to start dropping fast.,It takes fine pictures and doesn't cost much, making it acceptable for occasional use, especially if you'd expect to need more zoom than you'd get from a cellphone camera. But I'm otherwise not impressed, and it isn't holding up well physically.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Had this camera for 6 months. Many problems. The button to turn it On/Off was not very responsive and had to be pressed several times. The telescoping lens would not open fully at times requiring the camera be turned off then back on. This happened a lot. Once I turned on the flash but decided to not take the photo and I turned the camera off. Next day when I turned the camera on it would freeze and the screen would tell me to turn it off then back on. Did this several times. Tried turning off the flash and it finally worked again. Software issue? If I turned on the flash I used it and could then turn it off and on with no problem. Still under warranty but I'm going to dump it and try another brand. I want small handy pocket camera to keep with me. This Sony Cybershot was good size and took good photos but had too many aggravating mechanical issues with button and lens.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: So far, I am in love with my camera. I do wish it would take night photos. Apart from this, it takes FANTASTIC shots, great, sharp, well defined on all levels. I am impressed w/how easy it is to use. I got this b/c it has a 'steady' feature which is good for me as my hands shake sometimes. This camera keeps your pics from being blurry due to that issue. I DO however, (despite loving the item) wish it were just a TAD larger b/c it's so small (which is a + for some) that my aching hands/fingers sometimes have difficulty holding it or using it as it is so slim. Otherwise, I'd give it 6 stars if I could!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Regular point and shot, without zoom, are good, clear and natural. The bundle has many nice things. But any photos taken on zoom were blurred, indistinct and seemingly without the aid of any image stabilisation. I sent the camera back after 1 day of field testing and will order the Cannon SX730HS.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: the camera is defective!  It will not return on and no buttons etc work.  I charged the battery as directed.  The compartment where the battery goes does not close either!  I was thrilled when i saw it as the size was perfect for my use.  I am so disappointed as i wanted it for a cruise i am going on this weekend!!!,Please let me know what you can do for me!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Camera didn't power on. Defective right out of the box. (Yes, we charged the batteries!)  Had to return.  Shoddy product.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I'm very disappointed in the picture quality.  I usually shoot photography with my Nikon 5500D but I wanted a small camera to fit in my pocket.  My cell phone pictures actually turn out better than this camera.  I tried all the settings (preset and manual), but I'm very disappoint.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Bought this camera for a vacation. Comes with a lot of stuff ! Battery life was great. Quality is good, would definitely recommend.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Bought this as a gift for my niece who is going to be traveling to Paris.  Haven't used it yet.  I've used Canon's before & they are a great camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Very nice camera.  Takes nice pictures and very clear.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: A lot of extras with this compact camera - a great bundle for the money.  I have an SLR, but don't want to drag a big camera while traveling, so this small camera is perfect & takes quality pictures.  This is a great deal for the money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: We use this camera for capturing casual/unrehearsed moments while traveling. The wide variety of settings, the beautiful zoom, the enhancements all combine to produce wonderful memories.,This is a recent purchase, so we still have more to learn.,Only one minor problem....the wrist strap in this package did not fit the camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: My daughter loves her camera. We were so surprised with how much came with this kit. Definitely worth it.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I'm a Youtuber. I need somethings good and can be underwater. But i dont have a lot money. After searching, i found this camera. Its fit my hand and so easy to use. i had read it can submersible up to 10 Feet in depth waterproof without casing for one hour per time. and i dont believe it. But now i have used and very satisfied.,Good digital camera with best price

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Bought this cam for my holiday in Asia, was going to buy a gopro but its far too expensive, so i bought this with a reasonable price but has similar function. Its waterproof, compact and come with all the bit and pieces, and do what an action cam should do. Don't forget to buy a mini SD tho. It doesn't come with it. Charge with USB cable, can connect to my power bank.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: The quality of the camera was very good. In order to test whether it was really waterproof, it was put in the basin for a period of time.It's a good product. I can use it safely.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I never write reviews but this camera was GREAT! I'm picky about my shots but needed a waterproof camera for vacation so took a risk and bought this Double Screen Waterproof Camera. Great pics underwater and out of water shots! Easy to use & to upload photos once home. No water leaked inside. Battery lasted 5 days and it comes with a spare.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: i had Just received it from the delivery. it's so beautiful. immediately i jumped into my swimming pool to try it. And i felt so good. The camera is so easy to use and you can't know how the quality of picture is. Now i can take a lot underwater picture with this perfect product. So love it.,Try it if you love beautiful picture

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I love this camera. I did not expect a camera like this to be low priced, waterproof, and still be a quality camera. Everything about it is wonderful. I tested it a few times and everything worked perfectly fine. Overall, this is a good low-budget camera and nothing to complain about.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Very good cost-benefit relation. You pay a few dollars for a very good product. It has everything for a perfect picture in the beach. And real beautiful colors , especially teal, under the sun.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: i  am the one love photograph so much. And many times i try to take underwater picture but i didn't try yet. And when i have this product, i can take a lot of beautiful picture. And i love them. SO beautiful.,The camera is so easy to use. And it's cheap more than i thought. Love it.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: The camera looks very cute. Bought this cam for the pool party. It worked great with water proof feature. But you have to be aware it doesn't come with the SD card. Got to pay extra to get it prepared. Picture quality is decent. In summary it's a very nice product with cute appearance.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: The camera is very good quality, waterproof, can be used underwater. The picture quality is very good. The size of the camera is not big, it is very convenient to carry. I usually put it in my bag, it is not very heavy. The operation is very simple. I really like it.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I got for my mom as a Christmas present. The screen is almost too small to see. The picture quality on the screen looks very blurry. Buttons are very tiny, difficult for an older person to use. Haven't processed any pics yet. I would have returned it, but the Amazon 30 day return policy does not allow enough time for holiday gifts to be sent, wrapped, opened and returned, within 30 days.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: The pictures are not great quality, it seems to have issues with trying to take vertical photos as well. Also the video is AWFUL. When you try to watch it on your computer later (no matter what format you try) it is choppy, skips, the audio will continue, but the video will lag. It is absolutely impossible to play back a video and see the whole thing. Terrible camera.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I am not a photographer and just wanted a point and shoot.  This camera has every type of setting so I just set it to auto mode and the pictures are beautiful.  The pictures are clear with the appropriate lighting.  Love it and would highly recommend it.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: (See updates below this original review.),This is a great little instamatic type pocket camera as long as you use rechargeable batteries and don't mind charging them frequently. Of course it's nowhere near the quality of a DSL camera, but the price (especially when discounted) is a lot less as well. The camera didn't work in cold weather when all my other electronic devices work just fine. However, that was with the cheap batteries that came with the camera. The camera does go through good renewable batteries quite quickly, however--more quickly than my other cameras do.,Update after I've used the camera a while: I was having to recharge the almost-new, name brand rechargeable AA batteries in a high quality charger (i.e., I knew the batteries and charger were both good) after taking only around a dozen shots. So I called Kodak's support and was told rechargeable need to be at least 2300 mAh (milli-amps). So if you use rechargeables and find they drain too quickly with this camera, check the mAh reading. The support woman suggested trying new Energizer or Duracell non-rechargeable (i.e., throw-away) batteries to confirm the camera is fine and the low-mAh batteries are the issue. I asked why this is not mentioned in the documentation that comes with the camera and she said it's because they don't mention using rechargeable batteries.,Update 5/2019: I've had battery problems with the camera since it was new, buying and trying 2800 mAh batteries along with many others. It became clear the camera had electronic issues. I'd get battery exhausted warnings even with new batteries but by opening and shutting the battery compartment, the camera would work just fine. And occasionally I'd get a message to reformat the memory card though that also was fine and the error disappeared when I opened and shut the compartment. Kodak quickly agreed to replace it under warranty, however, they refuse to pay the return shipping (roughly $8, cheapest rate) which I feel they should pay.,My recommendation is if you buy this camera, test it out thoroughly when new, using either throwaway batteries or 2300 mAh or larger rechargeables to confirm the electronics aren't faulty.,Update 7.15.2019: The camera gets worse and worse. Kodak replaced my original one but I had to pay return shipping. The new camera has the exact same issues as the previous one. Furthermore, its recording of sound is erratic. I recently was at a music event where I recorded a number of short clips with the camera. A few of the clips have sound but the overwhelming majority have none. I just did a short test video and it has no sound. I have listened to the recording file with several different apps and on different devices to confirm the problem is the file itself--i.e., the camera--is at fault, not recording sound. So I am again lowering the number of stars I give this camera, now to the fewest possible.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: camera stopped working after about two days of use. I am very careful with cameras, and it would not shut down, new batteries twice. Same result.,I am on a trip to Alaska, and am tremendously disappointed as I bought Kodak because of the "trusted" name. Wrong...,I cannot return it as am on the road in the wilderness..as it were.,I have to use my phone for photos..and will never buy Kodak again I suppose...

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Loses focus some times.  Video gets purple lines if too bright back ground lighting.  Not acceptable of course.  Returned.  What's with Canon cameras lately?  Tired a couple and they are all sub-par,

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This review is mostly about the seller. The camera itself seems to be a good point and shoot especially for a teenage girl... if it would stay on for more than a minute.,The seller... I ordered this at the end of September for a Christmas gift. I was excited because I found this $60 camera for only $20 and thought I was getting a great deal. When I received it I turned it on and tested it out briefly. It seemed to work pretty well, however after my daughter received it for Christmas (three months later) and played with it for a few minutes it shut off randomly. At first it turned right back on then it stopped turning on and responding all together. We put different brand new batteries in it and once again it turned on but this time it shut off right away. We observed that it never showed a full battery icon even with new batteries. So obviously this camera does not work right and I immediately requested a refund. The seller, lotus media, refused because it had been more than 30 days since I purchased it. I wrote another email requesting that they take into consideration that it had been purchased as a Christmas gift and that was the reason for the delay, but they stuck by their “policy” and would not budge. I tried to file an A to Z claim with amazon and was told by them that I was outside my time frame for filing a claim. So basically I’m screwed. I’m glad that I only spent $20. Lesson learned - spend more time testing out electronics, a deal that’s “too good to be true” really is not a deal at all, and though I’ve always had good experiences with amazon I’m disappointed they didn’t back me on this. I can’t believe that this seller didn’t know exactly what they were selling and that’s why the price was so low. I’m sure they thought that was good enough compensation for the fact that the camera doesn’t work right, but this fact should have been made known in the description of the camera.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Works when it wants to , eats batteries. I have had intermittent times when it stops working but, left alone for a few hours and it will work again. I assume it overheats.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This camera would be great if batteries didn't die within 5 min. If putting in new fresh battery. No matter if it's lithium, alkilin, rechargable, expensive...they all die!,Wish I would if know that sooner.,Got this as a Christmas present for my backpacking trips...just start hiking and found out it's worthless. No to much time has passed to return. Not happy!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought this camera for my 11yo son's trip to Paris and he took almost 1000 great pictures with it. Almost all were in focus and image quality is very good for just over 100$. We also took the camera on a river trail mountain biking trip and got several complements on how beautiful our trip pictures were. Color of trees were a tiny bit faded but waterfalls and green/blue from river shots was true. Was all fine once I auto adjusted in software. It did fairly well with night photos in Paris. I like how compact it is and battery lasts a long time. Zoom also does not cause pixilation. I can recommend the Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 to anyone looking for an affordable portable camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I dropped my first one off a ladder several times and it just kept working. I once shut a car door on the shutter barrel while it was out. I snapped it back in place and it kept working. It finally croaked but it wasn't from a blow. I bought another. I dropped it off a second story roof onto the first story roof. It busted into several pieces. It then rolled down the roof and dropped 12' to the concrete driveway and busted into more pieces. I put them all back together except the two lens cover pieces. They're spring loaded and I can't figure out how they go back on. Even without those pieces the camera still works! Though it still works I ordered another for a backup. I expect this one to perform just as well. I take hundreds of photos a day for work. Nothing but powershots for me!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I took some test shots and video with this camera since its a gift and I don't wanna be giftin' no broken down gifts.,Right away I noticed that the screen is a bit fuzzy, but this does not correlate with the clarity of the photos.,The photos were clear and true to color.,The camera does not have built-in storage like I've experienced with other camera. Not a big deal, but it will fake you out and let you take photos, without a card, that ultimately aren't stored.,It's a reasonable weight. Not bulky or weirdly light.,The video was clear. It does have a built-in speaker. Sounds from a 4ft distance where hardly audible during a replay.,Overall, I think it will make a reasonable vlogging camera for my daughter.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This is a great little camera for quick point & shoot situations. One great advantage is that, if dropped, it’s only a few dollars compared to the cost of repairing a smart phone. Rather than fill my phone with lengthy videos, it’s easier to simply use this camera to take them, pop the chip into my laptop, and file or upload the videos.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: So far I love this little camera....when I purchased this I was just looking for an inexpensive little point and shoot camera to make a few family snapshots for our get togethers with all of our family's........ I haven't actually had any of the pics printed yet but plan to within the next week and if I feel any differently after printing some then I will come back with an update!!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Third ELPH camera I'd bought, as a replacement for another I'd thought I'd lost.  Picture quality was not as good as the first two I've owned.  Was glad I found the lost one so I had another option on my trip.  Also the settings were not easily manipulated and some were missing from the previous version.  I gave it to some of the kids on our mission trip to use and they broke the lens mechanism so the lens would no longer contract. they weren't that rough with it, but the lens became bent.  Pretty cheaply made and not worth repairing.  Won't order again.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This handy little camera is not going to take national geographic photos but it will fit in your pocket, take decent shots and will be easy to use.  The only problem you will have is that you still have to use a  memory card and there are less and less places to use those for removing photos off the camera.  It was perfect to take on vacation and not a big deal if it got lost or broken.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: The only thing I was disappointed in was there is no steady shot when taking a video!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: A decent camera but, like many compact cameras (and some larger, more expensive ones), not easy to set for particular shots (low light, flash, telephoto, etc.). For close-up snapshots, it's fine. I carry it with me and, over time, I may figure out ways to get better photos--but I shouldn't have to. Controls should be intuitive and easy to use.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I was truly disappointed with this camera, but in all fairness I shouldn't have expected much based on the price.  I really just wanted a good point and shoot camera without having to fidget around with a bunch of settings.  I've since bought a Samsung Note 9 that takes excellent photos.  I've giving this camera 3 stars only because it looks nice and the quality of camera body seems good.  Quality of photos and too many controls I can't remember what to do with knocks off the other two stars.  I've had plenty of cameras over the years so I'm not new to cameras, but this one was really for a child.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought the red version of the Canon power shot Elph 180 and added the USB cord that was advertised for downloading photos. I am very disappointed that the only way to download photos is by removing the memory card and inserting in the computer slot. This is really poor advertising. I also wish there was a way to send the photos to a cell phone or ipad. I should have bought a more expensive model, but I wanted something simple to use. It is simple to use, but the memory card is difficult to access and it was not as advertised. Perhaps the silver version has the USB connection?

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Great little pocket camera with a decent zoom capability. Still need to figure out how to lock focus when in video mode... it was going in-and-out of focus while I was videoing things on a recent trip we took which was frustrating since we didn’t take the instruction booklet (live and learn)... and the screen wasn’t the 3” screen I had on the Sony this one replaced, but 2.7” is still a decent size. Loved that my batteries and charger from my previous Sony was compatible with this camera... I was going for as close a match to my last Sony and this was almost a bulls eye but with a greater image resolution.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: this camera is horrible. the photos are all blury! I am a professional photographer and I have never had a camera be so horrible !!!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this a year ago to take pictures for my business after dropping my Cool Pix for the last time. I usually get over bright or too dark pictures that I spend forever adjusting so that I can list. Now, after a year, I'm starting to get blurry pictures, and strange brightness and color.  I can take ten pictures of the same item, just in different positions, and my brightness is sometimes glaring. Colors aren't standard in this same group of pictures and I end up taking them same ones over again that same day or the next day. Honestly, I don't have time for this!,I don't need a lot of features, and I don't need zoom. I take my pictures outside on my back deck to get natural lighting and don't use the flash. I don't understand why I can't get consistent lighting and item colors with this camera. So, I guess it will be in the next donation bag. maybe someone can find a use for it, since I'm thinking this is mostly a kids camera or a vacation camera.,I see that the Cool Pix is back for sale and I came here today to get a new one. Glad it's back for sale after being gone a while!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Love this little camera . It replaced my Kodak Camera which I never really like. This one is so easy to use and I think takes great pictures.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I wasn't expecting much from this, I only wanted a camera that was a) cheap and b) would provide a better quality image than the average smart phone camera. But the image quality is truly amazing. I will upload a few customer images of my hiking trip as an example. An SD card is absolutely necessary, the internal storage can only hold 3 maximum quality images.,I did have one problem with the camera, the battery that came with it refused to take a charge. Amazon made up for this by offering me a 40% refund to buy a new battery, and the battery was much cheaper than the $31 refund I got so this issue wasn't even reason enough to take a star off. Overall great camera and great customer service from Amazon.,I've only owned this for a month and only used it for 2 days for a hiking trip so I can't speak on long term survival of this camera. I will update my review if I have any other issues. Be sure to check for my customer images if you want an idea of the maximum image quality.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: My old camera's battery clip broke and was not repairable, so it was time to get a new one. Since I'm a Luddite, still using a flip phone. As I had not bought a camera in about 10 years, my expectation was cheaper, faster, better.,Dunno what the heck happened in the digital camera industry over the last 10 years, but damn, nothing good.,Price - I figured to get something for about $50, since my last camera cost around $70. Nope; this one was close to $100. Some less expensive cameras out there, but the reviews scared me off.,MP - ok, this is a big change. This camera's got 20MP, up from I think 12. However, who needs that? Sucks up memory, and takes forever to load on Shutterfly. In fact, turns out my pictures were too big for Shutterfly and I had to squish them down. Yeah, that's not supposed to be necessary, but it's what worked for me.,Speed - reasonably fast turning on; about the same as my last camera. Not good - time to take a photo.,Two issues here. First, there's about a two-three second process from pressing the button until the picture pops up on the screen. After 3 months I still have not figured out when I can move the camera; not sure what the exposure process is. But I get blurry pictures a lot, so there appears to be some delay between pressing the button and being finished. Second issue - not gonna get many chances at a motion event, so time it well! 3 seconds minimum between pictures. F that noise.,Ease of recharge, battery life, pulling chip to unload pix - no issues. THat's all good.,All in all, this camera will drive me to get a smartphone. Or at least ask my wife to get me one for Christmas next year. She'll be thrilled!,Good job Sony!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: small, very light 4 oz. and very good pics..20 mega pixels and a 5 X zoom..,real easy set up and I got a 32 MG card which holds a ton of shots..haven't used all features yet. bought for my wife's trip to London..in September..,.set up is right on the screen..so you can get it going in no time..EASY mode make flipping it up and shooting with no mistakes, but you can use the setting yourself for exactly what you prefer.. manually if that's your bag....compares very well with Nixon cool pix at 1/3 the price..

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Honestly I have 10 megapixel camera that works better than this does. You have to hold EXTREMELY still in order to get a photo that isn't blurry which is a huge problem. I'm certain that there are better 20 MP cameras that can get that job done but this is definitely not one of them.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I use this camera for work (real estate appraisal). I don't need ultra high resolution shots for the reports, but I do need a cheap camera (they get dropped a lot), that takes quick photos and can be operated with one hand.,I was using a Canon point and shoot before this that was made in 2008, so I expected an upgrade, I was disappointed.,Pros,Cheap price,High resolution,Cons,-Terrible battery life,-Irritating autoflash, when selected it will flash at all times - even in strong lighting and therefore reducing the battery life further,- slow shutter speed, seems to be a disconnect between pressing the button and the device understanding you want a photo to be taken,-long delay between ability to take shots. I don't expect to be able to shoot in a burst mode, but it should allow for maybe two shots every 5 seconds instead of 10 seconds.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This is my first full Digital camera I have ever had. I always loved photography, and I have been using all kinds of different types of smartphone and tablets for taking pictures. While lots of those handheld mobile devices did very good at taking pictures, this SONY DSC-W800 beats all the smartphone and tablet cameras especially with the image processing like (exposure etc.) Also the 5x Optical Zoom is awesome lots of smartphone cameras don't have any Optical Zoom and the ones that do are very limited on the distance because of the focal length. Most new high end smartphone cameras have 1x-2x Optical Zoom which is barely noticeable. And digital zoom just sucks. So coming from tablets and smartphone cameras I have to say this is my best first digital camera I have ever had! The camera has auto focus, 5x Optical Zoom, has a proprietary USB cable for data transfer and changing. The pictures are very good which I will attach in this review.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Used this product for a little over a month and now it doesn't work. It won't come on and if it does it won't take a picture and shut down. Fully charged. Will not order again and have to buy another camera since this one decided to stop working.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: It’s ok not really good quality, but ok for price

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: The camera is small enough for any bag or purse. It is great for traveling and easy to use.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Works great for my needs.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Good

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: My teenage daughter has been wanting a small lightweight camera for pictures rather than using her phone.  I scrolled though here and found this one which was PERFECT!!! And i got it at the perfect time for Christmas!! Not only was it compact, lightweight, the picture quality is great.  We did have to purchase the memory card separate, but that's with all cameras.  She is very excited about the camera since she's the historian for Student Council and their job is to take pictures of all school events!!,Can't wait to see how it is once school starts.  I may have to get her a 2nd SD card for personal pics.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Check out the photo to get an idea on size.  This compact camera comes with a rechargeable battery and charging cord.  It also has a carry pouch and strap for the camera.  Be sure to grab a memory card when you buy it because there is no memory space on the camera.  Very user friendly.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I bought this to take on vacation with me. I tried it out a few times because I wanted to make sure it would be good for pictures while in Vegas. Its a great camara. I did buy an SD card for $9.99 off amazon so I could save all my pictures. I am impressed with this camara. It takes great quality pictures.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I like how this camera is compact enough to put it in my purse. I don't always want to use my phone for pictures because the quality isn't the greatest. This has great quality and I can blow up the picture with a clear resolution, unlike cell phone pictures. It's simple enough that even my kids love to use it!

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I bought this camera for my daughter. She loves taking pictures and it is perfect for her. Picture quality is really good and has a nice zoom and long lasting battery. It’s compact which is excellent for young kids. It’s also good for adults, fits nicely right in my purse when I borrow it from her.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Lost my camera case on a recent trip. This case fit nicely and will protect my camera, which is what I wanted. Nice case for the price.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: This is truly an "ultra light" case that keeps a "pocket size" camera pocket sized. It snugly fits my enormous Canon G7X Mark II to the point that I didn't think it would when I first opened it.  I like that the underside flap partially covers the side of the camera so the camera won't just slip out if the top flap is opened.  Velcro attachment is solid, and it has a belt loop and a hook for attaching to different things.  It doesn't enclose the camera on all sides as there are small openings on either side of the top flap when it's closed, but it will absolutely protect the camera from scratches, dirt and an occasional splash of water.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Good snug fit, but neoprene is a little too soft a material for securing a camera to your belt-- at least the way they've sewn it together.  The belt piece ripped out sending my camera to the floor (and I was on a boat-- could have gone into the water).  I've sewn it back together and expect it to last, which is why it got two stars.  Good fit, and decent soft protection if you want to throw your camera in your backpack instead.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Though a bit snug, this case offers very good protection.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Excellent cushion and not bulky. Camera feels safe, which was my #1 goal. Fits my camera perfectly as advertised. There's a little lip to help secure the camera so it doesn't easily fall out, but personally I dislike this feature.  I want to be able to quickly pull out the camera to take a quick photo rather than have to fight with it to get the camera out of the case (which happened to me many many times during a recent vacation).  Also, I didn't feel comfortable using the included plastic clip to secure my expensive camera. I broke it off and replaced it with a carabiner.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Really liked this small bag. fits well. protects my camera very well too. Thank you

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Good Camera for beginners. My only problem is that the lowest aperture the camera can shoot is F4.5 and the highest the lens can shoot is F5.6. So if you want your pictures to look fine af there are only 3 aperture stops you can shoot at (F4.5,F5, and F5.6). If you shoot at an aperture to high for the lens, your pic will look like the Palm trees below. A good pic but the lens couldn't handle the aperture. It would have been great if the lens it came with could shoot at a higher aperture.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Nice case for my canon G7X (Good fit)

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Good tight fit.  In fact it's TOO good.  If it's on your belt, it takes two hands, torquing your body awkwardly, to cram it in the case.  Once in, it's like it's been swallowed up.  When you see that must have shot and you need to get the camera quickly, good luck.  It takes another two hands to get it out.  I'm sending it back and I never send stuff back, but this is horrible.  Avoid.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: It fits the Canon G7X but too snugly for me.  Hard to remove the body.  Just too form fitting. Padding is good but I prefer a harder, more roomy case. I wrote MegaGear and they refunded my purchase.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: The case fit well and seemed good... I would have given it 4 stars. BUT... After only using it a small number of times on my belt (I would guess 5-6) I heard a clunk and was surprised to find my camera on the ground. My canon g7x sustained a small scratch as the case didn't protect it. The case's belt loop had torn free of the case, rendering it useless.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Great camera for me. I bought to continue a great photographic journey with my son. This year is first year playing tackle football so I got the camera to take football pics..I ended up purchasing the 75-300mm telephoto lense, better for sports, in addition the the wide angle that came w the camera.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Very impressed.  Bought this for my daughter who loves to take pictures on her phone.  This is a major upgrade.  I was concerned when I read some reviews that said the wide angle lens and the filters were not compatible with the camera.  We were able to use every accessory and we found everything in this kit to be high quality and compatible if you know how to hook it up.  One ding...  the auto focus is a little slow,  but she prefers the manual setting.  Very good value.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I'm sure the camera quality was fine but my package came in and there were some sort of rice grain stuck inside of the actual camera lens.The camera was also cover in some sort of white flakey stuff that was hard to get out. And the inside lenses were already dirty and smudgy even though I had just took it out of the box. I will be sending everything back and getting a refund. Some thing like is is not acceptable considering how much money this camera cost.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: This was one of those purchases that had me refreshing my Amazon app to check tracking every 10 minutes. Although I chose the free shipment method, it arrived in 2 days. All of correct accessories came in excellent condition with warranty and instructions, except for one item which I'm sure I'll figure out eventually. It's a small piece with a handle and adhesive. I purchased this camera for a trip to Europe that I'll be taking in May, but I'm so inspired by the camera, I'll be doing personal photo shoots. The quality is great. I took a selfie and a photo of my turntable that I didn't realize was as dusty as it is until looking at the photo!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: The camera is of course working and everything was ok, but the bag came broken.. so that was a bit depressing. The part where the strap attaches was torn..,Day 2 and the other side ripped.. and I mean I get the bag isnt the main point of the order but it is really annoying I can't carry my camera out cause I need to get a new bag. If this is a kit, like everything should work pretty fine right?, It was so annoying when it snapped It made me almost drop the camera and the lenses in the bag

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Just get a Canon, and Canon lens. The only thing worth having in this kit is the Canon, and the Canon lens.  Everything else is garbage.,-The Digital Ultraviolet filter could come in handy if you put them to use.,-The memory card holder is cute, but I could have lived without it.,-The flash isn't compatible with Canon T6, therefore it's possible for it not to be compatible with any Canon(I wouldn't take the risk).,-The extra lenses... You guest it, they are not compatible with Canon lenses.,-SD cards work as they should.,-The tripod is cheap and generic.,-The remote shutter works as it should.,-The bag is standard, and if I'm missing something, no worries, it a huge chance you don't need it.,The only reason I gave it a two instead of one has nothing to do with Vivitar.  Save your money, get the basics from authorized dealers, and go from there.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I bought this camera to take photos of jewelry I'm going to be selling and for family events. It's pretty easy to use. It comes with a lot of stuff that I probably won't ever need, but they are nice to have anyway. I think it is a good value. The only thing that bothers me is that it depends so much on the battery being charged. There is no power cord to plug into a wall socket so that you can shoot table-top objects without the battery. You have to rely on the battery all the time. It can get tedious remembering "Oh yeah, I need to charge the battery — AGAIN". Down time. I was able to download photos into my Macintosh (which is 8 years old) without the battery being charged. That being said, you can't charge the battery while it's in the camera from the computer. I do like the quality of the photos and even though it comes with the two extra lenses, the one it comes with is very good. Overall, I am happy with this purchase. Just wish it came with a power cord.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I had been using a 10 year old hand-me-down Canon Rebel until it died. I knew I wanted another Rebel, so I chose this bundle as the best deal acknowledging that some of the accessories are off-brand and possibly useless. I had checked a couple stores, and I would have paid the same amount, if not more, for just the camera and the lens. The one down side is that it doesn't offer an extended warranty, so I'll just have to keep my fingers crossed. The camera is great, the lens is ok. I have a better lens from my old camera, so I didn't use the stock lens much. As for the accessories- the memory card, external flash, usb reader, and remote all function with the camera. Everything fits in the bag that comes with it, except for the tripod. I think this is a good bundle for the money.,I think the Canon Rebels are a great option for people who aren't trying to make money off their photography. I've never used another type of camera, so I can't fully compare but I've been able to take photos I'm really proud of with both of my rebels, and a free online photog course.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I’m an amateur photographer. I do senior pictures for fellow students and family portraits. The quality is amazing it’s easy enough to use point click and the flash works fantastic. The extra light I’ve set up as an exterior light for some photo projects and it’s worked fantastically. The tripod works in any ground pretty much with the help of a small level on the top of it. If I’m on a hill and I wanna know if it’s straight it works perfectly. The lenses are great! Perfect condition when the arrived, they are exactly what I wanted and what a steal! The UV lens is perfect for super gloomy days I think. It makes them look a little brighter in my opinion less bleh. Which is always nice. The bag it comes with is sturdy no tears no holes! The dividers are movable. You can take them out and switch them around! Which is nice since I’m always switching out the stuff I need for work! It has a million pockets to fit everything you need! The lenses have small pouches and covers to put on and in when you’re not using them. Handy indeed! The two SD cards work great! It has a little wallet like case for them that can attach to the cameras strap for easy convenient use! It does not has an extra battery for the camera however! It charges super fast in an hour and a half (1hr 30 mins) usually it’ll be fully charged! It’s also WiFi enabled! Meaning if you ya ether cannon app you can use your camera remotely through the app! You can also download pictures from it and tag locations you’ve shot at! Super handy!!!! The small clicker you can hook up on the side of camera is great! It works great! It’s very short however. Use only when working with nervous kids so they don’t see you take the picture! The pocket tripod isn’t that useful for me personally but maybe a smaller vlogger or general YouTuber could find it useful it’s only about 5 inches high but it’s super sturdy! The camera might look to big but it holds up great! I use the strap it’s semi comfortable it needs broken in but I don’t recommend it. It’s rough around the edges of it but still usable. I’m ordering a better strap because I use it often and my neck will hurt after shooting for 4-5 hours.,Overall great package! Super useful and great for amateurs or people starting out with Cannon!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Was a bit more complicated to use than I wanted. I had to read the entire booklet to figure it all out. Even after figuring out the camera I had difficulty getting a decent quality photo out of it. Most pics were grainy unless just the right lighting and zoom were used. Found the super zoom to be very grainy and unusable. Maybe was too complicated or it may have been defective because I have heard good things about this camera. Customer service was good and I received my refund quickly.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This camera takes amazing handheld shots while zoomed all the way out.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Initially, bird pics were soft. Lowering the Noise Reduction setting to -2 gives more sharpness and detail but still with good noise control. If needed, noise reduction is done in pp. I really like the rendering in the FZ70 pics. It doesn't have the fast lens and other features of my FZ200, but noise control is better, IMO, so you can use higher ISOs. Also, compared to the FZ200, iZoom performs much better, fewer artifacts, very usable pics. The camera focuses very fast. A great birding camera.,I do wish it had an articulating screen, remote shutter socket, larger buffer, but you can't have everything at this price.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I purchased this camera not long after the birth of our firstborn son. It is so much better than the one we had been using. I am able to get a lot of good nature shots, as you can see in the pictures I have provided. The coloring and saturation is great! The only thing I do not like about the camera is that the focus for zooming in is not always very good. If I want a crisp picture, I often have to get VERY close to the subject, which can often be a bit inconvenient (see spider picture). While fairly close, if I try to zoom in the slightest bit, the picture gets all blurry, no matter what setting I use. Other than that, I am able to get some really nice, high quality pictures to share with my family and friends. They have all complimented me on my picture taking skills, but I know that I owe it all to the Panasonic Lumix!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I had to practice a lot to learn how to use this camera for it is more complicated than any I have ever used before.  Manual settings are available for almost anything I want to do, but I've had to refer to the digital manual a great many times.  This is no point and shoot camera, although it works great for that too.  I had much difficulty learning how to get macro photos without blurring, but eventfully got great photos. The macro-zoom is something I did not expect and I'm super-pleased with that.  I can adjust the lighting, color, focus and get almost any type of photo I want, though for general use I leave it at Auto-focus +.  I like to take photos of insects, flowers and birds, so the manual settings are of great importance to me.  I also wanted to do time exposures, and although I would prefer to be able to set long time exposures, the longest exposure in this camera did permit me to photograph the aurora borealis with the use of a tripod, and the touch-up function.  The 60x zoom is very useful to me and I've photographed quite a few birds already.  It is very difficult to hold the camera still at the 60x level, but using a tripod for a bird is impractical when they are moving around.  I have to take several hand-held shots to get a good one, but usually succeed.  I am very pleased with this camera and it is everything I hoped for.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Pros:  Light weight bridge camera with super wide angle and ridiculous zoom.  I didn't have time to do a full battery of tests but I did test for ease of use, low light noise, macro, and OIS - I'm impressed with all of these.  The fact that this camera has a 20mm wide angle makes it worthy of adding to my equipment line up, I wanted something light for hiking so I bought the Canon SX280HS.  I'm marginally disappointed with that camera because it's slow and too noisy in low light but at the time of purchase I was pleased with it's zoom (25-500mm).  Four short months this camera was released and as it's the only light weight camera with a 20mm wide angle I just had to try it.  Despite the fact I can't just slip it into my pocket the FZ70 is very light.  I'm 6' tall and the palm grip doesn't strike me as overly diminutive so I can see myself carrying this around with out a strap and not experiencing hand cramps.,Despite reading a number of negative reviews, initially, I'm very pleased with the quality.  Low light for a 1/2.3" sensor'd camera is better then I expected, in fact it's better then the SX280HS (same size sensor) I purchased just a few months prior.  The negative comments surround picture quality, I could not duplicate a scenario that yielded a photo of "poor" quality.  While the images are not perfect they are better, IMO, than other point and shoots and perhaps equal to prosumer options from say five or six years ago.,Cons:  Finding a bargain - This camera's price seems to be jumping around from the original retail price so be careful.  Thanks to the super zoom and the uninitiated's inability to get a steady shot there are plenty of these as "used" which are in fact open box.  Be sure to read the descriptions when sorting through the used vendors as some are missing accessories.  I purchased mine as "used" and it arrived with all accessories, repacked in the original box, fulfilled by Amazon Warehouse Deals for nearly 30% off the already on sale price.,Summary:  I consider myself an avid enthusiast.  I know how to use a camera in full manual, how to get a steady shot even with out OIS; in fact, I use a full size DSLR (5D mkiii) most times.  I will be using this for my upcoming vacation and leaving the bulky lenses and accessories for my DSLR at home.  I'll still take my jean pocket worthy Canon SX280HS with me but will use this for excursions and killing time on ship.  If you are looking for telephoto capability my recommendation is walk before you run - this camera is good but only if you are familiar with bracing techniques, manual ISO setting, and tripod use.  If you aren't comfortable with say, shooting in full manual mode go with a less expensive shorter range compact zoom.  Check DPReview's site for a great comparison tool.  IMO this camera is as good as it gets for size, zoom range, and low light quality.  Not considering the value of the total package this would be a good camera to have at any price point within it's class of capabilities so if it's not on sale don't mark it off your list.,11/22/2013 UPDATE:,Add some Pros & Cons:,Pros:  I've shot 354 photos, about 150 outdoors, some with fill flash and the remainder inside, most with flash.  I'm very impressed with the battery life, the display indicates I have full battery life remaining even after all that use.  My indoor use consisted of walking around at the convention center here in San Antonio for the Auto Show.  The cameras display stayed on for about 1.5 hours during the time I was taking photos.  Also I wanted to point out the OIS is amazing.  I shot most of my shots today, indoors, in manual mode most at 1/25th of a second some at 1/20th at ISOs between 100 & 400.  Hand held sometimes zooming up to 16 or 18x and the shots came out crystal clear.  I believe out of about 200 shots I may have had two that were not usable due to camera shake.  I don't believe I would have achieved this with my heavier 5Dmkiii with the 24-105mm with IS.  I did have to employ bracing techniques, holding breath, gently pressing shutter and using any railing I could find to lean up against, but no tripod or mono pod.,Cons:,Pano mode, while it works great, does not have a manual exposure control.  Indoors it forced me to use ISO2000 which leads me to the next con, poor image quality in low light.  I don't know if its a sensor problem or a compression issue as I was using jpg.  It's not terrible but even at ISO400 it's noticeable.  I had spend most of the day yesterday photographing my dogs between ISO 400 & 1600 while indoors and first noticed it but inside the house it's a bit darker then at an auto show.  I knew to try and avoid ISO800 but after today I'd say if you can get the shot somehow with a lower ISO setting, say 200 or the lowest of 100 you'll appreciate the results - so a tripod, mono pod, or bracing techniques are a must.,A side note regarding perception of the camera itself.  Last year I used my 5D mkiii at the auto show and I went unnoticed.  This year, with the FZ70, arriving early to the auto show I was approached by some of the presenters who thought I was the official photographer - go figure...,As soon as I knew I liked the camera I ordered a spare set of batteries and charger.  Considering how great the battery life is I sort of regret getting two extra batteries.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This enabled me to get some spectacular shots sight seeing in Arizona - shots that would have either required 2 hour hikes or just not possible otherwise were easy with 60x optical zoom,I'm not a photography expert, and at the moment I don't want to have to learn about / spend the money on a DSLR and all the associated lenses, etc - however I still wanted a camera that had manual features like shutter speed, sensitivity, etc so that I could grow into the camera over time,The electronic view finder is surprisingly useful to help get level shots,Tips/advice:,- If you're going to use manual focus, try the same shot with automatic focus as well - I used manual focus for a number of extreme distance shots that looked ok on the LCD screen but are blurry on larger screens, where shots of other scenes I used automatic focus and came out great - this means many of my extreme distance shots at the Grand Canyon North Rim were blurry when they probably would have been fine in automatic focus mode,- If you want to use manual exposure times I recommend getting a tripod, since I did not have one the long exposure time shots I took were just blurry,- Instead of having to walk further away from / closer to the scene, it is extremely helpful to have the easy to use and plentiful zoom control, even for close range shots (few inches to 10ft) - just zoom in a bit to crop out what you don't want and put more of an emphasis on the subject in the photo

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Bought this camera a little less than a month ago to take with me on our family vacation to Hawaii.  Camera came in a timely fashion since we have Prime.  I would not be happier with this camera.  This is the largest camera we have bought ever (we had previous lumix point and shoot cameras, but nothing this big).
