The Auto/Intelligent option works very well and we are very happy with the pictures we were able to take with this camera, especially in the Botanical Garden near Hilo.  There were a lot of people with much larger cameras than this taking detailed pictures but I don't know how much better they are than those taken by this Lumix camera.  Overall, love this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this as main camera for my Z47 and I was disappointed. It has a shooting in raw which I would like to have but the camera took pictures that were blurry. I tried every setting possible to correct this and nothing worked. the shutter speed was way to slow and it was hard to change the f stop. After using it for several days I gave up,  My Z47 is much better and has  everything I need except the RAW feature.  Because I was so disappointed I returned it.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Update: 11/17/2014.  I have used the camera for several months now and love it.  I really like the zoom range of the camera from 20mm to 1200mm and it is my main daily carry camera.  It takes great detailed photos and the noise levels are very good.,The is going to be a quick review on the camera and I will add more as time goes on.  The FZ70 takes really good sharp photos, but hand held might be a problem in lower light levels.  I went out yesterday evening and took some shots hand held and they all came out blurry.  I should have paid more attention to the shutter speed.,The camera works fantastically in iA, which is the auto mode. I mainly use Aperture but was impressed with the auto settings.,It will go with a 60 second exposure in the Starry Sky Mode, which is under the SCN mode on the main dial.,The lens thread is 55mm so if you plan on using your filters from any other Pany camera, you will need a 55 to 52mm Step Down Adapter.  Amazon has them for cheap.  I don't think vignetting will be a problem using 52mm filters as the lens is way smaller than the filter threads on the camera.  Here is the 55 to 52mm Step Down Adapter.,The camera has no shutter remote cord jack, so a shutter release cable will not work.  My Yongnuo YN-560 flash will not work on the camera either.  It physically hits the camera flash housing, which is raised a little.  The answer to that is to use a wireless flash trigger with the Yongnuo Flash and that works fine.,Addition:  I looked at the Yongnuo flash again and it will fit on the camera, but it is a tight fit between the camera flash and the Yongnuo flash housing.  I modified the Yongnuo flash by taking some of the plastic off the flash housing where the camera flash is hitting, with a pencil grinder.  It doesn't take much, and it is right in the middle of the housing.  You could remove some of the plastic in the flash housing with sandpaper, but it would take longer, but will also give you more control of how much plastic you are taking off.  Now my Yongnuo Flash works perfectly on the FZ70 camera!,The video does not have a progressive setting.  Interpolated is the best you are going to get with this camera.,The FZ70 does not have a jack for a shutter release cable and does not have an infrared input either.  The camera has to be set to a timer delay within the camera for 2 or 10 seconds.  If it was a Sony or Canon, the timer is set and stays on till you shut it off.  Unfortunately this camera requires you set the timer delay for each and every photo.,The longest the camera will go on exposure under the Shutter or Manual Mode is 8 seconds.  In the Starry Sky Mode it will go 15, 30, and 60 seconds.,Like I said the lens thread is 55mm so your filters will have to be that size or use an adapter.  The camera will use a teleconverter with the DMW-LA8 adapter, which is not available yet.  Addition:  Those LA8 adapters are available on Ebay now.  They are being sold out of Japan though.  I had that happen with the FZ200 camera as well and had no problem getting one from a Japanese Ebay member.  There are several teleconverters that work well with this camera, but may not be needed as this lens rocks as far as zoom goes!,Update:  An aftermarket adapter is now available for a good price.,It will take Raw pictures, but no one is supporting the FZ70 Raw files yet.  It will come.  Added: I found that FastStone will support the Raw files from the FZ70 and it is much better than Silkypix, in my opinion.  Just Google FastStone and download and install the software.  It is free.,Upadate: Raw for the camera is now supported in Lightroom and Photoshop.,Start up time is very fast.  I was able to take a picture in one second after turning the camera on.,The focus button is on the top of the camera now.  The AF/MF/Macro button is on the right side of the LCD instead of on the camera lens.,One thing I have noticed with this camera is the noise, or should I say the lack of noise!  The shots I took at ISO 800 and ISO 1600 still look pretty good, and at ISO 100 noise is hard to find.,The camera will zoom to 60X (1200mm 35mm Equivalent) in the 16mp picture size.  Setting the picture size to 10mp will give you 75X zoom, setting the size to 7mp will give you 90X, at 5mp you get 108X and at 3mp is 135X.  This is Extended Optical Zoom.  If you need more zoom than that, under IResolution, use I-Zoom for an additional 2X at all picture sizes and digital will give another 2X, but image quality will suffer. I took some shots at the 10mp picture size with I-Zoom on, and the photos in my photo software are showing 3030mm zoom and they look amazingly good! I will post a link to some shots in the first comment on the review.,There are two FN buttons on the camera that can be set the way you want them to be.  I set FN 1 button to Bracketing and FN 2 button to Flash Control.  I may change them as time goes on, but I find it really great to be able to get Bracketing with the push of a button.,I don't care much for the lens cap, and ordered a better 55mm one on Amazon.,I use filters as it seems more often than not, I end up with my fingerprints on the lens filter.  It also keeps dirt and grime from getting to the lens.  It might offer some protection in an accident too. I would stay away from Hoya UV filters on this camera.  I was using one for a while and noticed the photos look fuzzy at full zoom.  I discovered it was the Hoya HMC filter I was using.  I now use a Sigma UV filter on the camera and it works great with no distortion at high zoom.,The camera does not come with a lens hood and none is available in the Accessories on the Panasonic web site either.  It seems there is no lens hood for this camera at this time.,This is it for now.  I will add to this review as time goes by, so check back often.,Addition:,I had a chance to check out the high speed picture mode with the camera and found this:  At 2 fps (frames per second) all works as advertised and it takes 2 fps for an extended period of time. 5 fps - it takes 5 frames per second for 3 shots and goes back to the 2 fps rate.  I tried it in Auto Focus mode and the regular mode with the same results.  9 fps - Once again, 3 shots and then the 2 fps rate.  H Mode - the camera took a very fast rate of speed (at least 9 frames per second) for 9 shots, or 1 second.  I have since found in the manual that at that speed the picture size is 2.5 or 3 mp.  I forgot which.  That is excellent.  The last mode is the Flash and it will take 5 quick photos with flash before stopping.  That could come in very handy at times.,I really like this camera.  I like the menu system on the Panasonic Cameras too.  I have the Canon SX50 as well, and still have problems with the menu settings and I have had that camera for 6 months.  The menu system just doesn't make sense to me on that camera.,I did a shootout with the Canon SX50, the Pany FZ200, the FZ70, and a Sony Nex 6.  The FZ70 images look about the same as the Canon SX50, and in my mind better than the Pany FZ200 camera.  The last shot is a Raw shot from the FZ70 camera converted to JPG.  The picture files can be seen in the Comments on page 12, the 7th post.,Added:  After using this camera for a while now,  I am even more impressed with it.  It takes great pictures and I really like the Panasonic Menu, which is laid out well and easy to use.  I am getting lots of keeper photos and the lack of noise in the shots is really appreciated!,Addition 10-29-13  I sent the first FZ70 back because the photos at high zoom were soft.  To make a long story short, it turned out that the Hoya UV filter I was using on the camera was responsible for the soft photos.  I have changed to a Sigma DG 55mm filter and the results are outstanding.  Sharp clear photos at all zoom levels.  This camera takes photos every bit as sharp and detailed as the Panasonic FZ150 or FZ200 camera and is as good as the Canon SX50 in sharpness as well.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I love my new camera, but wish I bought one that zooms in further.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: This little camera takes amazing pictures. I was so surprised how well it took. It also does not eat batteries. We went on a 5 day cruise and I didn't have to change the batteries once.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: After looking at a few pictures the screen would go lime green.  I would have to shut the camera off and try again.  Did this over and over - same problem.  Returned to Amazon

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Can’t downloads pictures—correct usb cable not provided.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I may be a slight bit slanted towards Nikon, but this is a product that replaced my other camera which broke.  It has held up on various things I have done and the picture quality is quite good.  The  overall quality of this camera is quite good and it will not break your pocket.  It is a perfect camera for a youth or just someone that wants to take pictures randomly.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Always a Nikon COOLPIX. This is satisfactory. When I walk with new batteries I do not have to remember if I charged my camera. Wi-Fi is better but using a card reader is ok with me.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Clear and quality photos. Like carrying in around in my car and have it handy for that random snapshot. Minus 1 star coz it doesn't come with USB,

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Great little camera. It's super compact so I can carry it in my pocket when I need to. The quality of photos are better than expected for the price and size combined. It doesn't come with a USB cable which was fine with me because I just use micro sd cards.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: This is my second Nikon COOLPIX. I drowned my last one. What I really like about this camera is that it uses two AA batteries instead of a rechargeable.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Works  well, easy to use, takes great pictures and video. The AA battery's give a long use time. I like this camera a lot.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Like the camera, size and all but the instructions are a nightmare!!!! Would not buy again. My brother is a computer genius and had to set it up  for me and he was complaining about the instructions! Taking it to Germany and hope it will work fine but it's not what I can recommend!

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: WOW so much fun! Got this and a case for my girlfriend for an anniversary and she LOVES it. It is completely plastic so I wouldnt say it feels ";nice"; or anything but it is very well made, everything is snug. It fits very well in the hand. We are still playing with the settings on the thing, there is a lot to learn! I almost wish they would include 5-10 film so you didnt have to spend $5-10 learning how to use all the settiings. Once we figured it out, pictures turn out amazing. SO much fun. A couple of friends have purchased the camera after seeing this one and love it also.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: I -like you- did an EXTENSIVE research on which camera to use for my niece's birthday party celebration, and I finally decided to give this camera a try and I have to say that I'm extremely happy so far! the pictures are great and the size is a little bit bigger than other cameras.It is a little bulky but I really don't mind that as long as the pictures come out nice, and they do.I did pay full price for this, and in no way received any discounts or such, so be confident this is a real review.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: So far working great! I have tested it out on just 2 pictures so far, but plan on using it at my wedding reception. If you are looking for perfectly clear resolution with sharp pictures this is NOT the camera for you. We are so used to digitized photos in this day and age, some might be disappointed with the quality. But if you are wanting an old fashion style ";polaroid"; camera, with soft focus, this is great! Make sure you read the instructions, but very easy to use.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: The camera is small and convenient to carry, but the picture quality is questionable and the zoom decreases the quality even more. Even with the flash, I had difficulty at time capturing pictures in lower light situations. But for the price it was a decent point and shoot.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: I purchased this camera for my granddaughter as she was going on a class trip to Washington DC. Unfortunately the battery died on the first day and would not recharge. The camera was useless without a charged battery. I missed out on the return date by three days.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: This is a good value deal. The camera is good quality and takes nice pictures. It is small and easy to use - ideal for someone who wants to take holiday pictures without too much fuss. The five times optical zoom is reasonable for casual use, and the number of megapixels is plenty unless you wanted to blow pictures up to a really huge size. It is a small light, nice looking camera and the controls are easy to use. It comes with one battery plus a charger, and a cable for connecting it direct to your computer.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: My daughter just started art school and needed a good camera to do her upcoming projects with. I saw this mini camera and ordered it. So glad I did. It is small and light weight and takes high quality images and video. It has built in flash and very easy to use. It comes a pouch and a wrist strap. This camera makes a excellent gift. Kids and adults will love it!!!

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: I absolutely love this camera. Its so light weight and sized perfectly! I put a picture of the camera next to a cotton swab for size reference. The photos cone out super vlear and its awesome that it comes with a rechargeable battery. Such an awesome camera!

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: In today’s day and age cameras like this are getting replaced with phones but I got this knowing that and just wanted something my son can carry around to take some nice pictures with his grandparents that was small which wouldn't take up space. This is a great gift for someone younger or their first camera. Some of the pictures he took made this a well worth purchase.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This little camera is perfect for the point and shoot photos we want to take when we are on vacay, pics of the kids etc. It's small enough to fit in your pocket, has a great quality picture, all the accessories to easily upload to your computer for printing and social media posting. Can't beat that quality for the price and the added bonus I'm not constantly maxing out my phone storage space.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Excellent camera for my 11 year old daughter. It's small and compact which makes it easy for her to take with her.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Camera arrived quickly with everything included. I bought the camera to take on a trip out west in May, so I have only taken a few pics in the house to get a feel for how it works. So far I'm content with the pictures that it takes. Most of my photos on the trip will be outdoors during the daytime, so I'm not expecting any issues as far as clarity or lighting. Love that it came with a memory card as well as a nice sturdy case for the camera!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Pretty nice camera for size and price.. I am happy with the quality pics.. Better than most of these small point and shoot cameras. Much better quality screen and I like having a little more zoom.  Kinda disappointed there was not a usb cord for the computer thou.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Just got the camera so I'm still learning how everything works. So far, I'm extremely pleased. The pictures are great. The zoom is great. My expensive camera is old and heavy and I wanted something small and light that would take just as good a picture. This is perfect.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I am a petite female with small hands. The Canon Power Shot 180 is smaller than my Lg g7, although more than about an inch or two in width. Perfect for me! Was looking for an easy to take anywhere camera. The pics so far are great! Will will update after my trip.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Perfect for vacation travel.  Easy to use for those spontaneous, quick-capture photo ops.  Small and convenient to carry with you.  And I really love the red!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I love this little camera, it takes way better quality pictures than I thought it would for the price and its just so conveniently small to put in your pocket when traveling. Very happy with it!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I haven't been able to use the camera yet, as the user guide is a pdf file and I can't print it out or better  to print selected pages rather all 111 pages. I would be glad to pay for a microsoft word version or an already printed version. It is very hard to try to learn how to use something from a computer page. Is there some way of getting the guide as a word or some way to convert the pdf file?

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I love this camera.  My Cell takes 15mp  but nothing takes a really terrific pic but a good camera like this one.  I am very happy with this purchase.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Arrived quickly. It's different than the last Sony we had. This one will take a little getting use to. It is very small, and the settings are different. we didn't realize the  memory card didn't come with the camera, so you would be all set to take pictures on Christmas Day. NO we bought the 32 gig memory care along with a bag of goodies, and the case separately

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Sony makes some of the very best digital cameras and this is one of the best.  It is small enough that I can carry it in my pants pocket all the time yet it has a very nice zoom lens and many, many features.  I also have larger digital cameras but this is one of my favorites.  If you want a new digital camera, I say just check out all the Sony models and pick the one which is best for your needs.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The first camera received worked fine outdoors but i noticed it was hunting and having trouble focusing indoors even in a well lit room. If I hadn't had a lot of experience with this level camera from Canon & Lumix, I would have thought it was my fault. I returned it and the second one has no problems focusing indoors quickly. It's just as good as the competition. Things I prefer on this camera to our Canon A3500: 8x vs. 5x optical zoom but with comparable f-stop. Simpler, easier to use menu system and a standard usb cable for charging directly to the camera without removing the battery. The advantage of the Canon over the Sony is the lens retracts completely into the camera body flat whereas the Sony lens protrudes a little bit even when the lens is retracted and closed. Also, the Canon feels a little bit more sold than the Sony. Overall, the Sony is a great camera that takes sharp pictures indoors or out. It has an amazing lens, works great in low light, is tiny, easy to use and takes much better pictures than my iPhone 4.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: My husband and I really love our cameras.  We bought one for each of us to take on vacation.  They are small, lightweight, and take great pictures.  The resolution of the picture is better than what you see on the viewfinder, although the viewfinder is good quality too.  They are also very reasonably priced for the quality of product you get.  When we are out and about, I tend to leave my camera out of the case in my bag so I can pull it out quickly and take pictures.  It has been durable despite the abuse, and we've had no problem whatsoever with them.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Nice little camera -- [UPDATE] it does "burst pictures" but not like an SLR would - meaning there is a slight pause after each picture as it processes the picture.  You have to put it into that mode.  It can do video, but I didn't get it for that.  Good Value.  Worth the money!  I do also wish, as constructive criticism, that there was an intermediate setting between VGA and 5 MP.  The pictures are either too small (150k) or too large (3 GB).  So I take pictures in 5 MP mode and resize them on my desktop computer.  I don't need the detail like some people demand.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Nicely designed camera and good value for the price.  Simple, intuitive controls.  Easy directions. Decent size screen.  Zoom works well.  Auto focus is excellent. Includes the charger.,Drawbacks are NTSC and PAL for video output.  No HDMI option.  No Wi-Fi or Wi-Fi Direct capabilities.  Images take a few seconds to appear after pushing the shutter button. Image quality was decent, but no higher quality than our Samsung Galaxy S6 and S7 phones.  Zoom images were about the same quality as the phone.,So, if you have a nice smart phone, this camera won't offer much additional.  If you wanted a stand alone pocket camera, this is a fine choice.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Took this camera with me to Israel to get shots of the Holy Land that I could blow up if I wanted to. Loved the small size which easily fit in my pockets so it was with me all the time, though it does takes a bit to power up to be ready to take a picture. Battery life was more than adequate and there were more photo options than you might expect on such a compact camera. Very pleased with the quality of the images captured. This Sony delivered high quality shots and others have raved about the optics of the lens. I was quite delighted with this little gem.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I have never purchased an inadequate "Sony" product.  This camera lived up to all of my expectations.  I was able to use it immediately with just a quick review of the camera itself.  The picture quality is amazing.  Looking at some of the other reviews, I might add that I don't like the date and time on the face of my pictures, with this camera you don't get date and time on the picture, thank you Sony.  Also, when I hit the on button it powers on instantly same with power off.  I love that you can get great shots of moving objects!  The size is perfect, not so small you can't find the right button to press but not so large you can't slip it into a pocket.  I also purchased a carrying case for it.  Honestly, I can't find anything bad about this purchase.  I love it!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Really disappointed; the camera is small and decently easy to use for someone like your grandma; but the battery won't last even few hours of usage, without even use the flash.,The image quality is OK; on par with other cameras in the same price range; but the battery life is very short; making this impossible to use for more than 20-30 pictures and few videos.  Beware if you are buying it, that the battery has to be charged constantly.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The slow auto-focus, constant blur, unpredictable light changes, and the display have me really annoyed. I have an older model of this camera which is much better and creates sharper more accurate images, albeit less pixels. The body and size on this overall feels a lot cheaper than the older model. The video isn't all that great either. I feel like some serious corners were cut with this and it was assumed no one would notice. The only difference so far that seems to be a real plus is the battery life. Seriously though, the display is killing me; the colors are nowhere near accurate and it looks no better than a circa 2003 display.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I am excited about my camera . Unfortunately I have not had and opportunity to use it yet . My friend has one and she loves hers . I have seen here pictures.So I will be sure to enjoy mind. Check back with me in late September . Thanks

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I got this a gift for my son to take on his trips he loves it

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I needed a camera to take the place of my 19 year old Olympus.  This Canon stepped right up.  It had all the features I needed and combined with the value pack, I couldn't go wrong.  I'm very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it if you're looking for a simple operating camera with great picture quality.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Camera works well and really liked the bundle. Bought for work surveying poles.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I am just setting up my new camera and the instructions are clear and concise.  I have snapped a few "test" photos and they look great.,Very pleased with everything so far and looking forward to taking this camera on our forthcoming vacation.  Thanks for the quick shipping and excellent service.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: This was the perfect gift for our grand daughter's 14th bday.  All of the extras that came with the camera were an added bonus.  The camera takes great pictures and is easy to use.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Got it for my 13 YO daughter. She says close pictures turn out well but zooming leaves things a little blurry. She loves the quality of the videos. Overall she is happy with it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Good price

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I love this little camera. It's so small and easy to fit into a pocket or outside pocket of a purse. Amazingly good quality for such a small device.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: I sent the camera back.  Spent 30 minutes trying  to put the wrist strap on.  Called Canon and Amazon for help.  Tried using thread, dental floss, a needle, and bent paperclip...NOTHING would get that strap through that TINY recessed clip.  Terrible design.  The strap should have been installed by Canon.  Sorry but I ran out of patience.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I've been waiting for years to start a new hobby and when I saw this affordable digital camera I went ahead and jumped onboard.  The other brand name digital cameras cost so much more, so I was okay making this investment as it is affordable and I'm glad I made that decision.  The camera comes with a two rechargeable batteries, a macro lens attachment, HDMI cable, USB cable and detailed manual.  I need to enroll in a photography course so I can learn about the different settings and how to optimize settings, but as you can see in attached photos, out-of-the-box settings are not bad at all.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I have never been a fan of digital photography, preferring black and white, high speed film for its fine grain detail. I decided to enter the 21st century and see if I could approximate the quality of professional film photography at a reasonable price point. I was surprised. No, digital is not the same as film, but for most of the mundane photography that I do, this dual purpose camera works well. I was impressed by the quality of the images in this relatively inexpensive camera. I have not used it to record video yet and may review that in a future post.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I purchased this camera twice due to a price drop. However, my experience with both cameras was when I put my SD card in, I could not take a picture. The screen read, please insert card. Both SD cards were brand new.  During a google search, I discovered it's the camera not the SD card. If anyone else has experienced this, please advise.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This camera is small and cute.  It is very easy to set up and use.  The picture quality is really good.  I just love how small it is cause I can just put it in my pocket and take it anywhere with me.  This camera came with 2 Li-ion Batteries and these are rechargeable.  It also comes with a charging cord that you can plug into your computer.  Batteries do last for quite a while before needing to be recharged.  For the price you get a really neat little camera.  The instruction manual is easy to use once I used a magnifying glass.  The print is very small and I am very old.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Since my dog knocked the camera out off my wife’s hands and it dropped on the floor and broke the lenses we took all pictures with our cellphones. But the quality is not that good especially at night. I know my wife wanted a new camera and I got her this one. She is very happy with this camera. She likes the wide angle. We took a lot of photos on Easter and we love the quality. My wife likes the flip screen very much. She can take a selfie with our daughter whenever she wants. Anyway we ate really happy with this camera.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I want to buy a camera for travel with a low budget and I choose this one. After using this camera, it surprises me. Since its picture quality is good and the camera weight is not too heavy. It comes with two batteries, so I can use my camera for a whole day and don't need to worry about the battery. It also takes video and has wifi function. When you take a picture you also have a few model function can choose. The best thing is the screen can turn, so you can take a selfie.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Camera was pretty simple to set up. Did have to look at the manual for a few things, such as setting the date and time. Camera reads a micro SD inside of an SD adapter but won't write to it. A regular SD does work just fine though. Was able to record an hour long video and still had some battery left. Nice that it came with a second battery and the wide angle lens was very handy.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This is very nice and stylish camera.  Is easy to use and reliable. In the bundle, it has a simple pouch, but that is fiddly to use . The bundle includes a good size lenses so it's ready to go for any purpose.  The camera slips easy into a pocket, and the supplied wrist strap is handy for carrying it ready for use when sightseeing. The lens is good quality and can make a decent picture where a photo would struggle.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this low-cost camera for my husband who is not at all tech savvy. I needed something simple for him and this fits the bill. I was really surprised by the quality of the pictures. They are, in fact, quite good. Sure, it doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the expensive cameras, but it is great for a beginner or for a child's first camera.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: How can you go wrong with a $40 digital camera. This camera takes adequate pictures and is great for taking photos on trips where your running around. No need to worry about loosing the camera @ this price point it's easily replaceable. It's not going to rival a Pro DSLR but for a quick trip to the Zoo, fine.. OR even better give this camera to your up and coming Photographer.. This is perfect for agest 12+, that exactly how I view it... IT works..

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Got this student camera just in time for my daughter's camping trip this week. After learning from the manual, this compact HD digital camera turns out to be very functional, yet simple and lightweight enough for a kid to handle. The switch on the side of the camera controls close up shot vs landscape shot, while only in landscape shot mode, you can use the digital zoom option. As for the image sizes, there are over a dozen image / pixel sizes to choose from. Also there are various scene options for different scenarios on the go, all managed from the menu setting. It comes with a wrist strap, a camera pouch, wall charger with USB cable, and TWO rechargeable lithium batteries. My daughter can't wait to take it to the camp and capture precious moments with her friends!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: If you are looking for a good quality camera thats easy to use this is your camera. Must say I definitely got what I wanted. The best part about it is thay it brings a USB wire and for a bonus 2 batteries. It does not come woth a memory card but you can get one at any pharmacy or almost any store. I bought it as a gift and when I set it up to make sirr it worked well I decided to keep it 😬. A must get and the price is definitely not bad.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: For the price nice simple basic  camera. The packaging is great. The camera looks nice and comes with 2 batteries.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I'm beyond happy, on how this cheap looking camera works so well! The main use of this camera was to use it to vlog, and i was willing to accept an okay, good quality camera to record videos (one that captures better quality than my phone) as a starting point (to invest on a better one),  but this passed my expectations! The quality is great! It is definitely 1080 definition and the photo aspact captures pictures well!,It's amazing how it came with an extra battery pack, a lens (that pulls out of outlook), and a wire that i guess you can connect to the tv.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I'm a  photographer and I was just looking for a quality camera for my kids.  Overall it does what it says will do.  The menu system is a little clunky, but it seems to be as good as some of the old point and shoots you could buy at the big box stores, but will also shoot video. It has facial recognition which is great, but overall it needs good light to take quality pictures. I'm actually impressed that it has 3 different types of lenses included.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: It is a great gift for kids. I bought for my little cousin to learn how to take photo. It is light weight, and my cousin can carry it for vacation. This camera is very easy and simple to use. And it is modern style. The photos are good considering the low price of this camera. What's more, it was shipped very fast.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I purchased this camera for my 10 year old daughter to take on her first class trip to Washington DC this past weekend. When the camera arrived last week, we charged the batteries, purchased a SanDisk SD card to store images on, and got a padded case to go with it. After batteries were charged we tested the camera and took several pictures to make sure the camera was working, and to make sure our daughter knew how to operate all the functions on it.  Nothing seemed amiss, our daughter was thrilled, and she was all set to go.,Upon her return this evening, we found out that the camera began glitching. The screen would freeze after taking pictures, every few photos. The second day she used the camera it froze and became unresponsive. Her teacher turned the camera off and on to see if it would unfreeze, and my daughter reported that half of her photos on the SD card had disappeared.  When my daughter took more pictures and tried to review them, there was an error message saying "no such file exists".  She then turned the camera off and back on again, and the device erased ALL the pictures on the SD card.,We have tried to connect the camera to our computer, and it will not allow itself to be recognized by our computer.  We hooked the SD card up to a separate card reader with USB port, and the SD card is functioning just fine.  Just empty.,This camera is a worthless piece of junk, and my child is now absolutely HEARTBROKEN because NONE of the pictures she took on trip were recorded, and she has NO pictures from her first trip to our nation's capital.  The reviews all said this camera was great for kids and as a starter camera.  I do agree with it's basic shape - the size of the camera body was just right for her, the functions were simple and easy to figure out, and the extra battery was a nice bonus.  But there must be some major flaw in the internal components for it to completely erase a brand new SD card.,Do not purchase this camera if you are wanting your child or family member to have a reliable device to take pictures of anything memorable. This camera should be taken off Amazon and any other selling marketplaces. It is a waste of money to purchase this, period.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I got this camera for a week long bike trip to keep in my jersey and avoid using my phone all the time to conserve my phone battery life. I had digital cameras in the 1990s that performed better. This product had absolutely terrible image quality and battery life and was completely unreliable and dysfunctional. If you are on a tight budget, take the time and save up for something better or try yard sales for something more proven- you'll be better off.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Bought this camera for my 7 and 11 yo. daughters and they love it. We took them on a vacation and they had lots of fun taking photos.,The camera is small (i.e. easy to carry) and in good light takes some pretty nice photos. Not great in low light, but there's a flash. Comes with TWO batteries, which is nice. One battery lasts quite awhile, but it's nice to have the backup.,Zoom is only digital. Does not come with an SD card, so make sure you buy one or two. I bought 16GB cards and they did not get filled on the trip.,Bottom line - you get a lot for $41. There are a fair number of settings and it doesn't break the bank. But be reasonable with your expectations - it's not an expensive camera.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I am amazed at the quality of the picture from this little camera even with the zoom. If you look there are a lot of settings as well as Automatic. It does macro as well as landscape with just the flick of a switch. It also does video, I have only used this by accident so I can not speak to its size or quality. THis beats a lot of name brand point and shoot for a lot more money and it fits easily in my shirt pocket.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: So upset camera came with the charging port broken and we bought it just for our Maui trip. Now we have to buy one there.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: it was one of the best purchases I have had from Amazon, worked perfectly under water

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I like it.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Lovely camera at a great price. I'd been looking at proper go pro's but so glad I didn't waste my money. This does everything you want and you get a few different mounts with it as it's waterproof. I'm planning on using it to go skiing. Simple to use but watch the online video on YouTube about it if you need any extra help.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Safety is most important when i bought electical products to my son.I will not worried about the electical safety when this camera need power.And this is really nice so this is definitely something i would buy as a gift. Also the pictures quality is very perfect, worth the money.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I was equally happy with my one attempt at photographing fish whilst snorkelling, even if the fish around Mallorca weren’t as photogenic as those I’d seen on previous holidays in more exotic locations.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Bought this camera for a up coming trip to Florida, so far it has worked really well for doing things around the house.,Well worth the money spent. I feel like I might buy a 2nd one soon. Recommend!

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: The first impression is that it is an excellent and small carry around camera with excellent picture quality, menu structure is much better and easy to use, very happy with this camera

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: The camera fogs up so it's hard to get clear photos. Not worth the money. The buttons jam up and they are hard to press. I took it to Belize and I used my phone in a waterproof case more than this camera

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I bought this for my husband as he did his open water Padi on holiday, which goes to 18 meters and for a first time use this was great. It's perfect for snorkeling too.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Have this camera 3 years now and aside from daylight  shots, the photos taken everyplace else inside, at night etc, never seem to match up to the hellishly good photos taken on my prior Canon cameras where I could aim at the crescent moon and get the moon and the planet Venus I think it is, and it comes out with zoom so clearly.  This camera always seemed to produce tired photos no matter what. I am hoping that a newer Canon, maybe with a little more cash investment will end up being  satisfactory as these onetime reasonable priced and quality filled powershots models are a thing of the past.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera has Digital Image Stabilization which is as ineffective as "digital zoom." Besides the falsity of the description, the lack of effective stabilization makes even worse the slow f3.2 lens at widest opening. Useless unless in bright sunlight. Not worth even the apparently low price offered.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I've tried larger, fancier, more expensive cameras for a number of years, but the ones in my mid-price range never seem to perform as advertised. Plus they're big and awkward to carry around for spontaneous shots. The Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 has been absolutely perfect for my needs. No frills, no bells and whistles, just good photos.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera is nice because it is so small - almost miniature -  but that is all I like.  Battery will not hold a charge.  Assuming this one is defective or old from product being in storage before shipping, but it is unreasonable to ask a buyer to spend $30-$40 more on a new battery when the product is advertised as coming with a battery.  The download process is slow, and way more complicated that is needs to be.  Comparing this one to my old Canon Powershot A480 . . ..This is a low-end model,, so if you are considering Canon go a little higher price and get a better quality camera,  I am disappointed . . ...

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I use this camera everyday for work.  This is my 3rd power shot.  The first is still being used occasionally by my wife, the second got water logged in my pocket so I stole the battery and memory card and pitched the rest, the third is in use and will be for several more years before I destroy it in some unintended stupid way.  Get one, you won't be disappointed.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: It is the best price I could find on an Elph anywhere: my daughter is taking a school trip to DC and we got this for her. The price and value are perfect for the trip. I’m very pleased with the purchase and camera. We aren’t one of those families that give their children cell phones at 10- I’m actually vehemently opposed to children having electronics because they stop learning how to talk to people in person and look at the world they are in. So we needed something for pictures without a phone- because that’s not happening in this house. She’s 13 and doesn’t pack a purse so this is perfect size for her to put in just a small wristlet or something. Overall, perfect solution and amazing first camera for a teen.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This is a fine digital camera for one looking for a very reasonably priced one.  It is very easy to set up and use, and the images it captures are generally admirable.  The instruction guide could have provided more detail, and more expensive cameras should be able to take sharper photos.  But for someone not interested in spending lots of money, this camera is a good buy.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought this camera two months on September 23, 2018, and the bottom fell off.  I have an old Powershot SD1100IS that I have taken to several vacation trip and lasted much longer than this ELPH180.  This new camera I take it to school for my class and been sitting in the back of my backpack.  The backpack is not even full of books.  How can this camera fell apart so fast?  Will try to contact Cannon to get a replacement.  Quality is terrible.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: You can't charge the battery over the USB cord, you have to pop it out and use the special charger.  Getting the battery out and back in, facing the right way is very difficult for older people with limited vision and dexterity.  If I had know, I wouldn't have purchased the camera.  Otherwise, it is a good little camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I was really disappointed when this arrived to find it incredibly light weight and felt rather cheap -- all plastic.  I owned the same model from 5 years ago and LOVED it. I just felt like the gates to the the ports and battery were ready to snap off at a moment's notice on this newer model.  I need something a little more sturdy for my clumsy soul.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This camera does not take quality pictures at all.  My phone takes better and it shouldn't.  I am tech savvy and read all directions.  I am just not happy with it and will find another.  I am returning this.  For $90 it should do better, this is a $40 camera with a $90 price tag. I will say it was in original packaging and arrived quickly. Thats about all the good.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Had similar SONY in past. Buy this new one. It is made of PLASTIC! Aluminum case is gone! 20mg max. I was on a cruise. New 16gb card. I took 543 pictures! played with pixels, high - low. Tried easy function. The zoom SUCKS! for sunset, horizon. I was not moving. Slow steady hand. 1/3, 33% of the 543 pictures were crap, fuzzy, distorted????,I did buy this cheap cam for taking ebay pics. I can not afford the new?? BIG, OLD style looking 35mm cameras? Really? Thought this new technology was smaller and easy to put in pocket! Yes, I was on a vacation! I have a smart phone that works better. But I hate them! I am 61 and still use  a  desk top PC to store and use paint program.,But cam had a nice long battery life ( of course being new it did ). Did not try video.,But this should have been $49.99. Cost them $3-4 dollars to make in China?? JMO!,I would not buy it again!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this as a gift for my 11 year old daughter for our trip to Europe.  It's a decent little camera.  The pictures turn out nice.  Although it feels a little flimsy (lightweight) she dropped it several times and it didn't break.  My only complaint is it's a little slow between pictures.  You take a picture and wait a couple seconds before it's ready to take another.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I have had a few Nikon Coolpix cameras over the years and loved them, but when my last one finally gave out I decided to try this Sony camera and I wish I hadn't. No matter what the photos are never very clear, are grainy, the colors are always off, the colors with the flash are off and don't look good. It's ok if you take photos in extreme bright sunlight, but anything else and it's not very good.,Worst of all is the horrible video mode which is completely useless. There is no way to stop it from going out of focus constantly. The Nikon Coolpix has two video focus settings, fixed and continuous, and the Nikon's focusing isn't bad at all, it only adjusts it when needed. This Sony on the other hand constantly goes in and out of focus literally every ten seconds making all videos completely unwatchable.,Forget this camera and go buy a Nikon Coolpix. I am.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Pictures were all blurry.  Not sure if we got a dud, or if all these camera's are blurry, but we returned it and bought something different.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: What's cameras in nice small portable easy to work with has a great zoom for how small it is pictures come out very clear and for less than $80 you can't go wrong with this device especially if you get a good size SD card for storage in a good case to put it in

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: So far a cheap and ez camera to use, not many functions, no display button to clear the screen of stuff, cheap and plasticky, light, kind of seems like a real cheap feeling camera, but seems to take descent enough pics and vids is a one button option that as soon as pushed starts filming then when pushed again stops.  Downloads are as ez as drag and drop and quick too.  I'm hoping to get some you tube use of this camera which I got with a tripod.  Not near as nice as my old 600.00 sony camera but twenty megapixels and good for 70.00.  If your expecting aluminum body and a whole list of options this is not the camera for you, mostly an intuitive camera that doe's everything for you and shows you flashes on the screen of what it's doing, such as night time, portrait, facial focus, low light, etc.  Great kids camera but I think some adults might be let down if looking for a fancy sony high end product.  Good enough is what I keep saying, I will update this in time maybe if it works better or worse to let you know.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: After I finally got it (took a week to ship it, 2days to get here), I am real pleased with it. It's easy to use. It stays charged well, though I had read reviews that it didn't. I'm no photographer, I just wanted to take some pictures of sun rises and my family, pets, etc. and it does a good job of that.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I purchased this to replace my old Kodak that is no longer supported online.  I'm liking it, so far.  Just a matter of getting used to something new. Takes very nice pictures (even better than my old Kodak!).  Worth the money, I think.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I used this a few times for biking.  Great for still shots, not so great for moving/action shots.  Even the still shots sometimes look a little crumby.  The only advantage this camera has over an iphone 6s is the zoom quality. I've actually resorted back to using my phone for its ease of use.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: My younger daughter (age 6) has taken an interest in nature photography and I wanted to get her a better camera than the advertised 'kid cameras'.  This camera takes good pictures and the LCD screen is ample. It's also easy for her to use. She's dropped it a few times and it's still working like new. She has taken pictures nonstop. You do need an SD card to store photos that isn't provided but that seems standard for most cameras.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: My six-year-old son LOVES to borrow my camera to take pictures, and he’s actually pretty good so I decided to get him his own camera as a treat. This is just what I was hoping for for the price: a basic, functional digital camera that is easy for him to use, won’t break the bank, and I won’t have to cry if (when) it gets broken. Picture quality could be better, but as I say it’s perfect for our needs and my son couldn’t be happier with it.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Perfect graduation present for an outgoing senior. Was able to capture all her graduation memories and then give her the camera and the memories before sending her away to college to make more. Very lightweight and compact yet does not lack in quality of photos or features.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Great small camera. I’m not a big bag person I’m more of a small bag person. The size of this camera is great for me since it’s small enough to fit in my small bag. Picture quality is just as great as any larger more expensive camera. So easy to use instructions were easy to follow

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Great quality and great price.  Bought this for grandma because of the strap and carrying case.  I love that if you have used any other camera you are an expert on this one. At 70 she was able to pick this up and go. She found the size perfect. The picture stabilization helped and the smile finder was useful. We added a SD card to the gift and it was a perfect combination.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: My son was always taking my phone to take pictures and using up the memory. I decided to try something like this. It is definitely durable as he has dropped it multiple times. It’s easy to turn on and off and snap a picture. The picture screen is clear. It’s the perfect size and fits in a small bag and can even easily fit in your pocket.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I purchased this camera for my seven-year-old. He has been asking for his own camera to take pictures and small videos. This camera is very easy to use and he is able to move through the functions easily. The quality is great for the price that you pay for this camera. He enjoys using it and takes it everywhere! This is an easy to use, affordable and fun camera.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: This is perfect for my son! It’s small & light weight so it’s easy for him to hold in his little hands. It’s easy to use. Love that It has flash & zooms in a lot. Very happy with this purchase.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I find it very handy to keep with me for those times when you really just don’t want to take a lousy picture on your phone. It’s compact, lightweight and easy to use. It’s easy to download photos to your desktop or laptop. It takes good pictures. Good enough to have printed and put in an album or share.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: This camera is perfect for beginners, kids, or even us older folk!  It isn't for super high quality pictures but works awesome for family outings!  It is slim and lightweight so it fits anywhere!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Works good, gets the job done. However, it kills batteries incredibly fast (no matter what kind of batteries I use). If you plan to go on any sort of tour or hike (something where it needs to last a while), this camera will not work for you. However, if you just use it occasionally for a few minutes, it'll be fine. Just make sure you have extra batteries.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I like this little camera - I was looking for something small enough to flip into my bag, quick enough operation for quick pictures, and with enough programing to help me snap quick pictures without getting bogged down with tedious adjustments.  Granted I am not a professional photographer but this little camera allows me the quick snap pictures and fun I was looking for.  The AA batteries are certainly affordable and available anywhere. The pictures are super easy to download to your computer.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Under no circumstances are you to buy this piece of ****!! you take 5 pictures and your batteries are history. its a waste of money and more than that is a plain rip-off I am not satisfied with this product but I doubt I'll get my money back. Hopefully the people  at Kodak can read this!!!!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This was a gift for a student of mine’s so I don’t have pics of it to post, but within the first few hours the batteries that came with the camera had already drained out. The focus/ quality of the photos were piss-pour and the flash also wasn’t the best. The audio quality of the video is terrible. Can’t expect too much for a camera at this price point but All in all, if you are planning to gift this to anyone older than 5 years-old then I do not recommend. And if you do happen to gift this to someone, I’d recommend purchasing some rechargeable batteries. They will need them.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: My old Kodak camera died, so I bought this little one.  It has no operational book included, which doesn't seem like a big deal.  However, I'm 78 and not able to use the computer to study & achieve the knowlege to operate this thing.  I found a manual in print on-line which I ordered (all 86 pages of it) and it will take up space and weight in my suitcase on vacation but it's at least something in words that I can use to learn to operate this camera. I would have appreciated a little instruction booklet to help me understand how to operate this item.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: The camera takes great pictures and is easy for a novice to use right out of the box. That said, don't take it camping unless you also bring 10 pounds of batteries. It seems to eat right through the heavy-duty lithium rechargeables I bought to go with it. Maybe it does better with throw-aways, I don't know. But with my batteries it used them up in less than 40 shots with no flash.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I love it now that I have managed how to operate it. Great quality pictures. Great price. Need to learn how to make videos with it but the instructions are so teeny one can't read them and the website it directed me to, isn't live. I shall keep trying. I like this camera. The value is there.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This is very small, but has very good quality photos and is easy enough to use.  Any child under 9 may have trouble , but we like the small pocket size just fine.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I bought this to use in my classroom as I do  year end slide show for parents.  I have used it 4x in September and taken approximately 20 photos.  The camera will not charge, nor will the lens retract.  So I basically wasted $65.  Apparently the window for returns was Sept 11th for me.  I do not recommend this camera.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I have the same issues as a lot of the other reviewers. The batteries do NOT last in this camera at all. It came with brand new batteries.  I put them in and gave it to my mom as a gift. She tried using the camera a week later and the batteries were completely dead. I put new ones in. She tried using the camera a couple weeks later and again, dead batteries. This happened three times. It takes good pictures when you have fresh batteries, but as soon as you let it sit, it drains and becomes an expensive paperweight. One star because although it can work, it makes it too expensive and inconvenient to do so.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: SHORT SUMMARY,===============,The X-T30 is, in my opinion, the best all-purpose camera under $1000 right now. The X-T30’s still image quality, video quality, ease of use, and good portability all add up to a winning combination. The only major negative about this camera is the lack of in-body image stabilization (IBIS), which is a sacrifice needed for both cost and weight savings. Arguably the Sony A6400, which is the closest direct competitor, has slightly better autofocus and a more versatile front-facing flip screen, but if you like some of the Fuji-distinctive professional features like manual control dials, film simulation modes, and clean output of 10-bit 4:2:2 over HDMI, you can stop looking right now and just buy the X-T30.,Is the X-T30 good enough to tempt you from your current system of lenses to the Fuji ecosystem? I made this exact decision almost two years ago. Getting the X-T20 in late 2017 and using it for a few months led me to sell my 2 Canon bodies, 2 flashes, and 6 lenses because I realized Canon would never give me un-cropped 4K video at a great price. Now, the X-T30 is a vastly superior camera to my beloved X-T20, so you might be next into the Fuji fold!,BACKGROUND,===============,I owned the X-T20 for a year before trading up to the X-T3, so this X-T30 is my third Fuji and I’ll use it as a second body for me and as a shared camera for my 14-year-old (I need a B cam for video and he needs a smaller camera to fit his hands, so we'll both use it at different times). All these purchases give me insight into a big chunk of the Fuji lineup, so I’ll compare it to both the X-T20 and the X-T3 so that current Fuji owners or prospective  Fuji owners can know where this new model sits in the ecosystem. I still use Canon bodies and the Panasonic GH5 extensively at work for video, so I’ll compare it to those systems as well.,FEATURES I LOVE,==================,Here are the major standouts of the X-T30 that make it exceptional for the sub-$1000 price bracket:,▶ 4K VIDEO with oversampling instead of binning or skipping, something that’s computationally difficult to do on a larger sensor like the 26MP APS-C found here; the X-T30 has the same quad-core processor as its bigger brother, the X-T3, so it can easily handle video tasks. The fast processor also makes the overall interface feel snappy and consistently quick (no lag).,▶ The X-T30 yields beautiful, low-noise 26-MP STILL IMAGES from the X-Trans APS-C sensor.  APS-C is quite a bit bigger than the Micro 4/3 sensors in this size and price range. This is the same sensor size as the entire X-mount lineup, and some sites claim that the detailed studio low-light noise tests show slightly worse on this model than its 24-MP predecessors, but in the real world I have found that the performance is superb. When paired with one of Fuji’s well-built X-mount lenses, the still images will hold up well to any DSLR under 30MP (and the video looks as good as any 4K camera PERIOD, matching units costing 3x-5x as much!). Check out the various demos online of the video quality, especially if you can download the original file and not rely on overly-compressed uploads like the ones you'll see here or on a video sharing site.,▶ Convenient HANDLING and extreme PORTABILITY: you can buy this camera and a Fuji pancake lens for portability that rivals a large smartphone (albeit too thick for most pockets), but with manual controls readily available at your fingertips that bring back the joy of photography. This carries over well from the X-T20 that I owned before and that brought back the fun I had lost after owning a succession of five different Canon DSLRs during the previous 12 years. The most obvious change is that the X-T30 eliminates the discrete selector buttons on the back in favor of a 4-way joystick, and in general I think this is an upgrade. The much-discussed Q-button placement that's now directly under your right thumb takes some getting used to, but you may end up buying one of the grips or hand straps that allows you to fully customize the ergonomics, so this is always a very subjective discussion anyway. Ultimately I prefer the X-T3 with a battery grip because my hands are pretty big, but the X-T30 feels plenty secure when I use a hand strap to attach it to my right wrist.,▶ Super fast, accurate, predictive AUTOFOCUSING in stills and videos (even beating the X-T3 until the T3 gets an update). I'm not a sports photographer, but I do have kids that dart around, so the X-T30 is a big improvement over the X-T20 and I'm eagerly awaiting the new firmware for the X-T3.,▶ Absurdly fast CONTINUOUS STILL SHOOTING, up to 30 FPS or 20 FPS with no crop; the buffer will fill up ridiculously fast, but it’s nice to know this is available, especially if you have a fast SD card that can drain the image buffer quickly. The image buffer is on the small side; don't plan on using the 20 FPS mode for more than a second!,▶ Unrivaled PORTS and HDMI OUTPUT for a camera of this size: thankfully Fuji has embraced USB-C for charging, and the X-T30 adds the ability to use USB-C headphones as well so that you can have a microphone (via 2.5mm adapter) and monitor the playback on the USB-C port. Usually, this combo is only found on much bigger/pricier cameras and it makes the X-T30 a serious contender for a real video production camera (as long as you can work around the 10-min limit for 4K recording to the card). You can bypass the time limit via HDMI where you can output clean 4:2:2 10-bit footage (with or without the subdued color F-log setting) that makes this camera on par with professional Hollywood rigs for post-processing and color tweaking. Most of the time you'll want clips shorter than 10 minutes anyway! By pro standards, a $900 body is disposable, so to get this level of color science and bitrate at this price would have been unthinkable even 3 years ago, especially for internal recording on an SD card. The Panasonic GH5 really changed the landscape when it launched 2 years ago, and the X-T3/X-T30 have continued that trend at even lower price points (with larger sensors that do better still images).,FEATURES THAT I DISLIKE OR ARE JUST MISSING,========================================,▶ Where is the flippy screen!?!? The size and weight of this camera would be perfect for blogging, but you can’t see yourself because the screen only tilts and never flips up to face the front. Canon and Panasonic have this figured out and maybe they have strong patents or another way to scare off poor Fuji. The autofocus on the X-T30 is great at holding your face, fortunately, but it’s still unnerving to not see anything when the camera is pointed toward you. My cheap workaround is to use my phone (strapped to a Gorillapod leg) as a Wi-Fi live view, but there's a small delay and it's hard to tell focus accuracy.,▶ Only one card slot. I’m being picky because no other camera in the segment has two cards, but I dearly love that feature of the X-T3.,▶ 2.5mm mic jack. Why, oh why? I get that this non-standard small mic port doubles as a remote release, but Fuji please just throw an IR port shutter release on the front and call it a day. Every video person has to buy an adapter to get good sound from their external mic! Maybe include a nice adapter in the box?,▶ No battery grip option. Even my old/cheap Rebel cameras had support for a battery grip, and this X-T30 is even smaller than those, so big hands may be really frustrated with the X-T30. Fortunately, my unit is always on a Gorillapod for stills or on a gimbal or tripod for video, so it’s not a big deal for me. It's a great size for my 14-year-old.,▶ Battery life is barely adequate for Fuji-brand batteries and terrible for other brands. Especially for video, you have to buy the fancy, expensive Fuji batteries because the knock-offs don’t hold up. The “S” on the 126S battery denotes some sort of better heat dissipation for 4K video, but none of the aftermarket makers have gotten the message on how to do this. Fuji even gives you a dire message when you’re using a knock-off, so consider yourself warned.,X-T30 VS . . . .,==============,Vs. the Fuji X-T20 (previous model),▶ A small upgrade compared to my trusty little X-T20. If you only shoot STILLS, you'll enjoy the new autofocus joystick and enhanced algorithm, but it's probably not worth the money for only 2 extra megapixels. The image quality isn't that much better and may actually be slightly worse in extreme low-light conditions (pixel peeping in the lab/studio).,▶ For VIDEO, the new autofocus on the X-T30 makes a bigger difference. Video autofocus is actually fully usable now. Also in the video realm, the image quality at 4K is oversampled thanks to the quad-core processor, so you should notice a difference in fine details and noise because the X-T20 used line skipping to get 4K from the entire sensor width.,▶ Headphone monitoring via a USB-C adapter.
