If you're using the X-T30 for video, you can now monitor the audio levels with headphones directly in the camera and check that your external microphone is working well.,Vs. the Fuji X-T3 (bigger brother/sister),▶ The X-T30 is very comparable in terms of image quality and video quality, so the additional $500 for the X-T3 is all about ERGONOMICS, size, and usability. The biggest exception is 4K at 60 FPS; if you need that, buy the X-T3.,▶ They've reserved pro-level features, like the battery grip option, PC (studio flash) port, and larger viewfinder for people MAKING A LIVING from their daily camera use.,▶ If you've got bigger hands, need more ports, want the best video rates (60 fps and 400 Mbps internally), prefer the larger viewfinder, or generally need the best Fuji has to offer in the small sensor space, get the X-T3.,▶ If you need the smaller ergonomics and want to spend the $500 difference on a NICE LENS, you won't sacrifice that much by choosing the X-T30.,▶ There's not nearly as much difference between the T30 and the T3 as there was between the T20 and the T2. It's a great day to be shopping for a sub-$1000 Fujifilm camera!,Vs. the Sony A6400,▶ The Sony A6400 has the same sensor size and is priced head-to-head with the Fujifilm X-T30. The choice will come down more to your preference for which manufacturer and system of lenses you want to commit to than the actual camera body. Sony, thankfully, now has a wide array of bodies in this size and price range, which was their differentiator until they disrupted the full-frame scene with their mirrorless strategy.,▶ I had this exact choice, Sony vs. Fuji, when I went to Fuji two years ago. I actually sold a Sony Handycam and Canon EOS DSLR (and a bunch of lenses) to buy into the Fuji X-mount system of bodies and lenses. I chose Fuji because:,▶ Sony's menu system on the mirrorless cameras confuses me. I've used Canon and Nikon extensively in the past and now use Fuji and Panasonic regularly, but Sony seemed to be way worse in my eyes. This is subjective, but it's a constant thing I didn't want to deal with. Ergonomics count, especially when you get used to Fuji's excellent dial system--wow!,▶ Fuji has made an all-in commitment to APS-C, the sensor size that's smaller than 35mm full-frame but also quite a bit larger than micro-4/3 (MFT). I went with the APS-C sensor size when I purchased my first Canon digital Rebel in 2005 and I was pleased with Sigma's lens choices (some meant for APS-C, some for full frame). I didn't feel stymied at all enjoying the good balance between weight and grip size. Sigma does have many lenses for Sony, but Sony's native APS-C lenses have a lot of feature and focal-length gaps. Fuji just doesn't make a bad lens in the XF space, and there aren't really any major gaps, which is a good thing since there aren't many (any?) autofocus third-party lenses for the X-mount. Pro-tip--Sigma can convert existing lens mounts for a price, so you may be able to pay for permanent conversion or buy an adapter if you end up going from Canon to Sony or Nikon to Sony and want to bring your non-Sony lenses. That wasn't an option for me, so I sold everything and bought Fuji gear.,▶ At the time, I was giving up Sony's better AF tracking, which has improved even further in this latest A6400 (borrowed mostly from more expensive Sony full-frame models). Fortunately, the X-T30 also has upgraded AF, so I think the Sony and Fuji options are now fairly equal, especially since you can get nice, fast Fuji XF prime lenses in either f/1.4 or f/2.0 flavors. The f/2.0 series especially won't break the bank and are super lightweight, well-made and SMALL.,▶ I am seriously wishing the X-T30 had the Sony's front-flippable screen for vlogging. Canon, Panasonic, and Sony have all figured out ways to do this. What's holding back Fuji?? The A6400 has a flip-up screen, but it's a little hard to use if you mount a shotgun microphone on top of the camera. You'll need a little bracket from Smallrig that moves the cold shoe mount over to the right side, thus exposing the screen to front viewers.,Vs. Micro 4/3 (MFT),Wow, I'm categorizing a ton of great camera from Olympus, Panasonic, etc. into this one bucket. But, if you're really starting out fresh with your next choice of a camera body (and locking yourself into a system of lenses), use this as a jumping off point for your research.,▶ For STILL images, the X-T30's larger sensor and higher pixel count will produce much cleaner, lower-noise images. It's as much better than MFT as the full-frame cameras (like the Nikon D850 that's over three grand) are better than the X-T30. The difference is that the X-T30 costs about the same, or often significantly less than, the MFT equivalents. The weird part is that even without third-party lenses, the native Fuji lenses are often similarly priced or cheaper than the MFT lens for an equal focal length. I very nearly purchased a G-series Panasonic MFT camera before going with Fuji, and lens selection was very heavy in my decision.,▶ For VIDEO, Panasonic is really hard to beat. Their GH5 / GH5S duo is just stunning. With in-body stabilization in the GH5 and a 4K-centric chip in the GH5S, these rugged little guys are amazing. I use the GH5 at work (and the GH3 and GH4 before that) and it's so cool to have pro-level features in a small, cheap body. I really love the auto-focus pull automation and the excellent stabilization on the GH5, both of which are best-in-class. Ultimately I chose the Fuji series because of the still image quality, and now with this latest generation in the X-T30 and X-T3 that support high-bitrate internal recording and F-log, I'm not really giving up much in the video space (other than IBIS). I wish Fuji would have waveforms built in, but for the extra cost of a GH5 over the X-T30, I can buy an Atomos 5" screen that has all that, or upgrade to the recording version and record 10-bit 4:2:2 over HDMI with HLG. Wow, that's a lot of technobabble, but the price/value ratio of the X-T30 gives you a TON of options for lenses and other pro-level accessories that you would still need to purchase with the GH5.,Vs. Canon and Nikon,Neither big C nor N are willing to be serious about the mirrorless APS-C sensor size, especially when it comes to video features and native lenses.,▶ Canon's M series is OK for stills but still a joke for video quality and pro-features. You do get their excellent dual-pixel autofocus, but Fuji has mostly caught up in that arena and surpassed Canon in everything else related to video features.,▶ I can't even say that I miss the beautiful flash system that I enjoyed with Canon because the cheap-o Godox TTL flashes I bought for Fuji seem to produce the same results that I got with my expensive EX600 speedlites, at 1/4 the price.,▶ The only saving grace for C & N in APS-C is the availability of Sigma lenses, like the excellent Sigma 18-35 f/1.8 that I owned for a few years. I would have abandoned Canon's APS-C system and gone full-frame long ago (or just to a cell phone) if it hadn't been for these Sigma DC HSM lenses that filled-in critical gaps. I'm very glad that Canon is making such amazing full-frame lenses for their new R body (and Nikon for Z), but it still doesn't help when you want a small body with a 6-oz f/2 lens like my X-T30 and 35mm f/2.0. You have to invest $1100 in a new iPhone to get anywhere near this ratio of quality to portability, and the X-T30 is available at launch with this 35mm lens for just $999.,I've attached 8 photos of the X-T30 by itself, and next to my X-T3. I hope you enjoyed reading this review! Please check out my profile and see the other reviews I've written as well.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: I'm really happy with this camera. I upgraded from the Fujifilm X-A5. It's very lightweight, which is what I was looking for. I can't stand when a camera is super heavy. This one is the perfect weight. I can tell already it will be great for traveling.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: I sold all of my Canon gear recently and went with this great Fujifilm camera. With the kit lens, it focuses with incredible speed and accuracy. The stabilization on the lens is great for video work as well. There are so many things that are great about this camera but I can't list them all.,One of my favorite capabilities of this camera is the ability to use vintage manual focus lenses. With the focus peaking feature you are able to confidently nail your focus. This feature has really brought back the fun in photography for me and exploring the wealth of affordable lenses.,If you have larger hands I would suggest an external grip, I went with the Meike MK-XT20G and it fits perfectly.,I was not sure if I should go with the X-T3 or the X-T30 and other than the larger grip area I have not been left wanting any of the features on the X-T3 so far.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: The "Fuji X T30" This is my 2nd Fuji product, have many Nikon's, and Sony's.,I like this medium sized body, easy to carry around,If you compare body to body with Sony medium body camera they are very close in features, but the kit lens that comes with Sony is not Zeiss, its sold by Sony, not sure who makes it. The Fuji kit lens 18-55 is an outstanding lens, this does make the package more expensive, but worth it - I think!,I have also always liked the colors that Fuji seems to be able to produce, In my opinion, superior to Sony.,A wise man once said the "The best camera is the one you have with you".,Now a days there are many cameras in this class that are all excellent, so far I like this one.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: Great for the casual shooter or as a backup / broll camera! I purchased this camera to compliment my Fuji X-T3.  It's definitely small in the hands and doesn't have all the dials of the X-T3, BUT the image quality is just as good!! Probably one of the best compact cameras in the market for the price.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: Sold my Canon Rebel T3i and Canon lenses and bought the Fuji X-T30.,Image quality:  no complaints! Focus accuracy, dynamic range, sharpness, low light performance, and noise reduction are all noticeably better.,Body and handling: I’m happy with the size and build quality, and I think it’s a good compromise between size and handling for my mediumish hands and preference to travel light.  It’s nice to have a body and lenses that fit the sensor size and I find that I bring the camera along for family outings, travel, etc more than I did before. The lenses are perfectly suited to the system, and are pleasantly clicky and smooth. They are small, metal, and lovely.  I was surprised though—I do miss DSLR controls on the camera body.  All reviews indicated that the dials made for an engaging experience, but I find that I actually need to disengage the camera to tweak the settings, whereas a DSLR allows you to modify settings with one hand without pulling your eye from the viewfinder. The Q button is a bit of a pain—-I often accidentally bring up the Q menu. The menu/ok button is also a pain—-I sometimes mean to bring up the menu but click ok. The joystick is great.,Autofocus: great, but not perfect. It’s faster than I’m used to, the full frame coverage is impressive, and it works in relatively dim light. It is not 100% intuitive and has a bit of a learning curve, however. And while it is faster than what I’ve used before, it remains a hair slower than my kids.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: My first "real" camera in a while. The image quality in both photos and videos is excellent and the camera is easy to handle. No rolling shutter in video, which makes a world of difference from other cameras in this price range and means you can actually shoot really beautiful video with it.,Overall I really love this camera, especially in combination with some of the nice prime lenses available for it. There's room for improvement, but I wouldn't want to trade it for anything else with the same form factor.,Instead of rehashing other reviews for this camera, I'll focus on a things I found noteworthy that I didn't find mentioned anywhere else, and only learned about from using the camera.,• No JPEG+RAW in Auto mode.,The camera can shoot in JPEG+RAW mode, which is my preferred choice. I will use the JPEGs to transfer to my iPhone wirelessly to quickly share a photo but keep the RAWs around for archival purposes. The Auto mode is a must-have feature to let anyone unfamiliar with the camera successfully take a picture with the camera. Sadly, you can't capture in JPEG+RAW in Auto mode. This is probably where you'll need RAW the most, because white balance and exposure will just be the camera's best guesses, and not what you chose carefully when shooting pictures yourself.,• Autofocus noise through built-in mic.,If you stick with the 18-55mm kit lens you won't have this problem because it has a very quiet focus mechanism. I bought the 23mm 1:1.4R and 35mm 1:1.4R lenses, and both have fairly loud autofocus mechanisms. Even when you use these lenses with manual focus, you're actually not controlling the assembly directly, it still uses the motors to focus. With either of these lenses, the internal mic is unusable because it will pic up constant focus whirring, which has ruined quite a few videos for me. The ST-1 external mic still pics up autofocus noise but less loudly, so you'll have to be creative and isolate the mic from the body physically and move it further away from the lens than the included mount does.,• Mobile app is poor.,The ability to wirelessly transfer photos from the camera to my smartphone was a key feature for me. It works most of the time, but the remote app is fairly poor. It's hard to understand and can take several tries and jumping through hoops to make it connect properly to the camera. The multi-select interface is finicky; if you don't have perfect aim for the checkmark, you are taken to a detail view with just the one photo, this is slow and when you go back, it is scrolled back to the top. After selecting a few photos and hitting transfer, sometimes it will tell you there is not enough room on your phone for the photos, and you need to start over. It doesn't tell you how many images it would have room for, so you just have to guess. Finally, remote capture is problematic. When you enable the live view, the connection with the camera prioritizes keeping the viewfinder up to date over taking a picture, so the shutter lag between photos is much longer than when taking pictures directly. This is pretty crappy when you're trying to take a group shot with yourself in it using your mobile phone, which is exactly the kind of situation where you'd want to rapidly take a lot of pictures to increase the odds of getting one where everyone's eyes are open at the same time.,The WiFi connection sometimes stutters, and it would be nice if the camera would let me pick what wifi channel to use, or if it could join my home WiFi network instead of having to do a ad hoc network between the camera and my iPhone, at least for remote shots taken at home.,• Microphone jack and USB-C port interfere with each other,If you use an external mic for video (you should) you'll have to disconnect it every time you connect the camera to USB-C. The connectors are spaced just slightly too close to each other to both be plugged into the camera at once. It would be sweet if they add a mic connector to the hot shoe for their own mic, so users don't need to have the camera door permanently open, deal with dangly cables, and the eventual inevitable failure of the minijack port plugging the cable in and out a lot.,• Q button,Okay, this one you will find in other reviews, but it's worth echoing here. It is very easy to accidentally hit the Q menu button. Not a problem for me, the primary operator of the camera, because I can slowly learn not to put my thumb there. The real problem here is that 9 out of 10 times when I hand the camera – in Auto mode – to someone else to take a picture, they will hit the Q menu and will get confused. There's now a firmware update that lets you remap this button and makes it slower to respond, so this should be somewhat improved.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: As a dedicated Fuji user I was curious about the improved autofocus vs. the past generations.  Believe the hype.  Set up the camera yesterday.  Slapped on my favorite XF lens - the 35 1.4.  Super snappy performance with the rendering that this particular lens is known for.,Took a short walk today with the 100-400 lens.  After a little cursing and disappointment at the tracking - the focus box was all over the place I realized that it was user error.,I had touch screen autofocus enabled and my nose was moving the box around.  Doh! 😂,Turned off the touchscreen AF and a tern flew by.  Boom!  Nailed it.  A duck flying by very quickly skimming the water over Lake Washington.  All 5 images were sharp.,I’m impressed.  The Charcoal Silver is very attractive and the AF is excellent.  Haven’t tried the Eye Recognition yet but that isn’t a top priority for me.,I miss the D pad but it isn’t a dealbreaker.  Having a hotshoe mounted thumb rest is a must on all the small XTs and helps to avoid the issues some are reporting with inadvertent Q button activation.,Worthwhile upgrade in my opinion.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: I own the A7iii as my "big" camera. It's so great but its heavy and large. The X-T30 is tiny! I purchased it with the 23mm F1.4. Makes for the perfect go to camera for daily carry. My Sony will always go on vacation with me but this little Fuji will go everywhere else. Having the same sensor/processor as the X-T3 is killer in a body this small. Fuji color/style comes through so well. I would recommend a grip as the body is a little awkward to hold due to its small proportions. Build in flash isn't the best but having it on the body at all times is so helpful in a pinch. "Auto" mode is pretty much terrible but you don't buy a Fuji for auto mode. Fuji lenses are cheaper than Sony's and are easily just as good. Make for a perfect Camera! Highly Recommend to anyone wanting Tiny and Mighty!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: After being hard set for so long on getting a Sony a6300/6400, I came across the X-T30 and decided to go for it based on how similar it was to the Sony specs-wise, as well as the Fuji having better professional reviews and a better kit lens (Sony's kits lenses are generally considered sub-par).,Also, Fuji having such a long history of great cameras..not to mention the great classic look of the X series, did me in.,I mostly got it for landscape and city/street photography, but also have hopes of doing astrophotography eventually with some 3rd party prime lenses (Fuji's primes are a bit out of my budget currently). Besides the lower price, I also selected it over it's big brother, the X-T3, because of its more compact size and lighter weight. But besides those things and a few minor feature limits, it is essentially the same camera for a few hundred $ less.,I will update soon with more thoughts and some photos..

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I've wanted a Canon EOS Rebel for years so finally splurged to buy one and glad I did. I took the attached pic of the full moon the other night with the optional 300mm lens I purchased and it works great!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: The purchase was extremely poorly packaged with little cushion and protection.  No surprise that there were broken parts.  Also the boxes and items seemed to have been opened and even previously used.  When trying to return it, post office refused to ship because of inclusion of lithium battery.  DHL can ship it but at a cost of more than USD250!  Now I am at a loss on what to do with the broken item I cannot use but already paid for.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: The original estimate for me receiving my camera was September 13th however I received the camera 2 days after I ordered it. The camera itself is great! I love all the accessories and I think it actually comes with a few more things than pictured. I'm an amateur when it comes to photography so I didn't really know what I was doing when I first opened the camera set up but it's pretty self explanatory once you read the manual to find out what everything does. The lenses are great! I haven't messed around with the filters yet but they're looking clean and clear. I'm super glad I bought this camera with all the accessories. I've priced cameras for over a year and I'm glad I finally got one. Great price for everything you get!!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I think the camera and the primary lens is what was described.  HOWEVER, the others items listed as "lens" ARE NOT LENSES - they are adaptors.  What is described as lenses screw to the front of the lenses attached to the camera. They do not attach directly to the camera.  This is a complete MISREPRESENTATION of what is being sold as lenses.  BUYER BEWARE!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Hate the stock lens. Look around and hunt down a better telephoto or a wide angle lens. It does come with stock versions however they just suck... They suck better than my vacuum... It's almost impossible to get a great shot of the moon even under the best lighting conditions. Other than that the other gimmes were okay, but really aren't necessary. You'll find out once you start to actually use the kit. IMO look into getting a colored lens kit for around 10-20 bucks. This will help with some of your nature shots and cut down on using Photoshop or other like programs for editing. Also, make sure to register this. I found out that the software for your model will be sent via a link that way you know what you need.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: The fit is perfect.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Seems like a pretty good kit for a beginner so far, I'm just starting out, so I'll find out. Most of the kit items are of low quality, but the it's a great setup for a beginner on a budget. The wide angle lens I received however does not fit the anything that came with the kit (including it's own cap). I'm pretty sure some of this was used, but I mostly got it for the camera and lens. I'm frustrated the lens isn't usable right now, but all in all, if you have no supplies, I guess it's a start. I may have gone with another kit though if I knew the lens wasn't going to work. To clarify, the telephoto lens works fine, the macro wide angle lens does not. (And if there's a piece I need to make it fit, it doesn't come with the kit, so still useless right now.)

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I've been watching this camera and package for years now and I finally bought it. I love it! It was everything I wanted and more. This is my first DSLR so I figured from other reviews, I would get familiar with the camera and technic and slowly upgrade lens, etc... the price is the same for the camera alone so why not add all the extra for free pretty much. The bag is perfect size to carry everything. The camera is VERY user friendly. I went on Pinterest to find tips and tricks for this camera and became overwhelmed with all the options. But just playing with it for a few hours, I feel like a pro already :) no Pinterest involved lol. I use the telephoto lens the most!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I was excited to order this because I read so many great reviews about the video quality from this camera.  But it really was not worth the money I spent on it.  The camera on my smartphone is far superior to this.  Maybe I'll just use it for photographs.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: LOVE my camera! It was a dream come true to buy it. It's the best camera I've ever gotten. However not sure how the warranty works, so I feel I wasted money on that part. However the camera itself is amazing! Plus all the accessories that comes with it is awesome and very helpful!

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Not a good fit for my Canon G7 Mk II. Very tight and awkward to get the camera into and out of the case. I will be returning it.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Works as expected.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: It's practice but offer poor protection.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: too small

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: The camera is wonderful. Appropriate for a beginner and takes great pictures.  A lot of the equipment included in this kit is quite useful, and some I haven't touched yet. I did try out the telephoto lens extender and found it difficult to thread properly.  It pulled apart when I removed it from the kit lens and I wasn't quite sure what lens parts belonged with the kit lens and which ones belonged with the extender.  But I eventually figured it out.  So, I'd just say be careful with the extenders. Thread them slowly and delicately or they come apart.  The tripod has a removable clip that you can leave on your camera to easily clip back onto the tripod.  Very convenient.  Overall, I'm pleased with this purchase.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: OK --but tight

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Good case overall. Fits well. Good protection for camera though some of stitching is easily exposed. Initial quality is a little suspect but I believe it'll last.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Fits my camera very well. I feel that it is well protected.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: The Belt Loop ripped off the first day I had it.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Despite the advertised claim, it's too small and does not fit the Nikon Coolpix S9900. However, it was a fast and easy prepaid return and refund.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: I got this camcorder for my upcoming trip abroad and I know for a fact that my iPhone will not hold up enough videos due to limited space. I needed a camcorder that will allow me to use SD cards so that, I wont have to keep transferring my videos to my computer. Also, I really don't want to spend so much money on a branded camcorder and just end up not using it as much. This camcorder does the job for me. I can definitely recommend this to everyone, especially those who are tight on budget but needed something that will allow them to capture the moment.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: I wanted a simple point-and-shoot to document an outdoor project, and this has been just. It did feel a bit pricy. It comes without an SD card in the box, although the company later emailed me a coupon for a free one.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: For the pros, it's really light-weight and small which creates no hassle when carrying it during hiking. The package also comes with the pouch to protect the camera from scratching and damaging. The camera has enough functions of a regular digital camera: continuous, night time, focus,... The image quality is significantly better that those taken with iPhone 6.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Great little camera. Exactly as described. Small, compact and lightweight which is just what I need for our trip to Europe.  The inclusion of an SD card was a plus, unexpected and very much appreciated.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: I am SO excited about this purchase! When i saw the price for how much it came with I was sold. I still can't believe it's mine! My boyfriend got the older version of this camera a few years back and he absolutely loved it. I wanted to get this camera to take pictures of our adventures together and everything along the way! also starting a youtube channel here soon! I will update with more awesome pictures later on. If you're thinking about getting this camera and you have the money, do it!

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: great camera when you get it the quality ad the meag pixels are set low go to settings and turn up the quality to super fine ， also can be used as a webcam so pretty awesome comes with detailed instruction booklet charge cable, wall plug, computer disk driver, case, and wrist strap. very good deal for the money ，buy it you wont regret it.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Bought this for a gift to give to my son and he loves it!Very cute and easy to hold and carry it with him.Works great so far! The picture quality is not as good as I thought, but it is enough for him！

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Couldn't get his to work right out of the box.  Wanted something small for an over seas trip.  The battery/st card compartment is so small that it is difficult to get them in and out of.  Went to Wal-Mart and bout a small Kodak. About $30 more, super easy set up and instructions.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Nice little camera. I couldn’t take my phone on a recent trip so I took this camera for pictures. It was easy to use after I learned all the little settings. It definitely took getting used to because I was so used to using my iPhone. Would recommend it!

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Battery lasts a long time.  Can take 200 photos or so (depending on settings of course) before battery fades.  Takes excellent photos, very clear.  Easy to move photos to storage.  On complaint (is a small one) is that the controls are not the most intuitive.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: This is a neat little camera that will be great to have when we don't want to carry the larger, bulkier Nikon!

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I had a Canon that only had 6 megapixels and I thought buying a new one that had more would mean I would get better pictures.....NOT!  The picture quality of this camera is terrible.  I would not recommend this one to a friend.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: This is the worst camera I’ve ever owned. It won’t take 2 pictures in a row. You have to turn it off and turn it back on each time to take s picture. Also the batteries last 3 weeks and need to be replaced constantly.  Just purchase a camera that you can charge and go.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I used a similar model of this Nikon camera for troubleshooting and repairs of industrial welding equipment, and even related circuit boards.  Results were mixed, but one in a hundred photos were pretty good. In spite of Nikon's great reputation for SLR cameras, their compact digital units just don't seem to measure up.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: We like the ease of use and that is why we purchase this camera plus the fact of using regular batteries not some special battery.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I needed a camera and had very little to spend. This is perfect for my needs. Taking photos of gravestones and scenery of Cape Cod. It appears to not be great in poor outdoor lighting. So I just wait until the sun is out or it is bright.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: No download cable  or software , so far I can't  view pictures .  Size is nice price  is good,Selector to use rechargeable  batteries  is good .  I've bought  a case a cable an a memory  card,I think  it would  have been better  to pay a little more and have these  items included

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Save your money and buy a Canon with image stabilization.  This thing cannot shoot a properly focused snapshot if your life depended on it.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I hadn't owned a camera in years, and this one is very small, easy to use and I like the fact that it uses regular batteries.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I love everything about this camera BUT, The picture quality is not very good for my use. This has 16 pixels. The camera I replace this one for was Identical except 20 pixels

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I cannot begin to tell you how much I love this camera. It's so amazing. It makes me look like I know what I'm doing, because it has so many automatic settings. Incredible zoom. Fantastic macro shots. Special settings for every type of scene. Eventually, I'll learn how to use the manual settings. The camera is compact and light-weight. I carried it for a week while hiking and was able to take amazing scenery shots and immediately switch to macro mode to get a picture of a spider web, all without having to stop and switch lenses (or carry those extra lenses with me.) I love, love this camera!,(I took this picture of the blood moon on the automatic setting, hand-held.)

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I had a Panasonic FZ70 digital camera for at over 3 years now & it still works, but not as good as before & I pre-ordered this Panasonic [FZ80] a few months ago & recently received it. It takes the same battery as the FZ70 does. It has the same CMOS sensor & 60X optical zoom lens set up as the FZ70. It has 18.1 megapixels & a few minor internal tweaks, including some sort of update to their Venus processor compared to the prior FZ70 model; which is suppose to create slightly better images. Photo qualities so far with this camera seems pretty good & on par with the prior model, FZ70. Daytime outdoor photos are good, but in lower light conditions, the pictures are very grainy...as expected. Indoor photos with the flash are great. Video qualities seems pretty good with this camera also...indoors or out. This camera has full auto & manual controls, self timer, burst photo modes, uses SD/SDHC cards & comes with a battery, but no actual external charger. You have to charge this battery in the camera connected to an AC outlet. I would get an  external battery charger[s] & several extra batteries for this camera. Battery life seems a little worse than the prior FZ70....maybe 300 photos with no flash & about 100 photos using mostly flash...not very good, but not really too bad. The lens hood from the FZ70 fits this camera too. You do not get a lens hood with this camera. This camera  resembles the FZ70 with some minor exterior cosmetic changes, but both viewfinders are upgraded which are much better than the view finders on the FZ70.  Plus, the rear viewfinder is now a touch screen type, something the FZ70 lacked & that viewfinder is still built into the camera & cannot swivel or tilt. Wifi connection possible with this digital camera & the wifi options is in the camera's menu. This camera can take 4K videos & photos. You can also turn that feature off easily. As with the FZ70 camera, you can use an external flash on this camera too. Really, this camera's upgrade over the FZ70 mostly is 4K video/photo, using OLED viewfinders, touch screen rear OLED viewfinder, 2 more megapixels, wifi compatible, a bit more cleaner cosmetically speaking & slightly upgraded internal Venus processor. Menu layout on this camera is as easy to navigate...typical Panasonic easy to navigate menu system. Really a decent digital camera, but still can take a good photo or video. A modest upgrade from the older Panasonic FZ70 Lumix & can probably give the Nikon P-600 or Canon's SX-60-HS cameras both a run for their money now. I would rate it 4 out of 5 stars mostly because it's just a modest upgrade from the FZ70, lacked an external battery charger or lens hood and photo qualities are basically about the same [not a bad thing there].

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The challenge for this camera like most bridge cameras with small sensors is image quality, especially  because of its phenomenal zoom range which can be increased even further with reduced pixelization. But, with this camera, contrary to the implied suggestion of most "professional" reviewers, there is much you can do to seriously increase image quality and have your camera pull well ahead of other super zooms, It is done both by camera settings and technique. Additionally, by processing, if you chose to go that far. You will need to work hard in order to achieve superior results full of color, sharpness, contrast and low noise, but it is doable even without RAW processing, notwithstanding the stunning wide to telephoto zoom range. To accomplish this, work carefully with the camera settings, pay close attention to get the optimal exposure, keep the ISO down, get the "hang" of the stabilization system, use spot focusing and area selection, and then use a tripod, monopod or brace like a shooter as I do. Finally, to do even more, shoot RAW and in processing go after sharpness and noise reduction, perhaps with an add-on noise reduction program like Topaz which plugs into Lightroom. The results from doing these things vs not and just snapping your shots are simply huge and stunning -- night vs. day. Just a word to the wise, if image quality is your real concern.,Update 9/15/14 to my last comment,For objects in shade/overcast, I use "Vivid" +1 contrast, +1 sharpness, 0 saturation, -2 noise reduction. For objects in bright sunlight or bright enough and nearer by, I use "Natural" -1 contrast, -1 sharpness, -1 saturation and -2 noise reduction. I switch between the two using the F2 button by having the Vivid settings stored as a custom setting and the Natural settings as the way the camera is set up. Pushing two buttons gets me back and forth quickly. Still playing with the settings, but these are pretty ballpark.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I had an old FZ150 I used for micro work for my 1,000s of web-site photos, it lasted 8 years ? or more,. but after a drop, it would no longer focus.,I bought this FZ80 to replace it, after 2 days of using it , I am returning it, the view finder is to small, the pictures are not crisp and the focus if not great and iI feel it is not made well  enough for the Lumix name brand.,I have ordered a FZ300 in hopes it is better built .,3 stars I want better pictures and better built then this model.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: What I like: The X60 zoom is amazing and rare; the camera is relatively light for easy travel; can do some manual settings and raw images.,What I don't like: When zooming far way, need to zoom in gradually to establish focus, else would get out of focus. Also, when zooming in low light, the auto shutter speed is slow, causing blurring images. For example, in events with professional lighting, such as a big concert, I could take decent pictures of the lit stage from very far away. However, for indoor events with no professional lighting, such as school events, zooming from far away would likely have blurry pictures, unless I try to snap only when everyone is still.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: For a camera with such a large zoom, you would think the body would be sized for two handed operation, but the left side of the body has little or no lip to grasp the camera without obscuring the LCD screen. I bought a leather case which extends the sides of the camera slightly, allowing for better two handed grip when using. Other then that the professional reviews align with my findings and use. Quick auto focus in good light and price point.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Fantastic camera. The only 'issue' is common to a lot of cameras these days. It's got so many 'smart' options sometimes it tries to take the picture 'it' thinks is better and I have to hunt around to find a more manual mode to get it to take the picture I want it to.,It is a bit hard to take star-pictures because it keeps trying to either adjust my time to get more light or take pictures and average them.,But that's a limitation more of the slightly higher learning curve to really use this camera. The stability at full zoom is great, much better,than the Nikon, for example.,The lens is awesome, If you wide angle, be careful. It will fish-eye if you angle 'up or down' too much. Also,the other thing that is a limitation of most cameras that offer a '3d' feature is the 3d is not very useful because it only works,at 'max wide angle view', meaning distant scenery, which really never has much depth. 3d up close with the differences in depth,is what I wanted, but it disables the 3d if you zoom in at all or if what you're looking at is fairly close. So the twin-lens cell phone,that does 3d actually takes better 3d pictures for close up stuff.,Otherwise I love it. The ring mount is 55 mm so it's fairly easy to use existing lens adapters and filters or get a ring adapter for it.,The camera battery life is great and with an inexpensive 32 gb card it takes a lot of pictures and a lot of video. The sound recording,is also very good.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I am having a good time using this camera. My primary use is to capture birding images. I want great detail for confirming ID. I am not a professional photographer and am not able to evaluate images to that extent, but for what I have taken so far, they do really well and blow up decently. Most of my shots are at full zoom.,It is a bit noisy when zooming. I am still getting use to where the controls are. If it has a primary fault - it has too many features and learning to use them all will take some time. I shoot in Manual and Shutter priority mostly and some of the control could be smoother. Learning how to manually focus is cumbersome, hopefully I'll get smoother at it and upgrade the rating when I am convinced it does all.,The manual is a bit complicated. Wish it was a bit faster (shutter/f-stop) but who has ever had a camera/lens that was fast enough?

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I really bought this because I had a Lumix 10 years ago and that worked well for me then.,Now, this is a step up except for the lens,  which used to always be a Leica.  I guess for this,price point under $300, you have to give up something.,For my use , it suites me just fine.  Took a little bit to get used to the new AF macro, as I do a lot of shoots with macro.,Wasn't as precise as the older one when it came to the focus point.  Almost better to do MF macro sometimes.  But once I adjusted, the shots came out much better.,If I have to really nit pick, some of the button placements are naturally in the wrong places.,I have hit several of them on accident when moving around to get different angles on a shot..,Again that will be more of an adjustment for me, but still something for the manufacturer to consider.,I know they got a lot of things shoved into this camera, so button placement area is limited to begin with.,So maybe some of the buttons we don't have to access all the time should be recessed with a cover over them.,Overall though, I am liking this camera more and more.,Let's hope it last as long as my previous one.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: First of all, I'm not a photographer. But I'm totally in love with this camera. An image speaks more than a thousand words, no? Well... lets see 🤓,This review ys for FZ82 (I can't urdenstando why Amazon allows to put all reviews together, for two different models)

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: It is a super practical camera! the photos have excellent definision and real carl zeiss color. I recommend this product, I have compared its definition and color with my lumix zs10 (16x hd) and it has the same resolution. Very happy with the purchase!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I bought this camera for when I am out on my bike and taking in the sites. It is very compact and light. Like other reviewers said, the pause between taking pictures is a second or two, too long, but other than that it takes nice photos will above average to excellent quality. The zoom feature is decent -- My overall impression of this camera is that it is better or as good as many higher priced ones for a lot less money. Delivery was fast. The charger is easy with the USB as is uploading pictures to your computer. I definitely recommend this camera especially for sporting events and traveling. The photos are of excellent quality and the camera is not very expensive in the event you lose it or etc.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Great quality pix.  Buy about 5 extra 'N' type I think batteries along with an extra charger or two and you will be able to take pix all day with power on all the time (have a 64 gig card in it never vaguely near filling it up, have taken 2200 pix in one day at various places / shows.  you can mix/match pictures with high quality video. power it on connected to your PC and you can copy pix from the camera's disk drive letter that appears.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This was a gift for a friend. It did not come with an AC adapter - we got a European adapter which doesn't do any good in the U.S.  I bought the accessory kit (that is another story - groan) which did have an AC charger. The price dropped right after I purchased it and then another friend stopped at Walmart and it was on sale for $60 (I paid $118) and they said only the display camera was left so he got it for $29. My friend likes the camera - especially the small size. I'm sure it deserves more stars but the adapter and price were why I gave only 3.  Be aware that there is no SD card included (surprised about that) but, fortunately I did purchase one as an extra.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I bought this camera to replace a DSC-W690.  The menu format is the same as the DSC-W690, however, the camera is significantly smaller, and the zoom clarity proved inferior to the DSC-W690 in a side by side comparison.  The zoom discolored low light pretty dramatically. I returned this camera & opted for the DSC-W690 instead.  But this camera does function smoothly.  It is really designed for a small hand.  Bottom line is I missed the W690 so much I decided to return this more recent version of it.  Better zoom, better clarity and color rendering in the W690.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This product was purchased because of maker's reputation, and it turned out to be a wise choice.  The supplier deserves an A+ in processing, as it arrived a day early, giving me an extra day to wrap it for Valentine's Day.  My wife loves her grandchildren, and now her own special camera to take pictures of them. Great job!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Excellent value. I bought the first one for myself a week before an Alaska excursion and cruise. Photos and videos were excellent. It is small and was easy to carry and easy to use. The second was for my husband per his request. The next two were Christmas gifts for our grandchildren ages 5 and 8. They both take good pictures consistently of their achievements and fun activities.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: ***UPDATE AFTER MANY MONTHS OF USE***- For my videos, this is an OK camera, but it dies SUPER fast. You need like 3 extra batteries on hand if say going out for a day trip No other camera I have had (about 20 of them in my life) has died this fast. The pictures are rough. I would say 3 out of 5 are blurry. I have to take numerous photos to get any that aren't the least bit fuzzy. It might be closer to 4 out of 5. Sometimes it's minor and you don't notice w/o zooming in. I didn't realize that problem very fast because I use it more for YT videos than anything else. Also, the shutter speed for photos is rather slow, but it's a cheap camera, so that isn't too abnormal there.,The pros to this camera are that it is small, light-weight and films video in the 16:9 widescreen I need for my online videos. IF I could turn back time, I would have returned this camera and bought something a little bit pricier and better all around. Oh well. Hopefully, I get a better one from Santa Claus :)!!,I love this camera so far, as far as what I bought it for, my You Tube videos and other stuff. I only used it one full day, but the battery STINKS!! My other cameras last 5x's or more longer. Did I get a bum battery???? I charge it fully and take video and it starts going down to one bar and done FAR too fast to be normal. I read reviews that said it lasted people through many flash photos and videos during the day. I'm wondering if this is a camera I can take out for a day trip or not. My husband thinks maybe I got a bad battery. Anybody have any issues??? I love that it doesn't change the lighting to an orangey color, which is what the problem was with my more expensive, larger cameras. It's all over the place with those, which makes editing sooo difficult. This seems to stay true, and the video quality is very good. I wanted a 1080, but I cannot tell the difference to be honest. This is worth the $$ in the quality dept. & it is a Sony. I haven't taken photos yet. I'm just concerned about the battery. If the battery gets replaced and lasts a lot longer, than I will give this a better review. PS- The size is great, but very tiny compared to my old point and shoot. In a crazy house like mine it may not last the year lol. All is good but the battery. I'm thinking that may be a defect.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Arrived quickly.  Easy assembly.,Could not tell if photo subjects were in focus window is so tiny.,I don't use glasses but would need readers to take any photo and to see the photo on recall.  Sent it back.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: It's a nice little camera. Wish I would've researched it a little more, would've liked to be able to direct connect it to the computer to download the pictures. I only used the card reader one time before I had to get a new one, it wouldn't work after one use.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I'm very happy with this purchase. Everything came as described. Very reasonable price.  Update after a month of use: This camera is very easy to use.  The battery holds a charge forever.  I'm a preschool teacher and I use it every day. It takes great pictures!  I'm so pleased!  .

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The product arrived within the time promised. I received all the pieces I would need to use including an SD/SDHC card and card reader. The camera is very light weight and easy to use.  Just point and click or point, zoom and click and you get a pretty good picture.  As an amateur photographer this product suits me just fine.  I would easily recommend it to others.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The camera seemed fine, although I never got to use it. If you are purchasing this camera from Phototech, please be aware that the camera is packaged for European sale (that is, the battery charger comes with a European AC plug rather than a US AC plug). Nothing in the product description notes this fact. US customers must either return the camera or purchase an after-market European to US AC adapter.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: i am absolutely in love with this camera, i contemplated for many days between Sony Cyber Shot and Cannon something. I am very happy with my purchase and shipping was fast.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This is to replace our older Canon Powershot. WE bought it to take on vacation next month so I am anticipating that it will work even better than the older model.  We love the smaller size and the great pictures that come from this camera

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Camera arrived on time with all the things needed to make it functional (battery charger, lens cleaner, card reader...). I took it on a trip to mexico and the battery lasted for 4 days and the pictures were really good...during the daylight ..Please note if you are looking to take a lot of pictures in the dark this may not be your best bet as the camera has trouble with autofocus when the flash is involved -- great camera for the price point and good service from the vendor

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I bought this camera as a Chrismas gift for my nephew to take pictures of his new baby. I wanted something for them that was easy to use, and portable enough to grab and go. I thought it was a great deal. It shipped and arrived much earlier than expected. So far it has worked out great!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: The battery stopped charging/will not work within 5 months of ordering and that was after purchasing an additional memory card reader because the one that came in the kit never worked. All around, it feels like a waste of money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This camera was purchased as a gift & is well loved by the recipient. I recommend this company, camera was received on time.  On to taking great pictures & videos......

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This is a wonderful little camera that you can take everywhere in your pocket. It takes good photos, and is,very easy to use. I have had a Cannon Powershot for years - this is just my newest one.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I was surprised and thrilled when I opened the Amazon box. Although I knew it was a "bundle," I didn't expect the products I discovered. Honestly, I thought most of them would be throw-aways, cheap, and not worth my time. But the bundle was only $4 more than the camera alone, so - what the heck?,First - the camera. It is exactly what I was looking for. Great optical zoom, 20 mp resolution, which allows plenty of image to play around with software-wise. Light, easy to handle, intuitive. I could go on, but suffice it to say that, for a point and shoot camera, this Canon takes awesome pictures. My first outing with it was a trip to Great Smoky Mountains National Park. My pictures could be hung in a gallery, they are SO good.,Second - the bundle. The case alone was impressive. It is one that I would have picked for myself. In addition to being roomy enough for all my stuff - camera, tripod (mini), charger, cleaning cloth, extra battery, it is well-built and looks as if it will stand up to years of use. The tripod is exactly the same one I had on my Amazon wish list - but I got lucky. It was included in the bundle. Cleaning supplies - check; excellent quality charger (with car adapter!), extra battery, extra 64 gb memory card, and some other things I don't recall right off hand.,I'm still astounded that all of these goodies were included in a bundle that cost me less than $5 more than the camera alone. Thanks, The Imaging World. You done good!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I loved how easy it was to figure out how to use, but how high quality the photos are! Im still getting used to it, but the photo quality can only go up from here!, If you want to change the setting to one you can manually change the lighting with, press "function set" when you are in photo taking mode and it'll let you do a bunch different stuff., I couldn't be happier! This is my first good camera (aka not a little pocket digital) but I've been studying about them and wanting one for years! It's perfect.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I bought my first digital camera 16 years ago for a trip we were going to in Europe. 3 megapixel with a 3x optical zoom. Worked fine for me and was satisfied. It finally gave out and I purchased this package deal. Very impressed with the quality of pictures it takes. I'm a graphic artist so I can adjust the image to meet my needs. All the extras in the package where more than I could have hoped for. Two 64GB memory cards, Two batteries with two chargers and a card reader I can plug into my Mac USB port. I don't need extra lenses and having to relearn how to use an SLR Camera again, this camera has all I need and more. Plenty of features to learn if need be, taking great photographs suits me fine now. Totally would would invest in this purchase again.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: So far this camera has exceeded my expectations. I wanted a lightweight, small camera with zoom to photograph wildlife, particularly birds. I also like to go birding at dawn and dusk. This camera captures that light beautifully while retaining sharp detail.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Pros- small, light weight, compact, zoom lens is better than most point and shoot cameras,  takes decent pics for a point and shoot camera, loved that it came in a color other than black.  Good for someone who doesn’t want the hassle of bringing a big camera and all the interchangeable lens when vacationing.,Cons-  The picture quality is not as good as a DSLR camera, it is not suggested for professional use.  You cannot change out the lenses.  If you want a DSLR camera than but it. I would not suggest that you buy this camera expecting it to be equal to a DSLR camera.,Overall-  I purchased this camera for traveling cause I did not want to lug a heavy camera and all its accessories when traveling.  Don’t get me wrong, I love my DSLR camera but sometimes it can be a bit bulky.  I wanted a simple camera that could zoom in and take a decent picture.  I believe this camera is priced right for a point and shoot camera.  It does the job it was intended for.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Absolutely love this camera! It cane with everything pictured and it's a great deal. I've been playing with it and filming with this for my YouTube channel... the quality is fabulous. I just need to get a monitor and a taller tripod. Arrived on time and i chose the red one. I'm still playing with out, but love the autofocus feature, timed photos so I can have my own photo shoot and timed start for filming. This is totally worth the price!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I just wanna start off saying this is a really great beginner camera. This is my first “professional” camera that I have ever owned, but I think it’s safe to say I’m not so much of a “beginner.” I’ve done photography before but I’ve never had my own camera, so I thought this would be a good one to start with. I got it recently and I still have the option to return it and I’ve really been considering it. I personally like having a little more weight in my hands when it comes to my cameras, but that’s just a me thing. I think the camera settings are cool so to speak - they’re more filters to play with than be serious with, but that’s just my own opinion. The continuous shot feature on the camera has to be the one I really hate. It’s basically the same as the normal shot - it takes a really long time to buffer and honestly that takes away the whole point of a continuous shot. I also don’t like how I’ll see the shot I wanna take in the viewfinder, but the moment the picture is actually taken, it looks different. This is especially apparent when taking certain creative liberties with your lighting. Also, the camera does not work well with motion in my experience. Either it’s too late or too early, again this goes back to the continuous shot problem. Also I was told there is a photo editing program that comes with the camera, but I have yet to discover it. I do want to say this, if you have never done photography before then this is a great camera to get you started. I just have a bit more experience so it’s nkt really doing it for me. The zoom, though, is amazing. I was in my backyard and I zoomed into my neighbors tree that was on the other said of the neighborhood, and the camera captured the leaf perfectly. It was amazing. Who knows, I might give the camera another try, but I don’t know. This camera honestly isn’t bad and is worth the investment if you’re starting out or just like to take pictures. It gets the job done.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I just received the camera last week and haven't had time to use it much.  Still learning it.  The camera arrived in two days just as promised.  Impressed with the service.  The bundle package is nice and you get quite a lot accessory items.  The case and extra battery were worth buying the bundle, but the other items are nice, too.,I ordered the wrong camera and was able to cancel it with no problem and get the right camera still on time.,I am well pleased with the company and probably will be with the camera once I figure out how to use it.,It is more for moderate or beginner users, but that's o.k. with me.  This is my second Canon camera and I'm going to love the zoom when we are out nature riding and walking.  If I find I need a more advanced camera later, this will be the company for me.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I decided to get this camera package since I was interested in doing wildlife photography and the idea of having a 40X zoom was very enticing for me.  The package includes an awful lot that I also wanted, most of all, the extra battery and charger, the case, and the 64GB SD card.  I realize all those things can also be purchased separately but it was just so convenient to have it all together in the box.  I haven't had time to take many pictures yet but plan to use this as my go-to camera when I'm out where I might be able to photograph wildlife, especially birds.  I have a smaller camera that fits in my pocket which I use while on kayaking trips.  This camera really doesn't fit in a pocket but it's extremely light and small for all that it does.  I look forward to putting it to the test in the next several months.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Based on the reviews I was so excited to get the camera, I thought I had made the right choice by choosing this one. Man, was I disappointed!!! No matter which setting I chose I could not get a good picture in clear daylight. Instead of our family photos being a success they turned out to be an epic fail. On top of the failed family photoshoot, there is no way to format the pictures so I can view them on my computer. I have no way to edit or print them. This was just a disappointment all around. I will be sending it back.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: We bought this for my daughter for her birthday. She loves it, plus because its rugged it means she can be a bit rough with it without me having to worry.,The picture quality seems great and even our 8 year old has taken some cracking pictures with this camera.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Okay, so I wouldn’t normally write a review, however this product is actually worth it.,So, I’m a week in and have tested the product and am so far very impressed.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: the product for the price is absolutely fantastic! My 7 year old loves his new camera.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Read a lot of reviews, and I am not disappointed in this choice. It feels as sturdy as suggested and won’t hesitate to use it for what it’s designed. Photos great for camera in its class.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: So far I really like this camera. I just wish the zoom was a little more zoomier. Haven't tried it in the water yet. My last camera was ruined at the beach, so that's why I went with a waterproof camera this time.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Absolutely love this camera. The kids love playing in the pool with it! I don’t have to worry about it getting wet and ruined and they love that they can take photos underwater with it. Great clear photos and cord included to charge it and download the photos to your computer. Oh and it floats!!! Can’t wait to take it to the lake.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Great little camera for a great price. Got it for my niece, who is too young for a phone, but loves this camera!,EDIT: I had originally given this 5 stars, then it broke within a week. Seller was unresponsive and unhelpful. Cannot recommend this anymore or this seller.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: This is a good camera when taking a picture if looks a lil off but once you put it on the computer it looks great.  I was hoping it didnt come out the way you see it on the camera and it doesnt.  So you going to take pictures and wonder hmmmm doesnt look great but then i tested on computer and the screen fools you.  So is the camera worth it yes for the price.  It is light and it is waterproof and the battery is easy to come off with a push of a button and that's where you will charge it as well

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: Bought this camera for my son to use in swimming pool very weekend. He rreceived t today, open up the box and say to me the color was so nice and the weight was so light and this camera had front LCD so he can selfie in the water. HE very loved it

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: This camera fulfilled its purpose during our beach day! It’s very lightweight, compact, and user-friendly. I had an underwater camera before, and this one is much better  The dual screen was very useful for underwater selfies and videos. The photo quality could be better, but for the price and function, this camera is the right one for us. I will definitely bring this to my next island getaway!

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: This is a really nice camera with waterproof.I had pay tiktok and i want to take the video in the water.So a high quality camera is my first problem and it will be my first choce.I had received the camera in the morning and i had try to take the video.Full 1080P underwater .Nice seller!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: My daughter loves this camera.The price and performance of this camera are very good.It's a great gift to learn and enjoy photography for children.Now my daughter takes pictures everywhere with her camera every day.The memory card has been updated to 32GB and is expected to be even larger...ha

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Bought this for my 6 year old as a fun camera.,It’s junk even for a 6 year old. The picture quality is so awful. Dark, blurry and hard to make images out.,I would not recommend.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: The reason I purchased this camera is that I want to capture moments with a good quality of camera , and this one fits perfectly into my small purse, I do have a good sony DSLR camera but just not worth to spend more money on cameras, but this one works out perfectly!, reasonable price, quality is acceptable! I do recommend for this product if you are looking for a affordable camera!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)

The picture quality is awesome.. it is all digital, very easy to use..,If your a beginner or someone that knows about cameras, this is the one you will want.,The seller was great, the delivery was on time. The packaging was not damaged..,Over all, I am a 110% satisfied..

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I get this camera for my mom, she told me the camera is very easy to use. The camera can be fully charged very quickly which differential from other camera in the market. The picture quality is also good enough for my mother. Overall, it is a good product and I recommend getting one if you are price sensitive.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I got this for Burning Man, because I didn't want my good camera to get ruined by the dust.  This one has no moving parts (no motion around the lens for dust to get stuck in), and it held up well under rough conditions.  The photo quality was fine for a point and shoot during the day, but it was pretty terrible at night.  Way, way worse than my phone's camera, and I have a really old phone.  If you use it for video, the sound is really terrible, too.,But if you just need this to take some abuse and take photos in the daytime, then it's a good camera at a good price.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
