During the summer I didn't need the extra flash as majority of my photos are outside during daylight but as we're going into fall and winter I decided to test it...and doesn't work. Which is quite upsetting as I will now need to purchase an extra component. :(. I bought this set off the recommendation of a friend who bought it and loves it and all his accessories work.,Other than this I definitely recommend this camera as it's extremely user friendly!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This has been a great little camera.  I bought it to see how much I would actually use a camera and if it would be worthwhile to get a nice DLSR.  I've used this quite a bit and am shocked sometimes just how nice the pictures are.  I love night pictures such as skylines of my hometown (Kansas City), and although this camera has a much smaller sensor than a DLSR, I get pretty good results with a tripod.  I'm sure not as good as a DLSR, but I've been pretty impressed.,I've tried driving out into the country and taking pictures of the Milky Way, but it's just not up to that.  Day photos look amazing.,I've had this for about a year now, and never did upgrade to a DLSR.  If you're just someone who is going to play around with it it's a great camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've owned a lot of cameras over the years, and this is by far my best and most versatile.  The zoom to 60x is amazing!  Does help to have a steady hand, adequate light and preferably a tripod, but you can get some shots that were impossible to get with a $400 cam a few years ago.  In my opinion, it actually beats out DSLRs because you don't have carry extra lenses. The 20x wide angle is useful too.  Have not investigated the other features, but I'm sure they'll come in handy later.  Very happy with this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: learning how to use this camera at 71 years old has been a boost to my outlook on life!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Okay, for the cost this is probably a 4 star item.,However, I give this a 3 stars because it fell below my expectations.,My expectations were a little high, as the image quality is not what I would have imagined. I feel like my samsung s9 gets nearly the same camera quality.,However, I've been told if I upgrade the lenses, the quality would be much better.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have more than 30 years as an amateur photographer. From my first days in the 35 mm field I was married with Olympus. I still remember the fantastic OM-1 and my last OM-2. Since the introduction of digital cameras I have had some experiences with the small point and shoot cameras mainly from Panasonic. This were very good cameras but nothing like the professional Olympus system.,Based a lot on the reviews, I bought the DMC-FZ70 with a lot of expectations. Now I have to say that all of them were fulfilled with this amazing camera. With it, I can make anything I made before with my old 35mm Olympus and much more. The most impressive thing is the long focus 60x range . No need of interchangeable zoom lenses. With just one lense you can make all the range from a wide angle to large tele.,In addition it offers adjustments for deep of field, color temperature (with no need of filters), selective focus, image contrast, etc. There is a lot of technology behind this small and light camera that fits anywhere in your baggage.,The Lumix lense at f 2.8 is incredible luminous. With a firm hand (or a tripod) there is no need of flash during normal night conditions.,Other things from the digital era are new to me but I love them as the suggestions from the machine for beautiful sunsets, creative effects and much more.,The only thing I miss is the absence of leather case tailor made for this camera as I had for my old Olympus.,I am not a professional but I will recommend this camera for any amateur who wants a quality systems at much lower prices than most renowned ones.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I will start this by saying that I am a big Panasonic fan and have owned several 12/16 mp P&S high zoom cameras (DMC-ZS20 for example).  I ordered this looking for a good super zoom unit.  I checked other reviews and noted the mixed ratings, but greedy for "zoom" ordered it anyway.,"Bad News" is much like what others have reported in that you are paying for zoom and one of the "give backs" is in the processor.  In order to get really clear pictures I find that I need to use my monopod to steady the camera if using more than a modest amount of zoom.  It is early days and I am still learning to use the unit so I will update this as I go.  I also noted that Panasonic does not use a "named" lense on this unit like on my other cameras, which may also figure into things. I also am aware that talent may be an issue here too so I want to tread lightly here for the moment.,The "Good News" is that it's a Panasonic.  It feels good, albeit a little large and the price via Amazon was very good.  The camera feels solid and the controls are well laid out. The view finders do a good job and Ai mode normally does a very acceptable job.,I want to love this camera, but it is too early to tell if getting the zoom was worth it.,02/23/2014 Update:,I've had more experience with the FZ70 now and it really grows on you.  As recommended in other reviews, I've added a UV filter and a lens hood now that there is one for the camera.  Not being the best at camera manipulation, I found that working through the manual with the camera in hand is a big help.  I also found that using the flash indoors helped with photo sharpness.  I am also in process of working through and testing my camera setups to be sure, now that I am more familar with the beast, that I am achieving what I thought I wanted.  In the end there is just no substitute for using the camera in a range of situations as, while it is no DSLR, it is a whole lot more than a mere point and shoot camera.  I freely admit that most of my "issues" with the camera reside with me, and by working with the camera I am learning to appreciate all it has to offer.  At the price point that I bought the camera for, I am really glad I have it.,06/13/2014 Update:,I wanted to report that I went to Everglades National Park a few days ago and had a perfect opportunity to give the camera a good outdoor test.  While at the main visitor center I was able to get some great shots of gators at a distance.  The zoom was incredible as I was able to get some really close in shots of the gator's eyes and hide.  Really a wonderful experience.  It was a bright day so the UV filter helped especially when taking close in pictures of fish in shallow water.  The camera did very well.  Earlier I tried out my wife's Cannon D40 to get a feel for a big DSLR.  For me I have to say that I prefer the FZ70 as it's a bit smaller and a lot lighter.  On the downside at zoom the picture softens a little (lens quality?) but is still pretty darn good for anything the average picture taker would want to do.  The more I use this camera, the more I like it.  At a $1,000 less that the Cannon/lens, I'm feeling pretty smug.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Bought this camera for a trip to Alaska. The zoom allowed me to get pictures I couldn’t have dreamed of with my other cameras. The attached pictures were hand held from a boat, bus or roadside stop during overcast days shooting hundreds of feet away. Not gallery quality by any means but great remembrances. Given decent lighting, a tripod and someone with more camera savvy there’s no telling how good they could be. Excellent value, couldn’t have asked for more considering the price.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: PROS:,- easy to use, right out the box,- battery life better  than expected,- great value @ $279.00 from Amazon,- lens cover  & neck strap are good  quality,- on-screen details help when using function dial,- transfer  cable & software included,- sharp photos with crisp colors,- the impressive zoom feature works smoothly,CONS:,- Only one.  The software provided  for video replay is on a free-trial basis , and then must  be purchased ($80+).  Perhaps  there is a free shareware  option, but it is unfortunate that free software is not included for video, like it is for photos.,ALSO:,- BE SURE TO PURCHASE A CLASS 10 DATA CARD, OR YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED WITH THE CAMERA's  PERFORMANCE.,- Understand that 60x zoom is significant, and best used with the stability of a bipod/tripod.,* * * I am very satisfied with this camera and would  recommend  the Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ70 to friends  and family  without  hesitation.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera for it's 4K capabilities, video and for taking still shots. I needed a camera for taking pics when I am in the woods doing things related to Bowhunting. The picture quality and zoom capabilities are Amazing. If you don't know much about cameras and their setting, you can set it in Intelligent Mode and it will set all the settings you need to take excellent photos in most situations. You can play around with various settings to optimize image quality in various situations, but in a pinch  use the Intelligent Mode. It is a great option. There are a lot of videos on Youtube that will help you optimize your use of this camera. Watch as many as you can before and after you buy! This is a great camera and I Highly Recommend it!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It's going to take me a lifetime to learn all the features of this camera.  Happily, there are some easy point and shoot/ scene options.  I bought the camera for versatility,  to photograph wildlife, festivals, and do some macro photography of insects and flowers.  Every time I use the camera I discover more potential.... and that I'm probably not using the camera to it's fullest potential.  This camera definitely isn't a drop it in your purse and take a few casual photos type camera.  Yet it's also not something you only pull out when your doing serious photography. Instead, it's a great mix.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I got this to replace another Canon ELPH that I have had for at least 12 years, maybe longer. It still works, but sometimes tells me I have a full battery charge when I don't. This ELPH seems fine and the picture quality is excellent. I need to get used to some of the changes in controls before I can give a complete review. So far, I am pleased with it. I looked at reviews and prices on similar products and decided to stay with Canon, and I have not been disappointed. I will update my review when I have used it more often.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Just got it yesterday.  It is easy to use.  So far I am pleased with it.  I took a few photos and transferred them to my computer using the memory card.  The camera is very light weight and user friendly.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I looked at several other cameras for less money but by the time you add the tripod, memory, case, etc. you were at the price point anyhow...I got them all in one package...one day after ordering!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: 3 months so far, great pictures. if you read the manual and practice you can take high-quality pictures no matter what.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Wonderful product, easy to use. My sister loved this gift.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I don't like the fact that you have to go online to download the manual. The quality of the pictures is fair. Simple to operate. Not sure of the battery life yet, but it seems to be okay. I would recommend getting another battery and card if you take this on vacation.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Works great. I use for video mostly. My only complaint is the product description is not accurate or helpful enough. I would like a description for how long the battery lasts, some sort of chart for how memory is used: how long can I video, how many pictures can I hold. I would like to know simple thing like the max video you can take is 30 min before the camera shuts off.,All in all, the answers to these questions are better than I expected so I can't really complain.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: using it for my field geology project in iceland, perfect for the situation, and really good so far

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This camera came with everything , it's compacted and have everything needed , the case , the card reader, the memory card . It's also small ,neat and easy to use.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: It's been YEARS since I had to buy a camera. I was so delighted that the camera was bundled with a 32 gb SD card AND a carrying bag....along with a TRIPOD. I felt like I won the lottery.

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: I LOST IT AND IT'S HARD TO BRING YOUR CAMERA OUT

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: ok

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Does not fit Olympus XZ2 at all. too small. going to return it .

product_name: MegaGear ''Ultra Light'' Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X, Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II, Nikon COOLPIX AW130, S9900, Olympus STYLUS XZ-2 Digital Camera (Blue)
review: Nice quality

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I love this camera! Photography is a hobby for me, but something I really enjoy and an area in which I want to continue growing. The zoom and clarity is incredible. I really enjoy having the extra battery and the charger that works in the car as well as the home. The disk reader is easy to use and caps so you don't accidentally lose your chip. The case is really nice with extra padding, space for the additional battery and cards, and a zip/velcro combo that makes me confident that the camera won't tumble out. I have not used the tripod yet, but it fits well. I had been researching cameras for months and this met and exceeded my expectations. I don't recommend for someone who wants the option of a flash since it only has auto or off. I don't use it for action shots, but it doesn't have additional modes like sport or portrait. I use the live option whenever I am focused on nature and it works beautifully. It's a great product and easy to use!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I bought this as a father's day gift- shipping was quick and arrived earlier than expected. The camera is great, perfect for the amateur photographer. Takes great pictures and connects to my phone and WiFi so I can upload pictures to social media or share with friends and family, so easy and convenient! The bundle came with a bunch of useful things.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: So far I am very pleased with this camera. It takes great photos, and I really like the zoom on it. It is sharp, and fast and you can get good close ups. I sell on  the internet, and it is perfect for my uses. It seems to be a very well made camera. I have not checked out all of the features yet, so I may still be in for some pleasant surprises. The package has everything you need in it, extra battery, card reader, etc. A great value for the money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I'm a journalist who specializes in radio/audio reporting. Most of my work is concerned with that, however this is the digital revolution and you need good equipment. iPhone's don't cut it. After going to several events where I needed good zoom and was getting pixelated garbage as results. This looked like a nice happy medium for me. Zoom is incredible, the WiFi option is awesome. I have to admit, I wish it would remember your phone with an automatic connection. You have to go into your wifi settings and connect it to the app to transfer photos, however after that initial connection, it works flawlessly to send photos/video from the Canon to your phone. Just wish it was a little quicker, absolutely not a hindrance to the operation  of this camera. It's also very easy to use, I'm sure some photogs out there would have their critiques, but I think is an absolutely great camera. Good for beginners and good for journalists as well. The bundle package here on Amazon is awesome too. Great travel bag, only thing I had to buy extra was a neck strap. A+ and highly recommend.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Easy to use (except that I've yet to succeed being able to transfer images via wifi to my MacBook Pro, will continue to work on that as I suspect it's something I'm doing wrong and not the fault of the camera), light weight, excellent image quality. The learning curve was short as I already own a Canon Elph and most of the commands and layout are the same. Curious however that a cable to transfer images from the camera to a computer is not included. I had to order one of those. But overall this is a fine little camera. The many additions included by this seller (spare battery, 32gig memory card, case, tripods, cleaning cloth, device to transfer memory card to computer and more) make this an exceptional value if you need those things. The follow-up from the seller was excellent also. Highly recommended!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Very disappointed with the result of this camera. I wish I could return it and get another one from canon...,Very mediocre picture it is taking. My very old iphone pics are looking way better than this.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Just got this a couple of days ago.  There's one piece that I can't find in the manual and have no idea what it's for.  BUT, better to have more than less . . . right?  So far it's pretty easy to work with and I like it a lot.  Thank Goodness I downloaded the PDF file of the owners manual so I could read it.  The print in the manual that came with the camera is way too small for my 75 year old eyes.  LOL. My challenge with a previous camera was transferring the images from the memory card to my computer.  Once I get to that point I will post my experiences.  But for now I very happy with the camera and its accesories.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Best purchase ever! I spent about 4-5 days searching online and at B&M stores for a new, high-powered digital camera. I landed back on Amazon for this sweet bundle. I had about 48 hours to learn the camera before going to South Africa for a 10-day holiday. I'm so glad I had this for the safari, wine country tour and exploring the sites of Cape Town. It has captured my most treasured memories without any fails. The bundle had nearly everything I needed - I did add the Canon neck strap (priceless). Lightweight. Easy to point and shoot. Stabilization is great. Audio is clear. Playback simple. I didn't use the WiFi features but will on my next photo adventure locally!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I'll start by saying that I've had this camera for eight months now, I always like to wait a while before writing reviews. I made a good choice when I bout this.,I know nothing about cameras, as much of a beginner as you can be. There were only a few features I wanted. I wanted something easy to use, I wanted one with an easy self timer and an easy to use quality zoom.  This camera had them all for me.. I've also been very impressed by how long the battery lasts without needing recharged. Like I said, it's easy and takes good pictures. The picture of the eagles is from my backyard at a distance of about 300 yards, with the camera on a cheap tripod, using the self timer. I really need to get a better tripod..

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: The focus is not sharp. Probably should give it a one.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: The camera is great quality, I purchased it to take HD proofs of my artwork and it is doing the job wonderfully. All items provided in bundle were great quality as well, I have tested them all and they work perfectly. I am actually extremely impressed with the quality of the bundled items. They clearly have a higher dollar value than the bundle all together. The seller was incredible though, we received the item a day before it was expected, it was packaged with care. He sent two e-mails expressing his concern with us being satisfied with a promise to ensure we were if anything was amiss. It wasn't! Highly recommend the camera CANON SX420IS, and The Imaging World for your future camera  purchases!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: If you want a great point and shoot camera then this is it. I've had some training in photography but I wanted a camera that my wife could use also. You still have the option to "tweak" your photos but if you do not know anything about cameras this is one to consider. I heard about the Canon PowerShot cameras from others so I decided to try it and I am pleased with the results. I would recommend this camera package to anyone looking for a good quality camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Great camera, great price, quick shipping. No complaints here

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: So far we like the camera, but still need to mess with the features to get it where we want it. Small and lightweight, but takes pretty good photos.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: We’ve used on several trips and it has done very well.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: nice camera for the price

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: this product was returned to Amazon on Tuesday 6/18/2019 by UPS

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Easy to use, light, fits in purse

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: The camera and accessories are excellent! Shipping and packaging are very good.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB SDHC Memory Card + Flexible tripod + AC/DC Turbo Travel Charger + Replacement battery + Protective camera case with Deluxe Bundle
review: Bought to use on vacation. Having two batteries which could be recharged in a number of ways was a blessing. Nice photos.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Handy little camera that's easy to use. I was surprised at the fine quality of the video. Makes posting videos on YouTube a snap. Now with the price drop it's a good deal. Only problem is with the charging cable, it's only 2 feet long with a dedicated plug. Amazon sells a 6 foot cable listed as "ABC Products Replacement Sony Alpha / Cybershot USB Cable Cord Lead (For Image Transfer / Battery Charger" that is a perfect replacement.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The Sony DCS-W830 Is much smaller than I expected but I'm happy with its size. It's smaller than an Apple 8 iphone and fits nicely in my shirt pocket/pants pocket. Lightweight... Sturdy Body... Well made. Takes pictures comparable to any cell phone and the zoom is about the same. Battery life can be better, but since it's a small phone, it's a small battery. I would suggest purchasing a couple more batteries as backup. Overall, I give it a solid 4 out of 5 stars.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I purchased this as something small to supplement pictures that I was taking with my Samsung Note 4 phone (16mp w/ no optical zoom).  I used both cameras indoors and out with different lighting situations, and when I reviewed them, almost all duplicate pictures were either better or the same ON MY CELL PHONE.  Even though there are supposed to be autofocusing features, the pictures had a soft focus appearance, foggy and washed out.,The power button is small and flush with the top of the camera, so sometimes it was difficult to press.  The small screen is low quality making it difficult to determine how good the pictures are, and if held at different angles, it is difficult to see all together.,On the plus size, it is small.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Camera seems to take good pictures (at least the best I can tell by looking at the screen on the camera). But I have the hardest time to download the pictures to my computer using the cord that was provided. Tried on both my desktop and the laptop. Have been working on it for the last couple of days but no luck. I have owned several digital cameras in the past and never had this problem.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Still getting used to no eye hole viewer and all the automatic stuff.  Wish it came with instruction book rather than on line.  Internet not always available.  Great little point & shoot camera.  One word of caution, don't drop it!  I had one in my shirt pocket, bent over and it fell out and quit working - lc screen was shot.  I ordered another one, that tells you something!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This is my second Sony DSCW830, I abused the first  one carrying it around in my pocket unprotected. The first one developed a shadow across the print face but I liked the camera enough to  buy again. This camera is easy on batteries, I've never run the battery down to empty. It is a point and shoot, it takes a few seconds to auto adjust the focus  but it is a 120 USD camera so it is to be expected.  Picture quality is about what you get for a hundred and twenty dollars, good enough.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I have owned two Cybershot cameras before which is why I bought this one.  Clarity matters to me; I want to be able to see the pores on a cat's nose, I could do this with my two previous Cybershots, this camera doesn't focus on anything.  The flash is delayed so it goes off a full second after the camera has taken the photo.  I have tried all the settings and this DELAY does not seem to change.  Literally the flash can and will go off and yet the photo will look like it was taken in the dark.,Lastly, the color is not natural.  I have tried several settings and everything always has a pink hue.  This was not the case with my previous Cybershot cameras, they had natural color.,Sony might think that the kind of people that buy this camera do not care about quality, only simplicity, but they're dead-wrong.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: At this price point, we can't expect miracles.  My other camera is a Sony a-6000, but the DSC-W830 was purchased as a simple-to-use camera for my wife--to replace her 2006 model Canon Elph SD600 (6 megapixels, 3x optical zoom, no image stabilization).  The image quality and noise levels are definitely much better than the old Elph with this Sony point-and-shoot.  But the remaining question is whether my wife should use this camera or her iPhone 6 while on vacation.,On paper, the DSC-W830 should be better: its sensor is 50% larger than the iPhone sensor, and it boasts 20 megapixels compared to the iPhone 6's 8 megapixels.  And the DSCW830 sports a Zeiss lens.  Using the intelligent auto setting, I shot several scenes using the DSC-W830 (lens at widest setting--25 mm focal length equivalent) and the iPhone 6 (29 mm focal length equivalent) and the standard photo app.  In the centers of the photos, the DSC-W830 images were clearly sharper reflecting the improved resolution of the sensor.  But at the edges of the photos, the iPhone 6 images were much sharper because of the large chromatic aberration for the Sony product.,I haven't tried out the P mode on the DSC-W830 in with various settings (exposure compensation, ISO, HDR changes, etc.), and I suspect that by fussing with the Sony camera I could make it perform close to the iPhone 6--in the center of the image with wide angle.  The chromatic aberration appears to be a lens issue, and I haven't tested different focal lengths (levels of zoom) to see whether it gets worse or better when focal length is increased.  The iPhone 6 probably has less of a problem with this because it uses a prime lens (no zoom).  Of course the DSC-W830 has the zoom capability (an advantage), which the iPhone lacks.,I tried out the panorama feature on the DSC-W830, and found the resolution of images to be so bad that the panoramas were useless.  The iPhone 6 panoramas are excellent--way, way better.  The SCN setting on the Sony camera may be useful, but the 4 picture effects are gimmicky in my opinion.  The screen menus are simple and easy to navigate.,Based on sensor size and number of pixels, I would have thought that the Sony camera might have been better than the iPhone 6, but overall it is equivalent in some circumstances and worse in others.  Did Sony use a cheap sensor and other inexpensive electronics? Is their firmware less sophisticated? I was disappointed in the lens performance (chromatic aberration, softness at the edges of the images).,I think that the Sony DSC-W830 is suitable for snapshots made by people who may be technically challenged--Aunt Ida or your 12 year-old pre-teen.  It is convenient if you are going to an amusement park with the family and just want some fun shots.  But if you don't need the zoom, you can probably get comparable to better results with your iPhone 6, particularly if you install the ProCamera 8 app, which makes the iPhone work more like a digital camera.,UPDATE,Previous shots were done in the evening, when conditions might have been less than optimal.  I tested the DSC-W830 in bright sunlight and with different zoom settings.  Results were disappointing.  The right edge of the image was blurred at 1X, 2X (equiv. to 50 mm), and 4X zoom.  I had thought that perhaps a smaller aperture (resulting from the bright sunlight) might help, or that the lens would have a "sweet-spot" at mid-zoom.  The blurring would be just detectable with a 4x6 print, but I wouldn't use images from this camera for any greater enlargement of the whole image.  You can have an acceptable enlargement if you crop off the edges leaving the center 50% of the image. One of the photos below (about 1/3 of the whole frame) shows the blurring on the right edge. I'm disappointed.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I bought the camera for my time abroad and it was an okay camera - like it took decent photos - but there were a good amount of times when my old  iphone took better pictures (of the same scene...). If I could go back, I would definitely have passed on this camera and saved up more money to buy a better camera instead.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I purchased a used XT-1 a little over a year ago and found myself hooked into the Fuji system. I consider myself a hobbyist not a pro by any means. This XT-3 is obviously a HUGE upgrade from the XT-1. It's extremely snappy in everything it does. The buttons and dials have a more tactile feel compared to my XT-1 as well. I also really love the weight of the camera and how it feels in my hand.,As far as image quality and low light performance  - noticeably better than the XT-1 (obviously), but I really need more time to run it through its paces. I'll update this review accordingly once I do.,I did try it with my Cactus V6ii Transceivers - they didn't work. Hopefully they get a firmware upgrade pretty soon.,***UPDATE***,Cactus Transceivers/ Cactus Flash works very well with the camera. Updated the Firmware a couple weeks ago - zero issues.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This little camera is okay.  I had 2 major complaints.,1.  It came to me with NO way to charge it - no cable, no charger unit, nothing.  This was frustrating over the holidays, I finally used a cable my mother-in-law had to wrap up Christmas, but once I got home I was needy again.,2.  The on/off switch is SUPER FRUSTRATING!  It will not come on unless you press down hard on the ON/OFF button for a little while.  That makes  quickie photos IMPOSSIBLE.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Switching camera systems is a massive pain and loss of capital investment. It's not something I consider lightly. I've been happily shooting full frame Nikon bodies for the last decade. Bought all the great glass to go along with it. For a time I lugged a lot of it everywhere and had a blast (I'm not a pro, just a hobby). Over time, I found myself calculating the hassle:benefit ratio and often found myself leaving my gear behind even on trips. I haven't sold it all off as the quality is still top notch, but I felt like I needed to find a system that was light enough to wear all day without getting in the way or causing neck/shoulder discomfort. Also, video on Nikon DSLR is absolute crap, have to manual focus most of the time even on my D850.,In addition to the above, mirrorless cameras have been on the rise (superior video, less chimping due to seeing exposure before capture). The current king of full frame mirror being Sony. I decided against the Canon and Nikon as they are inferior. So my decision process boiled down to Sony vs Fuji vs Olympus. So basically full frame vs APS vs m43. I decided to go with the middle sized sensor camera as the best compromise. Large enough sensor to get decent shallow depth of field and good ISO performance, but with smaller lenses than FF cameras. Compared to my Nikon setup with 24-70 its about 1/4 of the weight! The A7R equivalent is also about 3-4x the weight.,The Fuji Xt3 so far has been absolutely flawless. It's always possible to get a bad copy, so if yours isn't perfect, exchange it. Autofocus, far superior to my D850. Noise at high ISO ok, obviously not D850 level but useable. It's fun to use, light, produces beautiful images. Lenses are small enough to travel with several without getting too bulky.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I read all of good review of this camera, yet I received one with defect that show yellow lines on screen.,also, the shutter button is wiggled, is this normal? I had my nikon d700 10yrs, still works without any issue but heavy.,this XT3 is light but somehow my first impression is defect.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: - Excellent low light performance. Noise not an issue up to ISO6400,- Very good custom-ability. Menu is really good,- AF is really good. Face tracking amazing,- 4K Video at 60Fps.....OMG!!!,- Film simulations are amazing,- I use CaptureOne for Raw image processing. Really good tool.,- Paired with 23mm F2 WR Fujinon lens for effective 35mm output,- I like how ISO, Shutter and Aperture controls are easily used and locked.,- Build quality really good. Didnt expect this,- Been enjoying the camera since i got it,- Made a mistake shooting JPEG instead of RAW recently.....but JPEGS were still amazing,- Dual SD Card function is brilliant,- Manual focusing is like childs play....so easy with the camera highlight functions,Now the Bad....battery life is bad. Example, fully charged, 92 Images + 4 (120fps) Vids @ 3 sec each and battery is dead. This is with LCD turned OFF and using EVF only with eye sensor (the best for power saving).....looks like i need a few spare batteries....as this is not a deal breaker for me.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I took up photography about 3 years ago or so with the purchase of the Fuji X-T1. It was right about the time the X-T2 came out, but because I wasn't sure I'd be that into it as a hobby, I decided not to wait for the new model. I've been happy with the X-T1, but when the X-T3 came I felt there were a number of reasons to upgrade and I'm glad I did. No camera is perfect and discussions based on brand loyalty can get pretty heated, but here is what I like about the Fuji X-T series of cameras. I feel image quality is very good and even better with the X-T3. I shoot in RAW format and edit the shots in Lightroom. Unfortunately, Lightroom isn't be best RAW processor for Fuji RAW files. I'm experimenting with Capture One's free Fuji raw processor to see if it's better. I'll still edit in Lightroom after I convert the files in Capture One. I like the manual dials on the Fuji's. With a quick glance I can see what the ISO, shutter, F stop, and exposure compensation are set at and can adjust them before I even turn on the camera. The weather sealing on the camera body and certain lenses is also a plus if you shoot in inclement weather. I also like the high resolution view finder for seeing how changing the settings will affect the shot before I press the shutter. Not having "in body lens stabilization" (IBIS) isn't a problem for me at this point since most of what I shoot is landscape and I use a tripod when needed, plus the lenses I currently use have stabilization. Not having it also keeps the camera body more compact which is a plus for me. Now I've only had the X-T3 for one day and have only had a couple of hours to take it out and get some shots. I use the bracketing feature a fair amount and like the fact that, unlike the X-T1, I can take more than 3 shots. I also like the focus bracketing feature, the last shot is an example. I focused on the moss at the bottom of the frame and the camera took a series of shots where it changed the point of focus until it reaches infinity. I then used Photoshop to assemble the shots so that it's in focus from the closest point to infinity. Won't use this feature all the time, but I can see that it could be handy in certain situations. Focus stacking is something you can do manually, but this makes it pretty convenient. I feel that Fuji makes a well built camera and have great lenses, but they aren't inexpensive. And while the lens selection is getting better and there seems to be more third party lenses available all the time (all of which are manual focus which I don't mind since the X-T series of mirrorless cameras offer focus peaking) I wish there were more options. Fuji has a roadmap for lenses, so it's just a matter of time and patience. I can't say if this is a worthwhile upgrade from the X-T2 or any other brand of camera that you might own, but for me, it was well worth it.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Technically speaking, this is a fantastic camera. You will not be disappointed.,I used this camera on a three month trip to Australia and New Zealand earlier this year with several Fuji prime lenses. It does everything you could ever need and the weather resistant housing is a major benefit.,My main gripe with this camera is that now that my work is done, I had planned to sell the camera here on Amazon but Fuji has placed restrictions on Amazon to prevent people from selling it. This is not an inexpensive camera which is now sitting on a shelf depreciating.,So buyer be ware - Fuji has some seriously terrible things they do to customers behind the scenes.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Video shooters beware - when connected to the Atomos Ninja V, my Xt-3 freezes up and also sends glitching signals to the Atomos monitor/recorder.,Issues:,Atomos has sent me two Ninja V's and both experience these identical issues. When turning on the camera, the camera will periodically freeze. Also, when set to 4K, the Ninja V periodically glitches. Because both monitors do the exact same thing, this leads me to believe that this is a rooted Xt-3 issue. To be clear, when not using an external monitor, I haven't had any issues with my Xt-3.,Conclusions:,Both firmwares on both products are up to date. I'm suing supported HDMI cables and SSD's - and yet the problem persists. Either I have a defected Xt-3 unit, or Fujifilm needs to update the firmware functionality when outputting. If Fujifilm sends me another camera or updates the firmware, I'll update my review accordingly. I truly wish I could give it 5 stars, but for my video needs the camera freezing up and glitching (when using Ninja V)  is too unreliable to take on productions. I love Fujifilm and hope this issue can get sorted out. As a professional cinematographer and director, I can't justify having unreliable tools on my sets. I'll be returning my Xt-3 and hopefully will hear back from Fujifilm to update this review.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I had to replace my xt2 after it got wet in the rain and warranty would not cover. What i learned: Weather sealed includes only the front of the camera, camera back (screen, buttons) and dials are NOT weather protected. Be careful and act accordingly. Anything more than a single raindrop should make u Very nervous. I had this verified by a Fuji pro photographer on Instagram .,Anyway, this camera is so much different than the XT2! It’s face detection and processing speed is noticeably better. Many fewer blurred photos due to slow autofocus on moving faces. The touch screen is an improvement and there are lots of new controls to learn but all for the better, really. Photos I’ve included are not edited. Now I just need some more lenses and probably a rain cover . Photo quality not that different from tx2

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I have tried Fujifilm Xt2, Sony A7III and Olympus OMD EM Mark II and there is no doubt in my mind this is the best camera at this price. The image quality is outstanding and the new autofocus is much faster than Xt2 and perhaps a just bit slower than Sony A7. Xt3 improved all aspects of Xt2 but alas battery performance is only marginally improved from XT2. The image quality is equivalent to even full frame cameras. The video capabilities are better than all the others in this category. Image quality, autofocus and ease of use are all the reasons to buy this camera and battery performance only reason to buy Sony. I am waiting for to Olympus to come up with something impressive - And it better be at this price.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I’m a professional, have been for many years. The XT3 does it all, but after only a couple of days with it, not satisfied I made the right decision, not yet.. The kit lens quality / overall price seems terrific. Reviews I read were great but don’t tell the whole story.  Comfort with the Fuji setup is a ways off for me. It’s why people stay with a system for years...mine was Nikon until now. I recently retired, no assignments so wanted to lighten up hence the choice I made.  It was personal, not business.  I would not use the XT3 in a demanding situation although to be clear...it produces great images.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This camera takes nice photos for a “point and shoot” easy camera. It’s nice and compact. (See photos holding camera.) You’ll need an SD card to use it. No memory storing device is included.,I do wish the lens were somehow protected when not in use. It does come with a soft case, but if any type of sand or other similar things were to happen to get inside that the lens could get scratched.,Overall the camera is worth the money.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Until the batteries stopped holding a charge

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Bought this for my 9 year old daughter and she absolutely loves it. Great price for a pixel camera and accessories (includes 2 lithium batteries, charger, strap and carrying case). She can’t wait to take pictures on our family trip to Florida.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this for my daughter use in photography class. She was embarrassed and refused to use it because of the poor resolution. The instructions are over complicated and difficult to adjust. I am not joking! the resolution on my old flip phone was better and easier to operate!!! It now sits in the box because I cannot even give it away....Soooo Bad Deal!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: The camera is very pretty and cute, very light and easy to take it with you. It also comes with 2 batteries! It requires you to put in a SD card to store then pictures. It has video mode too but we haven’t tried that yet. Quality of pictures it good.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Although the camera is small, it still works well and is my favorite color. I like this camera as a collectible. I don't know if this camera can take pictures, but I'm still trying to figure out what it can do.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This is an easy camera for beginner. this camera is small and lightweight, I bought it for my kid. Even my 4 years old boy can use it to take nice picture. This camera just has a few bottoms that my kid can learn how to take picture in different mode. And we love it’s aduroble design and colors.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This is on my boy's birthday wishlist this year, I am very happy to have this for him, the package doesn't include the SD card, you have to buy one separate, very easy for kids to learn how to use this. picture quality is just for beginner and kids, but still worth the money.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Great affordable digital camera, decent quality pictures, you need good lighting in the room. This is good when you don't want to waste phone battery on pictures or risk of getting it stolen. This digital camera does the job. I recommend a 32GB SD card and its a good bargain if you don't do much photography or spend $400 on a camera

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I love photography and it has rubbed off on my kiddos. I didn't want them to break my big camera or my phone so this has been a terrific solution to telling them no. Now I offer them this mini camera instead when they want to take a picture. Happy with the quality of the pictures for the size of the camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: you want to be able to connect the camera to the computer and transfer data directly to computer or charge the camera via hard cable but you are not able to.,you have to keep opening the latch and remove your memory card or the battery for computer connection or charging which will eventually damage the battery door and you have to buy a new camera again.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I purchased this item for my mother as a Christmas gift.  I love it overall, however I am giving it four stars because of the following:,-Slow response time in taking pictures,-Does not have a very good anti-blur feature, you must hold it VERY still to get the best pictures.,With the negatives being said, the positives of this item are:,-Great size,-Rechargeable battery,-Easy usage (interface),-Feels durable,Overall, I would recommend this product.  I would just warn that it does have a little lag in taking photos, however, if you can live with that minor inconvenience then you should love this!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Not a pro camera, but for the price, didn't expect it to be. Does a nice job with point and shoot photos, and has nice set of basic features. My 8yr old son loves it, because he can "just use it" without having to do a lot of setup. Battery life seems to be pretty good after a couple days' use. He's taken close ups, portrait and landscape in bright and low light and it seems to auto adjust pretty well.  With 32gb card added, he'll be taking shots for a long time without worry.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Camera was everything I expected. Online manual very easy to follow and understand. Camera has taken great pictures indoors and outdoors. Easy to set up pictures and even has internal memory if you have no stick.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Good quality point and shoot camera for the price. I bought this for work and the quality of pictures is still worse than my cell phone but overall it they are good. It has basic functions like zoom and video. It is small and lightweight. I would recommend this product to others.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Bought this camera for my 10 year old daughter for Christmas. It’s been 6 months and she barely uses it. She wanted to record basic videos but the playback is horrible. You can barely hear anything even though the volume is all the way up. Even putting the camera up to your ear is still hard to hear. It’s okay with taking photos if you just want a basic camera and do not mind if the photo is not crystal clear.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: It's okay.  Takes great pictures if the object being photographed is close.  Lots of ways to adjust the camera's settings including the ISO speed.  However, in spite of this camera's exceptionally high megapixel, pictures captured from a distance, whether using the zoom or not, come out very poor quality.,The camera is extremely convenient to carry it in a pocket or a purse, but the quality of the photos don't seem to be as good as those taken by many smart phones now.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera to use while vacationing in Disney World. I needed something small and compact that would be easy to handle. While it did take nice photos here and there, it was extremely slow even with the 10 class  32g memory card. The zoom was okay, but I took better pictures with zoom with my phone. The recording feature left A LOT to be desired. Even though I got a lot of good shoots, I would NOT recommend this camera to anyone.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This camera works reasonably well. And does video also. Lots of long awkward pauses when taking several pictures in succession. After pressing the button to snap a picture. Not exactly a rapid fire type of camera, but it gets the job done, slowly. The images are very nice. I had that problem with another digital camera brand. I like the rechargeable lithium battery. Buying batteries all the time is no fun.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Good utility camera for the price. You won't cry when you lose it, it gets stolen, or it gets dropped off of a building. I use it almost daily in my work. Easy learning curve. One major pro is that you can charge it off of any USB port, and you don't need a separate clunky charging unit. The one major con (for me) is that the flash is not all that powerful for large interior shots under low light. Still, it has been a very convenient and trouble free unit so far.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I read a lot of  negative reviews before making this purchase but decided to try. So thankful that I did! This camera went on a vacation with us and took amazingly clear pictures.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I wish I would've returned this when I had the chance. I suppose I thought maybe I was taking the photos in bad lighting, but I genuinely think the camera just sucks. Don't waste your money. Go to bestbuy or somewhere you can try the cameras out before you buy.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Nice camera for the price point for a nine year old to learn photography and her slime channel.,Build quality is very bad though, not at all what I expect from canon.  I am a professional photographer who shoots mostly canon and fujifilm.  This is far below any cheap pocket canon I have ever purchased before,  the plastic body feels like it will break at any moment.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I charged the battery in the charger (light goes from orange to green) and then could not get the camera to turn on ~ I knew many reviewers with low-star review said they could not get it to turn on, but with free returns I gave it a chance.  I will be returning this item and all accessories that I bought for it for a refund and looking elsewhere for a compact digital camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I had an earlier version and I like the improvements. Only had it for a month so far...  First improvement  is 10x megapixels. (as opposed to 8) Second is that it's even smaller than the earlier version (but still hooks up to a tri-pod) and the 3rd improvement is the battery is removable but is a part of the camera. the previous cameras required 2 AA batteries and what was wrong with it wasn't the batteries but the battery holder lid, it wore out too and would no longer hold the batteries in place. I hope this one doesn't have that problem in the future. Overall I like this camera and it's reasonably priced for it's quality and accuracy. I use it primarily to photograph artwork using a tri-pod and extra lighting.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Don' t forget the card.  This does not come with a card.,My old canon elph 100 stopped working properly, and I wanted something to replace it.  I liked my old elph 100 better because it was easy to switch from close ups to distant shots.  But on the 190 I have to page through the menu to switch from close ups to distance.  Still for about $100 it is easy to use and take along in jacket pocket.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Needed new camera, one I could connect to laptop, and send photos via email/fb messaging to family/friends.  Old camera didn't have that capability!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Functionally, this camera is very similar to my older SD1100IS with a longer zoom range and larger screen. I'm only disappointed that I can't force the flash. The only options are auto flash or no flash.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: The pictures came out terrible and there was insufficient flash for low light. I returned this camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I'm no professional, just needed a camera to take photos of the fishing nets I sell on Etsy. It works for my needs and will serve its purpose.  My old Kodak EasyShare C182 that takes AA batteries eats batteries like crazy. And it started to get a lot of blurred photos. Since I don't have any other device for photos, Smart phone or other,  I bought this Canon. Seems good to me and will serve its purpose.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: No complaints. You pretty much get a smaller X-T3 (DPR camera of the year) for less than $1000. Almost all the features are included. Incredible camera!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: Other reviewer really did the great job on it, so I am just going to share how or why I chose this camera. P.S. It's all personal reason.,I was Nikon D3300 owner. I have 35mm f1.8 lens and I love it but somehow I do missing flip screen when I try to take low angle photo. And the body is pretty light, but it still kind of big for daily and street shooting.,So I did my research, what I want is to keep the APSC sensor, because I am designer and I will use it for work sometime. So when sensor smaller than that it won't work for me (noise wise) and I want to able to carry it all day with out using big lunch bag (you know, like Nikon camera bag or any kind of looking like that) so it down to Sony and Fuji. They both have great sensor, great for still, but Fuji have autofocus speed problem and lag on touch screen on their camera in general (before XT3), but they have great jpg color and great quality and compact lens for their APSC X mount. XT20 is great size for me but I will need to accept those points.,On the other side Sony A6400 is top of line on autofocus, but I do not like how their jpg looks like (yes, you can just shoot RAW all the time) but factor that you will need to spend more time just try the match up the color or make the color to the one you like. Also vs to the size and quality of the lens is big different, yes, you still can have great quality lens for of from Sony, but it will be too big and way more expensive than Fuji's X mount system. So I didn't count on Sony.,Than XT30 comes out with great size and the fastest autofoucs on Fuji (comes from XT3) even almost some as Sony and yet this is new camera vs to old version XT20 from few years ago, so it's system can be able to upgrade for more time than XT20. And the company who provide and take care of their camera system software update will be Fuji (you can google it and see). APSC camera is their main product and they do take care of it very well. So I buy it, and man it did not let me down. The size is perfect and I put it into my new bag PeakDesign 5L bag it just fit great and I can even carry my daily stuff with me without looks like a carry a lunch box of camera bag.,But really, go to youtube to watch more review on this and see did this camera is what you really need is more important than anything.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Super lightweight and easy to use. Gave it to my young son (so he would stop filling my phone with pictures up his nose 😄) and he learned how to use it in seconds. The pictures are surprisingly good from such a young user.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I am afraid that when it arrived, the lens would not extend, and if it did, it would not retract. Shame, because the camera was exactly what I was looking for. I am now in the about to return the camera.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T30 Mirrorless Digital Camera, Black (Body Only)
review: I would have given this 5 stars but the length of the USB cable is utterly ridiculous; with the length,  an accident is just waiting to happen. The cord is way to short, an unexpected tug from a passerby would essentially mean the death of your new camera as it will fall. You literally have to place your camera near or on the floor and keep your eyes on it to make sure no one touches it. The cord is so short a slight tug will bring the xt30's end.  To make matters worse, the adapter is self is one of those brick adapters, so you have find out how to place it along side the other plugs. I was actually about to give it 3 stars just from this alone. Other than that, great camera.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I got this camera for traveling. I love how compact it is. It’s really easy to use and takes great photos. Much cheaper than a lot of the cameras out there and on par with quality.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: This camera is perfect for using at the ball field. I needed something that could take good pictures in motion and this works great! My 7 year old can even use it easily. Great camera and very affordable

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Pictures are decent and batteries last about a day as expected.  However when I power it on the flash is always in the "ON" mode and I keep forgetting to turn it off so I when I need to take a quick picture the flash goes off when I don't want it to.  It doesn't remember I had switched off the flash the previous time I used the camera.,Plus none of the video modes play on my Samsung TV.  All of my other cameras have a mode or two that play on my TV.  Two of the modes on this camera display a still picture and play the audio.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Daughter got this as gift Xmas 2017. Died Jan 2019, tries to draw over 1.2 amps from batteries while starting, which drops the battery voltage and forces the microcontroller to reset, then repeats the cycle.  Killed several new sets before I measured it on current-controlled B&K power supply. Ordered replacement, and new unit did much the  same, right out of the box. Sent it back.  This design has issues, would not recommend. Dan, a ham radio guy

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: This camera is small and very lightweight. The picture quality is great and it’s easy to use. I got this for my daughter and she loves it. I would suggest this to anyone

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: I got this for my kids to use as a starter camera.  It’s a nice size.  Takes good pics.  Easy to use.  The pictures are nice.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I wanted a camera that didn't need a rocket scientist or computer programmer to use. This camera suits all my needs. It was easy to initialize, takes nice pictures, and easy to handle. The recommended carrying case is perfect too. Although not a professional photographer - I'm getting there with the help of the Pix Pro FZ43. Try it, you'll like it !

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This camera feels very cheap. I liked that it used AA batteries until you realize a set of batteries only lasts about 300 pictures. I do home inspections so I regularly take 3-500 pictures a day. Also to get this camera to focus on details like a data tag on an A/C unit or a water heater is nearly impossible. I kept this camera as a backup camera and now have realized for my business I can’t even use it for that. Also with as fast as this thing goes throug batteries I’ll go broke keeping batteries in it.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Bought this for our daughter to take to Disney. It worked great and was easy for her to use. She loved taking her own pictures!

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Great camera for me to travel with when I don’t want my massive one! Fits nicely in my purse. Takes great photos. Easy to use.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Startup time is horrendous.  Add in the time to pick your scene mode or turn off flash (you have to wait a few seconds after it's turned on, then click a button /seven times/, but not too quick), and you're not going to be getting any pictures of something that doesn't stand still for at least ten seconds.  Wanted to take a picture of a train the other day but by the time the camera was ready it was long gone.,Use for low-light situations is just okay.  There's an option to change the ISO from 80 to 1600 and 'EV' (whatever that is) from -2 to +2, but no way as far as I can tell to explicitly set exposure time.,I haven't had the battery drain problem that some other people mentioned.  It has lasted for a few weeks (of me getting the camera out maybe 60 times and taking several pictures over that period and taking several pictures each time) at a time on a single pair of NiMH AAs.,Biggest pro: cheap.  Definitely good enough to be my primary carry-around-everywhere-and-get-better-pictures-than-a-cell-phone-would camera.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Im very happy with this camera. Very nice picture quality and the smile recognition feature is great.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: Super easy to use. Takes good quality photos. Battery had a good charge life.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I never do reviews but here I go...their is no battery life with this camera! I have owned "Kodak" before and were great but this one is terrible. I even bought rechargeable batts cause recommended before purchase....forget it..."Duracell "Max batts..forget it..this camera completely took away the joy of photography. Just my opinion...stick'n to it...

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I purchased this camera in March, 2017, it's been a problem from the beginning.  I just figured I had to get use to using it, so I kept it.  I don't take photos often but this never is ready when you want to use it.  Eats thru batteries like crazy.  Now it doesn't work at all!  I used it a total of 2 hours since I purchased it. No more Kodak for me. Costly lesson learned.

product_name: Digital Camera, Lyyes 2.7" Mini Camera HD 720P Digital Point Shoot Camera 8X Zoom Camera for Kids and Gifts (Black)
review: The camera has very simple sitting so my daughter used it without any guidance from me.Good for recording her memories done.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I got just what I thought I would get.  I use this camera daily and it takes a beating.  The only issue is that it sometimes takes awhile to shoot the picture and if I am not watching I will lose the shot.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: These cameras are terrible. The picture quality is poor and the gobble up batteries. I teach at a high school. I put fresh batteries into the camera at the beginning of a 50 minute period. They did not even last long enough for the students to get their pictures off of the camer toward the end of class.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I was disappointed in this camera. It had good reviews and that’s why I bought it. The zoom is not great, the clarity of photos is not great. There’s no focus on it. I returned it and used the money towards a slightly more expensive canon and it was money well spent.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I purchased this as a gift for my son’s birthday and he loves it. It is easy to use yet has professional quality. The picture quality is great. It comes with a wide-angle lens that is detachable and rechargeable batteries. Its s a great camera for someone interested in vlogging.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: My iphone camera had conveniently broken right before my 10 day trip across country so I purchased this digital camera.,I received the box within 2 days of ordering and it was nicely compartmentalized (camera, accessories, wide angle lens, chargers, instructions),The camera is easy to use and takes great quality (wide angles if you want nice skyline photos while traveling) -,It's light and rather compact so it's super portable and easy to carry in your bag/hand.,Would highly recommend if you want a nice travel camera that's easy to use.,5/5

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: It's a great camera. Comes with an extra lens. It connects to screens and TV's with HDMI cable. Also it has an application where it enables you to see the screen from distance via Bluetooth. You can also use it like webcam. The only problem is the app is working on Apple but it's not working yet on Android but I informed the seller about it already. So I'm sure they'll fix it soon.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This camera does have a retro look, but feels really cheap. I know it’s priced well, but not sure that I cannot take better pics on my iPhone.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I bought this camera to learn how to do YouTube videos.  I would have given it a 5-star rating but I could not get it to connect to the Internet for use of Ap.  The App always failed.  Instead, I remove the Sandisk from the camera, put it my computer and upload my videos for editing to it.  It works for the purpose that I need it.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Camera is perfect for the price point it's trying to hit with the quality it takes. Always better than you would be able to with your own mobile phone and the ui is simple to maneuver through.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I bought it for my daughter who wants to start photography. This is a very decent digital camera to start her up, we are all very happy! During our recent trip, she constantly taking pictures. The extra lense is very helpful, and the picture quality are good too!

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This camera has a very cool vintage look. It comes with a very useful spare battery. It was also well packaged. I like the quality of the videos. I'm looking forward to using it this summer.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I bought this camera for my trip to Niagra Falls, and for taking photos while Larping. The features are easy enough for me to know but advanced enough that my boyfriend is able to find all the features that he likes too.,The battery lasts a long time and can be used while charging, it even comes with a spare battery.,It also can hook up to a PC and be used as a webcam, which I'm excited to try.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
