review: There has been so much written about this camera and there are already so many reviews that I will not repeat or duplicate the praise, but I'll say this...,Buy this camera, pick up one prime lens (just one), and then just allow yourself a little Zen for a few weeks where you learn the camera and to focus on photography or videography. There are so many options and there is so much customization avoidable that the camera is a little overwhelming. But once you get dialed-in, it's one heck of a camera. Don't give up. You'll soon be able to make quick adjustments with the buttons and dials, all by feel, while keeping your eyes on the subject.,Pro Tip #1: One of the first things you should do is create a custom menu of the most frequently-used settings. This will greatly speed-up your ability to get the shot you want without futzing through 20+ embedded menus.,Pro Tip #2: Don't go nuts with lenses. You could easily spend thousands of dollars on variable lenses. In my opinion, where this camera really does it's magic-- where any full-frame camera really does it's magic-- is with prime lenses.,Happy shooting!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I'm coming from a Canon 60D, and the dynamic range of the Sony is just awesome.  I bought it with the 28-70 kit lens, and I already miss my old Canon 10-18 for landscapes.  Nothing another $1300 won't solve, as lenses for this thing are not cheap.  Focusing is fast and accurate in almost all conditions.  I also love the dual SD slots.  There are plenty of informative YouTube videos for this new Sony, and if you are considering buying one, they are well worth watching.  I looked at both the Canon and Nikon mirrorless offerings, and Sony has them beat hands down on features.  I mostly shoot landscapes, and so far I'm thrilled with the results I get with my Sony A7III.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I purchased this camera to record events (commencements, meetings, weddings, etc), only to find out that it stops recording at 29 minutes 50 seconds. Apparently, Sony would have to classify it as a video camera and pay extra tariffs in Europe if they let it record over 30 minutes. So to avoid the expense, they programmed it to stop recording. Other companies, like Panasonic, are wiling to shell out the extra fees so their customers can record over 30 minute videos.,Did some research to see what I could do before sending it back; there was software for the previous Sony cameras that would bypass the 30 minute time limit, but Sony has blocked all third party software. So, I purchased an Atomos screen recorder for $1200.. Waste of money, because it doesn't record sound. I could've purchased a microphone and a mixer, etc, but going through all this trouble just to record an hour long event isn't worth it to me.. Plus, if you mount the microphone on the camera, the Atomos screen recorder is super loud and the mic would pick up all the feedback from the fan.,Ended up sending this camera back and going with Panasonic GH5S. The Sony camera is very nice and the video and picture quality is A1, but huge deal breaker having to purchase all the extras just to record over 30 minutes.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Coming from using the A7ii for the past 3.5 years.,The a7iii is a night and day difference.,Some of the key benefits for me:,The autofocusing capabilities are magic.,I was recently able to focus on and track faces on fast moving carnival rides at a local fair.,The battery life is much improved.,I went through a whole day (8 hours) with the camera on and taking pictures. After 800 pictures, it was still at 55%.,The high ISO noise is beautiful. 6400 iso is very usable and you are able to lift shadows without any major grain penalties. I shot a few images with auto iso and was amazed looking back and seeing ISO 10,000 images looking this good.,If you're on the fence and have Sony gear already, you owe it to yourself to get this camera

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I’ve had it for about threeDays now, I’m in love with everything so far my only complaint is that it doesn’t come with a charger. You have to use the included USB charger and plug directly into the camera

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Short version: I LOVE this camera!,Longer version: this is the camera I wish I had when I first started out shooting. Compared to ever other camera I've used (Nikon and Canon), this camera is so easy to use, and is so great at customizing to your shooting needs!,It's a focusing beast, being able to nail eye af even from far away. I'm more than confident now that I can nail every shot that comes my way, even with my 50mm 1.8 which is known for it's laggy af.,Battery life is a huuuuge improvement, I shot an event recently (attached photos) for about 5 hours and my battery went from 100% to 80%. I hated having to change between 3 batteries on my a7 mk2.,Attached are photos from a Día de Muertos celebration I attended where I tested out this camera.,Seriously. Just get this camera. I can't recommend it enough. I'm so excited to start shooting again.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Great camera and the kit lens that came with it is sharp.  Disagree with those saying the lens is not sharp. Its just slow but you kick your asa up to a thousand or more and you can shoot anywhere the fancy $1,200.00 lens can shoot.  Only bitch i have with sony is the garbage camera strap...cheap cheap...and the few very expensive lens they have. But help is on the way as other companies make the lenses that sony cant seem to make. And it would be great if sony could come up with adapters to nikon and canon that work well unlike the present ones out there.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I was super excited to receive my Sony A7III today. I paid for expedited shipping because I didn't want to wait any longer than I had to. I stayed home waiting for my package, it arrived, and I signed for it. As soon as I held the box in my hands, I felt something was wrong. The box seemed awfully light for a camera and a lens. I open the box to find a Sony a6000 and some random plugs. The only thing that actually belonged in the box was the camera strap.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I have been a user of both Nikon and Canon over the past 3-4 years and made the switch to sony in August of 2017. The a7iii is by far the best camera I have used on these three platforms. I previously owned and still use the Sony a6300 which was great for a budget camera but had tons of issues for someone who shoots professionally. I primarily shoot weddings and sports but also do commercial level work on the side. The photos I have provided are my first test of the a7iii in a somewhat warm climate doing both photo and video.,Improved Features:,1. IN CAMERA PROXIES... no one talks about this on youtube!!,2. dual card recording ability, dual writing ability,3. HLG color space, no overheating,4. Bright and Beautiful monitor, focus peaking, customizable buttons, uncompressed RAW photo capability, a large buffer depending on card size, and great autofocus with eye AF and face tracking... plus better "color science." Color science means absolutely nothing unless you are delivering a final image or video straight out of the camera, its all subjective and if you want Accurate colors Sony is the way to go. I could rant for pages about "color science.",5. Headphone Jack... Monitoring external audio is absolutely important if you are running wireless mics. I will use this to monitor my wedding ceremony Audio.,Things that could be improved:,1. The EVF is not calibrated color wise to match the display screen on the back of the camera... not a huge deal for video but it can get annoying for photo. Know your settings well enough to get you close in photos, and the RAW capabilities in Lightroom will give you some leeway.,2. No face tracking while using an external recorder AND recording in Camera. If you record solely on the external recorder you can still retain face tracking which is not a huge deal, there is an option in the settings but it turns the external screen black.,3. only 1 UHS-II slot. I would love to see two of them.,4. no 10-bit color depth... this is probably coming on the a7siii which I understand, but it would be incredible to get a firmware update on the a7iii, a7riii, and a9 to allow 10-bit color, making SLOG  and HLG way easier to expose for and work with in post. Also, it allows creators to keep their a7iii and purchase an a7siii to match perfectly with it.,5. The shutter button is a little spongy... not a huge complaint here because I am being rather critical,The a7iii has improved almost all of the issues thus far I have experienced with Sony APS-C Cameras. In my example photos and videos, I used the 70-200 f/2.8 GM (incredible lens). The a7iii lasted 4.5 hours of continuous video and photo shooting to two different SD cards with a completely bright viewfinder and screen with 20% battery to spare... something I could only dream of on the 6300. This is absolutely a professional camera and is reasonably priced for the features it has.,if you are looking for a prosumer camera with pro features... you can't go wrong with the a7iii. It definitely is not a cinema camera but will absolutely serve me well until I need to upgrade in the future for both photo and video.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Compared to the 2 Canon DSLRs I have owned in the past, it blows them out of the water in terms of auto focus speed and accuracy. For low light, I've never seen anything like it in the consumer market, not counting the A7s ii which I haven't tried yet. The version that I bought came with the kit lens and it's performance is fine. It's not the best to use for the ultimate low light capabilities, but it's reliable enough. Interestingly enough, the kit lens even has firmware that you can update. I have successfully used my Canon glass with it using a Simga MC-11 adapter. The Canon 17-40mm f4L and Canon 70-200 f2.8L focused quickly. My Sigma 8-16mm lens focused well, though it's meant for APS-C sensors. Oddly enough my Canon 50mm 1.4 paired with the A7iii and Sigma MC-11 takes about a minute or two before the aperature control is functional but once it kicks in, this combo turns night into day. I also use a 35mm 1.8 OSS Sony lens that I used with my a5100 and even though it puts it into APS-C mode which sacrifices quality, it's still good enough.,I can even use my Canon 580ex ii successfully with this (manual mode/no HSS) with a Fomex flash trigger.,The reason I bought this however was for video. 4k is stunning, though I have to say, plan for paying a but extra for a UHS-II card to get it to work. The S&Q setting is nice for switching over to slow-mo very quickly.,The menu system is a bit much but at least it includes a lot of features that are missing with Canon. Battery performance is quite incredible.,Overall, I can't see why this camera wouldn't satisfy most pros unless they work in a harsh environment in which case, the weather sealing probably won't be enough. The compact size of it though is nice when you don't want to draw attention.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: This camcorder has a remote control, you don’t need ask people to take pictures for you, so convenient. It is perfect for travelling. The size is very compact and lightweight. It also has a touch screen. I tried to take some pictures, the pictures look great. It has a ​night version, still not try it.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I am 99% a point-and-shoot guy who doesn't want to remember details but does want a massive zoom. This camera scores on both counts. We left on a trip the day after it arrived and I thoughtfully left my instruction booklet behind. Still figured it out and captured great pictures.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Even I can take decent pictures with this camera! I have a hand tremor so normally have a great deal of difficulty getting decent pictures. Went to Longwood Gardens in Kennett Square PA and followed my normal practice of taking an enormous number of pictures in the hope of getting a few decent shots. Out of 337 332 were good. (I posted some shots I took that day.) Even with the zoom extended completely I am able to get decent pictures. The AI setting does a great job even in low light conditions, it's easy to use, and battery life is excellent. I am beyond pleased and will experiment with settings other than AI. I have not used the video feature so can't comment on that.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have been quite pleased with the results of this camera.,A main use for this cam is for parents and others who find themselves seated in the audience but wanting to photograph friends and family members while they perform on stage or a field (think kids soccer game, or marching band, orchestra, etc...).  The 60x zoom is just incredible.  In both sunny and overcast I get perfect pictures.  I've used it for friend's child who is in a university marching band, we sit about 20 rows up on the side of the end zone and I am able to get super sharp close-ups of anyone on the field.  I'm sure many parents know the feeling of when trying to take these kind of pictures with your phone and your loved one ends up a tiny ant in the picture.,I would not count on this camera as much indoors and definitely not in low light.  But for sunny and overcast outdoor, possibly well lit indoor arenas, it doesn't matter where you are sitting, the reach will give you great pics.,I was concerned initially as some reviewers would say things like "better hope its not cloudy with a camera like that!".  But I have several times gone full zoom in overcast skies and ISO doesn't budge above 80/100.  The stability and being seated or using a string tripod can boost even more.,Another advantage is that some venues, like college football do not allow "professional cameras" or cameras with lens over a certain length.  This cam is a pretty safe to get into a stadium as is clearly for amateurs and retracted, is quite unassuming.,If you accept it for what it is, it is a wonderful camera to make sure you always capture those moments and capture them up close and personal no matter you are seated.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I purchased this camera just for the 60x zoom.  I used it especially to take pictures of the moon.  The camera has good features.,Pro: all the Lumix values, switch betwen LVF & LCD view under bright day light,,take 55mm filter (leverage all my old Minolta 55mm filters).,Wish: The shutter only goes to 1/2000.  I wish it can be one step faster.,Most of the attached photo are taken w yellow filter; one photo is taken w creative art filter.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: First of all I am not a professional photographer graduated from a university, but know a little more than basic concepts. With that said, I believe this camera offers an excellent combination of virtues:,-The optical image stabilizer is incredibly good,-The interface is a traditional camera (I will love to have one interface like in the lumia 1020 camera app),-The battery life is really good,-The zoom of course,-The microphone does reduce noise from wind, and a lot.,But it also has some limitations,-This is not a video camera, yes it records good 1080p but it's not crisp,-The LCD panel is fixed, and the LVF pales compared to an optical one(it's not terrible, but an optical is much better),-You will find some noise due to a tendency to elevate the ISO, but nothing the manual settings can't fix,All and all, this camera packs a hell of a bunch of features that amateurs and semi-professionals will find very useful and fun to use. I truly recommend this camera, but keep in mind you are not buying a $2000 camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I can't say enough good about this camera. It really zooms in and gets great pictures. We used it at my daughter's wedding and got some great shots, including a gorgeous night picture. Very happy and highly recommend.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The Intelligent Auto with this camera at the high and low end of zoom was far more adaptive than my Fujifilm S4000.  My Fujifilm camera (which is a 30x optical super zoom camera) had trouble focusing at times when taking indoor shots and some outdoor shots.  This camera had no focusing problems in Intelligent auto worthy of reporting.,I also found the white balance on this camera to be a step above my Fujifilm S4000.  It required me to use my flash more indoors so it could focus and that wasn't so much of an issue with the Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ70.  It took several indoor shots without the need for a flash and it had real time focus creating images that were sharp and clear.,On the long end of the optical zoom I did notice some noise in the image, but that's to be expected with a lens this powerful.  It performed very well in high range zoom and in both video and picture taking modes.  It's ability to focus in real time during video mode is pretty good and I tested it during a snow storm just to make it a little harder on the camera.,It's been boasted online that you can extend the zoom range on this camera by scaling down megapixel setting.  It does say that in the manual, but I haven't tested that feature.  What I do like about this camera however, is that on the low end of zoom at 20mm, it lets you take a wider shot than other cameras in it's class and some of them even cost more than this camera.,Would it be nice if it had a larger sensor?  Perhaps, but I haven't really seen any super zoom camera's that compete with it that have a larger sensor anyway.  That's probably more for an expensive DSLR anyway.  Besides, this camera takes pretty good pictures without the larger sensor.  Overall, I'm very satisfied with it and it's sure better than my old FUJI in every way.,I don't know if my opinion counts for anything but I can tell you this is a pretty nice camera.  I'm glad I bought it and I'm thoroughly happy with it and I bet there's a good chance you will be to.  For it's ability, features, and performance, I would say this camera is the best overall value of any camera in it's class being sold today, but that's just one mans opinion.,One thing I almost forgot to mention in closing, is that it has a 55mm thread at the end of the lens so you can attach filters for special effects.  That's awesome.  For example, if you wanted to add a Sepia filter you might be able to make your pictures look like they were taken way back in the late 1800's.  It's an awesome special effect.,Take care ... and I hope you buy this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: If you're looking for a more-than-capable camera, whether it be for ultra-zoom, or even because you aren't quite sure you want to make the investment for a DSLR (with all the lenses and such) I think this camera is hard to beat. I've been using it for months now, and it is, hands down, my go-to for every day shooting. The menus are jam-packed with functionality, and, if you're like me, post-processing is minimal in most situations. I love this camera, and it has truly increased my confidence level in taking stunning pictures...,It's a blast to play with and to find just what 'style' you prefer for images. I can't say enough good things about it!! As a matter of fact, I can't really come up with a negative at this point.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I was able to take amazing photos with it which was kind of a surprise as some reviews were so negative.,I found it to be of high quality according to price, video is pretty amazing and works great while zooming.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Do not buy this camera. After about a month I started getting 2 error messages while trying to zoom. The first one was zoom error and the other error notified me to turn the camera off and on?!  Not only that but after about 1.5 hours the camera will not record because the camera is overheated. Even without being in direct sunlight! Also this doesn’t have a pop out display which is a big deal now that I’ve worked with this camera. So these errors are happening every time I try to zoom in on something which is a huge problem. I would’ve returned it but of course these problems occurred AFTER the deadline to return. I’m writing this to save someone else who’s thinking of purchasing this horrible camera. Maybe I received a dud and no one else has this problem?

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I previously owned a Canon Rebel film 35mm camera bought it back in 2000...loved it!! Had wanted a new digital camera for a long time, found this kit deal and couldn't pass it up for the price!!! You get so many accessories and items to assist you in great photography. I would highly recommend this to anyone thinking of purchasing a digital 35mm.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I have never had experience with cameras past my smart phones. I have been wanting a "real legit" camera for a while now. I finally decided to purchase it. So far, it's amazing. It came with so much more than I originally thought. There was debate on what actually came with it so I was not expecting much. The amount I paid was definitely worth it. Everything came in great condition. It took me a second to sit down and put everything together but it wasn't too hard to figure out. I recommend this to others who are in a similar situation. The quality of the pictures are great too as you can see from other people's reviews. And yes, half the stuff I took pictures of are on my leg.. fight me.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Everything is lovely! (Haven't taken more than a few test pics so, know that when reading),Firstly, shipping time was IMMACULATE. nuff said.,Second, SO MANY ACCESSORIES! If you're trying to get into photography or do it as a hobby n need a quick upgrade, THIS IS IT. It is the camera set itself (camera base, battery charger, is chord, and lens) and an additional 14 (I think I counted right?) Accessories: 4 filters (2 uv's, cpl, fld), 2 lenses (wide angle w macro, & telephoto), flash attatchment, mini tripod, 60" tripod, 16 & 32 gb sd cards, lens cleaner, a remote shutter trigger, and a gadget bag. W H E W a lot. Do know that the only thing that's Canon brand is the camera set; the accessories I received are vivtar (and transcend sd cards).,I think the only BIG con is that IT DOES NOT COME W BATTERIES. you have to buy em separate. But man if they add that in later, y'all I'm saying there's no real reason not to get this.,Can't wait to take photos n better my hobby!!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Excellent addition to anyone's photographic arsenal.  Images are rich, sharp and colors are vivid.  Manual mode is simple and bracketing feature available for those wanting to get into HDR.  I'd recommend this camera to anyone looking for a great SLR, can never go wrong with a Canon.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: $300 for the camera & a whole bunch of inclusions - everyone I know has been asking me where I got such a great deal! Will be posting some photos taken using this camera & doing an update on durability in the future. For now, I absolutely love it!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I took my first photos this evening with the Rebel camera using the automatic features, and took pics with my Samsung Galaxy S7, too, of the same subject. I think my phone took better pictures--clearer and better color. Perhaps as I become more proficient with the camera the photos will improve, but so far I'm not impressed. Also, the front zipper on the Vivitar camera bag was defective, however Amazon customer service was very helpful and is sending a replacement bag free.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: This camera is great for beginner to intermediate DSLR photographers and is very user friendly. Arrived on time and came with everything description listed. All accessories work with the camera and are easily attached. Definitely worth the money.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: My daughter bought it with her birthday money. Everything came new and in good condition! She loves it! It is an awesome buy!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: The camera and lens it comes with is amazing. All the other gear with it is crap. What I don't like about legitimate DSLRs is their lack of flexibility. I've been able to take a bigger verity of shots with a point and shoot than with this. The lens here is made for close range and indoor shooting only and it does it VERY well, but that is it. Guess I have to start a collection of Canon lenses now after I sell a bunch of the add-on junk that came with the kit.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Great camera, but the wifi feature is really misleading. It only allows you to view on your smartphone. If you want to upload to your computer or a web service, you have to connect it to a computer via USB. In other words Wifi is worthless.  Pictures seem pretty nice, but my first DSLR, easy to use, good UI and menus explain what you are doing.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I am very happy with the size of the camera.  It fits perfectly into my handbag.  I am about to embark on a major trip overseas and this camera will back up my I phone camera.,The only thing I am not pleased about is the camera case and I will not be able to use it.  The case has a shocking odor, despite my cleaning it in soap and water.  It smells like everything that comes from China.  Wondering if it is formaldehyde.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle

It is very lightweight and perfect if you are looking for something that will produce a better than cell phone quality photo without the expense of a professional camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I was happy to receive the camera package. All items were in excellent condition. If anything, I wish the camera case was large enough to house the battery charger. I like to keep all items together.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Bought this for a trip to New Zealand. Great camera and it came with a good package of extra features. The camera is small and can fit in my hiking pants pocket. I made use of the case, the memory case, memory stick, and usb memory socket.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Just purchased this so haven't used it much yet and have not printed in pictures.  Screen is very small and pictures in camera view could have better resolution.  Jury is still out on this one.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Good point and shoot.  The package is a bit overpriced.  Looking at average pricing on line I probably could have got the whole shebang for about $10.00 less.  Was convenient to have all of it in a single package though.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I don't have anything against this camera, except it has no self-timer & that's what I wanted. Other than that one feature, it is a good camera & I would recommend it to any shopper.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: Great little camera, and I really mean little! Smaller than I expected, wish it were a tad larger, but it takes nice pics. I haven't had it long, but the photos I've taken with it have been quite lovely. I'm still learning how to use all features, and have yet to use the desk tripod. Nice accessories included.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
review: I am so happy that I purchased this waterproof camera and brought it with me to the water park last weekend with my family. It is light and the quality of the pictures are good. I took a lot of pictures of my daughter playing in the water and was not worried about water getting on the camera. And it has two screens which is very convenient for you to take a selfie. You definitely need one for the water park.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling

It will be a great camera to continue exploring and experimenting with.

product_name: Waterproof Camera Full HD 1080P Underwater Camera 24 MP Video Recorder Selfie Dual Screen DV Recording Waterproof Digital Camera for Snorkeling
