product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: The Canon SX420 IS camera is remarkably easy to use. I was surprised at its light weight and comfortable grip. Its advanced features are quickly accessible through the menus. Even the WI-FI setup is good, although I had some problems due to my network system, not the camera. Picture quality is excellent, due in part to its image stabilization. The accessories included as packaged by the Imaging World are very useful and are "the cherry on top of the icing".

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: The camera is easy to use, light weight, and the picture quality is really nice! I got this right before the weekend, so took some pictures on Sunday of some family, and tested out the features. I was very happy with everything. The package deal from TheImagingWorld is perfect for starter or pro photographers. I was really surprised at quality of everything for the price. I would definitely buy from TheImagingWorld again!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I had to return! It was not worth the money. The picture wasn’t good at all. I had better quality on my 12 year old camera. I went out and bought an iPhone XR and it’s the best camera ever!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: This is a Christmas gift for our Granddaughter, and she is going to be thrilled!!!  This package comes with everything she will need, and is a fine camera, besides!!!  We are very impressed with Imaging World and their personalized service.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: My biggest issue is the false advertising. There is absolutely no way this is a 21 megapixel digital camera. It is hardly better than early 2000’s camera phones. The flash washes everything in sight out and there is zero image stabilization. Immediately returned.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This HD Digital Camera works very well. My little one like it so much. This product is not only very convenient to carry it, but also easy to use. If you want you children to have more experience about taking pictures and finding different things around our lives, this product is a good choice. The price also nice for this quality. Thank you.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This camera is very nice. I like the color of the camera and I like the size of it. I really that it is easy to use and I like the quality of the pictures that the camera takes.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: It's a tiny camera that fits in your pocket or purse but has all the features of an expensive camera. I love it and i can't wait to use it for our vacation.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: My 11 year old granddaughter is interested in photography.  I ordered this as a Christmas gift.  She loves it and will use it to explore her interest.  Easy to operate and she is excited for vacation so she can document her travels.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: My friend’s daughter wanted a camera, so I bought her this one. It’s small and lightweight. It comes neatly packed in s small box.Very easy to use. I took some pictures outside and they look great!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this for my son as a Christmas present. However I tested it out myself first because I wanted to have it all set up for when he opens it. The quality is really great and easy to uSe. I am going to buy a few more to give out to my niece and nephews for Christmas.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: very good quality. As good as it was described. Safe shipping fast

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this for my kids so they don't always use my cell phone to take pictures, and so they can have their own little camera. For starters, the SD card will not stay where it is supposed to so none of their pictures ever save. You can sometimes make it if you open it up, jiggle it, hope for the best, open it, jiggle it again and then it stays, but the second you move, it comes undone again. It is very disappointing for your little budding photographer. The picture quality isnt great, nor is it awful, you definitely get what you pay for with this inexpensive first camera. Except it won't save any pictures.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my mother in law (given early bc of a vacation.) She does not have a smart phone and wanted to take pictures. The camera takes great quality photos for 4x6 prints and for her digital picture frame. It is easy for a not tech savvy senior to use.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: The best thing about the X-T3 is its video quality. It is absolutely amazing with the ETERNA film simulation. But if you color grade your footage, it is even BETTER. For photo, Fujifilm is famous for their color science. X-T3 provides a number film simulations for JPG color rendering. They are all very good. Other great features include:,10-bit 4:2:0 recording on SD card,10-bit 4:2:2 recording to external,F-Log,4K video at 60 fps,Fast start up time,Face/eye detection for focusing and metering,Panorama,Focus stacking,Weather-sealed,2 SD card slots,Wireless connection to phones or tablets,Camera can charge and operate at the same time with an external power bank,The only weakness of X-T3 is lacking of in-body image stabilization. However, when I do video, I always use a gimbal anyway. So it is not a big deal for me. Finally, I have to say, the X-T3 is the best camera that I have ever bought and I absolutely love it. It makes photography and cinematography so much more fun!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I've been using the X-Pro 2 for about two years now and I was REALLY tired of:,- Gluing the eyepiece back onto the camera (3 times).,- fixing the diopter adjustment dial after I hit it putting the camera back in the bag.,- Correcting the exposure compensation dial after accidentally moving it.,These tasks were driving me crazy and when I saw the XT-3 had corrected all three problems it was an easy decision.  PLUS there are a ton of other upgrades.  I don't use it for video now, but maybe in the future.  I use it with two primes (16mm + 56mm) that are the crown jewels in the Fuji lens line.  I bought it with the battery grip and the combination of the two are soooo much smaller than my old Nikon rig.  This new body and those two lenses are all I need for my flavors of photography (until the X-Pro3 comes out?).

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I loved the Fuji Xh-1 for its stabalization.  But, there is something about this Fuji Xt3 that just makes it different.  Maybe its just me but I will have this for a long time at least for the next 5 years or so.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Love this camera and everything it does. No issues. Only complaint I have with this camera is low light capability. I came to Fuji from a Nikon D750 and haven’t looked back, even with the z series. Fujis lenses are just too sharp and good to worry about z series being built up slowly. Also way cheaper with arguable better quality glass. My D750 was incredible at low light. This is The best crop sensor camera at low light but not quite as good as my former ff body. Yet here is the cool thing about Fuji, the low light noise isn’t really noise but grain. I haven’t noticed it looking blotchy or discolored light Sony stuff. All that happens is a film like grain. You could just call it character!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I switched from a Nikon D750 into the X-T3. Whoah. I was not prepared to be as impressed by the X-T3 as I was. It is truly a special camera. It has almost any feature you could ask for in a camera today. It is definitely on par with the Sony A7III and any other high-end mirrorless camera. The only difference being its APS-C sensor size instead of full-frame. Ultimately, that was the game breaker for me because of my shooting style, wanting as much bokeh as I can get regardless of lens.,Speaking of lenses, I used the Fujinon 35mm f/1.4 and the 16-55 f/2.8. Both lenses were phenomenal and matched the superior build quality of the X-T3.,The auto-focusing on this camera is INSANE. It has Eye-Detect/Tracking AF and almost never misses. I can't tell you how satisfying it is to nail focus on the eye instead of the eye-lashes or nose. However, it is lacking eye-detection on animals, which is something Sony, Panasonic, Canon, and maybe even Nikon mirrorless systems all offer. I am sure there will be a firmware update to support this eventually. But, it would seriously make this the best AF system available if you could track your dog or cat as well. (niche, but still prevalent in today's Prosumer market).,As far as build goes, you can't beat it. It feels so durable and without any expenses paid. The combination between metal, yes metal (not plastic), all around and the faux-leather grip is truly stunning. The dials are fun and such, but I literally never used them. I set my camera up to use normal function buttons and dials that all cameras have.,Speaking of function buttons: this camera has about 9 different buttons you can program to do any of about 50 functions. Additionally, you can program 4 actions on the touch screen as well, bringing the total up to 13 different quick function controls. In reality, you actually can get 17 different controllable functions if you use the dedicated shutter, iso, exposure compensation dials as well as the aperture ring on all fuji lenses. I have never experienced a camera that allows for so many micro adjustments to be made manually without having to do a certain combination of buttons.,Being a mirrorless APS-C camera, it is very small. Too small for me. I had to buy a grip to add to it, just to comfortably hold onto it, especially with that rather large 16-55 lens. But, I have decently large hands and was coming off of the Nikon D750 which has an enormous grip on it. The pro for its size is its ability to travel very easily as well as walk around all day holding onto it.,I will also add that this camera produces amazing, moody colors, has incredible video capabilities, and is one of the best cameras I have ever used. Sadly, Fuji has no intention of making a full-frame camera, so I have switched back to the Nikon family.,Who is this camera for:,-Moody/punchy wedding photographers or videographers that don't mind having less bokeh.,-Street photographers,-Anyone who grew up using vintage style cameras and want some nostalgia in their lives,-Anyone looking to use photography as a career.,-Anyone looking to switch to mirrorless, but not spend $2000+ just for a body and then fork over thousands for lenses.,-Vloggers who don't mind an external monitor

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Stunning pictures. Got used to the lack of ibis pretty quickly. Just don’t rush. The colors are amazing. Objects look like they are coming out of the pictures. Only problem is I like to edit. You really don’t need to edit these. Amazing. Oh and the black model looks very cool.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Love the colors and sharpness of this camera, love the weight and the size and I love the look. I don't really like the life of the battery I have bought 3 so I always have one ready to use but the price is way too expensive

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: After reading the reviews on his camera I was  so looking forward to using it on our vacation. It lasted about two days and then the screen went blank. I also purchased an extra battery for it. I charge both batteries and neither one brought the camera back to life. Now I have to spend the rest of my vacation taking pictures with my cell phone. All this money spent on a professional camera and it ended up being a dud.  This is going back to Amazon. I’m trying to decide if this one is just a fluke and maybe I should go ahead and order another one and give it one more try.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This is my second one after 5 years of pretty good use. An excellent little digital camera. The flash stopped working on my old one but not worth repairing at this price. It takes wonderful photos and I was glad I could still get the same one.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I am a professional photographer. I use an XT3 (and previously the xt2) to shoot about 100k images a year. I can count on one hand the times I've missed a shot, missed focus, or had an error. An absolutely bulletproof system with an incredible lens lineup. My colleagues with canon/nikon scoffed at first, but 2-3 years after I made the switch they've started expressing interest about switching, mainly about the weight & size savings compared to full size DSLR's (it's about 50%).

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: By far the best mirrorless camera on the market. I love the retro look and functions. Color reproduction is better an Sony. I moved from Sony NEX 6 to Sony Alpha 6000 to Fujifil XT20 to Fujifilm XT2 and now the XT3. I love the camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Incredible little camera.  Many, many features with excellent pictures.  I mentioned this camera to my brother, a camera buff, and he was so impressed, he bought one.  He's a CAO of a defense contractor and showed the camera to many engineers and factory workers who also ordered the camera.  It's hard to believe, but the count at the plant is now up to 142 cameras ordered.  One engineer ordered 12 to send overseas to his sons and friends stationed in Iraq.,For the price, it can't be beat.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I didn't want a rechargeable battery pack...I wanted operation by batteries.  Guess I missed this in the product description.  When traveling overseas (Europe, Asia), there is no ac current plugs, batteries are better.  When your camera needs more power...right in the middle of a "shoot" ...batteries are replaced quicker and more easily.  Oh well....

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Have had fun with this camera.  Some people use their phone for good pictures.  This affordable, high pixel / quality camera gives me many useful options  and I can get by with a relatively cheap phone.  A very essential tool for what I do.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Quality of the pics - pretty good for point and shoot camera.,Quality of the craftsmanship - poor.  Part that zooms in and out, one of the metal part is falling off after 2 use.  It's not critical to taking picture itself, so the camera still works fine, but I didn't expect this camera to start falling apart this quickly.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Bought it for my kid to play around with, the quality of the lcd is really poor, the autofocus is slow, and the low light capabilities are bad...if you plan on shooting in beautiful light all the time you’ll prolly be fine with this

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: wow its a great little camera ..takes great pictures is inexpensive ..and i use it to document rentals condition.wish it had wi fi .but i love it anyway .

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: It takes a lot of play with the settings to consistently get good clear pictures.  If you know your way around a camera you can do well for cheap with this.  If your an amateur hoping to be carried by Easy Mode I would look elsewhere.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: OK camera for the price. Picture quality varies, and the delay between pictures is LONG, causing you to miss some great shots. Good camera to toss in the glovebox just in case!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This is my favorite digital camera.  I had one that I dropped and broke it.  This is a replacement.  I couldn't live without a Sony digi-cam.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This is my forth Canon point and shoot camera. I wore the others out. This one uses Lithium ion batteries where the previous models used AA batteries. I have only  taken about 50 images so far with this camera and it seems to work just fine.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: The pictures were not very good quality and rather grainy. But if you want a point and soot camera with 4x6 prints it might be okay.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I purchased the Camera in October and worked ok initially. However, the battery now does not hold a charge and now will not work.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Great small compact camera to take photo of your every memories. Awesome quality pictures for,non professional photographers. Several functions for photography. Includes camera, battery,battery charger and wrist handle, instructions.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I use it at work to photo equipment; easily cleaned for moving in and out of clean rooms.  Excellent photographic quality.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I ordered two of these for work use and one of them works perfectly, however, after charging the battery the other does not work and I will be returning. Perfect for what we need them for.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Great pocket camera.. A little bigger and heavier than the cheaper Powershots , but this one does a lot more, and color is more accurate.. Lag between shots is way better than cheaper Powershots, a big plus...I like this camera a lot.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This is my 3rd Canon, started with the SD630 and so learning curve should be short, but I'm still learning. This one has some new features, but for the most part nothing overly complex. I've tried other makes but Canon is my favorite.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I have a professional, EOS to use when taking pictures for my business. It is expensive and should NOT be taking where it may damaged. That’s where this fabulous Canon Power ,Shot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/ Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode really comes in handy. It is very easy to adjust and captures high quality photographs ranging from 5 MD to 8.5 MB in size.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I love canon but this one is not working for me.  I charged battery and after fully charged try to turn on,  would not power on.  I give it 0 stars.  Another thing very light camera and kind of wished it came with a cord to hook up to laptop to down load. No cord.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Does the job and no more. Point and shoot. If you don't like taking pics with your phone this would be the solution. I like how it takes regular old batteries,though, any nearby minimart and your powered up again. If your expectations aren't too high, for the price, good basic digicam. 16 mp is bonus.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: To say this thing eats batteries is putting it lightly. I could barely take a few pictures before the batteries died, not worth the savings if I'm gonna be spending a ton on batteries plus the frustration of constantly replacing them ugh!!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I bought this for my wife -- she likes this type of camera because it uses regular AA batteries, so she doesn't need to travel with a charger.  Unfortunately, it only lasted 4 whole months -- this swamps ease of battery replacement in my mind.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: After working through the learning period, I really like the camera.  It takes great pictures and is easy to transfer pictures to my computer.  Be sure to buy the package deal that includes the SD card, case, and other items for the best price ( I didn't and had to buy the SD card & case locally).  I particularly like the small size as it fits into my pocket or purse easily.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Pictures come out nice but the battery life is pretty low. I don't think they fit snugly in their places - which would account for the problems there. Some times I just take the batteries out and re-insert them - and they work again.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: We got this for my daughter for Christmas and she really loves this!  Seems to do everything she wants, which is a great thing for a starting photographer at 10 years old!  Great stuff!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Like best the price was real cheep. Like the least dose not take good picture. I have had a camera like this for 10 - 15 years worked great, then get this camera and just want to cry . It is not working like the old one.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This camera does not come with a memory card. I have no idea why but I decided to return it as I did not see information stating that it had to be purchased separately.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Good little camera. Bought it for my daughter to take yo Girl Scout camp. Good quality pictures and durable enough for a 7 year old.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Bought the camera 6/16; the display screen blacks out today! I’m past my 30 day return for Amazon. Will not buy this camera again, will most likely go to a retail store to get a new one, at least that way I’ll have some place to take it back to...

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This Sony takes good pictures but I just wish that for the price Sony would have used a better LCD screen. I mean my cheap no name camera had a better LCD display. I mean I understand it's more of an entry camera but this is Sony not some cheap brand. This camera was for my mother but I guess I was expecting it to be similar to my own Sony.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I've had Sony cameras before and this one is pretty easy to use (to me). This was purchased for a friend and I showed him the settings etc. The simple auto setting only went up to a 5mp image which is likely why some people were getting poor shots. Its not as simple as an emtry level camera could be, but it also does more than it would seem at first glance.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Very small camera, probably the smallest I have seen, which is great for those who don't like carrying a big camera with them. The picture quality was not the best when seen it on the camera, but the image looks better when seen on the computer.,I gifted it to my dad who loves small cameras and is not concerned too much about the resolution of the image. I will possibly buy a new one that shoots a better quality of pictures even if it is a bigger size. The 20.1 MP really does not add much to the picture quality as expected.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Ok, it's not gonna replace my "big" cameras, but this has become my "take it everywhere" camera. It is 3.7 inches long, 2 inches high and a bit more than a half inch thick. It weighs about as much as a pack of gum, yet it shoots 20mp, has an 8X optical zoom, a Zeiss Vario-Tessar lens and uses standard SDHC memory cards. In "P" mode you have full control over ISO, White Balance, Focus, Metering and more (though no manual mode). You never notice it in your pocket. $99 at Amazon. Amazing, and highly recommended! I can't get over the price...

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I am so sad about this camera. I've been brand loyal to Sony, since my first child was born, and we've used Sony Cybershot since 2006. When they broke in the past, it was my fault (dropping it etc), but this is my 4th time buying one, and the quality has taken a nosedive. It is not worth the name anymore, and now I don't trust the SONY name either.  This camera is flimsy, so the battery is hard to get in and out, but once it's in, it can easily fall out. But worse than the battery issue is the fact that it takes a long time to focus/take the shot, and then a really long time to take a repeated shot, even without the flash. You can't effectively take photos of children, which is mission critical for me.  The other Cybershots, even back in 2006 were not this slow!  How can it be this bad 8 or 9 years later?

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I got this one to replace an older model that I have had for years that I have dropped too many times on the concrete.  This newer model is great.  I had purchased a Canon Elf first and I hated it.  This is a great little camera that I carry on my motorcycle or kayak and it always delivers great pictures. I love it!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I initially bought a bigger camera with more features for my daughter, and then decided to give her the choice between that camera and this one.  She picked this one!  She prefers the smaller size, but she did try both out to compare photo quality.  This camera actually had truer colors than the other one did.  It was also easier for her to operate.  So, now I'm packing up the other camera and returning it.  This camera will serve my daughter well and the fact that it's so compact just can't be beat!  It's a great value and so easy to use!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I know this is not an expensive camera so I'm not dinging it for picture quality. It is good enough for the price point. What drives me insane is it's inability to stay in focus. Anytime I am taking video it randomly but often decides to go out of focus 10-20 seconds in and will not regain focus.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Great little camera for the price. Was not looking for a camera for professional use. just something the wife and I could use for vacations and family events. Small enough to fit in a shirt pocket . Simple to use and has many nice features usually found on more expensive units. If your looking for a small camera that takes great pictures, you could hardly go wrong with this.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The screen is super flimsy. It's literally junk. ALL images are blurry, focus is crap. I would return it, but somehow being inside of my pocket broke the screen. Screen still works, but its cracked and has a blacked out area now. Complete waste of money.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This is a really great camera! The kit lens is just OK, but I ended up buying a Tamron f/2.8 28-75mm and it's a perfect pairing. I do wish the Sony lenses were a bit cheaper, but I know it's a newer system than some other mounts so in theory the price should come down as the ecosystem matures. The low light performance on this camera is unmatched. The menu system is a bit clunky and unintuitive, but that's most Sony cameras. Just keep that in mind if you're new to Sony... you'll have a bit of a learning curve to figure out how their menu system works.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Amazing camera. I honestly hadn’t even considered the A7III as a replacement to my A7S 1st generation.  I’m so glad I did! Autofocus is unbelievable on the camera, best of any I’ve owned in the last 5 years from Nikon, Sony and Leica.  Just found out it has the same Autofocus system as the A9, different sensors but same autofocus.  Seriously, they market this as an entry level full frame DSLR but the features are pro.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: OMG, this camera really does all it says it will!  Takes a bit of slogging through menus to set it up correctly but when that is done, it's a dream.  I am very, very pleased.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I'm using adapted sigma lenses so the af in low light isn't that great (face and eye af). The back screen and the EVF imo are not accurate (exposure, flash and skin). Besides that I love this camera. The A7iii made all of my lenses (Sigma Art 135mm, 50mm and 24mm) better. The color is just fine and this is coming from a Canon 5d Mark iii where the color of the pics looked great in camera before editing.,:::Update::: Now that the Sony A7iii has had a firmware update all of my Sigma Art lenses are great especially in low light. I also got the Sony 85mm 1.8 I love it!!!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I went from using the Canon 5Dmk4 to Sony a7iii and I’m so glad I did! Canon color does look amazing for photos but if you want a compact professional video/photo camera this is it! It performs outstanding in low light situations and I have ZERO complaints about this camera, I’m really impressed by Sony and their technology! I Really wish they would have put 4K 60fps or raise the Mbps in 4K 30fps, then I would say its perfect. Buy this camera ASAP and let it pay for its self doing top of the line gigs if you’re into that. Besides that make sure you update your firmware every time they release a new one kuz it only makes the camera better.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I LOVE THIS CAMERA! But here’s some Pros and Cons,Pros:,Battery Life- for photos last around a 1.5 days. Video around a day,Grip- I have smaller hands so the camera is perfect in my hands,Autofocus- It works wonders in video, has some small faults in photography.,Color- I personally love the color science coming from the camera.,Cons:,Not beating waterproof or really water resistant,The little flippy doors to get to the ports drive me insane especially when using a shotgun mic.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Wow wow wow! If you are debating on purchasing this camera.. don't. Buy it now!! This is an incredible piece. The Eye AF and the facial recognition.. impeccable!! 🙌🙌,The EVF is a whole new AMAZING experience. I can't believe it took me this long to make the switch.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've owned this for about a month and a half now and have for the most part enjoyed it.  I had a Panasonic Lumix previously, so this was supposed to be a slight upgrade over it (especially the zoom).  I would describe my photography style as "lazy".  It isn't that I couldn't fiddle with the settings, or that I don't at times, but I enjoy just setting it to Intelligent Auto and letting the camera do all the work.  The problem I've found is that at times this camera just takes blurry pictures due to it not switching to a good setting.  It also tends to take a lot of dark images.  At times you think you've taken a good shot and get it back on the computer and realize that it is in fact blurry.  Our previous camera's didn't have that problem except in some very particular situations.  Then again it can take some really nice shots too and the zoom is really incredible.  Overall it is a really good camera for the price and I am glad I purchased it.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Made a little video review of the camera. Video and image quality looks pretty amazing. No lag. The zoom works pretty good. And cant wait to start using it :)

review: Initially seemed pretty nice, but the image quality started going blurry and deteriorated very fast. poor to no support from the seller. If you buy it return it while you can, I did in the nick of time.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've been a fan of the super zoom category since 2001, back when Olympus arguably created the category with the introduction of the C700 with a 10x zoom.  It was ground breaking at the time to have a camera of that size, that much zoom, and at that price point.  I feel the same way about this Lumix.  The 60x lens is an incredible amount of magnification that is usable, hand held, in good light, the image stabilization is that good.  It may be the largest super zoom camera I've owned, but I don't mind carrying it, given it's ability to take long distance shots of small objects, with nothing more than a steady hand (in good light).,2018 Update- continues to amaze.  Great camera.

review: I am not very happy with the technology in this camera. There is no blue tooth, the connection to WiFi is indirect and the instructions are difficult to translate.

review: This camera is amazing! its super versatile and with a little knowledge about photography you can take amazing pictures. I also like that it shoots 4k. The zoom on this camera is awesome as well. I would say if you are looking for a high quality low cost camera and dont want to deal with lugging around multiple lenses, this camera is for you!

review: It is good camera for  taking pictures and makes videos.It is small and light weight.The picture quality is far better than mobile photo and Easy function , battery life is good  and comes with extra battery  I love this camera , nice product .

review: Whoa, Fred, did you not just purchase a Canon SX 530 with a 50x zoom a few months ago? Why would you trade it in and order this instead? Well, a minor detail is that this is 60x zoom so I gain a bit on the wide angle end but, again that is minor. I had a Lumix travel camera before (for serious stuff my "big boy" cameras are Olympus and Lumix mirrorless interchangeable lens models) and I used that camera until I wore the paint off the controls. When it came time to replace it, the Canon was being closed out and was a super deal. Now this one is at a great price and the major thing that drove the purchase is realizing how much I missed the viewfinder which this has and the Canon does not. Only a biggie when taking pix outside in the bright sun and this being Florida...

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I was impressed when the camera arrived.  I am usually a point and shoot type person so it is all a little overwhelming to me right now.  There are so many features and choices.  Once I finally figure everything out I think it will be a great camera.  I have used a simpler version of the Panasonic Lumix for years and have always received compliments on the great pictures it took.  Hope this one will provide the same quality photos.  I was impressed with the reviews of others..

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I purchased this F70 for myself for Christmas after exhaustively researching all the "super zoom" cameras I could find, including all of the reviews on this site. If you're considering this camera, know that you probably won't find it in any but the largest camera stores and the online price varies widely. Last week on Amazon it varied from $249.00-349.00, and that's on the one site! Needless to say, I waited until it was $249. I’m not a professional photographer so this isn’t a technical review, but I’ve been taking pictures for about 50 years, first with Kodak roll film box cameras, then a twin lens reflex, then a series of manual 35mm cameras (no light meter), and culminating in my ultimate 35mm, a Nikon FM. I’ve used various digital cameras that my wife owned, including a Minolta and a Canon ELPH. Until I bought my wife a Canon SX50 last xmas, I was not ready to give up my Nikon but the Canon astounded me with its picture quality, small size, light weight, and of course that 50X optical zoom (effectively 24-1200mm). After selling my Nikon, I was about set to buy another SX50 for myself when I saw the Panasonic FZ70. What attracted me was the 20mm wide angle and 60X optical zoom as well as the manual control options. I was turned off by some of the reviews regarding picture quality especially compared to the SX50 but after re-reading the reviews, I decided to take a chance and ordered it and I’m glad I did. I set it on a tripod and photographed a tree about a half mile away, first at wide angle then at 60X zoom and another at 50X zoom. And I did the same thing with her Canon. Despite tripod shake and a strong wind blowing the tree, the FZ70 took a remarkably clear shot at 60X. At 50X it actually appeared to have more detail than the Canon when viewed on my computer. I liked the colors with the Canon better but the colors are adjustable on the Panasonic so I could probably duplicate the results. I wish there was a way to upload the photos so I could show you.  Also, the 20mm on the Panasonic is a real advantage for me because I shoot mostly landscapes and the panoramic feature works as advertised, enabling you to take up to a 360 degree shot in one pass! Close-ups are also astounding, without even enabling a macro feature. As mentioned by another reviewer, the on/off switch does seem flimsy but at least you won’t turn it on or off accidentally. It’s also bigger and bulkier and hard to find a case for – I ended up ordering a Tamrac 5210 from Cameta Camera on Ebay which should fit. If you buy this camera and use a UV filter at all times as I do to protect the lens, follow one reviewer’s recommendation and get a quality multi-coated glass filter like the Sigma, because cheap filters can affect the clarity. I bought a set of Vivitar filters for my wife’s Canon from Digital Goya through Amazon and they seem fine but I opted for the more expensive Sigma for my Panasonic. To summarize, don’t believe everything you read. Different cameras perform differently under different conditions with different settings. Decide what’s important  to you and try several if you can. I’d be perfectly happy with another Canon SX50; it’s a great camera, but I’m glad I took a leap of faith and bought the Panasonic. No more film, no more lens changing, and I sold my Nikon and a Samsung camcorder which more than paid for the Panasonic – I’m a happy camper. If you’re a professional, neither will probably replace your SLR or DSLR or camcorder, but for the rest of us, these open a whole new world of photography.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: What a fun camera with loads of settings.  And if you like shooting birds and other outdoor distance things, you will love this camera.  Should be illegal with the zoom on this camera.  Stabilizer works great for optical distance, but IQ suffers when you extend the zoom.  And it really extends.  Try changing the size of the mps and it will go to super extreme tele distanc es.  Do not count on dslr IQ, but sure is fun to check out the distance things because it is not a dslr.  Have fun with this camera.  I am.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is my first real camera. I wanted something with a decent macro mode to take pictures of the tiny clay sculptures I make.,I knew I wanted a point and shoot so I wouldn't be too overwhelmed.,It took a couple days to become familiar with the settings but I'm happy!,The manual focus is great for tiny things (that don't move) and the fact it can be within 1cm away for the macro mode is helpful.,I use auto focus macro for some spider photography I've been doing for fun and it works pretty well.,My main problem with this camera is how grainy the photos are even in natural lighting coming through the window.,It seems to really need that direct sunlight.

This is an amazing deal. To anyone just starting out in photography or doing this for fun, don't pass up on this offer. The product came complete as it is in the ad. I recommend. If the person can take a course to learn how to use the camera is better.

Because of this MEGA SCAM I trust more in the reliability of a torn condom over the "aberg best" product line.  Not sure sure how it got 3.5 stars, I am thinking Russian hackers...and even they couldn't bring themselves to give it 4 stars.,I'am probably going to keep it in a vehicle, for one of those "just in case" moments when a camera may be used as an object to be thrown as a distraction, or be used as door stopper.,Seriously dont spend your money on this camera...
