review: Can I leave no Stars?? Really really bad. Bad build quality. Hard to use. Bad picture quality. Complete and total piece of junk.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: i needed a new camera after my phone broke. my phone had 16mp and since this camera had 21mp i thought it would be perfect, especially since the reviews said it was so good. it's not. the flash is awful..if you use it everything is blindingly white. but if you don't use it, everything is dark, discolored, and not anywhere as crisp as i hoped. i found out that you have to set it to 21mp in the settings or it's automatically on it's lowest, 5mp, but for 21mp it's a real disappointment. my old phone with an 8mp camera takes about the same quality pictures. i ended up giving it to my 4 year old.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this as a replacement for  Canon I'd bought my wife a few years ago that just quit working after hardly any use at all. I have an old Canon Powershot that has taken a beating and kept ticking, but the newer models don't seem to be as tough and aren't repairable at all. The firmware on this  camera is surprisingly decent. It has locked up on me once and simply removing the battery to reboot fixed that. The included spare battery is a very nice and useful surprise. Charging is fairly quick and when the camera is charged the red LED shuts off. Battery longevity is good to excellent. Setup is, luckily, pretty intuitive, because the manual is laughable and about as helpful as a plague-infected Deer Tick.,It's not obvious from either the camera or the manual, but there is a cool lens change switch feature  just above the USB port that allows you to shift the camera from distance focus to close and it works very well. The camera's software, however, far exceeds the camera's lens quality and that is the consistent limiting factor in picture quality. It would be unreasonable to expect a high quality lens in a $35 camera, so don't. However, because of the ease of use, battery life, well-designed features, size, and convenience, I find myself grabbing this camera instead of my Powershot 2 out of 3 times I decide to take a picture. If we lose it or break it, it won't be a big financial loss and I'd probably buy another.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This would be a great "first camera" for a young kid. Cheap enough they could break it within a year and you won't even be mad (and definitely cheaper than letting them use your phone camera), simple enough that they won't be overwhelmed, but still handling mostly like a typical digital camera so if/when they step-up to something a bit more feature-heavy they're going to feel comfortable and familiar. The landscape/zoom quality is horrid, but the macro mode on close-up objects did ok. The menu navigation is simple and fairly intuitive.,The 21 megapixel claims are meaningless - the sensor is tiiiiiny so there's not enough data to meaningfully fill in all those pixels. Picture quality is actually more like 10mp in most lighting conditions, and even in bright light I'd only say 12mp equivalent on landscape shots.,There's no control (like half-pressing the shutter button) that will show where the picture focus is. The view display is grainy enough that it's hard to tell just by looking, and there doesn't seem to be a way to zoom in in"view taken pictures" mode to check focus after the fact. So just, point, click, and hope for the best.,If you're an adult looking for a cheap pocket camera you're not going to cry about losing, I ended up getting the Coolpix A10 for about twice as much as this thing (and that's without ANY accessories), but the A10 has some optical zoom and a bigger sensor so average picture quality is better even though it has less nominal mp.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Ordered this as gift for my daughter. Tested it out before giving it to her and installed a formatted card. I was able to take 2 pictures and then I noticed the picture count go from 1000+ to 0. Went to review the pics and the camera showed no pics available. I tried a second formatted memory card and got the same results. Returned for full refund. I do not recommend this camera

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: We bought three of these for the kids to take out west on vacation. All three performed as expected, really no issues. Picture quality is just ok. Not extremely to use, Takes a couple minutes to figure out how to navigate. Sound quality is horrendous.  When you un-box it your going to think, Oh man, What did I do? Mainly because the camera itself feels like its going to disintegrate in your hand it's so cheap and lighter than you think a camera should ever be. But, If you are buying a first camera, A throw away camera or intentionally looking to buy a cheap camera. This is your guy. We knew when we purchased these the kids were not going to take care of them anyway. If they made it for the two week vacation, Hey, Thank the Lord. And they did, all three. I would never buy this camera as my main camera or maybe even as a backup if I had a choice. You really get what you pay for in this case. But, they worked, At this point one is currently lost, were down to one charging cable and lost 2 out of 6 batteries. Perfect purchase for us.......  Hope this helps.....

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I wanted a camera for everyday frequent use other than a smartphone.  I first ran into the problem when I couldn't take any pictures.  I thought that it needed a sd card so I put one in.  The problem was "card error" in red letters.  I then made the mistake of thinking there was something wrong with my sd card.  I ordered another sd card with the same effect "card error"  I did try to format many times with both sd cards with no success.  I passed my time limit to return this camera so I am now warning others in case they make the same mistake that I made.  This camera may not have cost much but if it doesn't work then my money went straight into the trash.  I can't even donate it to charity because I know it doesn't work.  Very disappointed.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I love taking pictures on trip, but my phone isn't usually high enough quality and I don't want to lug around my big DSLR and worry about it getting hurt. This camera is small and portable so I don't have to worry about it taking up a bunch of space. It doesn't come with a memory card, so be aware of that, but with the price difference between this and other small cameras, you can definitely afford to get a memory card. It comes with a wrist strap, carrying pouch, a charger, and two batteries. This is perfect for trips where you don't have enough space for a bigger camera!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Bought this for my 8 year old granddaughter and she loves it. She is still learning it isn't a toy, so she has to keep it away from her baby sister so it doesn't get broke. Doesn't want to put it down.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I recently purchased this bundle and I have to say I am very happy!  The seller is prompt and professional.  The price and quality is AMAZING for all that's included.  The only thing that i had to buy separately waa a neck strap but thats because i prefer that to the included wrist strap.  Its a point and shoot so when zooming it does take a little long to focus but that's a common issue with point and shoots. Overall its a great buy.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: The whole kit was exactly what i expected from the information given by The Imaging World. I was contacted by a Joel Weiss from The Imaging World after my order arrived asking if it was satisfactory. The level of customer service and Professionalism is outstanding. Will be making the Imaging World my primary supplier for Photo equipment.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: It looks nice but since no memory card comes with it I cannot use it until I find one.  This is very poor salesmanship and very frustrating. Then I have to download a different use manual than the one in the received package.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Awesome bundle and great camera! We have been playing with it for a few days and absolutely love it!  The extra battery and car charger were great additions that will prove very very handy. The only negative thing I can say about the package is that it did not come with a lanyard to hang the camera from your neck.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I received this product as a Christmas gift so haven't used it too much yet but so far fits my needs and seems to be what I wanted for a camera. My last camera was also Canon so it is familiar to me. The more powerful zoom was specifically what I was looking for and this camera appears to fit the bill. The accessories are great and is a good value for the price.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: We are excited get start using this camera.  Everything arrive as described, 2 SD cards, tripod, 2 batteries with chargers, carrying case, lens care products and nearly ALL of it fits in the case!  Of course you don’t need all of it to, but for travel purposes, its great to have.  I will post more once we put it into good use  ready to try the wifi upload feature!,1 week - took pictures at grandson’s birthday party and then shared pics to daughter to her  IPhone!  Easy as pie!  The more we play with - it the more we like it!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Just got camera, unpacking everything looks very confusing.  The owners manual is very small with very small print and icon pics are so small even young adults with good eyesight have trouble seeing them clearly. For me as an older adult with reading glasses it is hopeless.  Also they want you to upload photo's after downloading their wifi program so if you think you will be able to link to your computer think again. The process is confusing and frustrating. Be ready.  I don't know if it takes decent photos yet since I can't upload them. I would have traded all the silly addons for one upload cable.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I returned it. The pictures were worse than my iphone.  I bought a refurbished Canon  EOS T6.  It's great.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: We found that this camera didn’t perform as well as we’d hoped. The accessories that came with it were awesome but the actual picture taking wasn’t great, our phones took better pictures than this!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: This camera arrived as describe.  It was intact as promised.  The camera works quite well although I did not receive it until 2 days ago and am just now becoming familiar with it.  There are many modes to learn but I think it will be a fine addition to my needs.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Camera has issues with low light situations. Colors sometimes are off because of it. It's a nice size and has some decent features - but I wouldn't buy one again.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this for a vacation thinking a dedicated point and shoot might provide better photographs than my cell phone. Quickly learned thats not the case and point and shoot cameras like this have become obsolete. The only benefit this really gives is a true optical zoom but with fairly poor auto focus its a moot point. Pass on this, either stick with your smartphone or pony up and get a compact SLR camera

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I know it got great reviews, but I hated it.  The camera felt cheap.  The photos I took looked like photos I would have taken with a point and shoot camera 10 years ago, complete with the flash bulb that washes out faces.  I guess I was expecting more from a digital camera in 2015.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this as a Christmas gift to be used on a trip right after Christmas. Reviews looked decent. Half the videos and half the pictures are very blurry. It continues to refocus. I would not buy it again!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Perfect for my 9 year old! I didn't want to spend a fortune on a camera for him in case he loses it, and this had such great reviews so I thought I'd give it a try. It takes very clear pictures and it's light weight. I hope he doesn't end up losing it! Great camera, especially for the price!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera to use for an outdoor exploration group with kids. Upon opening it we had problems with the picture focusing and kept getting a message to turn on/off the power. Could never get the camera to work properly.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I love this little camera. I live where there is a lot of moisture in the air and my first camera, of the same type, stopped working within three months. Even so I replaced it with the same model because this camera takes such nice photos so effortlessly. I especially like the panorama setting. I recommend this camera for anyone wanting to take quick, high quality photos.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: There is no way this camera has a 20mp lens. My iphone 7 plus has Way better quality pics and stabilization. Do your self a favor and go with a nikkon.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: The only reason this is getting 4 stars and not 5 is I think the zoom could be a little better. I had the zoom maxed at my son's graduation and a few pics blurred, and I wish it zoomed a bit closer. Other than that, I am super impressed with the quality of pics 9 out of 10 times! For the price, I was willing to compromise with the zoom only being 5X. Overall this is an awesome little camera!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Takes great pictures (pixel rate is comparable to some of the better iphones).  Comfortable to carry and holds a charge all day.  Great purchase.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Overall, it's a great little camera, compact and totable. I have trouble focusing on zoomed-in images, however, something I've not had with other Canon cameras. This could be the camera, could be something I've yet to learn. However, I did get awesome pictures on a recent trip.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought this for my 11 year old daughter for xmas, she wanted a Polaroid but I couldnt see continually spending $$$ on the film, so I opted for this. She loves it and can take videos as well.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: The camera was bought for my son. He loved it as it was very simple to use. However, the lens cover stopped working and the lens has been left partly exposed after every camera session. This was disappointing. But the camera has seemed to perform well otherwise.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Well. It's palstic. So of course I was disappointed about that fact. None of the canon cameras I've owner have been like this. But...it is a canon. So there is that.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Most of the time use phone but were going for a hiking to Glacier and to Nepal so ordered it.  It worked for a week during Glacier trip but when tried to turn on during Nepal trip camera will not turn on. Cheaply made.  Should have ordered from Costco so I could return it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera is good for zooming in on close-up shots, or general picture taking.  For a take-along on vacation, it worked well for me.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: not as good as the Nikon it replaced

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought this camera to replace the one that was dropped and badly damaged .,  wife uses it ,despite her poor grip , she can hold it and has taken a few photos , all came out well !

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera surprised me. It takes better quality photos than I expected, is easy to operate, and battery life is very impressive. Excellent value.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: So disappointed!  Bought this camera for vacation and it stopped dead shortly after the vacation began.  Bought it in May and cannot find the option to return it!  It should not die this soon after purchase.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Pitched as a replacement for the D750; have one, no it's not. Focusing is way, way better than Fuji but not at D750 levels. IQ is really good, just like the D750. But white balance flips out often. Battery like stinks but that's mirrorless for ya.,Great camera, adapter lets my dozen Nikkor lenses work perfectly. Firmware updates (I hope) will fix the problems in time.,Size is FANTASTIC!!!

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I've had this camera for about a month now and feel like I've put it through enough scenarios to write a semi-informed review.,Overall I'm very pleased with the purchase and the performance of this mirrorless body.  The image quality is absolutely top notch.  The sensor and dynamic range combine to produce stunning images.  It handles low light/high ISO extremely well with the ability to venture into the 10,000 ISO and above without any hesitation.,The EVF is amazing, there's no lag and the view is sharp and accurate with regard to exposure and color white balance.,The XQD card technology is very fast and dependable.  I also enjoy the ergonomics of this body - it feels great in the hand and the button placements are spot on.,I'm currently using the FTZ adapter to utilize all my current F mount glass.  I'm not crazy about the extra weight and length this adds, but it's a necessity for the time being.  Over time I plan to switch to the native Z glass, whenever Nikon starts to release faster versions of the essential lens (ie. 70-200 f/2.8, etc...),Focus has been probably the weakest part of this camera.  Low light focusing isn't as good as DSLR.  The contrast detection system has a hard time grabbing focus on low contrast areas of the frame.  Also, the focus area modes are barely adequate.  Coming from D600 body, I miss my 3D modes and the ability to track fast moving objects.  The included focus modes on the Z6 are a bit tricky to get used to.,Battery life is lacking as compared to previous DSLR bodies.  I am able to use the camera on and off for most of the day if I'm just shooting my family events or out shooting a few landscape shots.  The battery will last fine for a typical family portrait session.  I'm concerned with shooting an entire wedding, as I have a feeling I'll be switching out batteris every couple hours.,Automatic JPEG transfer to iPhone via Snapbridge app and Bluetooth is useful and works quite well.  It's very handy to be able to shoot and share to social media quickly.  It works flawlessly and fairly quickly (JPEG transfers within about 15 sec.),Wireless transfer to PC via WiFi is a pain in the neck, is slow and buggy and very unreliable.  I may have a firewall or AV issue that's blocking the connection, but so far, I've only been successful at transferring to PC about 2 out of 20 times I've attempted it.  Setup of the PC connection is troublesome, confusing and buggy.,For the price, I have been very impressed with this new mirrorless tech from Nikon and always look forward to picking it up and going out shooting!

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I have owned the Z 6 now for about six months. It has quickly become my favorite camera and my first pick when I am selecting a camera to use. About me: I am a hybrid shooter. I shoot run and gun style family videos, timelapse, and the night sky. I have only shot on Nikon cameras as my support system all use Nikon professionally and will let me try out their glass before I purchase.  I have personally owned the D610 and still own D810 and D850.,Pros:,light,Z lenses (love the silent video autofocus),video autofocus,Sharp EVF,low light performance,IBIS-VR,Cons:,Lack of native, wide, fast lenses,EVF and monitor brightness difference,First off, I want to address the biggest complaint I have heard about this camera — dual card slots. Most of my cameras have had dual card slots, and I find myself using the second slot not to shoot redundant but to separate video and photo or as overflow for when I fill the first card. This was nice because as I purchased higher MP cameras, I did not buy larger cards, so it was nice to have the overflow onto the second card.  With my introduction to the XQD card on the D850, I choose to get 120 GB cards. They are expensive, but they are much faster. I would rather unload a full XQD card as compared to an SD card. Even the latest generation SD cards that I own are at least 1/3rd slower than my XQD card.,I love how light this camera is. When paired with f2.8 glass, this weight difference is not night and day different. However, when paired with the F-mount 50 f1.8 lens (my favorite adapted lens), the Z 6 is very light and very capable.,My favorite capability of the new system is the video autofocus. As a Nikon user who is not expert in manual focus, I love this feature. Nikon will continue to improve the autofocus system as shown by their efforts to add eye-AF. In close shots I think this AF system excels, I hope that future firmware updates will increase the functionality at further distances.,I find the in body VR to be very helpful. I am now hand holding shoots that I would have previously skipped without a tripod. When paired with a Z-mount lens, VR is improved even further.,Speaking of the z-mount lenses, they are the perfect partners to this new system. ESPECIALLY when it comes to AF and video! Silent AF paired with negligible focus breathing is fantastic! The 24-70 f2.8 s was my first native lens, but it won't be my last.,As mentioned earlier, I love shooting the night sky. To shoot without tracking, this requires a wide, fast lens. That is something this system lacks. I have used the 14-24 f2.8 f-mount adapted. This combo does give outstanding results. The adapter is just one more thing to pack/forget, which is why I am looking forward to the day a high performing native lens is available for astro on the Z-mount.,The display is super sharp, which makes checking focus on stars very easy.  When shooting the night sky, I use a loupe for checking focus on the D850 and D810. I found that the loupe is not needed on the Z 6. Additionally, the night sky is made easier with ISO invariance and improved performance (dual native?) at ISO 800.,As lenses will resolve with time, my only real con is the difference in brightness on the EVF and the monitor. Even on the lowest setting, I think the EVF is too bright and shows a picture brighter (higher exposure) than it will be exposed.  I think the monitor is accurate, but the EVF is too bright.,I wish they were matched in brightness.,Overall, I love this system. It has hiccups just like any system, but for my style of shooting it is excellent. I have no reservations saying to buy it. It is not going to make you a stand up videographer/photographer, no camera can. However, it makes the experience enjoyable for me, which means I am practicing more.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Since it was mirrorless I assumed it would be smaller and lighter.  Wrong.  Sent it back and bought the Fujifilm X-T3 which is much lighter and a better camera for the money.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I love my Z6. It replaced a Fuji X-T2 that I shot (stills, rarely video) primarily with the pro-level 16-55mm f2.8 when traveling. I'm not a pro, nor am I coming from another full frame camera. The pics from the Z6 are far superior to the X-T2...better dynamic range, less noise (especially in low light), and the in-body image stabilization is fantastic. The 24-70 f4 kit lens is amazingly sharp. I think the Fuji Jpegs had slightly better color right out of the camera, but I always shoot and develop raw, so that doesn't matter to me, nor does the single card slot. Other things I like...lightweight, good control layout and grip for my big hands, good customization options, bright clear viewfinder. So far I find battery life at least double what is rated in the manual.  Negatives...no live highlight warning when shooting stills (it is in the play mode), kit lens has some vignetteing wide open (easy to fix in post), the customizable focus ring is a little too sensitive and easy to move accidentally (I deactivated it unless in manual focus mode). I haven't had any autofocus complaints, but I'm mostly shooting slow or static subjects in decent light. What low light focusing I've done has been fine. I haven't had any banding issues in post-production, where I rarely lift shadows more than 2 stops. 3 max. One warning...I was using Capture One version 12 in post, and I found the software would not apply the lens correction metadata embedded by the camera, so...the raw files looked terrible. I though it was the camera at first. I was very disappointed. Then I confirmed the issue with Phase One and subsequently switched to Lightroom. Problem solved. So, be prepared for disappointment if you're using Capture One 12.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: After buying one Z6 and using it on jobs and loving it. I sold all my DSLR cameras and picked up a second Z6. I have shooting all my wedding and portrait jobs with them and it works great. Super clear high ISO images.,All my older F mount Nikon lens work great on it and seem to be much sharper now they ever on any of my DSLRs.,I love the exposure comp live view and image playback in the viewfinder.,I do not see myself ever owning a DSLR again.,I have shot in low light, bright sun and into the sun with backlit subjects and the Z6 is fantastic. Shot weddings, Portraits, Sports and just fun stuff with it. This is a quality workhorse camera.,Battery life is great one of my last shoots I shot over 1000 images and the battery was not even at half yet.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I switched to this camera from a Nikon D 3 and still have a Nikon D 810 as my backup.  Never looked back.  This camera is amazing.  Unless you need razor sharp, large poster size images measured in feet and not inches, you don’t need to buy a Z 7.  This Z 6, combined with quality Nikkor lenses, delivers outstanding results with Z lenses as well as my F mount Nikkor lenses and the FTZ adaptor.  I am considering trading in my D 810 for a D 850.  In my opinion, I would then have an absolute, best of the best combo!

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: his is EVERYTHING a Nikon has needed to be since the digital age began. Lighting fast focus, super light body, tack sharp 24-70 factory glass that sees in the dark! Havent touched my D810 since!

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Bought the filmmakers kit from amazon... The Moza articulating arm broke almost with first use.  Contacted Nikon....they send to send it in....I did....at my expense after this 5k investment.....they after a few weeks after receiving it.....said they don't support moza products......and after I emailed them to return my broken articulating arm......finally did so.......Moza hasn't responded to my inquiry..........Buyer be ware!!!  Also......paid amazon for the insurance so I guesss that my next amount of wasted effort to just get what I paid for!!!

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Bought the Z6 for filmmaking and it doesn't disappoint at all plus a future firmware update will allow you to shoot full frame RAW!!! Takes great pictures too and the Auto/Eye focus update just came out... Buy this camera!!!!!!!!!!!!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Just as described. Nice little point and shoot camera with the resolution to give my pics on Ebay a nice crisp look.,Camera phones only go so far this is so much better quality.Shipping was extremely quick and packing was fine. I downloaded the guide from Sony online and am good to go.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: 3 Stars,Has a non universal USB port.  Great little camera, but I don't like the fact that it dosen't use a standard Mini or micro USB port.  At 20MP 5152 x 3864 resolutions the camera does a great job indoors with the flash and assuming the object is close to the camera as well as outdoor lighting.  Image quality is great for the price.  The picture size is average around 8MB compared to an I-Phone 6 at 2MB.,Pros.,Image Quality is better than expected for this price.,Does have 8x opical zoom,Cons.,Does not use a standard micro or even a mini USB like everything else I have.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I was needing a small camera for product photography. I have a dslr, but wanted something smaller and comparable to a smart phone when it comes to quality and portability. After much research, I settled on the Sony DSCW830. Partially because of the reviews & price, and partially because my current dslr is a older Sony model which has a similar menu. I've already taken a bunch of test shots with it, and so far I'm really digging it. Now, don't get me wrong, this wont replace your dslr camera. I wouldn't use this to take action shots. This would not be my "go to" camera on Christmas morning, as it takes entirely too long for it to snap the picture ... However, for my needs it's perfect. The macro setting is where this camera really shines, as it takes very crisp photos of small subjects. It also seems to perform well for taking shots where the subject can sit still and pose for you. The video quality is more than sufficient and seems just as good, if not better than most smart phones. The battery life is good for this size of camera, and it charges up pretty quickly. All in all, it's a good little budget friendly camera if you use it for the right things.,Pros-,Size,Value,Quality,Easy menu system,Good for shooting 'still' subjects,Cons-,Doesn't come with a case,Not good for taking action shots

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I had an older Sony digital camera (14 MP) which was significantly superior to this version.,Unfortunately, I dropped it on a rock and it stopped working, that was the reason for buying this camera. I am not very happy with this newer version.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Excellent camera. I bought it for my wife for Christmas and she almost seems like it grew from her hand. She loves it.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The camera seems OK, but the light that is supposed to indicate it is charging does not come on.  The seller claims they do not do "trouble shooting", as if somehow the light can be made to come on, so they said I should contact Sony.  I don't see the point in exchanging the camera, since another one might have worse problems.  Perhaps there is a quality control issue here.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: ordered the camera last month and discovered after downloading photos that there appeared to be a "black smudge" in the upper left corner of each picture.  I returned the camera this week and have already received a replacement, but noticed that there is a shadow (pink-colored) in the view finder when taking pictures.  As yet, I have not confirmed that this shows up in the final pictures, but am disappointed that I'm still having some issues with this camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This replaced a Nikon I had. I had lots of issues with the Nikon cool shots. I decided to go to a sony. Seems like a good camera. Had if for a while now and its good easy to use. Much like the cool shots.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: A truly awesome camera. I have a medical condition that makes my hands shaky. I am trying to take pictures of items I am selling, but the pictures came out so blurry, they were unusable. I was very frustrated. Whit this Sony camera with "Optical Steady Shot image Stabilization" I can take good picture again. Most of my pictures are not only clearer, but many of my pictures bring out amazing details. I could not begin to talk about the many other features, a truly great camera at a very good price.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This was a gift for my daughter and she loves it. She thinks it's really kewl that when she pointed it at her baby sister it said "hey that's a baby!" and it switched to baby mode. Not kidding. It does take beautiful pictures!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Kinda tricky to learn how to use the settings on this even with the instruction book, but otherwise it's a really good and affordable camera. I haven't had any issues with it at all.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Good size and takes great pictures as long as you don;t get bumped or move the hand holding the camera.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: It takes great pictures for an inexpensive camera. My 7 year old can use it quite easily. The only complaint is that it absolutely DEVOURS standard alkaline batteries.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)

We were buying it for our kids to use at camp this summer. Still, even with the cost, disappointed it wouldn't work straight out of the box. We'll be returning it and buying a different brand.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Excellent camera much lighter than my nikon d750 and easier to use manually. Highly recommend

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I’m just gonna say, it’s a great camera!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Nice best camera I ever owned and I’ve tried a lot of them

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I just received a new XT3 body from Amazon and it does not exhibit any of the problems I had with the first. I am eager to try it out in the field tomorrow but initial impressions are positive.,I purchased and used the Fuji X-T3 for 5 days. I returned the camera for a refund today. I also own the Fuji Xt2 and Xt1 along with 7 of the Fuji lenses. I love Fuji stuff for the image and build quality and small form factor. I hope my disappointing experience with the Xt3 can be attributed to early build issues that get solved with more manufacturing time. My issues are as follows:,1. Everytime I switched on the camera, I received a message to use the NP-W126S battery, which was the battery loaded in the body and the same one the camera was shipped with. Even substituting another spare NP-W126S battery gave me the same warning every time the camera was switched on. Not only was this annoying, it also made it impossible to shoot images until the message cleared out.,2. Each time that I swapped out the battery, the camera lost all its initial settings like date, time and connection with the Fuji app.,3. The straw that broke the camel’s back for me was when the auto focus preferences that I stored were lost during one of these battery swaps and I wound up shooting a day’s worth of images completely out of focus.,I did perform a firmware update prior to using this camera, so I could only conclude that I had issues that would require more time and patience to solve than I possess. I must admit that I liked the way the camera handled, particularly for action shooting, so I hope my experience was an isolated example. Nevertheless, this was a frustrating experience for me.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: You get the best stills and 4k video from one camera. Bought this XT-3 to replace my Canon.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Oh my god!  This takes the XT2, already the best camera I’ve ever used, and takes it to an entirely new level!  Fantastic!,This camera, and it’s already existing incredible lens collection, makes the Canon and Nikon mirrorless offerings look pretty pathetic.  This generation of serious cameras now solidly belongs to Fuji and Sony.,Get one!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Great, but short battery life

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: perfect

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Incredible

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: What can I say, all the hype about this camera is well deserved. There is nothing I can add to what every other and reviewer has already said, so I just wanted to give it my 5 star rating because it surely deserves it.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I upgraded from the first-gen A7R. I knew there would be huge improvements, but boy oh boy, everything is just so much better. Thought I would miss the lack of AA filter, but nope, photos are pretty darn sharp.,Go read pro reviews if you want in-depth analysis of how amazing this camera is.,P.S. Check out my cute dog!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: the auto focus is outstanding on this thing. Took very professional photos at my daughter's birthday

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I’ve had the A7M3 since May 2018, I wanted to take good IQ pictures during family vacations in July. This camera is absolutely worth every penny, it helps a hobbyist like me, take astonishing pictures. (You still have to study and practice) love the camera, and the lenses are just fantastic.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: If you use non Sony batteries, 30 secs after start / wake up, the camera will freeze until you acknowledge the batteries are not Sony. The forced acknowledgment has ruined multiple videos of my family, as well as pictures I’ve tried to capture on the fly. Very uncustomer focused decision by Sony and disappointing. The first thing I need my camera to do is capture fleeting moments.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Theres something about full frame that makes it different from the others. Its really what you need to get that extra oomph in quality to put you up there with other big youtubers. (ofc I have used apsc sensors for years now so I am able to appreciate the larger sensor. Being dark skinned, I also cant get enough of how pleasurable the low light performance is even in adequate light. The color science too is much better for skin than my 6400.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Exactly what it appears to be, nothing more.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Extremely satisfied with this purchase, specially coming from a NIKON ASP-C. Despite having to start from scratch with lenses, this full frame mirrorless camera is totally worth it. The best feature is definitely the Eye Focus as it delivers amazing results when taking portraits. I elected to by the camera body only because I wanted to purchase a better quality lens than what’s included in the package with the lens kit. I know have the Tamron 28-75 f2.8 and I couldn’t be happier with the images I am able to capture with this set up.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This is a good camera!!!! Exellent, well I wish more megapixels but for the money Is more than I expected. This is so great for videos the Slow motion its really good I like it. I enjoy every photoshoot with this camera.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This camera is renowned and well-reviewed by now, but it really is amazing. The quality is superb. It's durable. The customizability is out of this world. I have two for my interview setups and they're brilliant.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I like the camera a lot. Battery life was excellent. My only complaint is with the kit lens. Picture quality isn’t as sharp as it could be and the speed of the autofocus has trouble tracking a moving target.,Otherwise amazing camera.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Just returned from a 17-day vacation in Scandinavia, for which I purchased this new camera.  It takes excellent photographs, and the 60x optical zoom is amazing.  What is particularly surprising, and useful, is its ability to take great photos in dim light, without using the built-in flash; this was especially helpful in certain museum locations where flash was forbidden. It autofocuses very quickly as well. Sighting of the subject can be done by using the LCD screen (which is quite bright, even in bright sunlight) or, with the push of a button, through the small sighting slot just below the flash.  The flash, incidentally, must be manually raised and lowered for use, but this is quite easy and quickly done.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera for a recent trip across the southwest US. My first impression was that this camera is a bit bulkier than I expected. It is basically the same size as a DSLR, while many bridge cameras are smaller. The handgrip is good and it feels good and balanced when held.,The photo quality is just awesome. I am no professional by any means, but I do appreciate the quality of this camera and the photos it produces.,The things that I used quite a bit on the trip were the dedicated video button (you can start video recording at any time), photos during video (while recording, just snap pictures like normal) and the incredible zoom. While at the Grand Canyon especially, we used the zoom like a digital telescope to investigate things. I was sort of concerned that I wouldn't really use this camera's zooming capabilities, but I quickly found that I was capturing things and getting great crisp close ups of things that I would have passed on with my old digital camera; especially wildlife that we couldn't physically get close to. By the quality and clarity of the photos, you'd never know I was at least 50 to 100 yards away for many shots. The stabilization is outstanding, so at extreme zooms, you can count on crispness.,Another great thing that I noticed is how quickly the camera could get from a standing start - meaning turned off to on, then booted up, then zoomed, then focused, then capturing the photo. On our trip, many things would just happen quickly and getting the picture required a quick camera. My wife gave up trying to use her Samsung S3 to get any quick photos because I could grab the camera and complete a picture with the FZ70 in about 3 seconds, no kidding. It's like boom, it's on and ready.,I'm having some trouble forcing the flash on like the manual states. I have created my own program setting to accomplish this. I played with manual exposure settings to get some interesting effects. I tried to set it for extra long exposure times for star photos, but so far I can only get it to 60 seconds. There is a ton of options and settings, so I need to dig more.,Battery life is good and the camera feels rugged, yet not too heavy. I'm very pleased with this camera and it is a good buy for the money.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've been using this camera for about 3-weeks and think it great! Oh, I could have spent twice the money on a "better" camera, but for my needs and the way I use a camera this one is just perfect. And, it seems - so far - the camera very well made. Note: I've owned Lumix cameras before so the learning curve (how to use the camera) is shorter. I'm very happy with my purchase...,A note on Amazons' packing... I was not at all happy with the packing. Amazon packed the FX70 in a box 3-times larger that the camera box and the amount of packaging material was next to nothing. So, the camera and the factory box rattled around inside the 'too large' Amazon box during,shipping. Luckily the factory box 'absorbed' any problems so the camera undamaged.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Great camera, absolutely amazing zoom.  We have had previous Lumix cameras, this one is the best one yet. And the zoom.. well, let's just say you can overdo that easily, it zooms so far.  Some great photos of very distant objects that look like we have an external telephoto lens on.  Just a great camera so far.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is the second Panasonic DMC camera I purchased. I bought the DMC-FZ18 (8mp, 18X optical zoom) in 2007 and took some wonderful pictures with it. I love the EVF on both cameras., I made the mistake of putting a different brand on my wish list. Hubby surprised me on Christmas day with the other brand. I played with it but  realized it was so so good as the Panasonic brand. The other brand was returned and I ordered the FZ70 for next day delivery.,The other brand used 4 AA batteries that just didn't last.  Yes, there are rechargeable AA batteries I could purchase, but it's awkward carrying around multiple batteries like that. Two batteries had to be placed positive side up and two negative side up, but the diagram wasn't clearly marked under the battery door. The battery door felt flimsy and it was awkward to open. Lastly, I had trouble with the lens cap staying on the lens.,I like how Panasonic compartments have a way to keep the lithium ion rechargeable battery pack locked into position when the door opens. The charger and the battery pack are compact and not cumbersome to use.  There is only one way the battery can be inserted because of its shape., There are a lot more bells and whistles with the FZ70 but I don't plan to learn it all over night. I hope this digital camera lasts at least as long as the FZ18.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: If you do not need a DSLR camera and want a very good general all round camera for nature or sport photography, the Lumix FZ80 is one of the best. The price for what you get is also very attractive. Use of the program is also easy to follow and understand. Image stabilization for a 60X zoom is amazing, shake free pictures can be taken at maximum zoom if one has a reasonably steady hand.,The only improvement I would have liked is to have the camera splash resistant, but that would of course add to the price.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Just received the new Fz80 yesterday and took it out today for a trail run. Did very well it takes excellent pictures has good focus speed especially for the price has a very nice zoom range is comfortable to hold, body seems solid zoom is quick it will be a good addition to my other cameras. Took it out to a couple of ponds today for bird and duck photos and got some nice shots It is easy to use has a host of great features which include the ability to take 4K videos and photos excellent entry level bridge camera :)

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: After having a small Sony Cybershot with only a 3X zoom (which actually took great pics), I decided to upgrade to another point and shoot with more zoom.  Looked around and researched similar cameras from Canon, Fuji, Sony, and Nikon, but decided on the Panasonic due to the wide angle feature.  I'm not a pro and probably will never use half of the features of this camera or even understand what they all mean.  I just want to put it in auto and go take pics.  Have already taken several hundred pics and I am very, very satisfied with this camera.  It takes awesome landscapes in low power/wide angle (my favorite pics to take) with awesome colors, crisp and sharp.  The zoom is phenominal and even with a tripod or monopod, you do lose some quality when zoomed all the way out, but still are good pics.  Although slightly larger than the other cameras, I like the size and ease of handling.  Really, the only negative I can think of is finding your way through the different menus and what all of the buttons and dials do... a little confusing, but I'm sure reading the electronic manual and using the camera over time will make it easier.  For the price, this camera is excellent and I recommend it, just don't expect it to be perfect in all areas and take pics like a high end camera. It's a point and shoot super-zoom that costs a couple hundred, to that end, it does an outstanding job IMO.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Excellent Camera. Very much impressed with battery life. I have many cameras whose battery life lasts maximum 2 hours. But this camera's battery did not completely drain even after continuously recording video for 4 hours. Video is excellent. I love this camera. Highly recommend to others who are undecided about which camera they should buy. Price is also within $300 which is very impressive.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I had earlier purchased a Panasonic 18X zoom and was favorably impressed with its optics and functionality.  I waited for the next Panasonic, even while other powerful zooms made their appearance, because I had a hunch it would be worthwhile to do so.  Indeed it was, I brought FZ70 with expedited shipping, as I was heading out to SF to see my son, daughter-in-law, and grandchildren and I wanted to be able to test it out during the trip.,My son, as a surprise gift, bought my wife and myself tickets aboard a tour ship that went out into the SF harbor to watch the America's Cup.  Our distance ranged from 1/3 to 3/4 miles from the racing craft and the zoom gave me exceptional photos.  Not only did the image stabilization take care of my tremors, it also took care of the rolling of the tour ship!  I have a collection of truly impressive clear pictures that I only wish I could share with you.  This camera is truly an exceptional value.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This camera is good for kids and very basic beginners for pictures and videos. Disappointed overall.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Very simple and easy to use! It will be a great gift!

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This is a lightweight camera that is easy to use as a point and shoot but the picture quality of a DSLR.,It is also very user friendly and simple to use for people just getting started in photography!

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Its a rather simple camera easy to use, good for beginners. The packaging and shipping were all great, and they give all the acceceries you need to start off as a vlogger, the wide angle lens is very important and for the price its a great offer.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries

review: Bought it on last Saturday but i am in love with it. The size is perfect for traveling and the quality of the pictures is amazing. Can’t wait for my vacation so I can take the perfect picture for my 2019 adventure book.

review: I saw this $40.99 camera on Amazon, this is cheap and if my son drops it or damages it, I won't have any hard feeling. I don't expect much from it. This is powerful, sometimes I feel it is a bit too powerful and make the image a bit washout when it is too close to the object.,Usually with my other cameras, you can touch the lens easily and get the fingerprint mark on the lens. But the lens on this camera is very far back in the small hole, which you won't be able to get the finger to touch the camera lens. The LCD screen on the camera is not good, if you view the photo on the computer, the photo will be better than on the camera screen.,Photo quality is very reasonable for this cheap camera.

You still have to have a cd driver disk to transfer files to your computer so if like most  modern computers you dont have a cd reader you may have some issues. product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I'm not impressed with this camera. I purchased this camera for concerts, as they are becoming so stingy with what devices you bring into the place. I figured if it didnt have a lenses that zoomed then you wouldn't have an issue getting into the venue. While that aspect the item did work, I had ZERO issues getting into venue. THE CAMERA IS TERRIBLE. Terrible quality. Terrible audio, Terrible graphics, Terrible EVERYTHING. The buttons stick, and the camera is HARD TO OPERATE. And IM A NETWORK AND COMPUTER TECH! I've been RAISED AROUND TECHNOLOGY, and usually NEVER need instruction manuals. The manual is like a deciphering code book full of equations that you dont have or know the answers too, it doesnt explain ANYTHING! Just please do yourself a favor! DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!! It was a waste of my money and not worth my time.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: A digital camera at a reasonable price, I can take it on vacation. When I saw this camera, I really liked its smooth appearance. It was very light and had a belt around its wrist, which helped keep it stable when taking pictures. I like this camera with rechargeable batteries! The battery will last a long time before I recharge it again. I don't have to worry about buying batteries. That's good. You just charge it with the power cord attached to it and it's ready to use. The 3-inch LCD screen is so big that you can see the image clearly before taking a picture, which I like very much. It also makes it very easy to shoot videos. After a few days, I was very satisfied with my purchase. I watched all the pictures and videos I took with this camera, and the results were great! This camera not only meets my requirements, but also exceeds my expectations. If you are looking for a reasonable price digital camera, it can take very clear photos and high quality video, this is a camera for you!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This camera is very lightweight and easy to use. However, the main issues I've had had to do with the CD (I don't know if my CD-ROM drive is going bad or what...), but in installing the drivers so I can upload photos from the camera to my computer, the CD never started or the screen for installation didn't come up. I had to go looking for the installation folder to get it to run. Once I got installed, I opened it so that I could download the few photos I took. Unfortunately, it showed a camera that I no longer have, and even clicking refresh in Photags didn't bring up the ABcam/Aberg Best. I was not able to locate the SD card on my computer to manually upload the photos. When I clicked on the link to go to the manufacturer's website, I got a warning from Microsoft Edge saying that my IP/server had notified someone that I was trying to do something regarding pornography! In order for me to continue using the computer, I had to call the Windows Online Help in order to resolve the issues. There is no way of contacting the manufacturer to obtain help immediately. I need to purchase an SD card reader in order to upload the photos.,If you're wanting a camera that you'll have to take to Walmart or one of the many pharmacies with a photo area in order to get hard copies, this camera is ok. The other thing I'd noted is that when I took pictures using the 21MP setting, they appear blurry and out of focus when viewing them on the LCD screen. At the lower MP settings, they appear to be perfect! I've used the 14, 16 and 18MP settings. As soon as I am able to upload the photos to show the difference, I will do so.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This camera is easy to use But not good quality. Gunna return

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This is garbage.  Flash too slow, takes blurry pictures, and the buttons and on-screen icons are difficult to manipulate.  cheap plastic, not a good camera at all.

review: Honestly I expected better from a SONY camera plus it being a 20 mp.  It takes blurry pics when zoomed SOMETIMES, NOT ALWAYS and I have printed larger pics expecting higher quality from a 20 mp and they were grainy. This camera is also a very light, cheap feeling plastic. For the price, I'm keeping it, but still wish it did better.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera mainly for work purposes. I have a Cannon Rebel XS DSLR, and this camera in no way compares to the quality of it. Of course I wasn't expecting it to. For this review I will focus on indoor shots of about 25 feet or under. I will start by saying low light, and even no light, performance is excellent. I tested it in my completely dark bedroom and the picture turned out as if it were brightly lit. I will say now that the colors do trend on the warm side. Subject tracking is a nice feature, great for moving objects, such as pets, and for people who have had to much coffee. It has an "Easy Mode" which is great for good casual shots, but I think that it's a little TO simple. It simplifies the menu choices to one: large images or small images. I personally think they should had left all of the sizes selectable in this mode. Video is limited to 1280x720, but this is more than enough for close up movies. The rated battery life is fairly short at 100 minutes, but this is most likely due to the viewscreen. Additional batteries are, as of this review, under $13 for the Sony battery NP-BN1, and half that for generics, which is very inexpensive for a camera battery. It charges via a special USB cable, which I hate, instead of a standard USB Type B which all small electrical devices seem to charge from, so be careful that you don't damage it. The included AC Adapter connects through the USB cable as well, and outputs 0.5A, so it is no faster than charging it from any other USB source.,All in all I would say this is a great camera for taking pictures up close, under 20 feet ideally. It's compact size, portability, features, and low cost make it a great camera for close up shots. It's not close to a DSLR quality, and I wouldn't think about using it to record once in a lifetime memories, but it's also less than 10% of the cost of a DSLR, and a great item to have around.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Sham on soney, check on line, too many common problem, mine too so I returned it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)

review: A good camera for the money. Does it always focus well? No, but I'm not expecting it to be the same quality as my full size Nikon DSLR either. Good for concerts and sporting events were they won't allow me to carry my DSLR.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: i like sony cameras , like that it is small , offers panoramic, movie 720p and USB for charging. There is a few second delay every time i click which is somewhat annoying but most times the shot is OK.  Haven't worked out the 'continuous' yet?,I think this will work for me for my needs.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Bought this for my father because it was small & easy to use. Takes great photos. He loves it, so I'm happy. Only complaint is that it's NOT a touch screen.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This little camera packs a big punch.  I'm a Realtor and I wanted something small and I don't count on my phone for photos.  I have used this several times and have yet to have 1 bad picture.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Great camera...it arrived on time and well packaged. Supplier did a good job on everything including the price. Been using it to get photos of the gators behind my house. The female has a new litter of 6. Great camera and good speeds. I replaced my 10 mp camera with this one.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Almost broke it from the get go, because the "switch" to open and close the battery cover is so minute and not very obvious.  The manual is on-line and too cumbersome to try to print out.  So far appears to operate satisfactorily, but a chore trying to learn all of the features using the manual.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: For me, this is the perfect camera: a grab-point-shoot, with great resolution for any use, including the option to better crop hasty shots and still have plenty of pixel resolution for posting or printing. I like that I carry it in my pocket and even forget it is there. Camera phones then to be too jittery and although lighter, cameras are more difficult to hold steady than this Sony. A final feather in this bonnet is the name: Sony has meant qualty for a billion years, give or take a week or two.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Just love it, it is the same as I have that I actually broke and I couldn't have it fixed , I didn't know what I would do with out it, and I never thought I would ever find exactly what I had. What can I say, It just saved me,

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The best camera for the cheapest price you can find!  Have two!  Zeiss lense's will get good pictures from the bottom of a bottle of beer!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Haven't put it to use much yet, other than just messing around with some of the features while taking silly photos...but I love it already! It's small and discrete...I like that it's black so I'm not pulling out some outrageous pink camera anywhere... I can't wait to take it with me on my "no phones allowed" camping trip! I'm sure it'll take great pictures.,--- I will add that it doesn't come with a case or a memory card, but it wasn't too much extra to add those to the shopping cart.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Got as a Christmas present for my mom. This is a BEAUTIFUL small camera. If you are looking for a good quality point and shoot camera for a lowish price and a small body, this will be perfect for you.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Former Nikon N60 SLR and D200 DSLR owner, I have been holding out for Nikon's full frame mirrorless.  Like the title says, it is truly the best camera I've ever owned.  For the 1st time in my life, I have been able to take spectacular action photos in poorly lit high school basketball gyms.  I also purchased the full frame Nikkor Z 24-70mm lens with the body and also the FTZ adapter to use my old "C" size lenses.  I tried the FTZ adapter and it worked just fine, but after shooting full frame I'm struggling to go back.  It has taken some getting used to.  There has been a learning curve going from a D200 which has been fun to learn all the new features while still having the look and feel of a Nikon camera.  The one thing that is noticeably missing is the built-in flash (minor complaint).  It was either an oversight, or an attempt to go more Pro than Consumer.  I use fill flash alot and now have to carry along a much bigger external flash.  Overall, I'm very pleased with my Z6.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Got this for my fiance's Christmas present and she LOVES it.  She has a photo business and had been wanting a mirrorless camera for quite some time.  She wanted to wait for Nikon's version since she already has lots of money invested in their lenses and she said it was well worth the wait!  I notice a huge difference in photo quality with the Z6 - the focus is lightning fast and very accurate, it's great in low light, and it has a silent shutter mode that is really nice for weddings and other events.  The only drawbacks are having only one memory card slot, and less battery life, but otherwise this thing is as good or better than the D850 (minus a few megapixels)!

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I'm a filmmaker, not a photographer so I don't use anything in AUTO, most especially focus.  But for filmmaking and being able to output 10-bit 422 to the Atomos V is a brilliant and worthy combination.  With exception to the pricier Panasonic S1 this is as close to a digital cinema camera as you can get in a DSLR.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: XT1 type AF and yes high ISO is clean, if you like mushy pics with no details.  Sent back.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I ended up returning the camera, but I am very excited about the Nikon mirrorless future.,Pros: Best viewfinder so far.  You can see the exact picture you're going to take in the EVF.  It's bright, clear, and so much easier to manually focus with.,Cons: Poor battery life, solid, but lower end controls, feels more delicate and heavier than expected.,Conclusion: If Nikon upgraded the D850 to an EVF I'd sell my soul for it.  Can't wait to see what semi pro - pro Nikon mirrorless bodies will come in the future.  But, these cameras will slow down Nikon users from converting to Sony.,P.S. I loved the 24-70mm f4 lens.  It's compact, sharp, simple, just felt right to use.  I'll miss it...and mostly the EVF.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: The camera performs as advertised, and there are a million reviews out there that go into excruciating detail about number of cards and line resolving and all that so I'll let them do it (and far better than I ever could).,At the end of the day it is a tool, one that feels nice in the hand and offers up all the capabilities most photographers need.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Got it on time and it is working great. Still learning the camera.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Didn't work. Had to return it.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Great camera

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: This is the best camera to get if you want to do video and photos.  Great value for your money.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
