product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I bought this for an Alaskan trip, completely stopped working on the 1st day, and this after I already changed batteries.,Refund was no problem though

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Small and compact.,You can easily carry this camera in your purse.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I own X-T2 w/grip, X-T20, lots of Fuji glass, former Nikon FF shooter (since FM/FE), Minolta since SRT-101, M 4/3, did my own B&W darkroom back in the day, freelance/wedding photographer out of HS for a number of years.,The X-T3 is a stellar achievement in features/functionality/performance/price.  Fuji is hands down the best value today.  Ergonomics generally are heads above everyone else.  Generally stellar glass.  Fuji APS-C IS the best bang for the buck for most photographers including most 'PRO' work today.,I've had X-T2 for over a year and its a solid workhorse.  Have borrowed an X-T3 and I'm glad I borrowed one and did not purchase it.  Why?  There is somethings odd about the top of the camera that I really don't like.,1)  The top right dial section is too busy.  The nubs on the dials remind me of the Oly OM-D EM-10 II which could cut you if you weren't careful.  There is too much going on in this section on the upper right.  I was immediately put off by that area of the controls layout.  Yes, it is similar to the X-T2, but the designers moved in the EV +/- dial and it is harder to get to.  The buttons just look weird now, especially on the silver model.  They are trying to be too 'pretty' if you know my I mean.,2) The top left plate on the other side of the hot shoe is also a little weird.  I like the locking diopter adjustment.  But why is that piece of metal coming out of the top pointing towards the ISO ring?  Is is a loop or a bend, what do you call it?  It looks weird like someone dropped in a part from a totally unrelated device at the top of the camera.,It feels like design elements of a bare metal 'styling' from the X-A or X-100 series are creeping into the X-T line which is a shame.  I really dislike the X-100 series because of the weird interplay and proportions of bare metal, space, knobs, and the odd X-100 LCD panel.  The proportions seem forced and unbalanced.  More like a Kiev 4A Type-2 rather than say a Leica or Zeiss Ikon.,Its getting to the point where the design is trying to make an artistic statement that is out of place.  Like a bad note in a chord.  Anything when overplayed, including design, tends to fail.  X-T2 was more attractive here because the 'coolness' in the design was not trying to overplay the utility of the controls.  X-T3 is trying too hard to be pretty.,If I needed to have another X-T heavyweight, I would certainly get another X-T2 and not the X-T3.  I'll wait and see if Fuji comes back to their design senses with the X-T4.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: It took me a while to decide between the X-T2 and the X-T3, especially since I had picked a T2 in graphite silver for $1,299 and it was made in japan. At the end of the day, for my needs either camera would have sufficed (mostly portraits and landscapes). However, after holding and feeling my way around both, I realized that the X-T3 was a better fit for my large hands, small things made a big difference, including the additional depth of the grip, the larger buttons in the back and the newly designed switches for the drive mode and metering. The larger X-T3 just felt right, without trying to convince myself of which was the right camerA. The made in China part sort of faded in the background given the solidity of the camera build, as many others have commented. It truly feels substantial.,I do wish that the camera operated a little more swiftly, coming from a Canon 5D Mark III, it feels just a tad slower, especially when reviewing a photo I just took. However, the same applies when navigating through the menus. I do think that Canon menus are the best, here I still have to stop and think where things are.,Photo quality is excellent and the autofocus is pretty quick, no complaints here. Photos at ISO 6400 in raw resemble the files of my 5D, they have a similar grain pattern that i actually like.,Overall, it is a very nice camera and I hope it holds up for as many years as my 5D did. When using it, I invariably have moments where I think, boy that works really well, whether adjusting aperture via the rear command dial or ISO settings via clicking the front command dial, or using the four way controller buttons as shortcuts to various functions.,I hope you enjoy yours as much as I enjoy mine.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Unlike what “WowFactor” is saying, unlike the XT-2, this new one has mic and headphone jack built in, and you can do full 4K 60, 10 bit internal WITHOUT the grip.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I don't have much to say other than this is an absolutely amazing APS-C camera, and overall an improved and next-gen X-T2. The battery certainly lasts a lot longer than I expected, lasted me a 4-day camping trip without any recharges. The camera is surprisingly light, but feels extremely high quality, and also looks absolutely gorgeous. I could not be happier with my purchase!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Extremely impressed with the preformance with this camera but keep in mind the battery grip is a must.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Wow, coming from an XT2 I was missing my Full Frame Nikon, for the supposed added DOF and extra DR. So I decided to go back to FF (using the Nikon Df, which has the D4 sensor). I was liking the results, but the weight and heft was something that was undesirable. When the XT3 came out, I saw all the love that the camera was receiving especially on the focus and face detect, so I decided to buy a used one, and OMG. I didn’t realize I had missed the Fuji experience this much. I thought that with the APSC sensor I was at a bigger disadvantage with the points mentioned earlier, but that was clearly not the case. FujiFilm has really done an excellent job with their sensor. I’m sure possibly in low light, this camera will suffer some, but I’ve shot at 6400 iso withou seeing any real issue. I am more of a stills shooter, so I can’t comment on the battery life when shooting video, but for stills, I think it’s plenty (just make sure you shut camera off when not using). All in all I’m excited with this new toy, and don’t miss the FF weight and heft at all. Don’t wait to buy one just go get one!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: The Fujifilm X-T3 is an excellent camera.  The performance and ergonomics of the camera are great.  I was looking a mirrorless platform to switch and decided to try out the Fujifilm X-T3 after doing some extensive research about the options available in the marketplace.  I have been very impressed with the responsive and ease of use of the camera.  I like that the controls are on the outside of the body.  I don't have to dive into menus to change features like the shutter speed, aperture, or ISO.  The Q menu is logical.  I like the design of the GUI that the Fujifilm X-T3 employs.  Eye auto focus is very reliable.  The colors from the Fujifilm X-T3 are amazing.  SOOC shots are beautiful.  I have been using the X-T3 as my primary camera for over the past 7 months now without any problems.  I don't miss my Nikon D810 in any way.  The features and capabilities of the Fujifilm X-T3 can stand up against any full frame or crop sensor camera on the market today.  Fujifilm does an excellent job with supporting the Fujifilm X-T3 through firmware updates that are incredibly easy to install using the Fujifilm app on my iPhone.  I would definitely recommend this camera for portraiture.  If you are looking for a camera that will inspire you to use it and is reliable, look no further than the Fujifilm X-T3.  You won't be disappointed.,I do wish the camera had IBIS.  I believe Fujifilm will release an update version of the X-T series camera with IBIS.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: There’s no need to write an in-depth review as there’s many out there on the internet already so I’m gonna keep this short.,The X-T3’s autofocus system is simply a massive upgrade over the X-T2 and is definitely worth upgrading to if you need the best autofocus performance in a Fujifilm camera. The image quality seems about the same as my X-T2, though DP Review and others have noted slightly worse high ISO performance so keep that in mind if a super quick autofocusing system is not necessary for your work and you’re looking for the best image quality in the Fujifilm X system.,The lack of IBIS is a bummer as most of its Full Frame competition already sports it and the battery life is mediocre at best. I’m pretty optimistic that Fujifilm will address these problems in their next X-H body at which point I may probably step up to that line.,The build quality is great as always despite Fujifilm moving its production from Japan to China.,I’m quite excited to truly test its capabilities on my next birding trip.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I've only had this camera since December (Christmas present for myself) but I must say that its been wonderful to work with.  I like the look...I like how customizable it is and most importantly, it takes great pictures.  The kit lens is outstanding... has OIS too!,And, it went down in price, hard to beat!,Only con is the battery life could be better, get the real battery from Fuji...and...get three of them!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Who in a sane mind will buy APS-C camera for this money in 2019 when you can get a full-frame for less? For still shots, Canon RP beats all Fuji APS-C cameras on all aspects, starting with much superior image quality and autofocus.  For video, there are other better cameras in this price range.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: It's a fine camera but we returned it because it doesn't have a rechargeable battery. It uses regular batteries.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I bought this camera for a gift, I think it will be a perfect fit for her, very easy to operate,The price was affordable and did not require a lot of computer skills.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: The cameras compact size and low price make it ideal for the type of on the spot photography that I do.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Looks fine, I only  tested it to see if works.

review: Takes really nice pictures. Had to order the whole package since everything is separate. I don't like the fact that the batteries are not rechargeable. The case that come with the package is nice. It has room for the card and extra batteries and the cable.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: It's a nice camera to snap a few quick pictures but if you want to go into detail or take pictures without adequate lighting I would recommend something more advanced. Definitely a good starter camera.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Great

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: We purchased this light weight compact camera for traveling but it’s so good I’m using it instead of my DSLR (it’s so heavy). It doesn’t replace my Canon 70D, but I’m loving the convenience of having all the manual capabilities as my other camera. The touch screen rocks and it offers so many different setting options plus the biggest perk, the lens offers such a huge range, super strong zoom and an aperture as low as 2.8f, creative play time!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It is a really good camera for an beginner like me. I have gotten some really good pictures with it.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I also bought a "Shot Gun Microphone" with audio plug and that's when I noticed there is no audio receptor on the FZ80, so enhancing sound is not an option as far as I can see.,Does anyone else have an Audio plug on their Lumix FZ80? and if not, what is the workaround?,I gave it 3 stars, but still learning and will upgrade if I find the reason. (6-12-19 I upgraded to 4 stars) take great pics, the zoom is impressive when set right. So that could be the settings, there are many and I am still not sure of what combo is best.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I love this camera for everything.  Maybe for a serious pro use you need a Nikon D5.  Last Nikon I had was the D2.  Got too expensive.  I love the LUMIX lens and recently I shot a pic at about 22X right throwing the home Venetian blinds of an unusual formation in a distant tree.  Focused perfectly on the object of interest with no blind showing.  Great travel camera and easy to learn its intricacies.  Can’t beat the lens either. While the sensor provides over 16 mp its is a small sensor, under 29 mm^2, about the same as an iPhone which makes very low light imaging subject to dark noise in the sensor.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I’ve been an avid photographer for a couple years and was in the market for a high zoom point and shoot camera and this one definitely did not disappoint it claims it has 1200 mm of optical zoom which it definitely does but there’s a hack that you can get over 4000 mm of zoom with this camera amazing for the price and the picture quality  is great depending on the light and how far you are zoomed in with that being said I highly recommend this camera to any family anybody traveling or somebody that is looking into  photography

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera because I noticed that my iPhone was outperforming my Panasonic DMC-FZ100 by its' ability to stop a tennis ball in flight. The iPhone has a feature called HDR that permits better photos of rapidly moving objects. The DMC-FZ70 also has this ability. I tested it and it also stopped tennis balls in flight. I wanted this capability for sports pictures and because I have young grandchildren that seem to be in constant motion when I want a picture. I also wanted the telephoto ability for sports and wildlife photos. It would cost a small fortune to get the telephoto ability for a DSLR camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I'll have the time to figure out how this works. I have yet to take a good picture with this camera. I got this because a reviews Website recommended it for Macro photography - big mistake. Not only can I not figure out how to do that, it barely takes even decent snapshots. My cell phone is better. Wish I didn't buy this and can't say I'd recommend it. It does have many features, so I suppose if you are willing to take the time to read all about it and watch tutorial videos or what have you, then maybe this isn't bad - but if you're looking for something more intuitive, I'd look elsewhere.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: First, I'm a complete novice in serious photography.  This camera is meant to get my feet wet, get me familiar first hand with the 'issues'.  That said, my rating is great, 4 stars.  Some things could be more satisfying to me so not five stars.,Zoom, clarity, basic ease of use are very good, 5-star worthy.  The combined weight of the negative factors below is only enough, to me and for now, to cost the 5th star.,Grip point on the camera for hand shooting is small (ok, I've big hands), somewhat awkward in location versus camera mass and makes me feel I'll drop the camera.  The image stabilization is the best I've used - compared against phones and an old, cheap camera I have - but not quite what I'd hoped for.  Auto-focus is sometimes strangely flaky.  Battery life is 'meh', I'm buying a second battery to work around that.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Strap broke in 5 months. Not covered by warranty, though honestly they're probably doing you a favor, since you shouldn't trust it anyway. For most, I'd say buy yourself a $100 camera, or even just use your cell phone if you're not too concerned about a lot of zoom. If you're going digital, chances are good you won't need the $200 worth of bells and whistles I (over)paid for.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I was skeptical about a camera with one lens with such a large zoom range, but I couldn't be happier with it! This camera allows me to capture great close ups without the hassle of changing lenses, and the quality is quite good for prints. I am a "nikon person", but I am selling my Nikon D3300. The convenience and quality of the Lumix beats the Nikon hands down. Awesome awesome awesome!

review: This is a great product for the price​ you can't go wrong,The video​ quality stunning,Great camera for the price. Needs an sd card.buy separately.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Great camera!  I wish it would tether to lightroom, but there is a workaround using Sony's software.  Additionally, you can use CaptureOne Pro to tether to the camera.  It is one of the best picture qualities I have seen in a camera this price.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I love this camera, my boss borrows it from me now too haha. It’s a high step up from my canon! I am impressed and have been using this since November. Not a day goes by I’m not happy I made this purchase!! 10/10 would recommend.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: If you are stuck on the research, look no further. This is what you've been looking for.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This is my second sony camera, I upgraded from the SonyA7, this camera is great!  Much better battery life, love the dual memory card slots for wedding photography.  The low light picture quality is great and overall the camera takes great pictures.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: So far, the only negative feature is the manual. An expanded index and list of abbreviations would help. The on-line one is better by far, but lacks a search feature. I may be adding a lens sooner than I'd planned - maybe a Zeiss w/a.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Using it with MC-11 adapter and Canon lenses. Awesome camera. Amazing pictures.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Best picture quality, require a little learning to exploit full potential.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: It was time to upgrade from a Nikon D5600. After much research, I decided to go with the Sony a7iii for it's superb low-light capability and to get a full frame camera. I have learned so much since making the switch and all my pictures have vastly improved in focus and overall quality. I am loving this new camera.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: It is just amazing camera with ligh weight and high quality. Totally worth it.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Low light is phenomenal, picture quality is insane and the video quality is equally mind blowing. Only complaint is that it does not support 60FPS at 4k video recording, but it's not the end of the world since I rarely shoot at that frame rate anyway.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my daughter who is just getting into photography. She LOVES this camera!! GREAT photo quality! Her favorite gift and she uses it all the time!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I recently bought this camera and have used it only a few times thus far, but I am very satisfied with the quality of the photos I was able to obtain. I was also pleased with the ease of setting it up and operating it. Am also very satisfied with the service provided by The Imaging World. Once my order was placed the camera arrived very quickly in just a few days. Great job!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: I said before; it is a gift, and I will let you know how well it is liked after it is opened on Christmas. Please don't let either of us appear dimmer than we are, by asking me to rate a product still in the box. Happy Holidays! I will get back to you in January.

review: Great bundle!  I especially like the second battery AND that the memory card was included.

review: have used to a few times now, once at company Christmas party, with great results. Have a lot more to learn and try but think it will be fun. The price was very good and am really pleased with this camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: cheap accessory kit not from canon. like the camera a lot. Good for someone that does not want to figure out all the technical aspects of photography. I just want to point and shoot and this camera works quite well for that. takes very nice pics

review: I've only taken a a dozen or so pictures just to experiment.  very good quality pictures . good zoom  .. We bought it to get some decent pictures of the wild horses in our neighborhood. I'm confident this will do the job. We have been relying on our junk cell phone camera's for way too long.. It came with 2 batteries 2 chargers a case , tripod.  screen saver and more great deal

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: The camera  was  a gift for my wife  in anticipation  of a trip to  Costa Rica. She is  an aspiring amateur  photographer and has long  wanted an easy to use but quality piece of equipment. Based on the description you provided I thought  this might fit the bill. Out of the box she was able to assimilate the features of the camera and in no time was able to capture many stunning photos of a remarkable journey through the mountains and rainforest we encountered.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Perfect for my 9 year old!! He loves taking pics and this is a great camera for him to start with!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I had to return my first order because it wouldn’t turn on. That process was easy. I re-ordered the second one and it came quickly. Look at the price...for the money, you get a lot of bells and whistles that you would pay a lot more for. But you do get what you pay for - I’m using this camera rather than my phone in Europe...the battery should last most if not all day and the pics will uploaded to my computer afterwards for cropping, fixing etc. For the price - don’t expect a state of the art Nikon...but my camera dealer was amazed with all the features, pixels and price. Although - he NEVER HEARD OF the camera!!!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Do not buy fourty dollar cameras off Amazon. UNLESS! You like to take photos from a foot away and you are four years old.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I wanted a small camera that I could carry at all times, with a descent optical zoom and not pay to much for. Picture quality is great for this size of camera and it is very easy to use.Has some great settings on it to get some cool effects and the video quality is brilliant.  like , white balance, image resolution, zoom I have not had a chance to test all of the camera functions, but the ones I had needed have worked well

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Perfect camera for little ones and for basic photos. Small screen. Hard to get sd card out. You can't playback sound on videos (it records though so you can listen to the sd card on another device) with all these cons I'd still recommend this as a gift for a child 8-12 years old as their first little camera,Update July, 2019,It's 7 months and camera not working. I emailed the company - Albergs, and within minutes after I explained my issue they gave me a refund. I strongly recommend them. A company that backs their products!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This is a nice little camera. It's best used outside. It has a small mirror on the front so you can set up a selfie. It has a full frame and a portrait mode. The portrait mode is kind of a zoom feature. The best thing is it came with two batteries. I took this to the to the amusement park near us and took lots of pictures and never had to use the second battery. I managed to forget to take pictures that did not include my family members. The camera is an auto focus. The flash works well but if taking indoor pictures I would use a tripod.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I bought this low cost camera for my tween daughter to try her hand at digital photography.,I don't want her to have phone but she wants to take photos.  This was a great fit and the price was right.,We're not talking about the height of professional photography here so this is a great fit.  Small and portable.  easy and simple to use.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: A company shouldn't be allowed to sell on amazon without instructions in English.  My opinion.  Tried to print out the pdg file but 34 pages was too much for my old printer.  Out of paper, out of ink, and too small.  It should be mentioned in their ad that the instructions are not in English. Will probably return.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: * There's a little slider on the side of the camera which changes the focal point from near to far. There doesn't appear to be any automatic focus between these two points, which can result in some blurry pictures.,* Charging port uses a USB Mini B jack, which is pretty unconventional compared to the standard Micro USB jack, making it sort of a pain to need to use an alternate charger + wire for this device.,* Has decent battery life,* No issues with reading/writing to an SD card. It doesn't come with one, but that's fine.,* Camera's functionality and UI feels like it was designed somewhere in the early 2000s.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I saw same bad reviews about this camera. Frankly speaking, you should not compare this one with an expensive digital camera. Its not an expensive camera. You get what you pay for. It is fancy and light for the kid. My kid enjoys the new toy. Two batteries give him extra fun time. I won't give him a chance to touch / damage my Nikon.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: My daughter got it for her birthday and absolutely loves it... To the detriment of the family. We can't sneeze without a pic now, lol. We just got back from the Grand Canyon... She did so awesome with the camera right out of the box. It's like it came with an "artistic eye" included! Lol!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Got it for christmas so far its amazing! And it comes with a ton of stuff more than I know what to do with it also has a 32GB SD card not pictured. And a charger not pictured. Great start very happy with my purchase.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Just now learning how to use this neat camera, the flash, and other functions. I've captured a few great up-close photos of birds in the backyard, also some indoor people photos. It's simple to learn the basic functions and easy to operate.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Daughter is tickled pink with her camera.  Tripod was broken(won't lock in place) but all other items in kit were good.  Due to low cost of kit I did not complain, will just buy one by itself.  Overall pleased though with purchase, no problem with camera itself

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I’ve had this camera for about a week now. I bought this camera so I would have a good camera instead of always using my iPhone to take pics. This camera takes excellent pictures. This is a good camera for beginners because it’s not complicated. This is also a good deal for the price.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: This set is amazing and the price is hard to beat. It has been great to use as a first time user of such a utility. I am still learning how to use it for my blogging, but I think it will be great.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: My mom bought me this bundle for as a birthday gift. Unexpected. I was so surprised and happy! It came with so many accessories. The camera is beautiful and takes amazing pictures. The camera bag is really spacious as all of the accessories fit in the bag. The 5ft tripod is sturdy and very portable as it is adjustable. It is the perfect starter kit for anyone.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: I gave this to my daughter for a gift and she loves it. It was everything she was looking for in a camera to make YouTube videos and great photos.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: The perfect camera for beginners. The camera priced alone is about $400, so, the extra $40 for lenses, filters and tripods is well worth the cost. I can upgrade as i go. As the reviews state, the lenses are Canon compatible, but work well. Perfect for learning and growing as a photographer.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm EF-S f/3.5-5.6 is II Lens + 58mm Wide Angle Lens + 2X Telephoto Lens + Flash + 48GB SD Memory Card + UV Filter Kit + Tripod + Full Accessory Bundle
review: Needed a camera for my photography class. This was a great deal. Now I have a camera to use for class and outside of class. Stand it comes with is very cheap. I recommend, if you are a serious photographer, to get another one. The cheap plastic broke pretty fast.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I like how so much is included in this purchase. It’s definitely worth getting, however, the picture quality is not the best. The price for this camera package is cheap so i understand if the quality of the pictures are not amazing. You get what you pay for. It takes a little practice getting used to the settings to find how to take a really good picture!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: UPDATE OCT 2016,Canon replaced the camera with a "new or refurbished unit" and this one has been working fine. I am grateful for Canon's warranty work but my sense is not to increase the review rating given that the issue seems quite widespread with this model. Those who are unlucky enough to have it strike after the warranty period are out of luck.,UPDATE SEP 2016,I'm sorry to say this camera has now started experiencing the dreaded focus problems that other reviewers have complained about. It still turns on and lets me select different modes, but will not take a focused picture. I got less than 6 months of use out of it - no drops, spills, or weather exposure. I'll try to get a warranty repair or exchange but I'm not optimistic.,As an aside, I have to say as a long-time Canon photography devotee that this is yet another Canon product that has not lived up to expectations. Other failures have included a Canon mid-level DSLR, 50 mm prime lens, and even a (very expensive) L lens which did give me years of service, but for that price should have given me years more.,***** ORIGINAL REVIEW *****,Long ago when I lived in Japan, I owned an earlier version of this camera when it was called IXY and it only had 4.0 megapixels. I loved it then and I love it now!,Full disclosure: I'm a photography nut and I usually take pictures with a full frame DSLR. In my experience there's simply no substitute for a quality full sized sensor and the lens to go with it.,But the philosophical side of photography tells us that the best picture is the one you get, not the one you missed because your equipment was too heavy or bulky to take with you. This little camera is a point-and-shoot dream. Out of the box, the thing just works. If you stand in the right place, point the camera in the right drection, and push the button at the right moment, you get a well exposed, color balanced, perfectly focused photography. From a camera that will fit in your front jeans pocket.,The battery lasts for a subjective forever - I've taken it on photo-heavy vacation and a single charge lasted most of the week. There are ample customizable modes if you want to tinker - from macro to exposure modes to filters and effects. To be honest, I never use them. The camera is good enough to get me what I need in its default mode. It has saved my bacon more than once when my primary DSLR was unavailable or impractical for the task at hand, and I needed something small and light that could still take a quality picture.,It's not the fanciest or most feature heavy camera you can find, but it's a great little workhorse that I wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This is a nice camera, with plenty of functionality.  The one downside is the pictures seem a bit on the fuzzy side.  I chalk this up to an image stabilization problem, but the pictures are good if I can get really still.  A higher-priced smart phone would probably take better pics, but I like Sony and their products, so I'll probably stick with this.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I know lots of people use their phone for pictures, but for me, you just can't beat a good Sony Camera!  This was bought as a gift for someone going to meet their new grandson.  Great little camera that is auto adjusting and quick to snap the picture.  You can carry it in your pocket for instant spontaneous pictures.  Auto stability is a wonderful feature, especially for photoing kids!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Received a charger with this camera that is designed for Europe (round prongs).  Why they shipped that model to Ohio I don't know.  Glad I opened it before giving it to my spouse on our upcoming anniversary.  Had to return.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: We bought this as a cheap camera to bring along to Disneyland. Sometimes the pictures turn out great, but it seems like most of them are blurry. I loved its small size, but it's not one I'd invest in for important pictures.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Never worked well.  Very disappointed.  Pictures blurry unless pictures taken outdoors.  I tryed reading the manual and trying different settings.  Still blurry.  Ended up buying another camera.  I've had this type of camera before and it was good.  I should have asked for a refund right away but didn't.  I think this camera was broken inside.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This tiny camera takes really nice pictures. The photos I take with it compare well with my husband's professional camera.  The zoom lens is nice, but can make far- off scenes a bit fuzzy.  Excellent camera for the price.  Clear, high -def pictures.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I got this camera as a quick point and shoot for a vacation to Florida.  The camera takes great pictures and footage with little to no issue.  The only problem I had is that the display screen died in the middle of my vacation.  Since it has passed the 30 day window for a return, I'm stuck with dealing with Sony to get the screen repaired.  I have to say they need to have a better setup for warranty repairs.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: HELP!  HELP! HELP!  MFG. DEFECT, BAD PLASTIC HOUSING, cannot keep battery door latched, thus camera doesn't work!!!!!  Taping door closed doesn't work either!,Sony customer service has given me an electronic loop frustration when trying to get a product defect solved.  The battery well cover latch will not retain the cover in a closed condition.  This disrupts the camera's function to keep the memory card circuit working.  I also wrote this input on my product review direct to Sony with NO response!!!  Their customer service operator gave me a telephone number that was a recorded message (not the camera service people) directing me to the same phone number I had just called getting the person that lead me to this message!!!!  HOW stupid can a business system BE???  This result is changing my faithful customer viewpoint of Sony and their products, this is after numerous good  TV's , DVD and tape machines and other cameras.  I'm a retired Prof. Eng'r and Air Forced trained as a camera repairman.  THEIR CAMERA problem is a small hinged piece that mates with the slide latch in the cover and DOESN'T keep the cover closed due to hinge moving.... R. Givens

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

The photo stabilization was a MUST have for this camera purchase. It is almost impossible to take a blurry photo. My Mother-in-law can now take her pictures stress free. She is learning to enjoy photography. (When she remembers to put it in her purse!!)

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
