product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Purchased the 24-70 F/4 bundle, love everything about the Z6 thus far. The images, build quality, and ease of use is a big plus.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Everything you heard and then some! Nikon is catching up to the mirrorless game with this system!

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Very fun to use a touch screen and have video AF at 4k.  I am mostly a nikon shooter with a bunch of f mount lenses.  Very happy that the adapter works well with my lenses.  I have own and used nikon d750, d600, DF, D7000, D40.  Had the panny Gm1 and sony A7, both gone.  A few quirks and things I noticed:,1. Since I shoot manual it was real time exposure, but after I asked somebody and he said you can adjust the manual exposure to be able to see under d8.  Good for studio shooter and night shooter that need to see their subject.,2. For video I think the AF jumps more for Nikon F lens vs S lens?  You can adjust the the video AF sensitivity under g4 or g5.  I also noticed this for still image too.,3. The Fn1 button I use as my zoom.  To check the focus as I look thru the viewfinder.,4. I keep on hitting the record button as the iso, which I used it as a iso button on the d750.,5. EVF is very good, don't missed the OVF as much as I thought I would.,6. Battery drain was big, I used the rear lcd a lot.  get spare batteries.,7.  Nikon nef looks like how it is on nikon first party capture nx as it does on 3rd party software lightroom and capture 1 pro.  I am using dng for lightroom as I have the old version.,8. touch screen is fun to use and focus well at night (tad jumpy).,9. can focus at the corner of the frame now.,10. face detect works well at least at f2.2 on the eyes.  Didn't test how shallow it can go.  Guess it depends on working distance too.,11. works with my trigger and flash, except for the IR AF-assist as that doesn't work for milc in general.,12. Have tested it on sport or action and does fine, I might give a edge to the d750.  Night shooting and it did focused at night better then I thought.,13. wished it had a vertical grip option not just battery pack.,14. I use the i button alot to change AF system.  Grant the fn2 button does that for AF settings, but I don't remember to use it much.,15. I don't use the joystick as much.  Either it autofocus on the face, or I use the touch screen af and look at the evf and use the zoom fn1.  Half of my shoot is just the rear lcd.  Nikon should have an option to use the rear lcd to move the af like other cameras for when looking at the evf.,16. You need an external video capture for 10bit recording at 4k, otherwise you got 4k at 8bit.,17. the kit 24-70 f4 is a great lenses for walk around.  Get it as a combo price is much better then the full price.  It feels solid, not sure why people say it feels cheap.  It is short too, so you have to extend it before use.  People call it retractable lens.,18. Since this milc has less external buttons must program your favorite commands to the external free button or the "I" button.  I found split screen zoom a unique features.,19. read the manual, many new features and settings that will effect your shooting to adjust not found on nikon dslr.,Positives:,1. built quality, very nice metal.,2. grip is good maybe between the d750 and d5600 size.,3. Image quality is good, I think it is on par with the d750.,Negatives:,-Batteries doesn't last as long as dslr.,-body size is great for most people who like lightweight, but maybe small if you have xxl hands.,-less external buttons then dslr.,-Af in video needs a lot of adjustments, learning or maybe some updates.,-When usign the adapter you must remove the tripod mount if you have one.,It you have bunch of nikon lenses this is a great new tech to play with.  Don't see much draw back.  I am keeping the d750 for that as my main sport camera.  this z6 can do sport action for sure, but the d750 does it a little better, I think.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: NOTE: This is a review of the Nikon Z6 Filmmaker's Kit, not the Nikon Z6 itself.  The camera is great. This "kit", on the other hand, is incredibly frustrating and incomplete. 3 stars is generous for it, but I don’t want to give the camera a bad rep just because the kit is a mess.,First and foremost, in order to USE everything that comes in this kit, you will need to ALSO purchase the following:,An XQD Memory card (unless you think you’ll always be using the Atomos Ninja V to record on),An XQD Memory card reader,A Solid state hard drive (in order to use the included Atomos Ninja V),A Hard drive dock (in order to get anything you’ve recorded on the SSD onto your computer),At least one NP-F batteries (unless you like being connected to an electrical outlet with the included cord and don’t plan to move around while using the Atomos Ninja V with the gimbal),At the time of this review, all of that ran my company an extra half grand to purchase. It was not fun telling my superiors that the money they’d already approved would not be enough.,So after that was all taken care of, here is a list of other stupid things related to the kit that I discovered:,1) It comes with a great Rode mic.  However, you can’t use it in conjunction with the gimbal, because it will slam into the mic if you tilt it even slightly.,2) The gimbal comes with several cords to connect it to various camera brands. However – get this – it DOES NOT COME WITH A CORD THAT WILL CONNECT TO THE NIKON CAMERA IT IS PACKAGED WITH. How ridiculous is that? It appears that I need a USB-C to USB-C cable. One more part I have to buy. So until I get that, I cannot use the gimbal to start and stop recording, or to adjust any camera settings. I have to press buttons on my camera with my off hand.,3) The kit comes with an HDMI to mini-HDMI cord to connect the camera to the Atomos Ninja. The camera comes with a clip to keep the mini-HDMI from slipping out.  However, the mini-HDMI end of the cord that comes with the kit is TOO FAT TO FIT THROUGH THE CLIP. Absurd.,4) Once you connect the Atomos Ninja V to the articulating arm and the arm to the gimbal and the HDMI to the camera, it isn’t really possible to use the gimbal correctly because the coiled cord is so heavy it pulls on the camera and unbalances it.  Also, all of this put together is extremely heavy, so unless you lift a lot, bro, you’re not going to want to carry this whole monstrosity around for more than a couple minutes.,I will be using the gimbal with the camera.  I will be using the Rode mic.  I will be using the Atomos Ninja V. But I will NOT be using them all together at the same time, because it's just not practical (or in some cases, even possible).,When all is said and done, the designers of this kit had so little concern for the needs of the customer that it has kinda soured me on Nikon as a whole, which is really disappointing.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: For years I wanted a mirrorless camera, though I never pulled the trigger because I couldn't use my Nikon lenses. The new Z mirrorless system from Nikon was worth the wait.,If you suspect the Z cameras have disadvantages over a high-end DSLR, do not worry, there are NO DISADVANTAGES!. The autofocus is spot on and fast, the metering is perfect. And the mirrorless design lets you see exactly what the final picture will look like, including depth of field, white balance, and exposure in the OLED viewfinder or rear display.,The build has the same high quality as the D850, with a magnesium alloy housing and weather sealing. It feels perfect in my hand. It fits my hand better than DSLRs. Clearly, Nikon made ergonomics a priority with this design. All of the functions are easily reachable with my fingers and thumb, allowing me to make adjustments with only one hand. And the internal VR features are outstanding, as is the silent mode that allows for truly silent shooting, even in burst mode.,The Z6 has fewer megapixels than the Z7, which allows for smaller file sizes, faster buffering and faster writing to the single XQD card. It also allows for higher FPS in burst shooting mode. Additionally, the Z6o has better low-light capabilities with native ISO up to 51200, twice as high as the Z7.,For most people there is no reason to use a DSLR if they have this camera. The superior ergonomics, lighter weight, and equal or better performance make it a no brainer. My DSLR is now my backup.,It took a while for Nikon to get it right, and it was worth the wait. The Nikon Z system is the new standard for mirrorless systems.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I bought the Filmmaker's kit directly from Nikon with their upgrade program due to a generous trade-in.,The Filmmaker's kit comes with an external recorder/monitor and gimbal for extra-steady shots. But it is not really possible to use it "out of the box." I'm not going to do an in-depth review of the Z6 or the other components - many people have done very thorough reviews of those. Instead, I want to help you get started quickly by highlighting a few things.,Additional things you need to have or buy:,SSD Drives for the Atomos Ninja V. Any 2.5" drive will work. You do not need to buy the extra-compact Atomos editions. Standard 2.5" drives are used with drive caddies (1 included in the box, you can buy packs of 5 for $30), and they project out the side a bit more than half an inch. Some might consider this beneficial, since it could provide some protection for the HDMI plugs from being knocked around. The special Atomos drives are far more expensive but fit flush to the unit with no projection. I bought 2 500GB Samsung 860 SSDs that are doing great as first recording units. They each hold more than 4 hours of 4K N-Log video. If I start using RAW (available in a future update) I likely will get some larger capacity units.,Batteries for the Atomos Ninja V. The unit ships with an AC adapter, but unless you plan on only shooting next to an AC outlet, that is pretty useless. It takes standard Sony-style NP-F batteries, and there are numerous options available. They recommend at least a 5200mAh battery for 2 hours of monitor/record time, and you can buy larger/heavier batteries as well. Beware that most sellers on Amazon do not offer a fast charger. This could mean very long charging times for the batteries, especially higher capacity batteries.,XQD Card for the Nikon Z6. At least 400Mb/s. I think most all cards sold do that now. I have used both Sony and Lexar with fine results in previous cameras. There is only one slot, so no backup capability. I've never had an XQD fail on me, but there's always a first time. So I will probably stick with 64GB cards and download them often to limit exposure to problems.,Options:,A hood for the Ninja V is awfully nice. Rather than pay the ridiculous price for a "genuine" plastic one, I made a foldable cardboard one.,A different HDMI cable - the coiled cable is nice and compact to connect the camera to the Ninja V, but is so tightly coiled that it interferes with the gimbal balance. The gimbal is strong enough to overcome this, but it's an annoyance. Also the connector on the coiled cable is too wide to use Nikon's cable clamp on the Z6, which if you're having the HDMI stick out a lot, might be good as protection. I have a habit of whacking and damaging cables and connectors.,Comments:,I love the Z6. It feels good. The battery life is shorter than my other cameras, but not really something to complain about. Auto-upload to SnapBridge on a smartphone uses a lot of battery, but is great for geo-tagging and viewing your pictures. I was disappointed to not find an artificial horizon in the menus, until I found it as one of the normal pages shown with the DISP button. And it's particularly good! I chose the D6 for it's better low-light sensitivity and all-pixel use of the sensor for 4K video. And it has delivered very well. It's a great all-around camera.,The Ninja V - If you want HDR type recording (and you do, if you want to high-end video), you need to use an external recorder. The camera will not record N-log (and presumably not raw in the future update) to an internal card. If you want standard recording, you can ditch the monitor and record in-camera. XQD cards are expensive compared to SSDs, and you can store a lot of video on an SSD.  The Ninja V is a nice compact unit. Not lightweight including a battery. Several nice monitoring options. An additional stereo analog audio input supplements audio in the HDMI from the camera. The camera can send timecode to the Ninja V.,The Moza Air 2: makes superb steady video. Lots of stabilization modes with separate on/off and responsivity for each axis. If you want focus or zoom control, you need to get the separate iFocus module. Theoretically the gimbal has Nikon USB control through the USB-C on the Z6, but I haven't gotten that to work. Also, even if it does work, with current firmware very few functions are even theoretically available - basically just the record trigger. Perhaps a future update will bring exposure control, and even better, USB focus control. Focus pulls and zooms are unwieldy and will jiggle the camera when done manually. This is a heavy unit. The Ninja V is difficult to mount with the included arm in a fashion that will keep it from sagging. If mounted to the right side, it will unscrew itself. There are optional brackets that would solve that problem. With camera and Ninja V, this is a very heavy combination that will give you a solid workout.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: I placed an order of the Nikon Z6 with the 24-70 mm and FTZ adapter the same week Nikon announced the product. It was worth the wait when this new gadget arrived. The Z6 is Nikon's first entry to the mirrorless market with a full frame digital sensor for the serious photographers. I have been having fun with this camera for over a week before sharing my experience. My first impression is that Nikon has done a nice job as a first generation mirrorless camera.,The camera has a beautiful easy to grip body weighting 1209 grams (about 2.7 lb) with the 24-70 mm Z lens attached. The modes dial is located on the left with the typical M, A, S, P, and Auto modes plus three users defined modes.  The selection dial is located on the right for setting ISO, shutter speed, and aperture etc. There is an ISO selection button located next to the power on switch for quickly adjusting the ISO by using the selection dial.  It has a beautiful electronic viewfinder with a diopter knob for those wearing eyeglasses. The monitor measures about 2 5/8" W x 1 3/4" H with a beautiful tiltable touch-screen functionality. By pressing the display mode button, we can cycle the monitor's display from live view to a variety of camera parameters . The i button to the right of the monitor provides an easy access to a variety of camera controls (eg metering mode, auto focus mode, image quality, white balance, flash mode just to name a few). What's really neat is that we can customize the i menu to our own shooting style with the most used settings. We can also program the Fn 1 and Fn 2 buttons located next to the lens for quick customized settings. Above the i button is a small joystick which is normally used to single / pin-point focusing.,There a a wealth of selection on the image quality with a combination of Raw, JPEG basic, JPEG fine, and JPEG fine *. I did a test shot of 27 photos with the highest quality settings (Raw + JPEG fine *) which took about 1GB of storage. This is not bad as this would translate to over 3000 picture at the highest quality setting with a 120 GB XQD memory card (provided that we don't take videos with it).,Taking video with the Z6 is a dream comes true for a camera. The Z6 supports true 4K video with a maximum of 3840 x 2160 UHD at upto 30 fp. We can also customize the i menu tailored to video shoots when we are in the  video camera mode. This video quality so far is one of the best I have taken with any 4K video camera.,The 24 - 70 mm fixed F4 Z lens is great for general photo shoots. So far the test shoots I did resulted super sharp pictures without any edge distortions. With the Z6's maximum 51200 ISO , this lens takes great shots for low light environment. The FTZ adapter weights about 163 grams (5.8 oz) which is not bad. I tried it with my DX zooms lens which worked pretty well. The DX crop mode seemed to be automatically selected when the lens is attached. As of this writing, there are only three Z lens on the market. Nikon is going to produce 6 additional Z lens in 2019 including a 70 mm - 200 mm F2.8 zoom lens. In the mean time, I would settle with my NIKKOR 28-300mm ED VR lens with the FTZ adapter.,So far my general impression of the Z6 is great. I am not a professional photographer but the packed features and functionality will make me go a long way. I also bought the Nikon DSLR bag (model 9793) for my Z6 kit which fits quite well so far. For those who are new to Nikon's raw format, it uses the NEF file format which would require using the latest DNS converter to convert the files to DNS for post-processing with the Adobe Photoshop. One of the slight drawback with the Z6 is its shorter battery life in comparison I would highly recommend stocking up some spares El-51b for photo-shooting trips.

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: Beautiful camera, very well built, great AF and amazing picture quality. Great dynamic range, low noise at high ISO and great JPEGS for people who don’t like to PP. I never like Sony because of the horrible jpegs and thank god for Nikon and Canon making mirrorless FF cameras

product_name: Nikon Z6 Full Frame Mirrorless Camera Body
review: The Z6 with the FTZ adapter and 24-70 f4 S lens is an unbeatable Nikon mirrorless for one of my styles of shooting - street photography.  Armed with an FX lens on the FTZ adapter it makes an excellent landscape camera.  I don’t do Portrait work, but can imagine it excellent for that as well.  It’s only weakness, and it may be firmware, or it may be the AF-C, but I can’t see this for sports or wildlife.  It is missing a reliable group mode, 3-D tracking, and generally struggles a bit with tracking focus on birds in flight.  Maybe with more experience there might be mastery, butright now, nothing can replace my D500 or D850 (or the D5) in photographing high speed events with precise tracking.  But it is a spectacular initial foray into mirrorless, and a no brainer for owners of Nikon FX gear who want a slightly lighter and more compact body without sacrificing your investment in quality Nikon lenses.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: The battery was completely defective and would not hold a charge for more than 2 minutes after unplugging.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This was a gift for my mom, since her old camera is not good anymore, and she loved it! It's compact , lightweight and the pictures are great!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Didn't work right. We bought this to take pictures on vacation. The shutter didn't open all the way and it wouldn't take pictures after all. We returned

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Brand new and haven't had a chance to really check it out but the few practice shots we've taken look great.  Especially like the "chargeable in the camera" battery configuration.  Will carry it in car and charge it in aux power plug (remember when it used to be a cigarette lighter?) while travelling.  GREAT idea, much more convenient than carrying extra battery and charger.,Will update later.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: This was just an okay camera. In the four months I've had it I've only gotten maybe 20% of my photos to turn out well.  The flash on this camera is crazy bright and washes out photos taken in low lighting.  And for 20MP many of my photos haven't been very well defined. I'm glad I got the warranty on this as I'm sending it back today.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Great little camera, beautiful pix. from Sony no bologna..

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I returned this camera because there was such an awful lag between pressing the button and the actual picture taking. The quality was okay, but I was frustrated when taking photos with moving objects or multiple people.,There are better options for the money in today's market (2014).

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera for my daughter as a gift.  It takes nice pictures, but it doesn't come with the memory card, and it also doesn't list it clearly which one to get.  If you look on the paper that comes with it, it's there in very small print.  The card costs another $10-$25. I got mine locally, but they also sell them on Amazon.  I think it would be better for the listing to mention that it is sold separately.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: My husband loves his camera. I bought it for him for his birthday. He loves how you can charge it in the car if you forget to charge it at home. Takes pretty good pics and easy to transfer to your pc...

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Bought this for our trip to London.  It was the perfect size to slip into my front pocket and carry around with me.  I took almost 300 shots, most of them decent.  The only negative I found was with image stability.  If I used any zoom at all, pictures tended to come out blurry.  Once I figured that out, I was able to compensate.,I used the panorama mode a lot to capture the skyline...in my opinion, this one feature makes the camera worth purchasing.  Easiest panorama shooting ever.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: This camera is a beast. It’s fast to turn on and focuses quickly. Prior to this camera, I had a Fuji X100 and a Canon 7D. My Canon was good but very heavy. I loved the X100 but wanted to zoom for when I took photos at events. This camera is very suitable for documenting weddings, parties, landscapes and portraits. My wedding photos were captured with this camera, and they came out great. I spend many days a year taking photos of nature, cities, and my family (including pets). I attached untouched jpegs so you can judge the quality for yourself.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: This really is one outstanding camera, probably the best one with an APS-C size sensor.  It is very fast and responsive, the controls are very well thought out and intuitive, and it is very well built.  Image quality is superb, especially outdoors and shooting with it is plenty of fun.,The reason for the 4 stars, however, is that while it is the best APS-C camera, it is sold at a price point where for USD200 more, one can buy a FF sensor camera.  Where the XT-3 suffers is in low light performance, which while good, is no match for a FF sensor, especially considering that its main FF competitor is about the same size with very similar outstanding features but also with IBIS which the Fuji lacks (maybe less so on the video side but that's about it).

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I was using a Fujifilm X100T for about 2 years before upgrading to the XT-3. I mainly use it for photography and I love this thing. I did wish it came with IBS for if I did want to record video but I guess using a lens with OIS will have to do.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: I've been hooked on Fuji since the XT20 and haven't looked back since. The XT3 is an incredible camera that has built on a strong legacy of Fuji products.,I use this camera primarily for video and absolutely love the footage.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: This camera has it all AND great price too!

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Great camera, but Sony eye af and af in general is leagues ahead of this camera. There’s mention of a firmware coming soon.  Great IQ, build, and lenses that support this APSC system.  Except for long tele lenses. 100-400 is a joke. Video is great as well, but not with high ISO. Overall, a more consistent camera over the XT2 that it replaces. Would recommend.

product_name: Fujifilm X-T3 Mirrorless Digital Camera (Body Only) - Silver
review: Amazing camera.  I never write reviews but this is definitely worth one!  Over any canon or Sony in the same price budget any day

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Love my new camera

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Great camera. took it on trip to Alaska and worked great.  If you want a back lite need to adjust the exposure compensation. This may take a little time. Wish it was a matter of just pushing 1 bottom like on my other cameras. Also takes great video. Fits nice in my pocket,And yes i would buy it again.,I also purchased the hard case,  I don't like the case, hard to keep spare batteries, I like the fact i can use AA batteries instead of rechargeable.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Camera seems ok.  Haven't had a chance to really use.  I'm just upset that the supposed new batteries were completely dead.  This may sound picky but if I'm purchasing a $90 camera with batteries included I guess I just expected new batteries.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Poor quality photos.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I discovered that in order to get a picture into my computer I need a custom USB adapter cord. Another 12 bucks....  I don't like getting nicked 12 bucks for for a piece of wire worth, I would say, about 29 cents that should have come with the thing. Any decent company includes the adapter cord, plus, generally, a few other cords you might need. Not this outfit.,Camera isn't bad. Simple and fits anywhere.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Upon receiving the camera, I could tell I wouldn't like it. It's very small. I put it away with the intent to use it right away, but kept leaving it at home. When I did get around to using it, I was not impressed with the quality of photos and just the overall functionality of it. I really wanted to like it, so I held on to it and told myself I just had to get used to it. I kept it in a camera bag with my other Kodak instant camera and when I took it out again to use it, the camera wouldn't work. The lens wouldn't open, somehow it got jammed. Not sure how because I took very good care of it and I kept it in the same bag with my Kodak and the Kodak works perfectly fine. Heck, I've even dropped my Kodak instant camera and it STILL works two years later. Luckily, I was still within my warranty window so I set up a repair. I returned the camera on May 21st and we are now in July and I have yet to get my camera back. I keep checking for repair updates and it's been in "repair on hold" status for weeks. Unfortunately, it's too late for me to return it and get my money back but I would if I could in a heartbeat. I purchased this camera with the intent on having a camera I could travel around with and take pictures instead of always using my phone since the phone battery dies out fast. I'm not a pro with camera's so I wanted something of good quality but affordable and easy to use. Spend the extra money and get something worth it - this one isn't.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have use the camera to take about 500 photos [at 16mp] and 20 videos [at 720P]. The quality of both photos and videos suprised me. Even at full 60X zoom [in sun], the photos were focused and the colors pretty accurate. Indoor photos with flash had to be white balanced but came out pretty good; though I liked the color balance better without flash. When I am watching these photos on my 27" monitor they are pretty good; however, if I digitally zoom in 2 or 3 steps, the photos pixilate, show noise [especially when camera automatically switched to iso 400 or greater] or indicate they were not focused over the entire photo [espec. if depth of field was over 10-20 meters]. Check out sample of Panama Canal on a rainy/cloudy day, and statue in Guatamala on a sunny day with plants.,But for a camera with a 1/2.3" sensor and such a great flexibility in lenses and shooting mode- I am very happy with the quality of photos and videos I got with this camera. I recommend it to anyone who wants a fairly cheap and light, very flexible super zoom camera; and doesn't need the photo quality of a DSLR or 4/3 camera,

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Perfect pocket camera.  Much better than smart phones.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: I should have read the description better. It takes 2 AA batteries!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera simply because of the awesome zoom range... I believe it's the only super zoom camera with the 20 to 1200mm range. At $227 price here on Amazon, it's just one heck of a deal if you ask me. Is the photo quality as good as  $3000 to 5000 dollar large sensor camera's with 2 or 3 different expensive zoom lenses that you'd have to have to get this same zoom range? No, but it's a few thousand dollars less expensive too!,Now, with that being said, I am actually pretty pleased with the image quality out of this camera and even find the low light abilities to be pretty good as well. I don't need to use the flash even inside with low lighting and the pictures come out pretty good. This camera has numerous different settings, more than I'll ever use. But I find the automatic settings work great for almost everything I want to do. I'm not a professional and not a photography nut either.... but I'd say this camera gives me as good of pictures as any I have ever owned... and given that's even when using the massive 60X zoom, I am VERY pleased with this camera.,The video recording works pretty good on this camera too. Now don't be fooled by Panasonic saying it will do 60fps, this just isn't true and is a mis-leading thing Panasonic puts out there. If you look at the specs where they say it can do 60fps, you'll see an asterisk that says the sensor output is at 30fps.... you know what that means? It means this camera will only give you 30fps output, not 60fps. They arrive at 60fps by duplicating frames. So you really aren't recording at 60fps. This is not an issue for me with most of my video recording and the video out of this camera actually looks very nice. But if I am recording something with lots of high speed motion, I would use my Sony Camcorder or GoPro so I have the actual 60 or 120 fps recording speeds.,In conclusion without getting into techy stuff, for this price range, and having the massive 60X zoom, I'd say this camera performs exceedingly well! I find the auto modes just simply produce great pictures very consistently, it just works! It also has many manual settings you can use as well, so I think it's a great all around camera. I think this is the camera I will use most often.,I've attached some pictures to show the quality in varying lighting conditions. I've ordered them in sequence so you can see the zoom progression from near to far. All these pics were taken in intelligent Auto mode, except for a couple that I shot in HDR.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Wow what a camera!  I have had many, many cameras over the years from film to digital.  This is for me the best I have ever owned.  I love the way it takes pictures and all of the options available through its settings.  I bought this camera after doing lots of research and decided to pay a bit more so I could have both a wide angle and long lens in one camera.  I have a Canon with lots of lenses but truth be told I no longer want to be lugging around a heavy camera bag and tripod.  With the Lumix I can point and shoot or adjust speed and aperture to my hearts content.  My vacation has been greatly enhanced with this camera and the shots I have taken are vastly superior to anything I can take with my cell phone.  It has a number of creative settings which function like filters for close-ups, scenery or special effects.  It also does double duty as a 4k film camera for short takes.  I also like the Panorama setting that allows you to get a wide landscape shot to capture more of the surrounding environment.  One caution is to be very careful when ordering extra rechargeable batteries.  By mistake I bought a battery that fit perfectly but would not charge.  When I investigated further it turned out to be a battery for the FZ70.  So be extra careful and make sure the battery is for the FZ80.  Also, on that note the camera thus far has held up to a full day of photography.  I have had to recharge at the end of each day so having extra batteries on hand is a good idea.,This is a very nice piece of photographic equipment.  No complaints thus far and I can recommend it without hesitation.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: You get what you pay for please note takes 2 AA batteries

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Just not happy with this camera.  Bought it to replace my Canon Power Shot A1100IS for a higher pixel count.  Unfortunately, the Nikon Cool Pix falls short in it's performance.  Sorry I bought it.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Bought this for my wife.  This is a great camera suitable for either an entry level photographer or as an all around general purpose unit with features beyond the price point.,Some negative? reviews about features seem unfounded.  For a guy who grew up on Nikon and owned as many as 4 bodies at once this is highly recommended.  If they made a high end unit I could be swayed.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This camera is a great step up from a simple point and shoot, while keeping all the usefulness of a point and shoot.  The zoom is incredible, and of course requires steady hands to get the best shot possible.  That said, the image stabilizer helps and you can actually take reasonably clear shots zoomed in by hand.  I was at a ball game the other night, and from my seat, the entire park fit in the frame of a single picture.  Zooming in, without digital zoom (60x), the batter would fill more than the screen and I was able to see footprints in the dirt...,I also took the camera to the races, and after a handful of attempts was able to get a classic picture with a clear car and blurry background.  That takes a little more skill to accurately track the car so it remains clear.  Easy to use, and the battery life actually lasted much, MUCH, longer than I was expecting.  Leaving the camera on, allowing it to sleep when it wants, I would be able to take fairly nonstop pictures all day I did buy 2 extra (generic) batteries as I plan to take this on a two week trip to Peru, but I am confident that it will have enough life.  The camera does have some weight to it but is easy to use.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Brings me closer to the birds, than my 24x zoom, and wasn't too expensive.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: For years, I've debated what camera to take birding. The choice is between being a BIRDER, that is, using binoculars to look at birds, and being a BIRD PHOTOGRAPHER, more interested in the great photo than spotting everything. Fortunately, I have had the good luck to travel with photographers, leaving me free to spend time looking. I've considered getting the gear necessary to take good photos, but the investment, both in dollars and weight, is significant.,Finally, a camera comes along made for people like me. It is small and light enough to carry around all day, yet capable of taking great photos. The lens extends to provide 60x optical zooming, coupled with superior image stabilizing firmware that I find myself snapping away. If the birds are distant, well, you at least have a record shot. However, when you have one reasonably close, you may get a real keeper.,I love this camera and it will be part of my birding equipment from now on.,The only minor complaint I have is that it doesn't seem to have an option to recharge the battery using the USB cable, meaning that you have to pack yet another battery charger on a long trip.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It is a very good camera for the price BUT I would not buy it again for some reasons:,1. The quality of the lens is not very good, there is a lot of chromatic aberration whenever you use the optical zoom.,2. As happened with another Lumix I had (FZ30), there is a lot of noise whenever you use an ISO higher than 100. I compared images taken with this camera and a Canon Powershot A710is (under the same circumstances and similar settings) and when you amplify the image in your monitor at the point that you can see the pixels, there is a lot more noise on the images taken with the Lumix.,Other than that, the video is very nice, and the optical zoom is simply unbelievable.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This camera is AMAZING!!! I cannot say enough about it, honestly. Let's start with the camera quality itself. It looks and feels incredibly expensive... hard to believe a camera this nice is so affordable. It has a nice weight and is sturdy in your hands. The design makes it easy and comfortable to hold. It has a viewfinder as well as a digital display, making it versatile. Next, its functionality. The zoom capability is UNBELIEVABLE. I could zoom in to see freckles on my dad's face from across a parking lot, and I am not exaggerating. The picture quality is professional-level. I have yet to try the HD video feature but I look forward to it- I have no doubt it will be as exceptional as the rest of the features. Finally, the cost. This camera was not that much more expensive than most small point and shoot cameras, but the quality of both the camera itself and the pictures it takes is exponentially higher than its less expensive counterparts. I am truly shocked that an amateur like myself can afford to own such an excellent camera, and furthermore be capable of operating such a camera without any expertise. I highly recommend this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Everything about this product and the seller is awesome!  Item arrived quick, safe and sound.  From the moment I grabbed the camera I could feel the quality and it does take awesome pictures.  Focus is clear, exposure in automatic mode is spot on and the range of the lens makes it the perfect one camera does it all solution.  I am going to sell my multi lens DSLR because this is a lot more convenient and with equal or better results.  Extreme zoom situations best use tripod.  You will not be disappointed!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: love my camera.  takes great pix and runs on standard batteries...so great for travel overseas.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Zero battery life. Never really worked. We plaeced 6-7  times new batteries (it's not chargeble).,Don't buy this camera!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Great camera

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: bought it for work, does what is expeted

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I bought this camera to use in our office as a point and shoot to take pictures of our patients.  The camera took blurry pictures and now after less than 6 months of use the lens is broken.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This is a great little camera for everyday use. I have been happy with mine.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This camera is easy to use, takes nice pictures and uses 2 AA batteries.  It was exactly what we wanted.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Nice - nothing fancy. Battery life is a little shorter than I would like. But good photos.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: This model was riddled with problems and Kodak discountinued it for good reason.,Tried three different (brand new) memory cards and every one couldn’t be read by the camera or even formatted. “Memory card error” every time & Kodak informed me they can’t even offer support on discontinued models

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Cheap

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I bought this camera, and admittedly I was a little skeptical because of the reviews I have seen that have been posted. However, after purchasing the camera and using it myself I can honestly say that I don’t know how half of these reviews came to be. One review demo’d the video quality and when I watched the video the video quality didn’t look that great. Now that I have the camera and can view things personally, I can say that the camera actually has pretty good image quality. I would say it might even come close to IPhone picture quality and that’s saying something. The additional lens is pretty nice. There’s just certain shots you want to be super close up on.,Thank you for reading my review, If you found it helpful I would really appreciate the helpful vote.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This digital camera is amazing I bought this camera because I have four kids and I’m one of those moms who takes tons of pictures of everything my kids do lol I’ve owned several different digital cameras and honestly this camera is one of my favs by far it really does take wonderful pictures the pictures don’t come out kinda blurry like some other camera the pictures are surprisingly clear very impressed this camera is super easy to use and change the lens truthfully the camera is very lightweight I can just stick it in my purse with no problems which is always a plus for me ❤️

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Bought this to replace my branded mirrorless camera as i have dropped it and it broke into several pieces. the price for this is competitive. i am just an amateur user for camera so having read the instructions more or less it is easy to operate and use it. Pictures are clear and crisp as it can be. the design can be comparable when the point and shoot digital camera first appear on the market. Design is a classic one so i really liked it. Wifi connection is superb and it removes the inconvenience when copying photos over to a device.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I needed a camera for my Vlogging, and picture taking. I wanted something that is good quality and not so expensive. When I purchased this, I was not too sure about the quality, but after I tried it, I was amazed. The lens changing is a big plus, and the weight is just right. I found that setting up the recording or taking picture is very easy, and the quality and price are just right. I’m happy with this purchase and the way the camera looks. Recommended

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This camera is light and easy to use. The style is very noglastic for me. The camera comes not 1 but 2 rechargeable batteries which is a plus. You do have to plug the charger into the camera to charge it up. There’s no separate battery charger. I also wished the flip out screen could rotate but at this price point, it’s pretty good. The photo and audio quality is decent but can get a little blurrier when zoomed at its maximum. It’s a great compact camera.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: it really has a very good image quality the photos come out very clear and take very long distance photos very clear the battery is very durable when it has a bag where you keep the camera very nice so that the camera does not scratch or anything I loved

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: Good quality and affordable. I like the classic look. The style reminds me of the early days when I had a film roll camera.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This camera is very easy to set up and use. It comes with an ultra-wide lens which is able to capture images vividly I love the fact that it has wifi function. so I can view and edit on the go. The battery last pretty long and sufficient. More importantly, it can be used as a webcam if you just happen to Skype somebody. The image quality is pretty good as well.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: I like this camera because it's small and not too heavy like my older camera. I brought this on our beach trip last week. So far it's all good. The quality of pictures and videos were fine. It's not that bad! Battery were great too, it lasted for a day. It might not be one of those high tech camera. But this one is very cute and fancy. I like it.

product_name: Digital Camera Video Camera Vlogging YouTube Recorder HD1080P 30FPS 24.0MP 3.0 Inch Flip Screen 16X Digital Zoom WiFi Camera with Wide Angle Lens and 2 Batteries
review: This camera is small and cute. It is very easy to set up and use. The picture quality is really good.  I am surprised by how well it works for how little it costs. I can definitely recommend this to everyone, especially those who are tight on budget but needed something that will allow them to capture the moment.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: all the easy to use features you need at a brilliant low price. If you want a easy to use point & shoot camera that gives sharp pictures at a low price you really can't go wrong

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: This is an absolute great camera! It is a great value for the money. It takes great pictures. I would recommend this product to anyone!I bought this camera as a gift to my nephew. He is 6 years old. The camera is light and cute for him. He likes it very much.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Build quality is good rather than outstanding (as you’d expect at this price point). The device itself is plastic, as are all the buttons, but you still get an excellent image quality for the money, and the ability to shoot in infra-red is a huge bonus.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Lovely little camera, came well packed and before delivery date.my family set this camera up for me i would recommend I love this camera,Great little camera and good value for money

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: The ease of use and picture quality are excellent. Can't fault it for the price.Good camera, Very good quality pics, easy mode does everything for you.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Nice tini camera, my favorites red ! With solf small hand bag with .easy hood ! I will give too my 12 year old niece birthday gilf!Not bad for its price. Image is fairly good. It comes with a usb charger so it’s convinient when it comes to charging

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography

review: Exactly what i wanted. Perfect size and easy to use. It's bigger than most cameras but it's worth it for the larger pictures.
