product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I purchased this camera back at Christmas time and have used it numerous times. I chose it mainly for its zooming features and am most pleased with how things have worked out and pleasantly surprised by the additional features I am still learning about.,Photography is my hobby so this review is coming from that angle. The pictures are crisp and clear. I only have enlarged one (8x10) that I did use the zoom feature on and it came out lovely.,I guess it is a personal preference but I love the feel of the camera in my hands and the quality of the photos. Again I am an amateur and just like to walk about and take some photos and print some of them up or post them on tumblr. I receive good feedback on my posts on tumblr so I am going to say others find the color and quality of the photos to fine as well.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is a very light weight camera with a great zoom. However, you can spend hours trying to solve problems to set functions to what you want. The menu in the camera is not all there is. Downloading the full manual would have helped if I could find the menu item in the camera to begin with! The menu is not at all intuitive and the places where settings are buried is very confusing.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is a great camera.  I have to admit this is the first really nice camera that I have purchased in several years but it has exceeded my expectations.  The zoom on this camera is impressive.  I was looking for a camera that would take great photos and video, it has exceeded my expectations for both of these requirements.  I was really suprised by the clarity even when using the extended digital zoom.  In the past when I have used the digital zoom on other cameras the picture quality was horrible.  The digital zoom on this camera produces pretty good photos.  I have been playing around with several of the features on this camera but still have a lot to learn.  I think this camera's options will satisfy most users.  If you just want to point and shoot you can always use the automatic settings which produce fantastic pictures.  For the price and quality, this camera is hard to beat.  So far the battery life is great, I have taken several hundred photos (mostly w/o flash) and taken probably an hours worth of video, the battery is still about 1/4-1/2 full.  I would highly recommend this purchase.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: A quick, short review is all that is needed.  This is a bridge camera and not a dslr so with that in mind, this camera for the money is the best you can do.  I have had lots of bridge cameras from all makes (even the Canon SX50 which is a very good camera, but with crazy set up controls and too small), but this one beats them all taking the cost into account.  The zoom is phenomenal especially if you set the camera to 7MP and put it on a tripod.  This zoom should be illegal!!  Or you can shoot at the 16MP and go to 60x and get a great shot.  Sure it has some weak points like no tilting LCD, but every camera has its weak points. IQ clarity is a strength for this camera.  With the price it is selling for on Amazon, I should buy another one.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Love it!!!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have used this camera for almost two years (about 6,000 pictures so far), and I love the camera - especially the 60x optical zoom.  It takes remarkably good pictures in very low light situations, too.,For the last several months though, I have been struggling with a rear dial which has stretches where it ignores rotation (or worse, responds as if I were rotating it in the opposite direction).  As the camera is virtually useless without a functioning rear dial, I was rather disturbed.,Then I remembered I had recently had problems with my computer's mouse. After an internet search, I found that breathing on the mouse button area - getting some humid air inside the mouse - fixed the problem for me.,Having nothing to lose, I tried the same thing this morning with my camera, putting my mouth over the rear dial and exhaling several times to force humid air inside the camera.  Much to my surprise - and relief - it worked.  This sure saved me from having to buy a new camera - at least for now!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Ordered when my 2nd FZ200 finally bit the dust...I thought I would try a different model.  Some things are slightly different but overall, the same quality I have come to love from Panasonic.  I do think there is a bit of a difference in the lens (Lumix vs Leica) but not enough to matter to most folks.  Love the extra zoom...just use a tripod or be very steady.  I am still learning how this particular camera works but in no time it will be an extension of my arm just as the previous ones were.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Very powerful camera with great resolution, albeit, the processor is quite slow.  I used it to photograph my Nephew playing high school football.  I could zoom in and get great shots of him from almost anywhere on the field.  The resolution is wonderful, even when zoomed all the way.  Note that, in low light, high zoom photos, the camera will take 2-3 seconds between photos so if you're looking for rapid-fire action shots, get a different camera.  For the price & features and what I needed for occasional shots, it's perfect.  The optical zoom is fantastic.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: easy use,

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX A10
review: Use it every day for work. Exactly what we need

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have used this camera for a year now. Excellent pictures. Many different controls on the dial, but I tend to use the 'automatic' artificial intelligence mode most. Scenic modes give good results though on the sunset mode the reds seemed more enhanced. Good sharp pictures. Zoom is amazing.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I am an experienced photographer and looked for a camera with long zoom.  Main reason to not to lug around different lenses. Product has manual features to adjust the Exposure and ISO however the result from the camera is very poor in lesser than normal light.  quite disappointed I spend 300 dollars on a product that did not meet my needs.  It is definitely not a supplement to anyone looking to have an alternate to a DSLR.  it is just a point and shoot travel product like any other point and shoot.  attached couple of pictures straight out from camera.  one of them is at high zoom (1200) on an evening light and i am not happy with the result.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This review isn't for the camera, but for the SD card that is being erroneously recommended by Amazon to be purchased with the camera. The Panasonic Lumix DC-FZ80 needs either a SDHC or SDXC card; and the specifications for that card should be (or be better than) UHS-I Speed Class 3 (the symbol is a large letter U, with a 3 inside of the U), and C10 (a large letter C, with a 10 inside the C). This is the minimum needed to shoot 4K Video.,The recommended SD card is UHS-I Speed Class 1, & C10; which is insufficent.

review: At first I thought this camera is garbage I charged it for a long time because I thought that was  the problem so the next day I was playing with it and it still wouldn't come on so I looked at reviews and /i looked at videos to see if I had put everything in right and I found why it didn't come on . Th battery wasn't pushed far enough for the black latch inside to catch so after doing that, it came on and works like a charm. Nice thin design that will help me with all my photography needs. If you don't want to spend thousand and thousands on a camera right now this is your best bet. I  need a wonderful digital camera that has wonderful quality when I'm taking shots of my products and this a wonderful camera!

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This camera meets all the basics of a compact, budget digital camera.  The pictures were good quality.  My biggest complaint about this camera is the very slow recharge time between taking photos.  Yes, there is a "burst mode" to take many pictures in just a few seconds, but this will not use the flash.  When you take a picture, there is a short delay, the picture shows for 10-15 seconds for a review, then a short delay before you can take the next picture.  This is not acceptable to me, but what can I do?  I could not find any settings to change this, could not find any instructions that explained this.,I was not too upset when I dropped the camera in the river and fried it.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This camera takes good pictures, but you have to make sure you are in a well-lit area although it has a flash on it.  Otherwise, the pictures come out dark, but overall I am very pleased with it.  Also, please note that it does not come equipped with a memory card, so you have to purchase one separately.  I would recommend this camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I use this camera for writing estimates that have to be sent on the internet. So pictures are taken at very low Megapixels so they transmit without creating large file sizes. Photo taking action is pretty slow but the pictures seem to come out good. We have to let the auto focus finish adjusting before a picture is taken so it doesn't get blurry. I would try and do action photos.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Had an earlier model which doesn't work because I can't recharge it.  I accidentally used the wrong camera's USB plug in on this camera and ruined the recepticle.  So be very careful putting your cord in because Sony's cords do not match other similar type cameras.  Otherwise this model is very easy to use and takes nice pictures.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Great little camera for the money.  It is small enough to fit in a small purse or jacket pocket but takes nice photos.  I got this for a trip to Disney and my photos turned out great.  Recommend this camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This is the neatest little camera.  I bought it for a weekend visit to the  mountains in the fall.  So handy just kept it in my pocket,  So easy  just point and shoot.  I have several other cameras but they are more complicated and take more time.  The pictures turned out as well as my more expensive cameras. This has become my favorite camera  for everything.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I'll probably only be able to update with more experience with it within a couple of months (1Q'14, when I'll be able to take a lot of real world situation photos, but here is what I tough so far from some tests.,I'm currently upgrading from a Canon SX20 IS and was considering Canon SX50 and Fujifilm X-S1 (both around $30-40 more expensive by the time of purchase). Since I tend to take a lot of photos indoor with poor illumination, some reviews I've read set my mind towards FZ70 and its 20mm wide.,What I like:,- 20mm wide: it allows me to cover a lot of width without having to step back much. My previous camera has 28mm and other cameras in this range has 24 or 25mm, tipically.,- 1200mm tele: SX50 has the same ammount of tele, but my SX20 maxes at 560mm.,- internal memory: not that I intend to run around without a SD card, but internal memory can be a life saver and it allowed for immediate photos after unpacking, since I didn't bought a new SD card (and my current one was very far).,- easy to open battery compartment: my SX20 has a battery compartment that is a bit tricky to open. On FZ70, you just slide a switch and it opens. Closing is just as easy.,- image quality: my main reason to upgrade. Of course, I fully expected a decent improvement since SX20 is a 2009 camera while FZ70 is 4 years newer. Still, it's quite noticeable when I looked at details while at 100% image size under low light.,What I disliked:,- Fixed lcd: SX20 has a variable angle lcd viewer (so does SX50), while FZ70 has a fixed one. I almost gave up on buying when I saw it didn't have a variable one, since it's so useful for selfies, seeing what is on it when the camera is too high or to low while mount on tripods and such.,- Proprietary USB connector: while most cameras allow USB connection by providing a mini-usb port, Panasonic decided to go with something else and so you're stuck with their cables.,- Battery: it was another factor that almost interfered with this choice. It's mostly personal preference, but I'd prefer if it used 4 AA batteries instead of a proprietary li-ion one. I use Sanyo Eneloops in my SX20 and have been happy with their duration (I can shoot 12h of video without needing to replace them). Also, I could buy some alcalines should necessity arises.,- No lens hood: it's a pity there are no lens hood in the box. My SX20 came with one. It's a cheap piece of plastic that'd be easy and inexpensive for Panasonic to add in the bundle.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've had this camera for a while now and the thing has been my baby. I love using it, but I have noticed a few flaws as well. It's a cheaper option for superzoom bridge cameras, so keep that in mind while you read about these pros and cons.,Pros:,- cheap for the technology, especially with the high zoom,- excellent 60X zoom,- clear, crisp pictures in good lighting,- fairly durable (mine has taken some hits),- small enough to fit in a backpack without too much worry,- wide angle lens and very good image stabilization,- has a decent viewfinder,- long battery life,- sensitive microphone for picking up audio,- able to have zoom even further increased with a telephoto adapter,Cons:,- the manual focus feature is a joke, it's practically unusable,- forget about manual settings too since it takes too much time to set,- it loves to autofocus on whatever is behind the subject,- the shutter speed is horribly slow (I've missed a ton of birds because of this),- mediocre in color and contrast,- practically useless in low light conditions (especially since you can't connect a remote shutter),- moisture has gotten in and appeared behind the lens on humid days,I still love this camera, but if I could go back in time I'd buy a Sony instead.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: After 1 year I still have not used all the features. Still my go-to camera!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The price to performance is unbeatable here this camera my not do well in low light, doesn't have the best menu system, or even let you change lenses BUT comparing a 1080p video from this camera next to my Lumix G7 both shot in AVCHD in good lighting conditions the only way I could tell the difference is looking at meta data and knowing the sensors give a different crop affect. To be completely honest this camera is a steal for $250 get one while they still have them!!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is a great bridge camera. Excellent images that are very sharp but with perhaps somewhat overly aggressive in camera sharpening. Very nice wide angle shots and relatively fast at 2.8. Overall extremely pleased to date and would recommend. I'm a novice but seasoned photographer and have had several film and digital cameras. I primarily use an Olympus micro four thirds system and would say this cameral could become my camera of choice for its versatility.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: well i tried it today for the first time. it is a little complicated... but i put it in smart mode, and could not believe the pictures that came out of this camera.. i cannot wait until the eagles come back to florida.. it will be awesome. one of the best purchases i have ever made... thanks panasonic. taking bird photos has just become an amazing hobby with this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Did alot of research on what to buy. Figured out I wanted the ability to adjust settings but didnt want to have to read a book to use EVERY time. Its a great combo and takes fantastic photos.  For the price..you cannot go wrong. The zoom....is amazing.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Absolutely incredible camera.  I have gotten close ups of birds that normally would take a 400 to 500mm lens.  It works wonderfully in good light.  However in low light or if there is a lot of movement, the camera has trouble focusing but in good light and without fast movement, the camera is miraculous.  I love it and bought one for my son, who was also astonished by its lens power. I highly recommend it even though it has the flaws I mentioned. The animal pictures it has taken are of National Geographic picture quality.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Amazing camera. Takes high end photos and great micro. You can't go wrong with this camera. It's great for beginners or experienced. I enjoy the automatic settings over my big daddy cannon for infant and children photography it keeps up better with the content movement which helps capture pictures without messing with constant changing of specs.

review: Buying this camera was the best decision I made! I have been looking for a good deal on a nice camera for a while and happened upon this gem.The camera not only is amazing in quality, it also came along with a lot of extras that I didn't even know I would need. This is an amazing deal. To anyone just starting out in photography or doing this for fun, don't pass up on this offer. Everything that it came with works, the shipping was fast and nothing was damaged when it arrived. Hope this review helps as I am also one to religiously look through every comment on a product before purchasing.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Unfortunately I did not realize there is a 30 day return policy and I purchased this early as a birthday gift.  I just set it up and tested it (so it would be ready as soon as the gift was open) and quickly realized I cannot give this as a gift.  The picture quality is terrible.  Even with making constant adjustments to exposure, etc., it is difficult to get a decent picture.  I was not expecting a miracle camera at this price, but I did expect decent pictures.  There were so many good reviews!  I don't get it.  Anyway, I am purchasing a different camera.

review: I just recently purchased this camera bundle and I am still getting acquainted with the use of the camera but I will state that I am impressed. Especially with the zoom and the clarity of the pictures that it takes.,The bundle that comes with the camera is exceptional. Considering if you were to look for this camera in other stores (ie. Best Buy) you would only be offered the camera and the price was about the same.,This camera replaces a Panasonic Lumix that has not been working properly and doesn't have near the scene modes as my Panasonic but the clarity of the pictures from this camera (powershot) along with the larger viewing screen has me excited that I purchased it.,The Imaging World was wonderful in providing quality products as well in the additional items.,I would have given it 5 stars if the camera itself had more scene modes, but I will say the The Imaging World deserves a 5 star rating. If you're looking to purchase a Powershot, I'd recommend checking The Imaging World to buy from.

review: The camera is tiny (in a good way), it fits in smallest pocket. Picture quality is superb. I also like the fact that it comes with both US and European charger.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Handy little companion. Fits in a pocket easily yet takes big camera pictures. I had a 16 MP Sony that was easier to use and seemed to take clearer pictures but broke less than 6 months after purchase. This one is its replacement and is serving me well.  My travels have taken it to six countries and thousands of pictures. Great little work horse and so easy to carry along.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: As a former professional photographer, I was seriously underwhelmed by this camera. For $120, you'd expect something that would, at the very least, produce sharp images. This one doesn't. But there are times when I don't want, or can't, or didn't bring along my big Nikons with all of my interchangeable lenses, filters, lens hoods and tripods; times when I simply want something small, portable to take quick images, to record a place I might want to lug all of my equipment back to, or simply to quickly record an event. Well...I spent a week testing the DSC W830, both indoors and outdoors. I do mostly nature and wildlife photography, not people. I don't need a camera that detects smiles or faces: trees, rocks, mountains, wildflowers, and squirrels don't smile! I just wanted something to take some quick, but sharp images. The autofocus on this camera is less accurate than expected. And though it supposedly focuses at about five centimeters (two inches), this unit did a very poor job. Frankly, the camera in a smartphone can do a better job.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Buenas fotos. La batería dura poco.  Los videos no duran más de 30 minutos.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I have the RX100 (which I love) but I wanted a second, truly pocketable, camera that I can carry around and won''t have to worry about at all. But a camera that still takes good pictures.  This camera does exactly what I wanted it to do.  I don't have to worry about it, it is small, and it still makes excellent images.  Sometimes I have to tweak the images but that's true with any camera that I have owned, including the RX!00.  I simply import the images to my iPad, and then I play around with them.  Great camera, amazing price!

We told her if she can take care of this camera for a few years, she can get an adult camera but she has to prove she can be responsible with this one. product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have had this camera for quite a while now, it has worked flawlessly. This camera has met and surpassed my expectations, it was left outside in the rain and after putting it in rice it works fine. The zoom is amazing and the close up shots are even better, the battery last all day and then some and the wifi capabilities are a life saver. The only thing I wish was different would be the sensor size, its a little too small, when zoomed in you will lose some clarity and definition, over all its an incredible camera for the price.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have had this camera for about 6 months now and I couldn't of asked for a better camera. It is great for starting out as a beginner photographer. Easy to set up and travel with. I take it everywhere I go around the country. A great buy. Thank you!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I replaced my FZ70 with this one and what an improvement!  4k video, raw, multiple special effects and it uses the same battery so I never run out of juice.  I have shared my advanced compact journey with lumix starting with 12x to 24x to 48x and now 60x zoom and 6mp up to the current 18. Just took 64GB of photos and videos in New Zealand without any glitches.  I also have a DSLR which was largely ignored because of the ease and range of the Lumix.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Great macro shots, even better getting close up of distant items. I was able to take a picture of a rock in a waterfall that was several hundred feet away and it came out clear as a bell.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I love the FZ70, at least what I've figured out how to use. It's quite a complex camera(at least for a digitally confused man), the instructions are relatively adequate, but going on to U-tube I was able to see some of the workings in action. Probably just how I learn better, see one do one kinda thing. But the photos are beautiful and when using a tripod I got some terrific shots of the moon that showed more than I'd been able to get with previous cameras. It has a multitude of scene variations as well as numerous programs that do most anything you would want a camera to do, from total automatic to total manual operation and anything in between.,I was able to purchase a factory refurb unit for a great savings, and I believe from the reviews and what I've experienced from the limited use so far I believe I found a real diamond in the rough !

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is the only camera on our 2 weeks cruise trip.  Good to shot whole day with one charge at night.  Good for all scenes.  Excellent for low light and very fast with moving subjects without flashlight.  Little bit heavy than regular snapshot cameras but with much dSLR quality and no need to carry set of lens.  When shot pictures, I hold it with one hand without problem so it's fine with me.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This camera is amazing! Haven't tried ALL the functions, yet; but what I have tried so far is truly breathtaking. The one photo that I took of the Moon really took me by surprise; the clarity! WOW! Shipping came on time. Very satisfied.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: My wife and I had been in the market for some time for a high-quality, relatively easy-to-use camera that would be especially great for non-professionals like us who like taking quality travel/nature photos and has good zoom.  We did not want to jump into the DSLR arena, but wanted to get shots as-close-as-possible.  After painstakingly researching media and reviews for all of the latest models in this category, I couldn't pass up the deal on this Lumix FZ70.,I have to say, I feel this camera is one of the best value purchases I've ever made.  First of all, the exterior fit, finish, and feel inspire immediate confidence, as the materials used and weightiness of the device exude quality.  Not chintzy at all.  I tested and compared the Canon SX50 in-store, and while that is also a very capable camera, the Lumix just feels and looks so much more high-quality in person.  Secondly, the ease of use and capability of taking great photos right out of the box, especially in iAuto mode was astonishing.  We were immediately taking awesome photos of our pets up close, and distant birds and squirrels out in the yard on full 60X zoom, with nice bokeh effect and great color and quality.  If the lighting outdoors leaves something to be desired, some of the quick post-processing effects can be implemented to immediately color-up, sharpen, brighten, etc to produce beautiful images with little effort.  Image stabilization is top-notch, as I have been able to take several long-zoom outdoor shots without a tripod with ease, just using simple technique tricks like using the viewfinder while bracing elbows against the body, etc.  Auto-focus is fast and accurate, burst shooting mode is also wonderful, as it greatly increases your odds of getting that perfect shot without any noticeable extra effort on your part.,Although I know there are many reviews that nit-pick on various things such as indoor photo quality, my use of the camera indoors has produced very good results, with a nice flash that doesn't wash out pictures at all.  I feel that for the average user who wants to shoot photos above the capabilities of the average point-and-shoot that appear 'professional' to 95% of viewers, you can't go wrong with this camera.  I have an aging Canon PowerShot SD1100IS small handheld that has taken some amazing photos for me through the last several years, and this Lumix FZ70 with its amazing zoom capabilities is the perfect natural progression to the next level.  At this price point, you can't go wrong.  Highly recommended!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Bought it for my mom. So easy to use as the buttons are pretty simple for someone not as electronically savvy as the generation these days. Changed to a different language too so she can utilize it better. Compact size for easy storage when traveling.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Had this less than a month. Had a dmc-fz10 before.  Very nice update.  Clear pictures, easy to use. Did take me some time to work out how to adjust manual exposure and such. The printed manual is very basic but finding some of the settings on the camera is not.  Amazing lens stabilization. I have a hand tremor and can still shoot at full zoom.  From macro to full tele, range is great and picture quality only limited by my talent, or lack thereof, as a photographer.  I don't want to have to haul around multiple lenses, but want to do most of what a full DSLR can do so this is an ideal camera. I'm not sure what the advantage would be of a DSLR.  I got a refurbished one for just over $200, and at that price it was well worth it. Not sure if would have paid full new retail price but even that is cheaper than decent DSLR.  Time will tell as to how it holds up. My old fz10 is still taking great pictures, 10 years on and I expect the same from this one.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This is my favorite camera. Switched over from my Canon and I am loving it. The quality and speed are amazing.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Best camera ever!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This is the full frame camera I have been waiting for.  I have been a Leica Camera user for many years, but recently I have more need on the videography side since I started a YouTube channel.  I need a camera that can cover all my need for videos, and a good full frame sensor for me to use with my Leica lenses as well.,Besides the good 4K video capability, the great low light performance really help in many situation.  I no longer looking for expensive zoom lens with f2.8, a f4 lens can pretty much cover all my need for my YouTube video production.  I feel confident to use up to ISO800 and above (I always keep my studio well lit for videos, but for slow motion shots I will need to increase ISO to keep the 180 degree shutter speed).,If you also plan to use Leica M lenses or another vintage lens like me sometimes, I found the 50mm focal length and above works better with adapter.  If you need to 35mm or wider, you might get some vignetting at the corner.  Each lens performance differently depends on the optical design, but modern lens usually works better.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Love it

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)

Sony overtook canon a little while ago in innovation, and their cameras are just better in general now. This is coming from a canon enthusiast so you know this camera is good! I’ve only had it for about a week and a half but it is so fun to use, definitely a great buy and worth the money

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Bad to the Bone. Get yourself one!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Proof of excellence from Sony again...,Classic and many advantages except touch functionality for all operations in basic model. I dont think this is a basic model. Great one...

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I am glad to get this a7iii on April 2018 because it’s now shortage. Very nice camera, the focus Speed is extremely fast, the battery size is large, able to make 4K video, touch mon and joystick.....that’s the specification everybody want, and Sony have put all of them inside a7iii, That’s why the demand is so strong, my friend quick sell his a7r2 and buy this one.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: At this point, I have had the A7iii for a couple months now and have clicked roughly 3000 images - mainly of family, pets, and my 6 months old babygirl. I can honestly say that these are some of the best images I have ever clicked and that this camera has helped elevate my photography to a whole new level. I would recommend it to anyone in a heartbeat!,A little background and more details...,I had been a dedicated Canon user for 10+ years with 70D (APS-C sensor) for my last camera. Unfortunately that camera had front and back focusing issues even though I had micro-adjusted all my lenses to it. I was so used to clicking 3-4 extra images for those can't-miss moments just to be sure one of them was a keeper.,Earlier this year, I decided to go full-frame and lucky for me, Sony had just announced the A7iii with features that were years ahead of anything Canon/Nikon had to offer at similar price point. After weeks of reading rave reviews from pros and amateurs alike, I pulled the trigger and ordered my A7iii along with the 24-70GM lens. After 2 months of using Sony gear, I couldn't be happier with my move.,Here are a few pros and cons that you may not find in other reviews.,Pros:,- Eye AF:  The hype is real! The Eye AF works (90% of the time) incredibly well and makes it super easy to take portraits. With it on, most pictures are so razor-sharp that I can zoom into the eyes of the subject and find my own reflection. And that's not an exaggeration!,- Excellent Low-light capability:  On my Canon, I rarely pushed past 1000 ISO because of high noise in low-light images. With A7iii, I haven't purchased a flash yet so I am regularly forced to shoot in 10,000 - 12,500 range and the images still looking stunning after processing.,- Less time in post-processing:  Compared to 70D, I find that less of my images need post-processing now and the ones I do have to process take less time.,- File size:  At one point, I was seriously considering the A7(R)iii but now I am glad that I chose this camera. The 50MB files (uncompressed RAW) from this camera already make my 2014 Macbook Pro feel slightly sluggish. Can't imagine what 80-90MB files from A7Riii would have done to my computer.,Cons:,- Sony software is worthless:  the RAW processing software installed 3 different apps - a photo manager, an editor and a remote shooting app. I found the apps a pain to use so ended up uninstalling after the first week and purchased Capture One Pro.,- No built-in flash:  I personally miss having a built-in flash. In most low-light situations, I could take out my 70D from the bag and start snapping in seconds. Currently I don't own an external flash but past experience tells me it will definitely take longer to get snapping when I have to attach an external flash.,With all that said, I still rate this camera 5 stars because of the incredible difference it has already made in my photos.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: This little camera is great for a point and shoot. My daughter has been begging me to get her a camera and I wanted something nice but not expensive in case she breaks it. This camera is far better than I expected. The zoom is good and the quality is great. It’s lightweight and takes great photos.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Nothing to dislike.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Bought this camera to shoot the video.  Was looking for pocket size camera with nice fixtures, not too pricey.  It is not a well known brand however quality is nice.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Since long time I was looking to buy a mini digital camera that is handy, easy to use and small in size and then I found this mini digital camera and I decided to give it a try. After using it for several days, I feel that this is one of the best camera that one can expect to have. It is really small in size, exactly what I was looking for which easily fits in your pocket. This camera takes the best quality picture at 18 Mega pixels. It also has 8X zoom feature which is really great. I have uploaded couple of sample pictures that I have taken with this camera. I am not a professional photographer but this digital camera is so awesome that anyone can become a photographer. It is very easy to carry around this camera and this camera is better than other bulky and expensive cameras. So far I am using it without any problems and enjoying taking pictures with this camera. It comes with the software CD for editing, printing and sharing photos. I haven't used that software because I use another software for that purpose. Overall, I am highly satisfied with this digital camera and I think this camera is a great value to your money as you can take good quality pictures with it. I highly recommend this camera to everyone and I am sure that you will not be disappointed with your purchase.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: We have been wanting a cheap camera for a while, when we just don't want to use our phones or our big camera.  This one seemed to fit the bill, but I was surprised because of the price being so low. We used this on a trip to Washington, but also took some pictures around the house. The pictures came out surprisingly well! Each file is about 1 to 2 megabytes in size, and the videos are as long as you take a video. The video was what surprised my daughter the most, who takes tons of pictures. She has a $800 camera, but doesn't always like to take it out while we are walking. She used this one the entire trip and was very happy with it. It is not grainy like some other cameras, and takes very nice pictures. Not blow up 2 wall size quality, but you could blow it up to a small poster and be very happy. Specially if your picture is still. It is a solid camera, and feels like it will stand up. And for the price, you cannot beat it. It does take a SD card and not a micro SD card, but nowadays that is not a problem because they all come with adapters. We are actually going to keep this in our car for when we take short trips that way we always have it with us.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: We as a family have been doing more outdoorsy events and I hate always bringing my phone because I am afraid to lose it or break it. I wanted to get a small, lightweight camera to take with us for when we go on hikes or even for camping which we do a lot. This takes some fairly nice pictures. It zooms well, however when you zoom if you do it too close it does appear to be a little fuzzy. Maybe I just can't figure out how to use it properly, it's been a long time since I have used a real camera and not an iPhone. Overall I think this was a great product and a good price point. Well worth the money. Plus, i don't have to get scared to let my 2 year old or 7 year old take pictures.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: I wasn't expecting much from this, I only wanted a camera that was a) cheap and b) would provide a better quality image than the average smart phone camera. But the image quality is truly amazing. I will upload a few customer images of my hiking trip as an example. An SD card is absolutely necessary, the internal storage can only hold 3 maximum quality images.I did have one problem with the camera, the battery that came with it refused to take a charge. Amazon made up for this by offering me a 40% refund to buy a new battery, and the battery was much cheaper than the $31 refund I got so this issue wasn't even reason enough to take a star off. Overall great camera and great customer service from Amazon.I've only owned this for a month and only used it for 2 days for a hiking trip so I can't speak on long term survival of this camera. I will update my review if I have any other issues. Be sure to check for my customer images if you want an idea of the maximum image quality.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: This is a very simple designed camera with very easy to use interface. Though my phone can shoot great photos and videos, I like the appeal of simple point and shoot camera like this one. The image and video quality is decent, it would be foolish to compare it with a DSLR. I guess it works well as an introductory camera for kids. I remember my first digital camera when I was a teenager, it reminded me of those days. Good value when bought with discounts or coupons. I wish it came with a sd card though. This camera made me nostalgic and I am thinking of gifting it to my 10 year old nephew. I think he will love it. Flash is super bright, night mode is bit grainy but okay.  I do not do much digital zoom, but it works. Display is basic and bit laggy, so viewing on desktop would be wiser. Very simple camera, very handy, can have it as a back up or can use it just for fun. Loved the simplistic appeal and nostalgia.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: The description leads you to believe that this isn't a pro level camera and it isn't. However, it does make for an excellent first-time camera for my kids. The focus and flash work very well and while the photos may tend to be a little pixelated if you zoom too much, it's very adequate otherwise. Battery charge holds for a good time. Since the video is 720p, it's not going to provide UHD level quality but the playback suited the kids just fine. Great deal for the features you get.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography

My 4 year old  even took pictures with this camera.,Its come with a 2.7 inch LCD screen and 8X digital zoom, 18 mega pixels and it's can take pictures or record video.  Also it is Multifunction: Anti-Shake, Face Detection, Smile Capture, Continue Shot, and Self-timer.,The pictures were clear and looked to be the same quality of any other digital camera I have purchased in the past. For the price and convenient of it I recommend this digital camera.

review: This was written sometime in January 2018, but submit was never pushed. Enjoy,Everyone seemed to rave about this camera, but my crappy cell phone takes better pictures. I've tried to take pictures at my grandson's basketball games and any motion creates a blurred picture. I've tried to zoom on him while he's not even moving and that gets blurry. Point and shoot maybe at birds, but this isn't working for me. So far I have been to 3 games with it and the game today I stopped shooting because the pics were only a blur. I hope there is a simple answer because I want to like the camera. Unfortunately so far after a week this is not the case.,Update...Sent a question to the seller and his first response was image stabilization on. Well yes it was, duh. So I told them that and the next response was "Then I’m not sure what to say". Very helpful. Just spend your money on a better product as based on what I have this is junk.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: I took a chance selecting this camera case when the description stated that it was designed for the Nikon P520.  Since I knew that the P510 is sized so closely to the P520, I was pleased to find out that the MegaGear Ever Ready case would fit perfectly.  I have been looking for this type of leather case for over a year, and finally discovered this one.  The quality is excellent and highly recommend this case for being useful as the daily "go to" case.  I am using my camera much more often because this case offers excellent protection and easy portability without the bulk of a bag case.  I do not think I will ever use my old bag case again.  The leather is beautiful, classy, and will attract attention for being so distinguished from anything else.  Affordable too.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Definitely does not fit the Nikon P610.  The tripod screw does not line up with the hole on the bottom of the camera.  It's a good case but doesn't fit the Nikon P610.,It's been two months now and I'm still looking for a case like this for the P610 and still not finding one. I also don't understand how this manufacturer can list this case fitting the P610. The P610 measures 125.0 x 85.0 x 106.5 mm and the P520 is 125.2 X 84.1 X 101.6 mm. Large enough difference to NOT fit.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Unfortunately, this case which looks very nice....does not properly accommodate a Nikon P610 camera.The screw is improperly placed for the female screw receptacle in the body of the camera.,I do not know if it is properly located for any of the other models of cameras.,I am returning it and have already received the following item, which has a properly located screw. Unfortunately, the repacement is light brown and I would have preferred black.  Functionally, the replacement works great!,TechCare "Ever Ready" Protective Black Leather Camera Case Bag for Nikon Coolpix P520, Nikon CoolpixP530, Nikon Coolpix P610 Cameras Light Brown

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Works great for my Nikon Coolpix 600. I was a little hesitant because other reviewers mentioned the case was inconvenient for charging or removing the memory card, but I quickly realized that I would have to remove the camera from just about any case to do these things. The leather is beautiful, and I get lots of compliments whenever I carry the case. One thing most reviewers don't mention: the strap is not attached to the case itself, so you have the option to use the one that comes with your camera instead. I do this since the padded fabric strap my camera came with is a little more comfy than the leather one.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This case has a great retro look and a good price for leather. But the fit is too snug for my Nikon P530. When I opened  the case one time, my lens cover popped off because there's very little clearance when you lift the lid. The inside has a nice soft suede like finish, but particles of it have come off onto my camera body when removing it because of the tight fit. I don't like my camera to be under this kind of pressure. This is an excellent looking and well made case, but the seller should not include a Nikon P530 as a model that will fit in this case.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: The MegaGear "Ever Ready" Leather Camera Case was perfect for my Nikon COOLPIX B500 Camera. I looked high and low and ended up purchasing a Camera Case from eBay, which was way too long for my 📷 Lens, which was very expensive. I found this Camera Case way less money on Amazon!!!,Thank you so very, very, very much. It arrived within 3 days. Fast Service.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: The case looks expensive. It has a deep rich brown leather-look and feel. The quality is good. However, it is very stiff.  The case may become more flexible with use. I returned mine, it is not practical getting the camera out of it quickly to take pictures.  I found myself fumbling with the case and twisting out it of the way to take pictures. If you want to store your camera and do not take pictures that often, it should meet your needs. If you are constantly grabbing your camera to take quick shots, this case could slow you down.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: I prefer this type of case to the bag cases.  It doesn't hold any extra stuff but it fits the camera fairly snugly.  Due to the shape of the camera the top piece is a tad bit awkward.  I wish the top would stay attached on the bottom so you didn't need to take it clear off to take pictures but that's a minor thing.  When I knew I was going to use it I just took the camera with out the top cover piece.  Worked fine.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Very well-made of sturdy leather and fits the Nikon P520 very well. The front piece does have a little extra length to it, but I believe that gives the lens coverage a little more rigidity and "bump room" to prevent damage from direct frontal impact. If I have any complaint at all it would be that the strap I received seems narrower and thinner than that shown in the picture. Also, where the picture shows a finished rolled edge to the strap, the one I received was simply a flat, cut edge that's not very comfortable when the weight of the camera is on your bare neck. Except for that, it's a good product at a fair price.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This isn't a bad case for the Nikon Coolpix P530.  It's protected it well enough from minor bumps.  The case is constructed from quality leather and is well put together.  My chief complaint with the case is that you can't access either the data port or the memory stick without completely removing the case from the camera.  That said I've continued to use the case for lack of a better option.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: So, am still learning. Will update review later.  For now, it's one of the most beautiful, intriguing cameras.  Everything was shipped with care.  The name, as well is well chosen. Lumix.  I can't wait to learn everything about it.  I am in awe.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: One word to describe this camera: WOW~! I am amazed with its zoom capability. I appreciate it even more after I download the photos to my computer and as I review them, I notice more details that the human naked eyes couldn't even see when taking the photos. It is obviously not a compact camera to accommodate the powerful zoom lens. It is solidly built. I especially love the super wide 20mm lens. Great for party shots when you need to squeeze in a group of people in the frame. Buy it! You will have so much fun using this camera! You might consider becoming a Paparazzi, too. :)

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: It has a fantastic lens: I was at a high school graduation, about 200 feet away from the band, but was able to get a clear close-up of the drummer (my grand nephew). It IS very complicated, meaning it has many, many options -- but I have to confess that I leave it in intelligent auto mode and use it as a point and shoot. It has most of the capability of an actual SLR at a fraction of the cost. The down side is its bulk, it will not fit into most pockets.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Purchased to take on vacation to the Dominican Republic.  Amazed at the clarity and the the zoom feature.  This 60x zoom really brings far off things very close and even holding it without a tripod I had no problem taking clear photos with the anti-shake feature.  Love that the lens is threaded to accept filters and additional lenses.  Also I love that it it has a viewfinder and hot shoe.  At this price point you don't get all that from other makes.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Great zoom.  Lots of features.  Takes some time to learn all features.  Can be more complex than a simple point and shoot.  That is good if you want more features.  WiFi is tricky.  Good camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Love this camera.,I am a proud mom with little ones that are into different outdoor activities.,This is a easy to use camera.,I love taking video with this camera.,The best part is the zoom!!!!!!!,All of my other cameras do not come close to this camera!,I am not Professional or a amateur photographer like my husband, this is the reason why I am not so picky when it comes to megapixels.,If you are using the Nikon D810A or anything of this caliber it does not come close, but for moms like me it is great!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I love this camera. Most user friendly camera I have ever used, considering its' capabilities. I feel that a person should print the user manual (all 300 pages of it) to be able to use all of the amazing things this camera can do. Still looking in the manual frequently to make use of the wi-fi options. Explanations are excellent. Panasonic has a winner! One small qwuible. The viewfinder diopter adjustment doesn't stay where I set it. Have to reset it frequently.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: To fully enjoy the use of this camera,  YOU NEED TO READ THE MANUALS, BOTH OF THEM.  YOU NEED TO DOWNLOAD THE ADVANCED MANUAL AND READ IT.  This camera has amazing capabilities.  The zoom capabilities without reverting to the use of the digital zoom are awe-inspiring.  The Intelligent Zoom is better than a digital zoom, and it extends the zoom capabilities to more than the 60x figure.  I have used both.  The intelligent zoom will give you a photo with fewer megapixels, but the distortion common to digital zooming is missing.  Since you're starting with 16.1 mp, you can well afford to reduce the mp for the purpose of getting a long shot, but you don't even have to do that if you use the zoom attachment you can purchase with the adapter.,I also have the adapter for the zoom attachment and the close-up attachment.  I was using a FZ100, and the same accessories work.  For the record,  you can use the regular zoom AND the intelligent zoom with the telephoto attachment which allows you to get magnificent zoom capabilities without using a digital zoom.,This camera also has good wide angle capabilities as well - at least as wide as I ever want.  It doesn't do fisheye.,It has macrofocusing down to 1 mm AND macro zoom focusing, which is delightful and will enlarge the subject.  And I have the close-up attachment as well, although so far the macro zoom has produced pictures I'm happy with, so I haven't used it.  .,It has many different focusing choices.  You need to see what they are and see which one works for you.  The flexible focus is my favorite.  Uses a bit more battery, but it is faster continuous focus than the one labeled continuous focus.  This is why you have to read the directions.  There is also manual focus.  And standard focus.,They have skimped on not making the vewing screen moveable to different angles.  If you want to take a time exposure, you mght want to use the timed shutter release to avoid camera movement, since there is no input for an external shutter button.  And yes, those things would have been nice, BUT I couldn't afford the camera if they hadn't kept the price down.  This is a hobby of mine, not a profession.,This is one whopper of a camera for the price.  I think they economized in the right places and spent the money on the best kind of image stabilization that you can get - a necessity if you are going to use such a zoom.,I have set my camera to limit the shutter speeds (found in the camera menu settings) so that it can't automatically go to too slow a speed.  Panasonic recommends a tripod -- and it's very true that a good tripod helps - but ninety nine percent of the time, when I want a photo, I either don't have my tripod with me, or it's not set up -- so I am handholding shots that should be on a tripod -- because the deer will leave -- or the birds or small animals are active -- I'm often taking a walk, and I use the zoom to photograph wild flowers I can't get close to without getting into poison ivy or some such thing.,My advice for handheld shots is to use the shutter speed limit, so the shutter speed can't go too slow on you.  I often use shutter priority, risking the shot being too dark, but there is also an option in the setup stuff. Often, even if a picture is too dark, you can improve it with software.,The camera also had editing capabilities, but I use Corel's software on my PC.,I take LOTS OF PHOTOS.  If you think you can't hand hold the camera, snap as many photos as you can, and try.  Hold your breath and get your elbows close to your sides -- really - it steadies you -- or find something to lean on, if possible, and do your best.  Sometimes it doesn't work, but often if I take a lot of photos, at least a couple of them will be sharp, because I snapped the picture at just the right moment.,The beauty of digital photography is that you don't have to pay for your flops.  You can just delete them, and keep the good ones.,This is not a professional photographer's camera, although I would bet that pros would have one whopper of a good time with it.  But I don't have the money to buy a pro's camera, nor do I have the ability to carry the camera equipment I used to -- nor do I have the money to spare for excessive film and processing.,SO I am as happy as a hog in a mud waller with this camera.  It take good pictures.  As with any camera, you need to get used to this particular one.  I have a particular combination of metering and exposure that I usually use -- you could vary your choices to suit yourself, BUT YOU WON'T DO THAT IF YOU DON'T DOWNLOAD THE ADVANCED MANUAL AND READ IT.,I went to the trouble to print out the manual, because I studied it in odd places in order to cover the information.  It is convenient to have it on your computer, too, but I wanted a print out.  I printed it one section at a time.,This is a wonderful camera for the money.  If I could afford the setup the National Geographic photographers use, I wouldn't be able to carry it anyway.  This camera is a great deal of fun, and if you will take the time to master the vast number of choices you have available, you will surely enjoy it.,I highly recommend it.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've had the Lumix FZ70 camera for all of two days, and so far I am thrilled with the experience of owning it. The default iA setting produces sharp photos and videos, far superior to my Samsung Galaxy 2 (phone), iPhone 4, and assorted cheap 16MP Canon and Nikon cameras. The picture quality is comparable to and possibly even better than from the Canon 16MP D5100 that costs more than twice as much. Some people may be put off by its light weight and plastic body; it feels solid enough for my needs.  The camera works well in low light, occasionally I got a warning to pop open the flash. I simply pressed a button to do that, and viola the flash fired without requiring any setting changes. Because it is light, compact, yields quality results and is not expensive I am likely to pack it on every trip.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
