review: If you have big fingers, Please don't buy this camera.  It says youth, it means YOUTH.  I will probably keep it but never would buy it again. I have a neighbor that is 8 years old, I will probably give it to her for her birthday.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I can't rave enough about this camera.  There are plenty of reviews out there that do it so much better than I could.,Sony hit another home run with this camera...,I got 2, and sold the other one for $3,000  and the guy was really happy to get it for that!,Love the 4K video, the focusing, the battery life, the silent shutter, everything... I replaced the lens with a $1000 lens, but that was because I needed a F4 lens.,I recorded a theatre play with this...and when it did the fade to dark... the camera didn't... you could tell it 'faded', but you could still see all the actors moving on the stage.  Next time I need to lock the exposure for that so it really fade to black!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: If you're looking at this you've probably allreayd seen reviews and know it;s amazing for the price. But to ship a $2000 camera with no charger so you can sell one for $100 is without excuse and I'm taking a star for the pure greed. I owned many pro level camera over the years and never have I received one without a charger until now.,USB charging is available but it's crazy slow and not a viable option for anything series. I'm making a statement and I refuse to pay Sony this price for a charger that cost them a couple dollars and should have been included with this camera. If we all do the same and buy one of the many aftermarket chargers maybe Sony will learn something.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I recently bought the Nikon Z6 and fell in love with the build quality, but poor autofocus performance, limited native lens selection, subpar battery life and issues with the EVF (It shows a brighter image than what the camera will actually capture, Jared Polin talks about this in his Real World Review of the Z7) caused me to return it. I picked up this kit as a replacement and I could not be happier! The build quality feels great. The EVF and rear screen could be better, but I do not feel that they detract from this camera at all. Battery life is insane, I have been setting this camera up over the past few hours while taking about 200 test shots and I am currently at 99%. In my opinion, the menu system is amazing, I feel that this menu system is better than the Z6 menusystem (again, just my opinion). The autofocus system is literally INSANE, I cannot believe how fast and accurate it is, even in terrible light with a kit lens. I have pretty big hands, so I did need to buy the battery grip for this camera to be comfortable, but having the extra battery is going to be amazing. I have been shooting Canon primarily for the past 10 years and now I see why everyone is jumping ship and moving to Sony. I never thought I would love another camera enough to give up my 5D Mark IV, but this camera is a game changer. I cannot wait to see what Sony has in store for their future cameras and lenses. Don't hesitate, buy this camera, I promise you won't be disappointed.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter-in-law to take pictures of my new grandson. The only camera she had was her phone. This camera is small enough to fit inside a diaper bag or small purse. The only thing is it does have to be periodically charged and one may forget to check it before that "must have" picture. Still, it's a good camera & she loves it!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: You will not regret the choice to move.  I wish I did not wait so long.  But then again, the A7III was not out. I had the 5D markII loved it.  5D markIII loved it till the Sony's came out.  Was watching the Sony evolve till the A7III came out. Canon did NOTHING! That was it Goodbye Canon.,Canon told me to spend 8k or 33k on a camera if I wanted to get a good video camera.  Well, I say goodbye to you Canon.,The eye focus,The ability to customize buttons,Sharp sharp,almost entire frame to get focus.,98% of all my shots are focus usable.,Canon killer.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Coming from Canon background (started with the 10D, latest was the 7D) - I still have my a6000 which is still a truly mindblowing camera (especially for the current price!!) and started to hunger for full-frame with the added benefit of the larger sensor, pixels etc etc when Sony introduced this monster of a camera. It combines everything I hoped into one body - the menu system sucks. The lack of timelapse features sucks (the app store where I bought the time-lapse app which worked great on my a6000 - that store doesn't even exist in the A7 III as of June 3, 2018). Why camera shutter speeds still stop at 30 seconds is way beyond me.... BUT..... the photos from this camera are mind blowing without doing huge editing if you know what you are doing. The sharpness is awesome. The Sigma MC11 allows me to use my 17-40 f4L, 70-200 f4L and other Canon lenses and like others have said, due to the power of this sensor, images are drop dead sharp. There is a bit too much green at times to the images but that's an easy fix if not wanted.,If you are in the market for a full-frame camera, this camera pretty much blows everybody away in the categories that matter: overall noise, sharpness, battery life, video quality (OMG!) and nothing can compete with the size. Holding my 7D in one hand and this in the other, the 7D feels like a bloated dude that needs to loose 30 pounds.,Can's say enough about this camera so I'll let a few images do the talking for me. These are mostly straight out of the camera with minimal post processing. Enjoy if you take the plunge!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This Sony A7iii is the best sub 2K full frame camera in the market now.  With more money you can upgrade to "better" full frames like a9, a7riii, Nikon z7.. and Canon and Nikon DSLR full frames.  However, if you do not need all those functions then Sony a7iii is the way to go.  FWIW, I tried out the Nikon Z6, Fuji XT-3, Canon 6DMkii (phenomenal deals), and Nikon D850 (was getting a great deal on used).  Eventually, I settled on a7iii.,I upgraded from a Canon 40D which I purchased more than 0 years back.  I did not have too much hardware invested so the move to mirrorless was minimal cost.  I chose the 24-105 G lens vs the kit lens.  It is a lot better and the money is well spent.  I did not choose any GM lenses because I need to get my feet wet using the camera before investing in top notch lenses.,I primarily do social events, travel photography and some sports events.  The camera has great capabilities for that.,The good things about this camera:,1) Resolution is in a sweet spot - not large to slow down the computer,,2) Dynamic range is great, backlit photos come out really well.  Shadows show detail too,,3) Low Light sensitivity:  Photos are very usable till ISO 12800.  I limit the max ISO to that,,4) Autofocus:  Fast, accurate.  Eye AF is something out of the world.  There really is nothing like it on the market from other competitors.,5)  Battery Life:  Really good if you are taking photographs.  But it drains fast and furious if you are taking video.  I would highly recommend buying a second battery and a charger.  Will make your life a lot easier.,6)  Dual Card slots:  I like them a lot.  Use one for video and the other for stills.  I am not too worried about cards getting corrupted or full.  I have 128GB each and those are plenty for a couple of week's worth of travel.,7)  IBIS:  This helps tremendously with camera shake.  Will allow the use of non-stabilized lenses if you find good deals on them.,Cons:,1)  Menu System:  Very exhaustive.  It takes a long time getting used to.  But once you get the hang of the system, it works wonders in customization.,2)  No Charger.  This is way too cheap to not provide for a 2K camera.,3)  Weight:  For all the supposed "lightness" of a mirrorless camera, once you add in the lens there is no savings in weight compared with the DSLR.,5)  Sony lenses are heavy and expensive.  Hoping that as the system matures we get more choices.,Overall, a great great camera with very few cons.  There are more detailed reviews on photography websites but I just wanted to give my 2 cents worth on how it works in real life for me.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Having become fed up with the lack of innovation on behalf of Nikon,  I had finally outgrown my D7100.  Hoping to stick with Nikon with how much I’ve invested in it over the years,  it was really difficult for me to switch to an all new system especially to the likes of Sony whose lenses are extremely expensive.,The A7III Made it impossible not to convert given all of the features this camera deploys for the price point.  The video and pictures this thing captures simply blows me away as well as the amount of options this camera has.,It does have a few dumb drawbacks and sometimes I feel as if this cameras has been independently designed by multiple people who Never spoke to each other.  But the drawbacks be them as they may  such as the insane menu system is perfectly acceptable to live with given what you get at this price point. I cannot recommend this camera enough and wheras I’m not going into detail in this review, Take it someone who has nearly 30 years of photography experience that this is hands-down the best “hybrid” camera you can get your hands on at this price range period.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I had my a9 and 3 lenses stolen when my home was broken into. I had planned to purchase the a7iii as a back up to my a9 so decided to pick one up. Don't get me wrong, this is a great camera for the price but having shot with the a9 it just doesn't quite do it for me. Eventually I am selling it off and buying the a9 again. What is missing for me is the focusing. Maybe it's just the copy I have but I don't find the focusing quite as good though don't get me wrong, this camera is a good camera it's just the a9 is the best all around camera you can get in the Sony line in my opinion. I also miss having a choice between the mechanical and electronic shutter. The sensor read out is faster on the a9 so there is just less rolling shutter. After the last upgrades for the Sony cameras I have to say I think the a9 is even better especially regarding eye AF. I have to admit I didn't care for the a9 when I first got it but after awhile I just found myself loving it and now the prices is even lower as of the writing of this review as the price has dropped and the new upgrade for the a9 has made it an even better camera. If you can afford it go for the a9. Having said all that if your budget makes this affordable option this is a great started option and certainly the low light performance is very good. And if you're not shooting sports and have a need for the extra speed of the a9 this is a great option. I have been able to shoot at fairly high ISO and get pretty clean images. The a7iii offers great performance and value. My main con is I don't care for the LCD screen. I feel it could be better and a high resolution but considering the price I guess I can't have everything.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Big fan of Sony owning A7 II and IIi with grip and 24-70 f2.8, 35 f2.8, Rokinon 35mm f1.4, 55mm f1.8 and 85 f1.8.,Been and still am shooting with Canon 5D mark IV along with Canons f2.8 L zooms and primes.,Definitelly holding on to my canon and will be using Sony strictly for vacations and such.,Prefer canon ergonomics especially with fast zooms that are by nature big and heavy.,Take under consideration price of Sony glass.,Sony version of 24-70mm f2.8 is actually bigger than canon (i own both and will get rid of sony as it defeata a whole purpose of compact camera/lens ) and cost quite a bit more just like all sony primes.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: This was a gift we just gave to my grandson for his birthday -- from what we saw and tried out it seems to be a nice product and size for him -- I am sorry I cannot provide more useful information but so far so good.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I had to replace a Canon PS A560 and I chose this one for very occasional light use. I miss the little view finder window (or whatever it's called). On this camera you need to use the display window to frame your shot and sometimes in bright light it is nearly impossible to do this. Also I notice that pictures taken with full zoom are not clearly focused even with a solid support of the camera to eliminate shaking. But it works and you don't need to worry about batteries since it is rechargeable. I just used the 1GB card from the old camera and that is enough for 195 pictures set on the highest ("L) setting, or 24 minutes of video (8 minutes of HD video). This is more than enough for my needs. I can't imagine why anyone would need anything bigger. Seems that it is not available in BLUE which is unfortunate.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This was the only case I could find that was a direct fit for the camera.  And it does fit well.  But I do not agree that you can undo one snap and take a picture.  The case does not easily lift off - it has to lift up and the lens is in the way - maybe you are not supposed to use the lens cap?  Most designs (for other cameras) the snap is at the top of the lens and goes down - also it is just the part covering the lens that goes down.  Here 3/4 of the case lifts up - and then will really be in your way - if you can get it over the lens.  Also the case must be unscrewed to change the battery/memory card - you have to unscrew the case at the bottom - don't expect to do it quickly - if you run out in the middle of something you won't be able to reload before it ends.  I will keep it because it is the only one out there, but doubt I will be using it except when I am not using the camera.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: If your looking for a great looking and functional camera case for your Nikon CoolPix p520. this is the one., It looks like it would cost far more than what I paid. Also, it,s very functional and doesn't get in the way of taking a picture., What I mean by that is removing for a quick shot is easy., Can't add much more other than it was a great purchase for my camera.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: The quality of the case is very good. It looks like this leather will last for years. The leather base does a good job of protecting that part of the camera. You do have to disconnect the base to access the battery door but I don't see this as being a show stopper. The top cover attaches solidly to the button on the base and also protects the upper part of the camera quite well. This is a solid compromise between using a simple strap which gets uncomfortable and a camera case which is difficult to use when you are mobile.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This is a perfect fit for the Nikon P520 camera.  I fooled around trying to find a fanny pack that fit,then did a search and found this.  Just like your father's old camera case.  Two piece.  One half screws to the tripod socket and leaves all the back controls & LCD accessible.  Second part snaps to first securely and flips down for camera use, or snap it off completely.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This is a pretty nice case, especially when you want to pack light. I  have a larger case that has all my misc. equipment plus holds this. I find this useful when I go for walks, hikes, and events where I won't need all my equipment right away (batteries, plugs, etc.). Seems to protect the camera very well. Easy enough to put on and remove.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: I only wish that the cover for the lens portion were a little bigger to accomodate adapters up to 67mm since I use one on my Nikon p510 from the U. K. that fit the inner barrel and allows me to place a protective U.V. filter on the 67mm and with a littlle more room I could also use the flexible tulip shade over the filter. Also, I glued a small compartment on the outside of the top of the case to carry extra batteries and memory. Please let me know If you would like me to show you what I have done. psowsy@gmail.com

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This is such a classy way to protect my camera, the price point was great.  Love that you can just snap off the top part and replace it when you're done taking a picture.  Seems to be a quality made product, very old-school looking like what my grandfather used.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: I bought this case for my Nikon Coolpix P520. The case is nice, but the screw on the bottom that screws into the camera is misaligned by about 1/8 inch. This makes it very difficult to screw in. I have to push really hard and insert it at an angle. This is very annoying.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This protective cover is a perfect fit for this camera. Leather is high quality. The shoulder strap is redundant as the strap attached directly to the camera works fine with this cover. The "locking screw" in the cover base is threaded to mount the camera on a tripod. Efficient order processing and shipping from the vendor. My overall satisfaction with this company and product influenced my 5 star rating.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This case is exactly what I was looking for. It fits my Nikon perfectly; snug with an easy snap-off front for ease in taking pictures.  The leather is quality and provides protection.  The strap is wide, comfortable, and adjustable. I definitely recommend this case.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I think this camera and brand are a little under- rated.  I am not a professional photographer but it has great features some of which a professoinal camera has.  Been very pleased with the quality and performance.  It does struggle a bit with clarity in low light situations, which in my experience is not terribly uncommon.  I have not done enough manual adjustments to exposure and white balance see if this can be overcome.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I like everything about the new camera and despite having owned it for awhile, I am still learning about the many different things that I can do.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This particular camera gives you everything you need.  Not everything great but definitely good enough. Good focus on stills, Easy Video w/4K, great zoom ability, Wi-Fi capability ( to share pictures with others), light weight, Close-up and Action options, Editing, Menu with several different setting to choose from (I'm still learning them all).  If you don't want the heaviness of a DSLR with the versatility of always available zoom and quick switch capability to Video then this is the camera for you.  I haven't missed shots like I use to with my Canon Rebel, great camera itself but sometime to too long to switch zoom lenses, find the right setting to shoot, and instantly ready for whatever.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Very good camera. I was looking for camera with zoom and this camera was within my budget. It has got very good image quality and can focus and shoot at high speed. You can transfer photos to your smart phone using wifi option in this camera.  Just download image app from play store and select camera's SSID from the wifi listing. 4K video is another advantage. You need class 3 xcd memory card for 4k video recording. I recommend this camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera for the zoom range, and I am very pleased with that aspect. However, a couple of other things could be improved. For example, the burst rate/buffering is pretty limited. Rapid fire shots (like I am used to doing with my DMC-FZ200) are limited to 2-3 and then there's a substantial wait until the buffer is flushed to the disk. This effectively forces me to be very selective about when I push the release button, especially when I'm shooting action scenes. Another issue is the fixed monitor screen, which isn't much help when the camera is pointed at the sky. Again, I'm spoiled, I suppose, by the FZ200's rotating display. Another surprise came when I tried to take some long exposure night sky shots and found that the camera controls the limits on ISO and shutter speed. This was in P mode, so I need to do some more experimentation before I give up on using it for these sorts of shots.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Great camera.  Average life.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I've used a SLR digital camera for many years and the lite weight of this camera concerns me. This may not be a bad thing just used to a much heftier product. My grandson ,20, picked it up and was using it immediately where I ,63, have been trying to figure it out for days.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Great camera, not a direct competitor to the P900 but definitely faster processing and better all around capabilities. With a teleconverter you can get out to P900 range but you have to use a tripod. The image stabilization is far less capable than Nikon's. The android app is particularly useful when using a tripod, even allowing for control of focus. It puts the Nikon app to shame.,The best teleconverter I've found is the Olympus B-300 1.7x which can be found on ebay. Its lightweight enough that it can be attached directly to the lens without using an adapter. Just understand that your image stabilization doesn't work when you do that, and you'll need to use a tripod. I couple this with a Bescor MP101 pan tilt head to take ultra long range shots.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Pretty nice camera and overall I'm satisfied, but I do have a gripe or two.  The major criticism I have thus far is that the writing on the buttons is already wearing off, despite treating the camera gingerly.  I've had the camera less than 3 months and one button is illegible already.  Very disappointed with that aspect.  Also, soon after my purchase, the lens cap fell apart while attaching it.  One of the tiny springs shot out, never to be found, so the cap no longer stays on the lens.  I've never had similar problems with my Nikon and Canon products.,EDIT:  10/6  - I have to lower my rating again at this point.  The sticker trim that's around the lens has begun pealing off.  I've not even used the camera in a few weeks.  Took it out of its case and it's hanging off.  Can't be "stuck" back on readily.  I think Panasonic really cut corners on the fit and finish of this camera.  Although the image quality is very good, at this point I'm starting to regret my purchase because I'm not confident the thing will hold together over time.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Great pictures for a small price. Still shots are great. Video a bit grainy.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Very easy to use.  I always loved Sony cameras.  I find them easier to use than my phone.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Very disappointed in this item. I have had several other Sony cameras but this one does not even flash when should and pictures are very blurry

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Sorry I bought this. I have had two Lumix Point and Shoot cameras and absolutely loved them. They were small and great price and took incredible photos. I avoided buying a DSLR just because they took such good photos. So when I saw this Lumix FZ70, I thought wow, this is going to be a great camera. I didn't like the larger size, but it sounded like it would have such great options and who could pass up that 60X zoom! Sadly, I have been disappointed. In fact I was taking photos at an event with this new camera, and the action photos were so bad, I ended up pulling out my little Lumix DMC-ZS25 and used it to take my photos. We read through the big on-line manual to see how we could take better photos, but to no avail. Absolutely cannot take action shots with this camera. The subjects are always out of focus. The IA setting was useless. We even went to the manual settings, trying every combination, but again no luck. I had bought this to take action shots of dogs running in agility competition. My little Lumix ZS25 camera did such a great job but got dust on the sensor and it would cost more than the price of the camera to fix. So we bought this one as a replacement and sorry we did. Can't return it because the instructions say you can only return unopened products. Of course we opened it. We used it. Should have just put the money toward a DSLR.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: no good , twice.  Got my money back , that is most important

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Great little camera,to have with you. Simple and easy,as should be!

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Im just not thrilled wth the way it functions.  There is a delay in the shutter that I still am getting used to and most of my no flash pictures are slightly blurry.  I thought I was just updating my privious sony camera, but it still takes better pictures than the new one.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Similar to the other negative reviews for this product, I was unable to get indoor pictures to be in-focus.  The center of the frame was decent (although not as sharp as I'd like), but the entire 360 degrees in the rest of the frame was blurry.  I played around with all the focus, resolution, and "scene" settings, but the results were consistently poor.  I'd say 1 picture in 5 was borderline acceptable -- the rest were not.,I'm just a family guy (not a photographer), and was looking for an affordable point-and-shoot camera.  This was certainly affordable, but the indoor pictures are bad enough that I'm returning this camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I Use this camera product for taking Pictures always with it at places and on TV screen things I see on my TV always and wherever I go out too and I can get photos always as when wanted.. I can NOT live and go without NO Camera always..
user: Ordering a Camera When you Need to get you one anytime

I requested a new camera and they sent me one.  After about one week it failed. I then threw it in my trash can. I will never buy a sony camera again.

review: So far so good.....

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 IS Digital Camera (Black) with 20MP, 42x Optical Zoom, 720p HD Video & Built-In Wi-Fi + 64GB Card + Reader + Grip + Spare Battery and Charger + Tripod + Complete Accessory Bundle
review: Have not had the chance to look at all the options this camera has to offer, but it is the exact camera that I paid for. product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: It came with everything noted, but also with the shoulder strap for the camera case, which one reviewer mentioned they didn't get. Most of this stuff I don't know what to do with, so will leave in their boxes until I figure them out ("USB multicard reader/writer", tripod (extends to 8 "), LCD/lens cleaner, memory card wallet, SanDisk Ultra 32GB SD Card (it says 16 mp photo/7 mb file size = 2000 and video (mpeg-4/H.264, 1920x1080 @30fps) in minutes = 40), and some odd Focus Squeegee card w fluid and Qtips and a floppy card w a grid and ruler printed on it (does anyone know what this stuff is for?), 1 battery, the charger (also a charger for the car and a converter for European plugs!).,Even though I don't know what everything is, it is still a good deal for a small point and shoot camera. And it is definitely a very small camera, but that's how they come, these days.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: I am a senior...travel a lot...am NOT smart phone fan....I needed a simple , high quality camera to keep in my pocket while traveling. This one suits my needs perfectly....compact...has all the needed features. I had a Nikon ...time to replace....it actually had too many features.,Buying this as a package with what you need....is simple and easy....and you are ready to go!  All in all...great value...delivered two days with Prime! Life is good even when you get old....keep it simple!!!  My career marketing...learned that too many features...more things to fail...best to buy one step above the basic....last longer!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: I'm a 71 year old who has pondered for years whether I should buy a better, more expensive camera although my PowerShot ELPH 100 HS (bought 5 yrs ago) worked well, and my pictures were satisfactory. After hours of research, I was still hesitant to shell out big money due to budgetary constraints. Then, I came across the Canon PowerShot 180 bundle. All I can say is, I'm completely satisfied with this camera, It's a great value, takes wonderful pictures, and has a bundle of accessories included. Run to your computer (or walk) and check out what's being offered! Few purchases please me as much, and I make dozens annually, mostly through Amazon.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I wasn't looking for a lot of bells and whistles, just want nice sharp photos and rich color. So far, I like it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: This is a great camera to have when you need something small that takes better pictures then your smartphone. It's small and easy to use. All the stuff that comes with the Kit its great as well. Definitely worth the money getting this camera with accessory kit.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: Well, for a P&S, this is a pretty good camera. Light weight and small enough to fit in a pocket, easy to use settings (yeah, you can throw that manual away), nice results (though not as good as a smart-phone. probably). Use the auto mode and go ahead and shoot, or choose your own settings. One thing I miss is the copy and edit functions that I had in my other P&S's. I was gonna buy an extra battery and memory card and camera case, anyway- so this package was both a deal and convenient. I might even use that wee tripod that weights only ounces.

review: I am a home inspector and I am rough on my cameras. I drag them under houses in the mud on the roof and they fall off sometimes and fall to the ground I have sat and stepped on them while making my way through the attic of a home. Yes I have broken several of these cameras but they last just as long as a $150.00 or $200.00 camera for me. If you are in the trades and need to take photos this is a great camera that if it breaks it won't break the bank. I like the optical zoom lens on this camera but that is the weak point of the camera for sure.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: This camera is a big pile of crap. It's made of poorly molded plastic there feels like a toddler's toy. It has options to change the the megapixels. The five megapixels is just as bad as 21 megapixels. Resume doesn't even work right. The buttons are cheap and don't push very well. The pictures are blurry her than blurry. I could have spent $40 on beer and would have seen things better and I don't even drink. I am definitely going to be sending this camera back.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T7 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm is II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Flex Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: For the price, I felt this was one of the best deals out there. For a beginner like me, the Canon Rebel T7 is a perfect starter camera as it gives the ability to use manual mode where you can control things like the ISO, Aperature, and shutter speed, but also several auto modes for those who just don't want handle those options. The lenses were all great; however, the 500mm felt like overkill unless you're into certain types of photography. I've been able to get some great shots with all lense. The carrying bag is also a great starter for lens storage. Really happy and excited to venture deeper into photography with this bundle.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T7 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm is II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Flex Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: As most people I'm not a professional. I've been looking to purchase a camera for months now.  I've read many reviews and it seems like Canon is a good brand for beginners.  So far I'm in love. Between Canon and YouTube videos I've gotten a better understanding on how to use it.  I plan to use it during vacations and hiking.  My camera bundle came in a large box but within that a medium sized one.  I'm glad nothing was punctured,  ripped or torn. Everything came perfectly packaged.  I've tested every item and haven't had any issues. This is my new obsession.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T7 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm is II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Flex Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: Gave as a gift and she seems to like it a lot. Has taken pictures outside and really like the quality and ability make "blurr" photo's. Inside might need to look at some of the setting to get better quality. Looked at the retail store and got a lot better deal ordering online with the package bundle. Overall seems like a nice camera with no regrets purchasing it.,Has been using a lot more. It has quit a few features and still figuring out some of them. Takes really nice photo's.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T7 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm is II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Flex Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I recieved the Canon EOS Rebal T7 camera bundle. Well packed and all in excellent condition.,Nice overall camera rig. With one exception. I was EXTREMELY disappointed in what was called a tripod. Luckily I have a good tripod. If you don't, order one with this bundle.,Everything else is of very good quality.,Looking forward to playing with it.,I still shoot 35mm & 620.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Bad for wireless transfer to phones, iPads, or computers. Great for focus clarity.,Worst Con: NON-FUNCTIONING WIRELESS FILE TRANSFER (both WiFi/NFC) due to Sony software and App upgrades.,Best Pro: All the accolades about sharpness of focus are true. Perfect for those who rarely use manual mode.,I bought this as a travel camera and as backup to my Canon 5D MIII camera. This has longer batter life (no AA batteries) and full frame. Wanted the ease of use with wireless on-the-go file transfer to iPhone/iPad. The mandatory Sony Playmemories app gets 1 Star for being made useless by Sony. Can’t log in. Cryptic menus before they bricked the app. One app controls the Sony cameras for file transfers. Not working with all Sony models. I’ve ordered an SD card reader to Apple lightning connector to, hopefully,  get my pics to my iPad. Maybe, at least I can share with social media sites and friends/family. Casts a dark shadow on such a great camera!,Background:,I’ve used Canon cameras and lens for many years. They have gotten less usage due to the heavy weight of the setup and my aging joints. I collect antique and modern day cameras. So, this is not my first Sony or first mirrorless camera. This is my first Sony alpha line camera.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: There are a lot of excellent reviews on the technical side of this great camera, so I will not go there.  Instead, I will just share some personal experience playing around with it in the past week.  I bought the camera with the 28-70mm kit lens.  From Costco, I bought two 128GB Sandisk Extreme SD cards and put them in.  Alas, slot 1 could not read it while slot 2 can.  Switching the cards gave the same outcome, so it is not likely the cards’ problem.  And my a6000 could read the cards.  Searching on internet showed that this is a common problem for a7iii with 128GB cards.  So I had to two PNY 32GB cards on hand.,The camera is light weight, which I really like.  Coming from Pentax K-1 with 24-70mm Pentax lens and 70-200mm Tamron, I can really appreciate the portability.  For ergonomics, I have to say that the grip feels more comfortable with the K-1 because I have large hands - the AF-on button falls naturally under my thumb (I use back button focusing all the time), and the front and back dials are easy to control.  On the contrary, since the a7iii has a smaller footprint, I found my thumb sometimes has to “hunt” for the AF-on button, and the front dial is not easy to operate.  After a few tries, I am used now to the setting and feel more confident with all the control buttons and dials.,I have not tried the high speed multi-frame shooting for fast moving objects (sports, birds, etc.), so cannot say how good the a7iii is compared to my 7Dii (both have 10 fps I believe); besides, my kit lens on the a7iii lacks the range and power of the 100-400mm II on the 7Dii, so I will leave opinions on that to a later time.  Btw, the 7Dii has also a better grip in my hand.,Back to the grip - comparing the a7iii with the a6000, the a6000 feels surprisingly better because it does not have the groove and I don’t need to do BBF (no AF-on button).,Overall, I love my a7iii so far and will put a lot of good use to it once I have some decent glass (my eyes are on the 24-240mm for travel, and some GM or Tamron for local use).

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Thank you Sony for developing this insane beast of camera. This is such a powerful tool at the disposal of the photographer. Absolutely insane dynamic range... so much so, even Lightroom sliders can’t keep up. Insanely good high ISO quality. You can’t tell the difference between 100 ISO and 1000 ISO. Huge flexibility. Eye autofocus is perfect. Fast. Responsive. Beautiful images from this camera. Blows my old a6000 out of the water. Very impressed. WAY more than enough for the “entry level” photographer. Seriously, for 2,000$, look no further.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I have been a Canon user for many years and I was skeptical buying this camera. When looking at this camera on paper the specs are amazing for the price. Canon would charge at least $800-$1000 for the same specs.,So I bought this camera and figured I would use it along my Canon and adapt my Canon glass. I did purchase the camera with the kit lens so I could compare my adapted Canon lenses with the native Sony lens. Well, getting use to the new system did take  a few days of learning the menu system and customizing all the programmable buttons how I wanted them. Sony gives the user so many ways to customize the camera it took some getting use to. Canon does not give the user that much freedom.,I used the MC-11 adapter to use my Canon glass on the Sony which worked good for photography but video auto focus was a struggle. After using the Sony A7III for a few weeks I was impressed with the system so much that I decided to make the switch to Sony. I have been waiting for Canon to improve their video features but I have waited long enough so I sold my Canon glass and bought Sony native glass including the Tamron 28-75 F2.8 E-mount which is an amazing lens that is much sharper than any lens that I have ever owned. Yes even sharper then my Canon 70-200 IS II 2.8. I no longer need to add sharpening in post which is great.,The Sony A7III a great all around camera with so many great features. Some of the features that I appreciate the most are the 4k full frame video, 1080p @ 120p, the electronic viewfinder which shows you your exposure in real time (amazing and a game changer), 10 frames per second shooting great for sports or wild life, 15 stops of dynamic range, fast auto focus, eye auto focus, and hundreds of autofocus points that cover most of the frame.,Sony has legacy of not holding back when it comes to their cameras which is the opposite of Nikon and Canon and I hope that their history of innovation will continue.,For me this camera meets all of my needs at a great price. There is no perfect camera but right now this comes pretty close. When I use this camera it makes me want to shoot more and it gives me the tools that help me create. From a Canon user with no regrets.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Switching from Canon EOS 6D, the first thing I noticed is the dynamic range! I updated to the firmware version 2.1.0 and my Canon EF 85mm f/1.8 USM and Canon EF 135mm f/2L USM performs flawlessly wide open with the Sigma MC-11 adapter! Even I can confirm that my Tamron SP 15-30mm Di VC USD G1 lens performs and focuses perfectly with the Sigma adapter. Therefore, I don't have to buy native Sony lenses for now. However, given that the Tamron 28-75mm f/2.8 Di III RXD is so good, I added it to my set up and I am blown away by the quality I am getting!,Coming from one cross-point autofocus and focus & recompose technique, using the flexible point autofocus with joystick works amazingly for me. AF-C is better than AF-S. Eye AF is awesome and it performs very well in dark situations such as taking portraits in Christmas lights without using any flash! And then during editing, shadows can be recovered really well! But I found the auto white balance a little bit off from the real world when I took the picture. So it takes a while to adjust during post-processing. Well, I shoot uncompressed RAW to have the freedom to make any adjustment, so I ain't complaining.,Of course, Canon EOS 6D is a good-old sensor and has old specs, it cannot be compared with the A7III. But for $2000, I can't justify getting even the EOS R (was being sold for $1900 on eBay for a while) when this camera performs so well with the Sigma MC-11 adapter on the Canon lenses with IBIS! I am confidently saying that Canon lenses are sharper on A7III than on Canon 6D. I calibrated and micro-adjusted all the lenses on 6D so they were sharp. But on A7III, they are sharper!,I am more inclined to travel and landscape photography, so I added extra battery and L-bracket. Amazingly enough, in this freezing winter, I didn't need second battery during 4 hours of outing! And while the L-bracket helps as a tripod mount, it also guards the edges of the camera and provides support for the pinkie. It also protects the battery door from snow and water! Therefore, I keep it on my camera all the time, except while changing the battery.,The menu is broad compared to Canon. But I am okay with it. I customized the buttons watching the Youtube reviews and it is becoming muscle memory after every usage.,After using Canon EOS 60D and 6D, I waited to switch to mirrorless. As Sony has progressed so far while Canon is catching up, I will keep using this awesome camera for the time being and expecting better techs from Canon. Third party lenses are so good nowadays that as a consumer, you cannot go wrong if you change systems!,I took it out during heavy snowfall on Christmas night and it did not show any warning at all! So I confirm its weather-resistance. I have added a picture here to say it all!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I've only had the camera a few days, but I'm excited to really test this out.  My other camera is an a6000, so having a stabilizer for all of my vintage lenses is wonderful.  The math is easier without a crop factor on the focal distance.  The image quality is wonderful.  I'm not sure if it's any sharper, but seems to do better in different lighting conditions.  As far as with my old film lenses, the images look much better, not as cropped.  My 135 f2 looks like a portrait lens instead of a telephoto again.,The menu system is much more substantial.  There are about 30 or so pages of menus.  Do not let this overwhelm you!  Sit down and watch a YouTube video on it for 20 minutes and you'll have it dialed in.  If you already own a Sony Alpha model, it works the same, but there's more options.,The body size isn't really any larger than the a6000, but it does weigh a bit more.  The handling is great!  I missed the front and rear scroll wheels that I had on the old Canon 50D.  It's a much more simple process when you are in Manual mode.  There are also 4 custom buttons, 2 more than the a6000.  And of course most buttons are programable to however you'd like.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I have the camera since the beginning of May. So this summer I was able to test and try out the camera really well. That's why I can now say that I find the camera in almost all areas awesome. Sony has created something with this camera which clearly shows the direction for the future. Whether autofocus, low-light, processing, features, etc., anywhere the camera can score big. A clear purchase decision!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: No words to say, best~

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: After taking a very long break of 10 years from photography I pulled out my Minolta 7D and tried to shoot some sport action. I quickly realized that 3 fps, 6 mp resolution, and high iso noise are not good for this task any longer. After long research I decided to go with this camera and boy am I glad and surprised how advanced Sony has come since taking over Minolta camera division (or something like that). The camera can be for starter photographers, but once you get familiar with all the versatility it offers you'll be in a difference place. I highly suggest to watch videos online on the extensive menu system. There is so much more to tell about this camera...,Love it!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: My husband got this camera as a gift for my birthday  mostly to take pictures of our dog.. because he is just too darn cute!  I am not a professional photographer, but the pictures speak for themselves. The bokeh is  very nice. The camera feels bulky in my hands,  but I have small hands. I bought a 85 mm f1.8  lens but the kit lens that came with it  is also very good .  AF is super fast. This is a major upgrade from my  lumix. Love this camera!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: TAKES A CLEAR AND NICE PHOTO. REQUIRES LITTLE OR NO EDITING. I LIKE THE ZOOM FEATURE.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Bought as a replacement, as husband, took mine.  It's a great little camera and fits nicely in a pocket and is very easy to use.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: great price

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: First camera had to be returned because it stopped working. Second one arrives and on day 39 it stops working too. Now I’m outside of the return period. Works great on the beginning. Waste of money and very disappointed in a brand I once trusted.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Nice basic camera.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: It's very easy to use and takes great pictures.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I had an older previous Kodak camera, but this one is so much better!!

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: Foolishly bought a camera in summer as Christmas gift for daughter. It's was unusable within 10 days. It keeps shutting off and when it is on, the lens continuously retracts and opens. Expected more from Kodak! Read similar reviews prior to purchase, but just couldn't believe it would be a common issue. It is...heed warnings. Too late to return to Amazon. Have spent three days trying to reach Kodak to resolve and learned that this model camera will only work properly with Energizer or Duracell batteries. I explained that I used the batteries that came with the camera and was informed that they are only good for a couple of hours to get the camera running. If this solution works, I will update this post.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: DONT USE THE BATTERIES IT CAME WITH! Lol I thought I got a broken camera cause it was acting funny at first but just put new batteries in and it’s great for the price

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: love this little camera. takes good pictures and is easy to use.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: I have a professional Nikon camera purchased several years ago but it’s too heavy for me. I am so glad I found this inexpensive camera on Amazon and it fits perfectly into my purse.The most fun part is the flip screen, taking selfie is much more easier. The pictures came out very clear and very real The battery capacity is about 3 hours. I will recommend it to my friend.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: I like this camera but it was not what i expected i love how it takes videos fast and I would reccomend it for somone starting youtube

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: Now is a good time to travel.I'm a novice photographer and this product is great for its powerful design.I was really surprised by the quality of my video shots, which was exactly what I needed.Long battery life.I love it

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: I'm not sure if it was just the camera that I got, but no matter how much I change any of the settings for a better picture/video quality it would not focus as well as in any environment with different lighting I was in. When I transferred the pictures and videos to my computer to see the quality of it, it's still very pixelated even as I compare all the different quality settings. The camera is exactly like the picture and the screen flips perfectly fine. But not the quality that was being described in the description. Also, when taking videos the sound is very sensitive to the camera being touched or moved around where you can't really hear any other noise in the room even as I steadily and silently move the camera in one direction.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: Looks good. Ok for taking our holiday snaps and a much clearer and better picture than our mobile phone cameras. Small enough to fit into a small handbag and appears to be good quality. So far it is working OK but only used it a couple of times.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: Poor instructions,No clear way to turn off video ir even see it; doesn't come with SD card,Pp show wifi connection app had wrong password,A oain in the butt to connect,Flip screen does not rotate,.. have Dslr camera.. wanted simple smaller handheld to use for simple videos.. returned,Will buy a name brand brand with decent how to instructions,Found a you tube video and the reviewer could only say rhis this was junk! He's right.., and a total time waster!

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: This camera is bought for a birthday gift for a friend. The quality is very good. He likes it very much. He likes to bring this camera when he goes out to play. It is very convenient.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: I was actually surprised about this camera. You do have to play around with it to a bit to get the picture quality out of it. If your expecting this to compete with 400 to 500 dollar cameras it's just not going to happen with any company you buy from. Now for this price it is a good camera i have seen other cameras at this price point that have far far worse image quality no matter the setting. It is a very easy to use camera and great for a starter camera or someone who can't afford a expensive camera.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: Tried out most of the functions of the basic satisfaction, camera quality is good, shooting head is very clear, no color difference, good cost performance, amateur level is no problem, or very convenient operation, worth having!

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: I very like it, user friendly, easy operation, great quality, great price. Overall, good price with good quality.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Very nice, sturdy case. Helps protect my camera from damage and is easy to use. I have gotten quite a few comments about how nice it looks and how it looks 'old school'.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: I like the look (the old style look ‘50-‘60). Mega Gear Protective Black Leather camera case fit well with my Nikon D5200 and keep the rain/dust off my camera very well. The price is just right and the shipping from Amazon was very fast.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: It was just what I expected, arrived on time without any damage or defect, as the seller had predicted, had other things on my interest in the product from the seller would certainly buy it, the quality of the products.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: I wanted a little extra protection for the camera when I was carrying it around my neck or in the purse. This case is nicely made and will add an extra level of protection when on. But - you can't just unsnap it and let it hang from the snaps while you use the camera - to use the camera, you have to remove the case completely.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: I wish it were easier to put on and off when there is a lens filter added.  It is really great for me to be able to drop the camera into my purse rather than to have to have a separate bag as with my DSLR camera.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: When I don't want to carry my camera bag, this is an inexpensive and durable to protect my Nikon P520. Highly recommended item and seller.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I love this camera. I've been a longtime fan of canon rebel SLR. I was worried the digital model wouldn't live up to its predecessor. My worries were unfounded. Everything about this camera is wonderful. Easy to figure out (even for an old lady like me). I recommend spending several days with the camera just trying out all the features and functions before using it for an important event, because there are so many enhancements and possibilities. You COULD just put it on auto and get fantastic pictures, but then what would be the point of buying a camera with so many great features? The lenses included in this bundle are all great. The 500mm, I didn't think I'd use, but it's been so fun taking pics of the moon. It takes time to get used to the light balance if you are used to film cameras, so practice with it if that's how you started. If you started on digital cameras, you won't have any problems. The camera bag is too small to hold everything that comes with it, so if you want to take everything with you, get a bigger bag. The bag isn't waterproof, either. Just water resistant. So a good, large, waterproof camera bag is a good additional purchase. You can't go wrong with this bundle. I was so nervous buying something this expensive online, but I'm so happy I bought it.Included a few photos I've taken with it since buying it in June. The moon is with 500mm lens, manual setting w/250 shutter speed (on tripod using the included shutter cord/button). The other pics are in Colorado.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: This is a real QUALITY PRODUCT. The leather is smooth and the packaging is awesome. The bag comes with it's own protective case. This is a professional quality case at a very affordable price .A must have if you want to protect your camera.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Very prompt delivery. Product is exactly as described. Very good quality and very well constructed. This leather case fits my Nikon P520 perfectly. It was a good purchase and a good purchase experience.

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Fits the camera well and i can snap off the cover face and let it hang on with the bottom snap if i need to shoot a quick photo. Provides excellent protection.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I absolutely love this camera! I was extremely nervous to order something so expensive when it had only a few reviews. It comes with 3 lenses two of which are canon brand lenses and one that isn't but still is very nice. Plus it came with all kinds of fun other things like a mini tripod and an different filter lenses. Great purchase glad I took a chance on this product!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This is an amazing deal. I've been shopping around for this type of camera and lenses for quite some time so I knew what I wanted and the average price. Let me say, it was way more than this. AND here I got lots of accessories that I wouldn't have gotten at a store. I am not a professional photographer, just an amateur that wants to mess with it and learn. I've used a camera like this with my work so I am familiar with it and this one met all my expectations. I have not tried the very large lens yet but the two Cannon lenses work great. I also have not tried the flash that came with it yet. I'm delighted to have a mono-pole but will use a regular tripod, which I already have, when using the longest lens. I do have to say the bag that came with this stuff is a bit cheap feeling. I quickly ditched that and got a backpack to transport everything.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I recently wrote a review and gave this item 4 stars. My sincere apologies for I thought I was missing 3 of the included filters. As I looked further in to the case it comes in, I found the 3 missing filters. Aside from that, this camera deal is a total package!! I'm most impressed with the quality of images and every time I use it, I get better as I become more familiar with the manipulation of its settings. I HIGHLY recommend this package!! THANK YOU!!

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Molded just right for my p520 Nikon!  protects my camera with the thick leather and stitched very well! couldn't be happier with this purchase or the delivery!  thanks Mega Gear!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This is my first DSLR camera.  I bought this to complement my DJI drone photography and im not disappointed. It's fun learning new stuff and this package comes with a ton of accessories to work with on my journey to evolve my skills.  I've included a few photos. I know i can do better once I've learned to master this tool.  Have fun!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: Great camera. Two short lenses and great, the long one is a bit of a gimmick. This is. Super entry pack. And you can add better lenses, I have a EF 100-400mm f/4.5-5.6 IS II USM lens and the photos with it and this camera are mind blowing!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I received when expected and it was all in great condition. The T6 works great and I was very happy with all the extra lenses and filters etc that came with it. Haven't had time to try out everything yet. I have a T3 and T5 so I am very happy with this camera.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: Great Camera only thing I wish is that you could video record remotely using the app.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: Years ago I owned a Canon XTi Rebel 35mm film camera. Loved that camera!!! Then I bought an SX40 and loved that camera and last year decided on something stronger - the SX60. For some reason I couldn't get a feeling for that one. Then I saw the T6 w/the 500mm lens.  Almost identical to the XTi - only digital. Bought it on Black Friday, had it Saturday. I couldn't have asked for better packaging with the camera and one lens wrapped with bubble wrap. The 75-300 was in a box of it own and packed so it wouldn't bounce around. The whole bundle was packed very securely. Tried the camera and lenses and all worked as it should. I can see an affair coming already with this camera. If you've ever had one of the 35mm film Rebels, you'll adore this one.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This is a great starter kit and a very good value for someone who wants a nice camera set up. Although I purchased some extra lenses and accessories to go with this set, I am very pleased with this set as a starter set. Takes great pictures, and is very versatile for someone who wants to take a lot of different types of photos. The lenses are not the best quality, but they are pretty well made and should last for a very long time if not abused.

review: This is a great camera for small kids. We got it for my 7-year-old daughter. She love it and always hold it! Pictures may not be the best quality but great quality for little ones. Love that you have different screens you can use. It is easy to use for small kids.

product_name: [16GB Memory Card Include] RegeMoudal Kids Digital Camera Gifts for Child Boys Girls,Mini Rechargeable Children Shockproof Digital Camcorders Little Kid Toys Gift 8MP with Battery 2 Inch,Pink
review: Sooooo cute!  Great size for little hands. Little Girls love to take pics and videos and I don’t love to share my phone for them to do it. It solved my problem perfectly! Love it!

product_name: [16GB Memory Card Include] RegeMoudal Kids Digital Camera Gifts for Child Boys Girls,Mini Rechargeable Children Shockproof Digital Camcorders Little Kid Toys Gift 8MP with Battery 2 Inch,Pink
