product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Great camera but there are others that may be better at this point in time. The huge zoom is sometimes unnecessary. Although this may sound bad there are so many features to play around with on this camera. I will leave some pictures so that you can decide for yourself if this is your camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I originally did not like this camera but after using it a few more times realized it was me not the camera. I am use to Canon cameras. I got a fantastic shot of the Blue Moon this month and am now going through the advanced user guide. I have not had a chance to use the camera extensively and find it is different than other camera brands in the way it operates or even uploads on line. I bought it for the zoom and the zoom does not disappoint.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I wanted a super zoom bridge camera because I take a lot of bird photos but couldn't justify the cost of upgrading to a DSLR right now.  Before I bought the LUMIX, I had been using a Fujifilm SL300, which I loved but which didn't quite have the power I wanted at 30x zoom.  The Panasonic camera has mostly met my expectations, with clear optics for the zoom (with a tripod, of course) and options for manual settings that allow me to tweak my shots.  The Intelligent Auto setting is surprisingly good in selecting the correct settings for the scene you're shooting, although it doesn't always give me what I want, hence the need for the manual settings.  With a 60x optical zoom and macro lens settings, this camera gives me both power and versatility.,Some reviewers have mentioned how big it is, and because I couldn't find it in stores, I was nervous.  I was relieved to discover that it's NOT big for a bridge camera, only in comparison to a point-and-shoot.  The LUMIX is the same size as my Fujifilm, just with a wider lens.  There's a bump out on the right for gripping with a nice area for my thumb on the back of the case -- we lefties have always had to adjust for a mostly righty world, and I have no issue holding the camera with my right hand.  I'm not going to stash this inside of a handbag, but then again, I didn't expect to.  When I'm using this, I wear it around my neck or over my shoulder.,The LUMIX has too many features to include in a customer review; however, several of them are worth noting, especially for those who want to use this as more than a point-and-shoot:  manual settings for aperture and shutter speed; the ability to program shift; focus locking; the option to switch from LED screen to traditional viewfinder; pop-up flash; shoe for separate flash; continuous ("burst") shooting mode, with or without autofocus, up to nine shots.  Point-and-shooters will be familiar with the scene options, and, of course, the camera also takes video, although I never use it for that.  I also never use the "creative control" feature since, if I really wanted special effects, I'd do it on my computer, not with the camera itself.  Although anyone can pick up and use this camera, it takes some practice to get used to the settings and features for a more enhanced photography experience.  Don't expect the LUMIX DMC-FZ70 to equal a DSLR, but do expect it to be much better than a point-and-shoot.  My only disappointment, and hence the half-star deduction, is the inability to use a remote shutter.  Most people won't care about this; however, for bird photography, I could really use it at times.,The camera comes with a battery (buy a spare!), a wall charger, a lens cap, and a neck strap.  You'll have to buy a case if you want to protect it and don't already have one.  And don't forget the memory card.,In comparison to the Fujifilm I already owned, the Panasonic is almost interchangeable except for the zoom power.  Both are excellent bridge cameras with roughly the same size and features.  The stability feature on the Panasonic might be slightly better, and it includes a few extra options; however, I consider them to be comparable cameras.  The real issue is deciding on the maximum optical zoom power and whether you need it.,-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have it now for 3 months and it does not do what it promises to do. Pictures are blurred, no matter what setting you take. You take 5 pictures, same light, same motive, within 10 seconds (not talking about lighting), but 2 out of 5 are blurred and pixelated.  Truly disappointing. Had professional photographers test it and they are also not happy with it. If I could, I would return and get another one!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Brought this camera with me to Europe for a backpacking trip. Couldn't be happier! It was easy to use, durable, and really portable. The picture quality was fantastic. The panoramic function was probably my favorite, I've attached my favorite as an example. I was also really pleased with the battery life, over a month of constant use I only had to charge it twice. The lens pops off a lot, which is a downside but the camera bag is a good protector.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Really like this camera.  Was worried it might be too clunky, but quickly got used to it, and it's actually easier to steady and handle.  Picture quality is not the best when using full zoom, but pretty good considering what I paid for this.  The best feature is the ability to use a viewfinder which most times is missing in the small compact point and shoot.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Already have the ZS40 but find it a bit small for my gorilla hands.  The 70 is absolutely perfect.  Getting rid of all my Nikon DSLR gear, two bodies, five lenses and many pounds in the bag.  Hardly know the FZ is hanging from my neck.  Don't think I am giving up much picture quality for the savings in weight and inconvenience of dragging around all that stuff.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I waited awhile to review my Lumix because I wanted to spend some time with it. I want to preface that I am not a professional nor am I aspiring to be a professional photographer. I will say that I am an artist so I know how to frame a photo and I know lighting and color. I am also obsessed with wildlife and macro photography which is the reason that I chose this camera.,I will tell you that I have had this camera for over a year and have taken pictures indoors in lowlight (with and without flash) sunlight, artificial light, etc... and has given me beautiful photos every time. My last camera, Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150, couldn't handle any of my photography in lowlights.,The zoom is wonderful for outdoor photography. The colors are crisp. If you flip it onto auto it will do most everything for you.,Lumix DMC-FZ70 is no muss, no fuss. It is wonderful point and shoot for those are new to the photography world and would like a starter camera.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I'm not a professional photographer by any stretch. But I have had numerous cameras in my lifetime and this is by far the best one I've ever had. The zoom length is amazing, the color and clarity are SO sharp and "right on". I highly recommend this camera.,It's also quite eay to use. BUT you have to read the lengthy manual to take advantage of all of its capabilities.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I have a DSLR and I have a pocket camera. The pocket camera does what it was designed to do. Sit in your pocket and take pictures. They were never great but...I purchased the DMC-FZ70 after several weeks of research and I must say I am very impressed. I have had it for three weeks now and I am still finding new features. In fact the only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because I have to "find" the new features the manual could be better in explaining all the camera does. Shooting in RAW format is great and works well. Great camera smaller and lighter than a DSLR and much better quality pictures than a pocket camera.

review: The camera is okay, not better than the average smartphone camera. The charger for the battery that came with the camera not the one in the accessories did not work, it is broken. Also the SD card reader doesn't fit the SD card for the camera... Its for mini SD cards. I feel like this was not the best camera I could have bought for the price but lesson learned.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: Purchased for my granddaughter's 7th B-Day; while most of the accessories were too much for a little person, overall a great package and camera. She loves it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: Phone was out of memory - needed this to take pictures at a wedding.  It took great pictures.  Easy to transfer to a computer.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: I bought this as a gift for my son-in-law. He absolutely loves it! The picture quality is amazing. The bundle that came with it provided EVERYTHING that he needed to run out and begin take pics (which he did within 15 mins of getting it).

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: The camera is fine, but came without the full complement of necessary accessories to take the first picture.  Why not a complete set-up?

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

The clarity when I uploaded them was so crisp.  I will say though that it doesn't take the best nighttime photos, even with the flash.  If you're looking for a handy pocket camera then this is definitely it.

review: Summer trip usage for my son he loved it great pics

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Very small, you can simply put it in you pocket, but the photo quality is not good.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I purchased this camera for a 5 yr old that loves taking pictures and videos. Works great for her. Images are not great but she doesn't care. If you are looking for quality pictures you want to get something better but just for fun and so a kid can see what they take pictures of it's fine. Images tend to be dark and overexposed. Changing the sharpness to soft made them easier to look at. For the most part they are clear. Zoom gets a pretty blurry.  Battery lasts well and we like the lack of moving parts.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Camera is lightweight and easy to use. It came with a small bag to carry it in. It also came with an extra battery. My elementary age children are enjoying being able to take their own pictures!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I got this for my son and he opened it to use it right away! He really loved the bright red color!! Perfect for kids to mess around and learn basic functions of a camera. Will definitely recommend for kids, very easy and simple to use!

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: Very poor quality and pictures are blurry. Returning this item.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Cannot believe the cost of these little tiny feather light cameras.  I’m sure he will perform just fine.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: I purchased this to take close up shots of materials used in manufacturing. Image quality was very poor. Images were blurry and could not get decent pictures on any of the materials I needed. Returned.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Camara much smaller than i thought to the point of being difficult to hold on to securely. For a 20 megapixel cam photos are not detailed or bright, and movement causes a blurred photo. In today's world of fine camaras this seems more like an overpriced toy.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: It takes good closeup pictures IF you're lucky or you can figure out how to set the controls, but the instructions are hopelessly inadequate and misleading. Even when I emailed Aberg Best, their response on how to set it up was incorrect.

product_name: AbergBest 21 Mega Pixels 2.7" LCD Rechargeable HD Digital Camera,Video camera Digital Students cameras,Indoor Outdoor for Adult/Seniors/Kids (Black)
review: I brought that camera for my 7 years old daughter, she loves it Easy to use, nothing complicate on/off, shutter, zoom and menu button.  Super lightweight.  Good battery life.  You can take some amazing pictures

review: This is my first review, this camera took blurry pictures and the battery life did not hold up well even with turning the camera off after each picture. Not a 21 Mega Pixel camera.

review: Purchased to replace older camera and the best feature, I think, is it using a rechargeable battery. That will save us the expense of buying and replacing batteries like we did with the old one.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20MP 8X Zoom Digital Camera (Silver) + 32GB Card + Reader + Case + Accessory Bundle
review: I like the camera a lot. although not you the seller but amazon suggested the USB cable for Canon power shot ELPH and the camera is not equped for it. It does however fit my GPS.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Needed a new full frame camera body.  I also had to have 4K hdr video... the only other option I had(as a Nikon user) was the new d850 that you can’t find right now and is $1200 more expensive. Boy am I glad I made the Sony jump. Did 3 photo shoots with it this week and pictures are outstanding. It will take me a while to get all of the buttons setup so I can find them quickly - af mode and iso especially.,I also got the vello adapter and it works great with my g portrait lenses. I loose the autofocus of course but I’m sure someone will build an electronic adapter that will work with my lenses.,As for the video wow it is great and when using the Sony lens the autofocus is spot on for me and that alone is worth the switch since my eyes are not what they used to be.,The B&H kit comes with a free charger FYI

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: My first review on Amazon, after years and years of orders. It's hard not to when you purchase the cannon killer. This Camera does it all, my primary uses are for video but it's amazing to know I have a world class photography camera at my finger tips when I need it. I recommend this to anyone who is on the edge of switching to a full frame camera. This boss is a beast!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I got this camera from adorama when the pre orders dropped. Hands down the best camera I have used so far. Only con are the prices of native lens. But, if you can always adapt virtually any lens to this thing.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Everything I’ve been waiting for and more. So excited I got to try it out. Can’t wait to buy it. To the reviewer who wrote about it not reading his memory card, It didn’t read my memory card at first either, so I got a different one and Shazam, it worked!!  Don’t spend $2000 on a camera and hey hung up on a $20 memory card. Get a new one silly

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: at the time i bought my a7iii, i determined that it was the best camera for the money.,since then nikon put out its z6/7 which i've heard are also good, but i love my sony.,only thing that bugs me is i have some overheating issues when recording for longer than 25ish minutes.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This is the best Full Frame Camera out there as of today for $2k, no contest...but I do have two minor things to address (or maybe just a wishlist).,The AF On button: I wish this button was bigger so using back button focus will be alot easier.,The door to the usb charging: wow what a pain when charging the battery that the flip out door is right against the cable.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: The camera is great - when it's working. If you get the dreaded shutter curtain stuck issue and you're in the EU (Greece) then you're in for many weeks service. Also the microphone jack just suddenly stopped working - another 4 weeks. Compared to other major brands, Sony's menu is something I don't really mind - I navigate quite fast these days, but using the roll dial in order to change ISO, or even the dedicated dials for shutter and aperture - there is a noticeable delay and lag in order to perform the action. Autofocus is one of the best I've seen.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I was going to buy another lens, but the picture of the one I got had a little sign that says "Adobe Creative Cloud Photography Plan 3-month Complimentary Membership". I called Amazon customer service they said it is about the manufacturer which is Sony. I hanged up and called again, and then, they said you can get it only when you get the base. Sorry but this is bulshit. This is the worst experience I have ever had on Amazon since I started shopping.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Hands down the best camera I've ever owned. All photos shown using 100% natural light. Edited in Lightroom Classic.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: This is a BEAST of a camera. The only complaint I have is the horrible, horrible menu system, but from just about every angle it bests the Canon Mark 4 with ease. No brainer for serious photographers who are looking for a full frame around this price point. Silent shooting mode doesnt get talked about enough, also be sure to set a button to Eye Autofocus to get the full magic!

For those who don't want to have a cumbersome SLR travel, it's a good choice, but the picture quality is not as good as an expensive professional camera, but it is still very good at this price.

HD quality filming. light weight, so you don't feel tired easily during filming. the material made is something can be improved, but I think they just trying to spend more on the inside not from the outside.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: Got this camera for my niece . Great little starter camera. Has some cool features . Very good quality shots. On our home laptop, the video looks natural color, crisp and clear.. I like this little video camera

review: I needed a digital video camera to help me transfer old cine reels to the computer. This was perfect for the job - simple to use, high enoug image quality, and cheap. I wasn't expecting much for the money, and was very happy to have my expectations massively exceeded by this camera. I struggle to understand how it's possible to make something this good for the amount I paid for it.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: For the price you are definitely getting what you pay for if not more!Its customization features for me are a must for any video camera be it camcorder, dslr, mobile or what ever your preference. I can safely say this has it!. From color, exposure and output quality these need to be looked tat before operating this camera as you environment depends on the settings to be adjusted to get the best outcome. something i didn't master in my clips in the video.

review: Not worth 15 dollars. Cheap looking and produces poor quality photos.

review: Love this camera and the fact that it takes regular AA batteries instead of rechargeable. Nice to just pop in new batteries when you're at an event instead losing your charge and not being able to take any more pictures.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I purchased this camera set for a trip to Alaska.  I was very pleased with how easy it was to use this camera and loved the pictures it took.  I do have some trouble using the telescope lens, and they do offer other packages so if that's something you don't need, you may want to chose a package with a different lens.  I use this camera all the time living in the woods for wildlife pictures and they are professional quality.  It did come with a lot of extras and I haven't used some of them.  However, I shopped around for this specific camera and this price couldn't be beat.  I even went to a store to look at this exact camera before purchasing and the store's price just for the camera and a small lens was more than this whole package.  Definitely very pleased with this purchase.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This camera is basically idiot proof. It has settings for different types of picture types. My camera is generally set on sports mode, but I have taken portrait photos and landscape photos. The bundle comes with light filters and screens, which allow you to control the amount of light coming into the lens. This is awesome for Friday Night Lights photos. I also love the two different lenses that come in the bundle. They make taking photos super easy based on your distance from the subject and how up close and personal you want to be. If you are a manual reader as I am, you can make your photos even crisper by adjusting the shutter speed. This is accomplished by knowing which small dial to turn. The autofocus feature is also nice. I love this camera!

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This is by far the nicest camera I have ever owned especially for the price. I loved having the option to buy a beginners set including everything one might need. My only complaint is that the spider tripod is cheaply made and it broke very easily even after MINIMAL use and only using it in the very basic tripod fashion without bending the legs into any sort of shape. A minor inconvenience for sure but I can't really complain given the price.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: very good camera

product_name: MegaGear "Ever Ready" Protective Dark Brown Leather Camera Case, Bag for Nikon COOLPIX P520, Nikon COOLPIX P530, Nikon COOLPIX P610 Digital Camera
review: Well made, nice looking. If you are looking for a "quick shot," though, keep the top off.  It takes too much too long to take it off.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This is a great, I am so happy with this purchase..

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I love the camera Canon T6, I think it’s very good beginner camera. I honestly only use Canon EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS II and,Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens. I feel like you don’t need the huge telescope lens unless you are going to take picture of the moon or lions from far. The bag it comes with are okay and so are the filter. The reason I’m giving 3 star review is because the little tripod broke on me and I email them just to get a reply a week later. The monopod is pretty bad. But overall look for the kit that has the Canon with two lens and you should be ready for your photography journey.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle

review: I would be giving it more than 10 stars.  I’ve been eyeing this camera for the past 3 months and finally after all the wait I finally got it today. But shipment was great and the customers that answered questions were great. I’m still learning photography and hope one day my dream comes true of owning my own studio.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This package has all sorts of extras, including some things I’ll probably never use.  The only thing notably missing is a 2nd rear lens cap.  I’ll have to order another one separately.,I wouldn’t recommend this camera for casual users.  The “automatic” mode has been more than a little frustrating.  It takes forever to auto-focus even after changing some settings.  Sometimes it makes all the sounds of snapping a photo but then you go to look at how it turned out and there is no photo.,I have a lot of experience with 35mm film SLR cameras and so it didn’t take long to learn to use the manual options.  I really like Shutter Priority mode (TV) for moving objects and Aperture Priority mode (AV) for still shots.  I keep this camera set to manual focus at all times.,Take some practice shots to get the correct ISO and this camera can get really great photos!

product_name: [16GB Memory Card Include] RegeMoudal Kids Digital Camera Gifts for Child Boys Girls,Mini Rechargeable Children Shockproof Digital Camcorders Little Kid Toys Gift 8MP with Battery 2 Inch,Pink
review: This camera is so cute and very soothing to the eye. It's exactly like the pictures given- the casing is smooth, the pink is very pastel and beautiful, and the yellow is just as pastel and bright. The camera feels very lightweight and it's quite small compared to regular cameras, but then again it would be perfect for young children to play with. It feels sort of plasticy but it's a very nice texture. I didn't quite understand what it meant by stickers, but when I tried it, to me it was more like filters (like those on Snapchat, Facebook messenger, or Instagram). The only difference from these camera filters and the social media filters is that the camera can't match up to your face. The sticker/filter is in a set location and you have to match it up to the person or thing you are taking a picture off. The camera is really easy to use and I love how there is a memory card included. My niece will definitely love this for sure. It'll be a great toy for any children that loves to take pictures of things and wants to have a camera of their own. Although I do wish there were other colors since not all kids like pastel pink. Definitely recommend though.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: This is my first full Digital camera I have ever had. I always loved photography, and I have been using all kinds of different types of smartphone and tablets for taking pictures. While lots of those handheld mobile devices did very good at taking pictures, this it DSC-W800 beats all the smartphone and tablet cameras especially with the image processing like (exposure etc.) Also the 5x Optical Zoom is awesome lots of smartphone cameras don't have any Optical Zoom and the ones that do are very limited on the distance because of the focal length. Most new high end smartphone cameras have 1x-2x Optical Zoom which is barely noticeable. And digital zoom just sucks. So coming from tablets and smartphone cameras I have to say this is my best first digital camera I have ever had! The camera has auto focus, 5x Optical Zoom, has a proprietary USB cable for data transfer and changing. The pictures are very good which I will attach in this review.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: This is a very good camera for everyday use. I keep it with me at all times at work and its' 'predecessor' cybershot was extremely reliable and although it still works well, developed an issue after 6 years and I figured it was time to replace it, so I purchased the next closest clone in the it line which I expect will serve as well. Purchase was fine and delivery fast.

product_name: GordVE 2.7 Inch Digital Camera, HD Camera for Backpacking, Mini Digital Camera Pocket Cameras Digital with Zoom, Compact Cameras for Photography
review: Wonderful camcorder!!! The video turned out very clear. It is an fabulous camera for outside filming. It has powerful zoom to help filming outside. I know everyone uses smartphones to record videos and photos, but when we have a big or special events going on I think we should have a DV. It is not heavy at all so your don't have to worry carrying all day. The view screen rotate, easy to operate, touch screen and it has the night vision.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Took this to the national parks. More settings than a point and shoot normal camera that you can accidentally get lost in. The factory default is the best. Great clarity and quality pictures.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Love this camera. It is light, 16 mp and the zoom is fantastic. There are so many features that I will have to study the manual for a while to know how to use them all. I can hardly wait to take this camera on my next trip. I should get some amazing nature pictures. Zoom is 60x for optical and another 60x for digital (120x). Wide angle is 20 mm and it zooms out to 1200mm at full extension. I looked at various cameras with a mega zoom feature including the Canon SX50. This Lumix has most of the features of the Canon as well as a few extra, a larger optical zoom (60x as opposed to 50x on the Canon) and is priced about $35 less than the Canon. I am very happy with my purchase.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Bought this for my husband because of the huge zoom feature.  He loves it!  You definitely have to be careful to be VERY steady when it's zoomed all the way out because the image can tend to be grainy in certain lights and if there's any movement.  But, he's taken some really great images at full zoom and it's always surprising how close he can get.  It's lightweight and small enough to carry around all day; all the other buttons & functions are easy to find and similar to our other camera.  Not top of the line, but definitely a good value.  Recommended for an affordable camera with lots of function.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I owned a Lumix camera before but due to some unfortunate events it was broken, and instead of getting it repaired my husband decided to get me a brand new camera. I knew right away I wanted a new Lumix because the photos come out amazing, the camera is easy to use and all the extra features are all so fun to play with. I have a family of 5 and nothing is more important than the memories we make, and with my Lumix those memories will not only be saved, but look as crystal clear as the day they happened.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: large magnifying lens 60x,focus while zooming,allows adjustment of focus and SLR cameras,not interchangeable lens fixed,internal memory of 4 gb,has all the modes and effects of a point and shoot camera,easy to use,comes with protective lens cap, battery and strap,manual in multiple languages,packed in its original box.,the display is not moveable,brings optical viewfinder.,Recommended for intermediate photograph experience,gran lente de 60x de aumento,enfoca mientras se hace zoom,permite ajustes de enfoque como camaras reflex,de lente fijo no intercambiable,la memoria interna de 4 gb,tiene todos los modos y efectos de una camara apunta y dispara,facil de usar,viene con tapa protectora de lente, bateria y correa,con manual en multiples lenguajes,empacada en su caja original.,la pantalla es fija,trae visor optico.,recomendada para el fotografo de experiencia intermedio

review: I love this camera in every way. It's fun, versatile and a lot of bang for your buck. It's great quality and yet cheap enough to take to the beach, camping, hiking or vacation. If it gets lost it won't cripple you financially. It has enough professional features to let you experiment with photography for years.

review: I'm a long time Panasonic fan.  I like to take travel / tourist pics and have no mad photography skills.  Just got back from San Diego where I took pics at the zoo and the Safari Park.  This camera zoomed in to the big cats faces so well.  I got some great shots.  And, best of all maybe, it did a good job of getting past the wire to the animal at the zoo.  The larger size is a little unwieldy to compared to the pocket cameras but it really takes great pics.  Recommend!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

Nearing retirement with grandchildren we want to continue to add pictures of, and a need to keep it simple. This camera does that and is capable of so much more than we will ever use, and the price, wow. We are extremely happy with it. Upon retirement, with a little time on my hands I plan on exploring some of its' fancier abilities.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: of events, I only had the canera for a very bruef amount of time.,I am a Canon user and only own Canon lenses and one Rokinon. The camera I am using now is a T5i so nothing professional.,What I like about the Sony:,The camera feels sturdy and heavy like the old 35mm film cameras of the good ol days. I loved that feel.,The sensor is huge compared to the one in my Canon T5I.,The autofocus, Adapted with a Metabones V, was incredibly fast on my 50mm 1.8.,The bokeh was amazing.,WhatI didn’t like about the A7III:,Coming from a past of Canon’s cameras, this camera feels like a point and shoot. The doors that cover the usb and external mic is so flimsy it feels wrong for a $2K camera. Even the door that holds the SD cards or the battery feel very flimsy. My T5I, a $400 camera, feels much more rugged.,No battery charger. Are you serious, Sony?,That is all I can say this far. In short, eithrr my canera or my metabones adapter were difective and, once I took the metabones off the canera, the lens contacts on the camer body were broken. Like, 2 were completely cut off and 2 were bent. So, I am getting a replacement of both items and will update the review then.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)

review: Excellent camera.  Period end of story.  Quick focusing, sharp images and incredible video quality.,That being said, it is not a Canon DSLR replacement.  Shot a wedding this past weekend using both my Canon 1DXMK2 & this Sony A73 w/ 55mm 1.8.  My Canon is sharper with better colors.  Now this Sony did a great job but its not to the point where I would ditch my Canon cameras and shoot weddings exclusively on Sony.,Video quality is great.  Makes a excellent steady cam camera.  Slow motion is fantastic.  ISO performance is on par with the 1DXMK2

The camera was smaller than I expected, but very user-friendly and I'm excited for her to receive it next week! Be sure to buy a memory card as this camera does not come with much internal storage (3 pics max). I did a lot of research and didn't see an easy-to-use camera that could beat the price of this one! I'm very happy with my purchase.

product_name: Digital Camera with WiFi 24.0 MP Vlogging Camera 2.7K Ultra HD 3.0 Inch Camera with Flip Screen Retractable Flashlight (RG)
review: I was so surprised when I finally got this camera how disappointed I was given the fantastic reviews! We have a GoPro but the fish eye angle drives me crazy sometimes. This is a camera I would give my kids to play around with. But when it comes to me recording stuff in our lives, I’ll spend a few more hundred to get better quality.,First, the internal mic is AWFUL. It picks up every little shift in the camera itself. It ends up sounding like creaking and crackling noises. And then even at arm’s length I could barely hear what I was saying.,Second, it wasn’t as intuitive to use. I consider myself decently tech-savvy, but I had to use the user guide multiple times.,Third, I was not impressed with the photo quality. Super grainy no matter how I messed with the settings.,I’m not sure if I just got a dud, but I’ve noticed the same photo being used for other listings on here. The other listings don’t have perfect reviews. Maybe that should have tipped me off that something fishy is going on. Unfortunately I’m going to return this camera.

review: I took it out of the box, installed batteries, turned on, set date and turned it off.  Lense wouldn't retract, then it wouldn't turn back on. Garbage.

product_name: Kodak PIXPRO Friendly Zoom FZ43-BK 16MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom and 2.7" LCD Screen (Black)
review: I am searching for the original box so I can return this. (Hopefully I didn't throw it out, ugh). My daughter has had this since her birthday mid july, so about 3 weeks. On her memory card she has 30 pictures and 4 short, less than 30 seconds each, videos. I have replaced the batteries a total of 7 times in this thing already!!! That is crazy! No she isnt lraving it on. She takes a few pics, then she goes to turn it off . It turns off but the lens never goes fully back into the camera bc the batteries have died. I so wish I had bought a different camera for my 10 year old. The pictures are fine for the price of the camera. We don't need a camera that takes pro pictures . The camera is my 10 year old daughter's camera.  But I shouldn't need to put batteries in it every 10 pictures! That's insane.,Choose another camera. Spend a little more and save yourself some aggravation.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX B500 16MP 40x Optical Zoom Digital Camera w/Built-in Wi-Fi NFC & Bluetooth (Black) + 16GB SDHC Accessory Bundle
review: This was an amazing deal from Beach Camera!  Love the features of this Nikon Coolpix B500.  I'm not a camera person but I love to take pix, and this works very well.  It's like a step above a point-and-click, but with a wonderful lens that can zoom in tight.  I bought this for my husband's birthday because he liked my other one so much that I figured he should have his own.  (not that I don't mind sharing, but when we're together and trying to take pix, seems to me that we should not have to wait our turn to use this great camera),I was particularly impressed with the whole bundle from this seller.  There are so many great accessories included that aren't normally with a camera purchase.  The bag is a really good camera bag that adjusts to hold virtually anything you'd need.  Love that they included both a large spider tripod and a short tripod.  Plus, they sent a 64gb memory card which was a very nice touch.  The cleaning kit was included as was a USB reader for the memory card.  Also, despite the fact that this base camera comes with four batteries, they also included four rechargeable batteries together with a charger.  I think we got a great deal on this camera, and my husband is loving his new toy!

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX B500 16MP 40x Optical Zoom Digital Camera w/Built-in Wi-Fi NFC & Bluetooth (Black) + 16GB SDHC Accessory Bundle
review: I am a semi pro nature photographer and I found this camera a sore disappointment as it pertains to image quality. I have been using Fuji for about 15 years and I switched to Nikon for a change. It contained most of the basic features as my Fuji except the eye lens. Please note: You are only able to take a picture using the display. If you need to see extreme detail, this may frustrate you. With a 40x zoom, you need an eye lens. I used the camera for about a week and a half. The image quality  is terrible and every image on a regular/auto setting is thoroughly washed out. If you utilize the dawn/dusk or sunset setting it drops a blue cast over the image which in some cases looks ridiculous, but without it, it would be too bright. There is no definition or depth to the images. It seem to me I get either washed out/unremarkable images or blue images. Glare is hard to avoid as well even with a darker setting. You don't see this glare until you download the larger image. I have provided images side by side. From L to R is a cell phone image, one on Auto and one on Dawn/Dusk. At least the cell image has no glare. An everyday user for everyday life, this is fine. Other than that, it has no use. It is my opinion that the reviews posted are fictitious. There is simply no way I could be getting these pictures based on REAL reviews. It doesn't make sense.

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX B500 16MP 40x Optical Zoom Digital Camera w/Built-in Wi-Fi NFC & Bluetooth (Black) + 16GB SDHC Accessory Bundle
review: This camera is great.,1. Take a picture, it goes right to your phone BAM! Upload it, send it, easy to share.,2. Batteries, some may not like the AA type but for traveling it's Paramount.,Having a Keen eye makes for great picture taking and I've been away from it for a while now. My old Nikon N64 35MM film camera is still a champion.,But this camera is fun and easy to use.,Versatile in almost anyway.,And it takes outstanding photos.,So if you are new to the hobby or just want something that is ready to go and pull in from a good distance.,This camera will not upset you.,So easy to use.,Have fun!

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX B500 16MP 40x Optical Zoom Digital Camera w/Built-in Wi-Fi NFC & Bluetooth (Black) + 16GB SDHC Accessory Bundle
review: This is an update to my last review.  This is a great camera for amateur photographers.  It is true to the advertisement.  It is a lot smaller than I expected, but I appreciate that it will be easier to slip into a purse when I travel.  Very comfortable to hold and use.  Straightforward features.  I would say the shutter (if that is the right word) is very slow.  So if you are setting up for a sudden photo op, you might miss it.  That is the reason I cannot give it five stars.  Also, I had a great customer service experience with Beach Camera.  Initially, when I got the camera, there was a defective European battery charger in the box, and for many reasons, it would be no good for a U.S. based customer.  Also, the batteries had already corroded.  It could be argued that someone should have caught it, but I understand mistakes happen.  I appreciate just how quickly they resolved the problem.  Thanks, Beach Camera!

product_name: Nikon COOLPIX B500 16MP 40x Optical Zoom Digital Camera w/Built-in Wi-Fi NFC & Bluetooth (Black) + 16GB SDHC Accessory Bundle
review: I love this camera. This thing is so much better than I expected. I originally bought it for filming my you tube channel but found that this camera takes great photos. The video is second to none and compairs to cameras costing much much more. The video sound quality is surprisingly good. This is the best camera purchase I have made in the last five years. I love I.

review: 01-15-19  Editing my review. Wish I had not bought this. Very disappointed in this Nikon. Enough so that my next purchase will be another brand altogether. *********This purchase was to replace my NikonCoolpix P510. Had that one for several years and finally the abuse caught up with it. I actually feel like I took a step down with this new camera. But, I have not used it a great deal yet so perhaps my opinion will change. I shot some video at a dog agility trial, even in good sun there was a bit of blur when I zoomed. One negative of note, the usb cable to allow me to upload directly to my pc is RIDICULOUSLY short. Too damn bad the usb cable from my old Nikon won't work with the new one. This camera is OK. Just not super.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: My Pentax DSL camera wouldn't autofocus any more so it was time for a new camera. I have been a Pentax owner for 30 years but couldn't believe the price of this bundled set which I got for slightly more than the price of a new lens for my Pentax. I will say the housing is not a robust as the Pentax so it remains to be seen how it works in the field. However, for a beginner or someone who just doesn't want to spend thousands on their digital photography this is absolutely great.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: Heavy for an older person

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: This is my third Canon camera. I had an older film SLR and then a Rebel XT. Unfortunately an accident rendered that one inoperable. So I looked at this T6.  Overall I like it but I am very familiar with Canon.  The body is much lighter than the older XT which is a plus. I have played around a bit with the WiFi and it seems straight forward.,The only complaint I have is that the lens shades when attached to the lens (both Canon lenses) is that the lens cap doesn't fit.  They screw on to the fittings like a filter will.  The tolerance is just a bit off.,More reviews as I put the camera through its paces.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: Every thing works perfectky! Worth every penny. So I went to YouTube twice, because I was too lastly to read the users manual and lack patience. I watched a video on getting started, that showed all the buttons on the camera and the second video was how to set both the zoom lens to 32 to get me started. All I had to do with the zoom then was focus the end of it. Well treacherous crystal clear shots, zoom gets me closer to the critters, and the negation gets me crater shots of the moon. This camera is also lighter then the cannon Seri had in the 90's and I also YouTube's how to use the Bluetooth Wi-Fi with my phone to remotely take photos and receive them for Facebook. Anywho, I'm more patient these days and technology is easier, so I'm a happy camper. Thank you for your service.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: The camera is really good! The quality is awesome and the all the stuff it comes with is so cool. It came with everything listed and it was all very good quality. Honestly I would've given it 5 stars but the SD card that came with it was broken and doesn't work. That was the only problem though! The bag is really cool and has these velcro section dividers so you can divide up the bag anyway you want! I'm so excited to have this camera! I'm going on a trip next month and this the perfect thing.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle

review: I am amazed at everything included in this package for the price. I've been using phone cameras for the past few years but wanted to get some decent zoom capability for nature photography.  It took a few hours of playing with it and a couple youtube videos and now I am beginning to get comfortable with it. I was skeptical about the 500mm zoom at first because it was relatively cheap, but the few test shots I took came out great. My last SLR was a Pentex K1000 from the 70's.

Would give it 5 stars if it wasn't for that detail.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I was a professional photographer 10+ years ago and always wanted a Canon EOS, but could not afford one.  This package costs way less than an original EOS and you get a ton of extras. Although the phone was way more convenient, the pictures from this camera were much better, especially the action shots.

review: I love this camera because of the anti-shake feature. I teach photography and Photoshop. I stopped buying Sony 10 years ago because of expensive proprietary memory. This one uses a standard SD card. I am very happy with it and tested it at Disney. It did well.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: Seems to work fine as a small point and shoot.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: After reading the positive reviews and seeing the price, I decided to purchase this camera for a trip. It's very easy to use out of the box. Simply install the battery and your memory card and start using. The memory card is sold separately. As an amateur photographer, I loved how easy it was to snap pictures. All you have to do is aim and press the button. I was also impressed with the battery. My first digital camera was a Kodak that required Double-A's, which ran down very quickly. I used over three dozen batteries on that trip, which wasn't cheap. That wasn't the case with the battery. I never once had to recharge it during my 1.5 week trip. The reason I give it three stars is because of the picture quality and the screen. The screen was hard to view in a variety of lights because it was dim. The picture quality was too light, and some of them came out soft and blurry, even when I was standing still. That said, I managed to get some good shots that I was able to improve with Photoshop. I love the compact design, which is perfect for traveling.

review: Images were worse than the prior model.  Compared to a Nikon d3500 - the images were awful.  The video was okay, but then if you zoom in or out you can hear the mechanical sound of the zoom. Did not feel good in my hand - the camera body is very similar to others, again, nearly identical in feel to the Nikon D3500, but the images on the Nikon are much much better.  I used to have a prior Lumix model - a point and shoot that was flat so you could put in your pocket.  Not sure that one is still available, but that was better than this.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This was purchased as a gift for my husband and he loves it! We are avid birders and he is using this to take photos of birds. The photos are clear even at the maximum zoom (even though you REALLY need to keep your hands steady at this point) and the quality is incredible for the price. The photos have aided us in identification, and we end up seeing more than we thought we saw (my husband snapped a picture of what he thought might have been a chickadee, and it turned out to had been a prothonotary warbler!!) If you are hesitating about getting this, don't! Just get it! It is amazing bang for your buck!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Wow, what a zoom! I added on another zoom lens that attaches right to the front of the existing lense, with no adapters or anything needed, and now I have over 100X zoom on a compact digital camera! Now, I am not a professional photographer by any means, and can't tell you any technical stuff, but this camera is AWESOME! I had two Nikon DSLR's in the past, and they were just very complicated and very heavy for me to use all the time, this is fairly lightweight, and takes stunning photos. I'm in love. Between this and my LX7 I am set for awhile with cameras!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: So much in such a small package!  It will be awhile before I get to use all the features that this camera has to offer.,I do like that I do not have to haul around extra lenses.  I have found that if I go tele all the way, I will need a tripod.  I just cannot hold the camera still for that distance.  The menu in the camera allows all kinds of adjustment to pictures taken, if not done in the camera I can wait until processing in the computer.  So much can be done with this camera, it's like having a mini-computer!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought the Panasonic LUMIX because I was tired of using my phone to take all of my pictures and I wanted something that had better quality and zoom range. I think I set my expectations a little too high though. The camera itself is nicely made; light and small enough to fit in my tiny woman hands. But i wouldn't call this a professional camera. It takes quality pictures most of the time but sometimes I feel as if I NEED a tripod to take second pictures. Especially if the lighting isn't perfect or its dark out. I've taken beautiful close up pictures of full moons with this camera and it's given me plenty of stunning pictures for my cousins wedding. But when I have tried to take far away night shots, you definitely need a steady hand because it doesn't seem to focus nearly as well as during the day. It's a nice little camera for beginners but I wouldn't recommend for someone who's trying to do photo shoots. All in all, I'll keep my little Panasonic but hopefully I'll be able to upgrade in the future.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is a great camera. The 60x times optical zoom is like having a,portable telescope. Every person who has seen it work is amazed.,One single lens covers 20mm-1200mm equivalent and  Full 1080/60i,HD Panasonic Video recording with auto focus. All of this in one camera!,No more lenses to change. No chance of dust and stuff getting in the camera,,especially on windy days.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: There are or soon will be many reviews on this breakthrough camera by experienced and trusted camera experts. There will also be countless opinions stated on these pages by actual users, by people who have never seen one and will never see one, and also by advocates of other brands and systems whose opinion is driven by brand loyalty rather than the merits and flaws of this brand’s products. Me, I am an a7 series owner who is a career photojournalist, who uses this series as a bridge between true pro gear (which this is not by any stretch) and consumer/enthusiast models, most of which these days are still DSLR small(er) sensor models.,Always remember that unless it says "Verified Purchase" opinions are not likely not based on real hands-on testing by someone who has bought an actual a7 III and at this time they are in very tight supply with a wait of a couple of months. It will take a long time before someone receives a working production model and spends enough time with it to make any valid performance claims, either positive or negative. As a working professional photographer I had the opportunity to spend enough hands on shooting time with the a7 III to get a good feel for it and compare it to my own a7 series. Of course none of the advance user impressions prior to the final release and delivery of the product in spring 2018 carry much meaning as they are most conjecture and opinions. So rather than dwell on so-called test images or camera specs, which by now have been well published and documented by established trusted sources, I will just add some real life observations and hopefully guidelines that can help you with your decision making process.,Unusual for me I won’t detail every spec and what it means and how it works because I believe someone who is shopping for a camera of this sophistication level is savvy enough to know those things and where to find them. And I won’t bore you with sample photos that are meaningless unless you know all of the EXIF specifics and even more importantly, what post processing the shooter applied to their photos. I did include a couple but please consider them for what they are, merely examples, not proof of anything.,Therefore I’ll keep this short and focus on a handful of missed opportunities that I feel strongly about:,1. The lack of an external, dedicated on-body manual switch (like on the a9) for auto/manual focus is missed on a camera in this category.  This should not be a premium feature, that is a mandatory feature of any camera above the point and shoot range.,2. Realizing that Sony already has that fine a9 product, not carrying over the dedicated external drive selector knob is also unfortunate. That or a similar easily reached mechanical selector is a differentiator between a more basic enthusiast camera and a camera designed for someone who is serious about photography.,3. The menu system is “improved” but for whatever reason Sony refuses to dump everything they’ve ever done with regard to menus and start with a whole new fresh design.,4. The touchscreen reeks of the result of an argument between engineering, marketing and finance and the result is embarrassing for a two-thousand dollar camera,5. The remaining ergonomics and general control placement, look and feel are behind the times, as if they can’t give up on the belief that interchangeable lens camera still have to look like a Nikon F or a Canon AE1.  I’m sorry to say this camera does not feel anywhere near as good as it should in-hand and they have missed the boat with regard to often-used controls naturally falling to hand without the user looking or thinking about it.,I promised to keep my opinions brief and there they are.  If you were a friend or relative and called me to ask if you should buy this camera (assuming you are qualified to know how to master its power and capabilities) my answer would be an unqualified yes. In my opinion, all things considered, there is no better choice of interchangeable lens camera for someone who is serious about photography as a hobby or to start a career in the business than this one.,The Mk III sibling in the A7 family is not revolutionary but rather evolutionary. As the next in lineage to the Mk II it continues the heritage started by the original A7 and compared to it maybe revolutionary sounds like a more appropriate word. The world will have to wait a little longer before Sony finally breaks the mold and releases the shackles that in some ways still bind it to their acquisition of Konica-Minolta back in 2006. It’s an “almost there” camera in so many ways, and trust me, if you are coming from a marriage with Canon or Nikon “enthusiast-grade” DSLR’s with the 7 III you will feel like you’ve suddenly turned into Marty McFly and are thrust back into the photography future at warp speed.,Already owning an a7 series and having some quality time with the newest a7 III am I excited enough to buy one?  One of the unfortunate things about some of what I have read from others seems to concentrate a lot on gadgets and features that don’t “necessarily” make this a camera that is more capable of huge gains in image quality but more in terms of usability. I appreciate the impressive auto-focus capabilities but because of my work and training I tend to focus manually far more than letting the camera do it for me. The same with auto-exposure enhancements, there is no doubt for some shooters the improvements are a big reason to step up to this model, for me not so much. Improved battery life?  Let’s be real, if you’re shooting photos for a living you are carrying spare batteries, if you are doing it as a hobby how many shots are you going to fire off in one session anyway?  And backing up for a second to image quality, I hope no one is going to judge what this camera is capable of by shooting with the kit lens, and do keep in mind that the compatible lens arsenal fits every a7 series and how much the lens influences image quality on this camera or any camera.,The a7 series currently encompasses three distinct categories – this all-around all-purpose model (which Sony for some reason calls “basic”), an ultra-high resolution model and a model optimized for low-light photography. Only you can decide which best fits your needs.  For me, right now until I spend a little more time with the a7 III in my hands if now is the right time or to wait to see what the next a9 will look like.  If I do order an a7 III I'll circle back and fill in the gaps with real-life hands-on reports.,I know this hasn’t been a “hands on” test which was not possible on the date of release but I do hope that some of this has been of help to you in making your decision.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: The Camera I received was a broken piece of plastic... seems to be some kind of Sensor Misalignment issue.... Amazon are replacing it but it will be another 3 weeks before it comes, add this to the 2 months I waited for the broken unit. Not very happy!,Aside from the error... the camera feels plasticy and cheap and definitely not very well put together... is this the price we pay for a lot of technology competing with Nikon and Canon?!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Awesome!

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Would love to try this camera but it refuses to read the memory card.  Appears to be a known Sony issue for some time.  I’m a bit shocked a brand new Sony A7iii just uppdated can’t read a damn memory card rendering my brand new camera useless.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Sony deals with its cutomers with disrespect. No battery charger for a 2K camera!,Camera is awesome. Good thing is that I can use my regular APA-C e-mount lenses. For video: no difference between the full frame and the APS-C lenses. For my surprise even for photos not much difference.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: My daughter absolutely loves this camera! It was one of her Christmas presents. She is finishing up college in the spring to be a photographer and the pictures that she has taken with it so far are breathtaking. Very nice camera.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: Okay, so it is hard for me to come to grips with this, but I don't think I am going to be returning to Canon or Nikon.,The big, and basically only, CON:,AUTO FOCUS -  Okay, I'm really really on the fence about this, but I THINK I like the AF on this camera, mostly.  To give you some perspective, I was mainly using two 5D Mark III cameras for my portrait work, as well as trying out a couple of Nikon D750s and the AF on all of those those was all I've ever wanted. With those cameras, I've never had any issues whatsoever with autofocus.  It always worked, even in low light, whenever I wanted it.,Now comparing the Sony A7III to those, using the Sigma adapter and Sigma and Canon glass, I've had MOSTLY great success.  The EYE-AF is AMAZING for anytime that portrait sessions are going slowly/ people are not moving around too much.  I get A LOT more keepers when that is the case.  In my work, however, I really like to have movement.  I find that I get more natural body poses when movement is going on, and both the regular AF and the EYE-AF don't work great when I'm snapping photos under those conditions.  The camera can KIND OF focus when it is rapidly shooting, but it really seems to be a trade off - you either can focus, or you can shoot.... but not both at the same time like the Canon and Nikon excel at.,I am VERY disappointed about that - that is the one thing that is keeping me on the fence.,PRO's:,EVERYTHING else on this camera is AMAZING.,Here are some highlights that particularly excite me:,1) The customizability of the buttons - so much better than both Canon and Nikon.  And it has even improved over the A7RII !!! :),2) The dynamic range and how far you can pull the files is amazing.  I attached a photo out of an airplane window that I accidentally took at 4 stops (!!!) below what you see.  It was basically pitch black and my eyes could barely make out the ice below, but Sony, you're amazing, and this file came out great.,3) The Image Stabilization is legitimately amazing.  I can do handheld shots with my 270mm (135 + 2x extender) handheld at about 1/50th of a second and get sharp results 90% of the time.,4) 10FPS is way more than I ever need as a portrait photographer.... but I kind of like it sometimes.  :),Conclusion...,So because the AF is not quiiite at the point where it is flawless in high frame rate shooting, I am still interested and willing to see what Canon and Nikon come out with.  This camera is 90% of the perfect camera for me, and I could easily shoot it for the rest of my life... but it would be 100% perfect if the AF always worked in those fast movement/high frame rate kind of situations.

product_name: Sony a7 III Full-Frame Mirrorless Interchangeable-Lens Camera Optical with 3-Inch LCD, Black (ILCE7M3/B)
review: I absolutely love this camera. My photography ranges from pictures of family outings to climbing mountains in blizzards. I take it everywhere and can be rough on it. The auto features are so good, I rarely find manual setting helpful, it's a better use of time to find a new angle. If you have the right angle, one of the autofocus settings will get you the right shot at the right time.,The camera got wet multiple times, and finally I left it on the top of my car and it fell off while I was on the highway and landed on the road, someone returned it and it still worked! The LCD screen is broken but I use the viewfinder anyway or connect it to my phone for stills.,I attached examples of how I use it: #1 my son and dog playing, 2 landscape, 3 adventure landscape, it is raining in shot 3

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
review: I've only taken three pictures so far, They were good quality. The camera was a little confusing Getting to know, but now I love it, I just put it on automatic and away we go.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 20 MP Digital Camera (Red) + 32GB Card + Battery and Charger + Accessory Bundle
