product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Bought this as an upgrade for my Sony W330 (which is an outstanding camera). I do not notice any significant improvements; so no "wow".  The macro focus and the low light sensitivy appear to be comparable to the W330; these are 2 of its best features. The panorama feature is a little disappointing as it only captures appx 60 degrees and often ends up with misalignments between frames. I have much better luck using an SLR and photostitching software to create superior 360 degree views. At max resolution, the time interval between frames seems really long due to the size of the files. I considered reducing the resolution, but then what's the point - - might was well just use my W330. Still if you're looking for a very compact and very versitile point-and-shoot, I do recommend the W830.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This thing is horrible!! Do not waste your money like I did on it. I only use Canon cameras, I owned the previous elph that lasted from 2011 until last year when my 2 year old accidentally got sand in it on vacation. Hence the purchase of this one as a replacement. I also own the Canon 7D, so I'm pretty sure if I can use manual mode on that but can't get this point and shoot to work, it's definitely a horrible product. Other sites have horrible user ratings but somehow I went by the ones on this that give it 4/5. It doesn't focus for anything and we found this out when I was in the hospital having our 2nd child and didn't want to use cell phones. I'm the only one who knows how to use my professional camera and I was having a baby, so I wanted something my husband and family could pass around. So very disappointed. Do not buy this product!!! Horrible horrible quality photos, even if it looks like its focused in. What a waste of money.

It doesn't do too well in low light, but if you have a lot of external lighting, that shouldn't be a problem. I'll probably review this camera on my youtube channel pretty soon. I'll put a link to the video once it's uploaded!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera was only returnable within 30 days, and now it does not focus and is completely unreliable. Can't use it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Works great

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Warning! No image stabilization! This is my 5th or 6th Canon powershot camera and they all used to have image stabilization, even the entry level cameras. I don't know at what point they took this away from entry level cameras, but this really affects picture quality. Luckily, I was able to get my ancient SD 1200 working again, which takes much better pictures even though it is MUCH older. If you are interested in this, I strongly suggest spending the extra $20 and going up a level, as that one seems to have image stabilization. IS really makes a difference in any indoor or darker environment. I wish I would have paid attention to this detail, but you never previously needed to. Be aware. I'm also bugged that this camera has fewer manual controls than older models of entry level cameras. Is it time to switch brands or start using my phone more?

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)

I wouldn't be able to get it back from South America anyway.  This mom is very sad.  All I wanted was a way to see my son in pictures.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: As another reviewer posted, "I tried to like this camera"... It can take very nice photos BUT writing to SD card after a shot is extremely slow. No quick, multiple action shots with this camera., Zoom is great BUT a Tri-pod is recommended to eliminate blur.  Wi-Fi connection is more complicated than it needs to be.  Battery compartment has a tiny switch/lever that makes insertion not necessarily a pain, but tricky  As I already have a Rebel T3,  I was looking for a smaller pocket size camera but this just wasn't it.  Good entry level but not for me.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: So far this digital camera has been great. Was very easy to set up and takes nice photos. The camera does require a digital card in order to save photos. I purchased one separately from Amazon for 13.00. There is a small strap that comes with the camera. The shutter speed is good but you can not take fast moving shots with this camera. It is better suited for portraits and still life.,The camera is not heavy so would be easy to take with you on a tour. I would also recommend buying a camera bag with the camera to protect it from being scratched or hit. Another nice feature is the Wi-Fi. It was easy to download photos to my laptop without having to connect to it.  I saved around 70 from purchasing this camera on Amazon versus best buy.,Very happy with the purchase and will be using this on my trips!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I bought this camera to get close up shots of the moon.  I got three really beautiful shots - OUT OF THIRTY!  I was using a tripod, but still the photos came out blurry.  Most of the photos I took inside were really blurry as well.  The user settings are far from intuitive and the lag time between pressing the shutter button and the picture being taken is excruciatingly slow.,Maybe this camera is defective, but after reading other reviews, I suspect this is simply a terrible camera.  I'm returning the camera and just sticking with the camera on my Galaxy S9.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Return window closed September 5th - Lens error began September 9th.  This is the second camera that has lasted less than a year due to lens  retraction problems. Really sad because for its price range you can get some rally great shots with this one.  I was hoping for something to take on hikes and trail rides - this it not it.  Back to my old one Kodak.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: This camera takes fantastic pictures outside! I went to Disney World and Disney on Ice with it. My Disney World pictures came out fantastic. My Disney on Ice pictures were mostly terrible. It all has to do with lighting. I’ve tried several different settings. I purchased the camera with the intent of using it for the parade as well as the Flower and Garden Festival in Disney World. I know it will be great for that! It’s a great beginner camera. Light weight. Easy to use. FANTASTIC ZOOM!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I'm still trying to learn how to use. Get a tripod for the magnified shot. Easy to move shots to my iPad. Gives fast turnaround to get it to Facebook or E-Mail.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Amazing pictures! I love my camera so much. You can get beautiful pictures out of this camera, with out needing to spend 400$ on some camera to get the same quality. Its the photograper skill more so than the camera. Practice makes perfect for sure with this camera. I'm by no means a professional. But I do take many many photos. From people to still life to the moon. I love taking photos of the moon. But anyways, this camera is a wonderful option.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: This camera is great. It does everything I needed, expected it to do and more. It is amazing for the price. I bought this camera to take pictures for our neighborhood and also to take pictures for art that I am doing. It picks up the detail amazingly, and prints from this camera come out beautifully. I have no negative reviews about this camera, I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a camera to take amazing photos and last for awhile.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I am an artist who needed a simple new camera for my colorful artwork (and for personal nature hike photos). I have used the camera for a couple of weeks now (still figuring out some of the settings), but I am super happy with it so far. The color seems good, the zoom works well (though can be a bit grainy on super large shots). I shot the moon photo the second day I had the camera. I am really pleased that the self-timer will remain ON from shot to shot instead of having to re-set every time - very handy! The length of the lens takes a bit of getting used to, but I do like the way this feels in my hand compared to a rectangular point-and-shoot. The largest image resolution is HUGE and will yield crisp prints at a smaller size. I am very glad I ultimately chose this Canon PowerShot SX420 out of the literally dozens of cameras I researched over a month's time! (Photos: I bumped up saturation in post editing on the close up of the 1 " and 2" crystals, the moon was shot on a tripod (I never shot the moon before, so that was an exciting result).

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I wish I wouldn’t have spent the money. Very poor picture quality. My phone takes more clear pics than this camera. I should’ve returned it.

review: Good camera for simple pictures. My wife and I tried it out, and it was very compatible with our tv/computers/technology, but it didn't have the quality shots for the variety of environments we were looking for. good for outdoors, or very well lit areas, darker areas left pictures too dark or blurry from extended exposure. I would recommend this camera for a basic tourist as a secondary or backup to a smart phone.

review: It is a good upgrade from the basic point and shoot camera or cell phone camera.  Definately not the same quality as a DSLR, but that is expected.  A good travel camera.  To get the most out of the camera, you really want to start learning how to use the manual settings.  One note for low light/night time shots, the manual settings only allow a maximum of an 8 second exposure.  Auto allows for longer exposures.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The reason I gave this 4 stars is that this is a great little camera for those who want to move into the more advanced photography than allowed by the simple point and shoot ones.  It takes wonderfully sharp pictures and has an easy override for the exposure.  It has quite a number of photographical effects that would take large camera bag filled with filers and gadgets to accomplish in a film camera.  The viewfinder is a lot more comfortable in taking pictures than the screen at the back of the camera which is prone the washing out in bright light.  One feature I especially like is the ability to set the view finder so that it is overlaid with a horizontal and vertical lined grid.  This not only helps with composition but also for aligning vertical structures for architectural photography and also keeping the horizon level.  I have nearly the same view screen in two of my three film SLR’s,A minor complaint I have is that the camera lens reverts most wide angle zoom mode when first turned on.  I would prefer it to start with a more normal view of around 3x to 4x zoom.  It has a lens resume option, but that takes it back to the zoom position last used when the camera was turned on.,A not so minor problem is that it takes nearly three hands to plug the mini USB adapter into the camera.  One to hold the black camera, one to hold open the little black access door, and one to insert the little black mini adapter into the black opening of the black camera.  Night vision glasses and a third hand could be very useful.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I bought this camera thinking it would be better than the same camera but model FZ60. I loved my FZ60!! the bad thing was it just quit working after 2 years and I have no idea how to get it repaired. This newer model with the extra zoom is very hard to use unless you have a tripod. It does not take shots well with motion and the zoom is very difficult to use for amateurs like myself. I did not see the FZ60 on here for sale anymore but I would buy it again. I am just trying to sell this model to someone in my family and I will purchase something else. I did read the reviews and most people liked it. I also think it does not focus well and takes a long time to make clear when zooming.

product_name: Sony (DSCW800) 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
review: Cons: Very cheap made! Whenever I try to record a video, the screen moves in and out and the picture is extremely blurry. Picture quality isn't the best. Zoom in feature wasn't great because it made picture quality even worse.,I returned this camera back to Amazon for a refund.,Pros: However, I do like the convenience of a rechargeable lithium battery. Battery life was great. I don't like dealing with double A batteries and spending money buying them. So, it was nice to have a chargeable battery. Saves time and money.

review: Camera works great. A lot of different options to try out. The 60x zoom is fantastic. I just used it the the first time last week in CO. I saw something on my walk about 500 yards away. Couldnt make it out with the naked eye so i zoomed in on it and it was a coyote clear as day. I do recommend a tripod for long range snaps. Hard to hold steady. Overall its a great product

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Owned for a few weeks now. Used almost exclusively for nature photography, ranging from close ups of insects to distance shots of birds.,The FZ70 does many things well: it has a great zoom, the buttons for control of the features are easy to reach, even when your eye is pressed to the viewfinder (after a bit of practice), and has enough stabilization to allow sharp, handheld photos at full optical magnification. The manual focus control isn't nearly as good or as quick as a ring, but will get the job done if your subject will stay still. It's not a macro camera by any means, but I've been happy with butterfly photos taken far enough away to not startle the insect.,That being said, comparing to my partner's Canon SX50, a few limitations have made themselves clear. The first, and most obvious, is the difference in digital zoom. Pushing the magnification beyond the optical limitations, the FZ70's quality deteriorates much, much more rapidly than the Canon. For distant shots of eagles, the Canon still looks crisp while the FZ70 becomes fuzzy. This holds for both for automatic and for various manual settings. The screen and viewfinder also aren't quite up to par, which makes determining perfect focus or reviewing photos a bit more of a challenge.,At the time of this review, the FZ70 is also $100 cheaper than the Canon SX50, which certainly played into my purchasing decision. It is a very good camera, but I wouldn't say it's the best in its class.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I have had only a short while to use this. Takes great photos, but you do have to spend time learning the function mode settings. I feel that the ones offered: tiny camera, monochromatic, pinhole are all effects that you can easily add while editing your photos on the simplest photo editing sites. You cannot quickly add the effect, take a shot, then get rid of the effect. In fact, it is hard do get the camera out of the mode and back to reset. The most useful modes are macro and fish eye lens. Again, it takes some thumbing around to access those modes. Jury is still out.

review: I cannot stand this camera. I have had two Canon Powershot's before and loved them.  My last one just broke so I decided to buy this one before we went to Disney Land so some days I wouldn't have to lug my big Nikon DSLR around with me.  This model was a huge let down.  It had a slow response time, so when the camera finally did fire the people had already walked out of the frame. It wouldn't shoot rapid fire for mulitple frames and it had very poor low light capabilities.  I finally just gave up using it and got better results with my iphone by far.  I'm very disappointed.,Sadly I missed the return window so it looks like 5yr old and 9yr old will be getting to play with this camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Terrible camera! Only a 30 day return window too, so I can't exchange it.,Don't waste YOUR money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Although a negative review I'm not here to just complain but hopefully help others make a decision. I'm not a pro wedding photographer, but I am an experienced photographer who has owned a variety of cameras over the years and I take the time to read features and instructions for each camera to get the best result. I picked this camera up a year ago for its small size, high MP and brand name. The amount of time it takes this camera to focus is simply disastrous. I have used numerous settings to take photos of sporting events, subject up close and far away. Blurry every time. If you are taking still shots in excellent natural light, you can get a decent photo. Under other lighting conditions, terrible! Night or low light? forget it, nothing comes out clear. Sports or moving objects - 1 out of a thousand will come out clean. Fact is I purchased this camera to get better pictures than my phone, turns out the phone easily beats this cheap toy from Canon. Again, i'm not a shaky handed novice photographer so trust me when I tell you, don't purchase this camera, go up to a higher level camera or stick to using your phone. Sony Cybershot cameras in the $150-$200 range have delivered the highest value to me over the years, this is what I'm going back to for a simple Point and Shoot.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I've had this only a few days and glad I have it.  I bought it to take pics of the total eclipse of the sun on Aug. 21.  I've been aiming it at the sun - WITH APPROPRIATE FILTER -  and the 1000 mm lens is  tolerably good.  Blue Bonnets in my back yard 75 yards away are very sharp. Haven't been able to shoot the sun yet.  I have used a Canon AE-3 and a pair of 500mm mirror lenses for a number of years and this camera seems equal to them.  It is extremely light weight and very easy to operate.  One thing I dislike intensely about all digital cameras I've seen is a lack of a facility for a cable release.  With a 1000mm lens a cable release seems indispensable. So far that is the only drawback of this camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I took advantage of buying a Refurbished Camera and saving at least $80 over all the other SX420's available at that time. In fact, I was a little concerned about the quality because of the very low price, $100. When I opened the box which arrived right on time I was pleasantly surprised. It looks like and functions like a new camera. I am very happy with the seller and the quality of the camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Good Camera, not as fast as i will like it to be though. Pics takes approx 7 secs to allow for the next one.,Am i doing something wrong?,Also, the battery holds charge for approx 2 hrs. it goes dead overnight. It is on Eco mode.,However really good pics and video.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I bought the red one for myself and absolutely love it.  I find the stabilizer works well and my pictures are sharp - mostly photos of people in casual settings.  After 6 weeks I bought a black one like it for our office and while I think I have set the settings the same I am not sure the pictures are as sharp!  Maybe my eyes have gotten worse (a possibility as I am awaiting surgery) or maybe there is a glitch in the second camera.  The original reviews showed some significant variation from 'clear sharp photos' to 'not happy with clarity of photos'  -- so maybe the black one has some issues as I am same photographer now trying a second one for our office.  Again, I love the red one I got first and stabilization/clarity of photos was one of the main reasons I chose this camera.  I only purchased the second for our office after practicing/testing the first one for 6 weeks.  The jury is still out on the 2nd purchase (a black one so there is no question which is which!)

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Both pond sample pictures were taken hand-held through a double-pane window about 35 feet from the subjects.  The turkey vulture picture was taken through a double-pane window, hand-held and about 175 feet away.  Those who complain about picture quality are doing something wrong.  I now own two of these cameras--almost instant on so you can capture great shots.  The amazing thing is the equivalent 35mm camera focal length on the lens is 1,000 mm when in pure optical zoom.  Inexpensive, fast, great picture quality and fantastic image stabilization--no tripod needed.  If you're looking for great flash, you're looking at the wrong camera.  I know a thing or three about cameras and photography; simply, you don't need to know anything to take great pictures with these.  You can remove the SD card or hook directly to computer with USB cord.  Apparently Wi-Fi is another feature which I haven't attempted.  Buy this camera and impress your friends with the great pictures you take!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The camera was the perfect size. Unfortunately when i used it to record videos thw auto zoom noise is picked up on the microphone plus there is no aux for an additional mic.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The camera itself takes good pictures, but then most cameras these days are just as good.,This review is about only copying pictures from camera to Computer. Not dumb, stupid, and weak smartphones.,Once you get the camera configured and connected to your Wireless network:,1. You have to press camera wireless button to connect.,2. You start the program on your computer to either import all or copy what you want.,3. You *can not* take pictures while connected to the computer.,4. On the camera now you have to disconnect from wireless, in order to take more pictures.,This is completely unusable, it would be just as easy to take the SD card out of the camera and copy the files, or use a USB cable connected to the camera/computer.,People don't care about cameras, people care about the pictures and copying pictures where they want them.,1. Getting pictures off the camera to a Computer is poor, it works but very inconvenient.,2. The defunct company Eye-Fi had this working better than any company I have found (ten years ago).,3. I never tested the Cloud based upload, nor the smartphone features.,For those of you who have never seen or had an Eye-Fi wireless card: The process of getting pictures to your computer is incredibly simple:,1. Just turn the camera on and shoot pictures, a hundred if you like. The pictures just show up on your computer, without any interaction.,Eye-Fi (now defunct), Originally the software for the eye-fi sucked just like all the rest as it was CLOUD based. But the final software they released (because they shut down their cloud service), was designed to connect to your computer directly using WiFi.,It worked flawlessly.,-Cheers

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Only negative is the lack of view finder as the screen is hard to see in bright light.,Compact and light and easy to use.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought the Cybershot model DSC-W230 many years ago. It is still going strong, although it developed lens dust/spots, which isn't unheard of for cameras. I bought the DSCW800 because I use these cameras for work, and worried the older one would give up, and wanted to have a replacement before I needed it.,Although this newer model has some advantages, one disadvantage is that the W800 has a difficult time focusing when recording in video mode, something the W230 never has a problem with. It doesn't matter what one is taking a video of, and under what light conditions. It just doesn't want to stay in focus very well. Eventually it will focus, but even if the camera is in a static position, it will go in and out of focus.,It took a long time from order to actually receiving it, which I didn't mind because I really like Sony products, but am disappointed that focusing and staying in focus is really makes it undesirable for taking video. Takes great photos though.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
review: I bought this camera for my 9 year old son. He saved up enough allowance to buy this himself. I have an expensive Canon camera that he seems me taking pictures with all the time and wanted one of his own.,Pros:,1-I was looking for a camera that was small,2- Has an easy interface to use for a novice,3- Has automatic settings for a novice,4-Has decent picture quality.,5-My son loves this camera and uses it all the time,Cons:,1-The automatic settings aren't sensitive enough so you need to be able to manipulate them (i.e. the flash can be took bright or too dim) to get pictures to turn out.,Overall, it's perfect for my young son. If you need something easy to learn and need something compact this is a great camera.

product_name: Sony DSCW800/B 20.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

I photograph my sewn work, you can see the individual fibers in the fabric at the highest resolution, the weaving of the fabric! Very happy. The flash is pretty bright so be careful when using this for product photography as you might want to turn your flash off or flood out the colors

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: I’m in love with this camera. This is my first real camera so I wanted something easy and this camera is pretty simple. Picture quality is clear. The camera itself isn’t too heavy. Also, the zoom is incredible!

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: The 18 megapixel photos are about the same quality as my last camera's 12MP photos. The sensor on this camera introduces a lot of noise at relatively low ISOs. The camera is also somewhat noisy, due mostly to the image stabilization, but still makes noise even when that is turned off.,The wifi features are good, but the UI behind them still needs work and is a bit slow for certain mundane tasks like uploading all the photos to a computer. It does support SMB shares, so that is a plus if you run linux. Controlling manual aperature, shutter speed, and focus still require going into a menu, so there is no fast way to control those.,The 4k videos come out alright, but for anything action based you will still want 1080p@60hz since the 30hz can be painful if whatever your shooting is moving around.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Easy to use and just perfect for my needs. Takes wonderfully clear, crisp interior room photos with excellent color. Very, very pleased.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I have had this camera for a little over two weeks now and I can honestly say that is it a great camera if you are on a budget. With 20 mega-pixels this camera takes extremely clear pictures and amazing video (at 720p HD). The small design of this camera is great for taking trips and just placing it in your pocket.,BATTERY LIFE:,For the short amount of time I have had this camera, I cannot say too much about the battery life. I charged the battery when I first purchased the camera and have not had to recharge it since. Being a YouTuber, I shoot a lot of video and have used this camera on average 2.5 to 3 hours each day since I purchased it. I also take a lot of pictures with this camera (I have a dog who likes to sleep or sit in very odd positions), but again, I have not had to recharge since the first time.,20 MEGA-PIXEL & 8X OPTICAL ZOOM:,As stated previously I take a lot of pictures, and with the 20 mega-pixels this camera provides the pictures come out very clear and almost perfect. I say almost perfect because while it does take clear pictures the Smart AUTO feature does cause some problems if you are not taking pictures in idealistic settings.,With the 8x optical zoom I have noticed is not as good as other point and shoot cameras. Again this will depend on if you are shooting in idealistic settings, but on this camera it unfortunately does make the photo a little pixelated if you are trying to zoom in. Having taken a variety of pictures with the camera I have to say that unless you are shooting with extremely good lighting, the zoom on this camera should not be used past half of the full feature.,SMART AUTO:,Smart AUTO is honestly a great feature on this camera because you do not have to program your camera for every situation. The Smart AUTO feature does use 32 predefined shooting situations to determine the best settings for that specific shot, however, it does have its problems. The main issue with the Smart AUTO feature is that if you are taking pictures in less that ideal situations, the camera might choose settings that basically ruin the picture. For instance, when taking a picture of my dog at a dusk setting out in my backyard, the Smart AUTO feature chose the settings of an indoor close up shot. So while this is a great feature be prepared to run into some issues.,CONCLUSION:,While this camera does have a few flaws I do honestly believe it is an amazing point and shoot camera. All of the features do take some getting used to just like any other product out there. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who has a budget they need to stick with but still wants a great camera for either pictures or video.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: The camera itself is good, but I have two complaints. The wrist strap comes separately and is extremely difficult to attach. I was unable to do it. A previous camera in this line came WITH the wrist strap attached. Why not this one? The enclosed info booklet had such small print I needed magnifying eyeglasses PLUS a large magnifying glass to read it. And then it had little info of value other than FCC rules. To find operating instructions, I had to go to the Canon website where I had to download a manual that previously came with the camera. The manual was a staggering 216 pages! Previously the manual was a manageable 4 or 5 pages.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: not as good as I had hoped

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Meh.  Lightweight, old-style camera.  Does not auto-focus, so you have to practice using it before you take pictures.  I am annoyed that the description does not explicitly say that it does not come with memory chip or USB cord, so I had to buy these separately.  It also doesn't explicitly say that it does come with charger for the battery, so I was keeping my fingers crossed, and I am glad it does.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought this for my daughter's trip to Europe.  She got familiar with the settings and functions then took some snapshots.  Pictures are clear and ready to go!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I purchased the ELPH 180 to replace my old Canon SD1000 that I have had for about 10 years but unfortunately there is a big difference. The ELPH 180 takes nice photos, but the case is cheap plastic. I will be fortunate if the cover for the battery/card compartment lasts a year. When I take photos I usually take the card out and put it in the computer, but I will not be able to do that any more. Instead I will have to use a mini USB cord. Yes, it is that flimsy.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I am so disappointed in this camera. I have always been a Canon girl and was looking for a replacement of the camera that I keep in my purse, my previous camera had reached a point to where the lens cover was not closing all the way, but it was several years old. With the new camera most of my shots are blurry or have a glare in them. So disappointed.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Poor quality photos.  After 5-10 photos it stops focusing properly even in daylight and in high contrast scenes.  After ruining many photos of events important to me, I finally learned that I have to turn it off occasionally so it can reset itself.  It would be nice if there was a firmware update to fix that.  Most lower-light photos are unacceptably grainy and out of focus because the camera seems to default to increasing ISO rather than operating the flash.  I think I have defeated that feature by finding the menu selection to force the ISO to 100 or 200 rather than letting the camera set it.  Even when operating at what I think is its best, colors seem dull.  I tried setting the colors to "vivid" and they turned out unnatural and with an orange cast.  Still experimenting with settings, but so far this is a big disappointment compared to my previous Canon pocket camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought an Elph 180 in August and took it straightaway on a major PCT SecJ backpacking trip (7 days). It was by far the lightest, most compact camera available at short notice, and I had had the previous model (2016) - and killed it using it in rain (photos recovered from SD Card)!!,Online reviews had dissed the Elph 180 battery life as limited to 220 per charge, so I started out rationing the number of photos I took daily, and with flash disabled.  However 5-6 days into the trip, the battery was still reading FULL, and I had taken over 150 mountain,  views, flower shots etc, so I let loose.,Total of 220 shots later (coincidence) it still read full and we reached civilization, with a bunch of GREAT photos - only issue was the wildfire smoke limiting the visuals.,I love this camera - but will now always keep it in a ziploc baggie on wet days.,Let's fix global warming!!!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Absolutely the best price we could find. Reasonably priced camera that takes good photos. Thanks!!! 5 STARS*****

We requested a refund and sending it back. Quality control has really gone down, every other order either damaged or a dud:-( Afraid to order another, what are the odds of getting a working,  quality tested product? Especially sad considering we finally saved up for a camera to take family photos and pictures of my artwork, our phones are cheap, old ones and can't take normal photos. I was so excited to receive it only to find out it's just a useless piece of plastic:-(((

I just need something small and light for vacation picture taking with decent picture viewing and this Canon works for me.  The bluetooth setup is also great.  I am happy with this Canon.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: I could remove the memory card from my old camera, plug it into my printer and print the pictures that I wanted. I thought that I could do the same with this camera but I can't. It will not let me print my pictures so I don't want this camera. I am so angry that there was no way to know it before I bought it!

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The Canon SX420 is an excellent camera. It is easy to use and takes good pictures. The only criticism I have is that in direct sunlight you cannot see the picture you are taking on the screen. It should have a small viewfinder on top.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: The quality of this camera is terrible for videos. Photos, it's OK but if you're like me and don't settle for OK then ditch it. It's the kind of camera your mom brings on vacation and thinks the pictures look good. Go for the cameras in the 400+ range with DSLR. That's what I'm doing.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: Best 4K camera you could possibly get for the reasonable price. Crazy zoom.

product_name: PANASONIC LUMIX FZ80 4K Digital Camera, 18.1 Megapixel Video Camera, 60X Zoom DC VARIO 20-1200mm Lens, F2.8-5.9 Aperture, POWER O.I.S. Stabilization, Touch Enabled 3-Inch LCD, Wi-Fi, DC-FZ80K (Black)
review: This is a great camera for the level just below the SLR.  It does not allow lens to be changed but it has a very wide range for zooming.  In fact the tele is so long that one must use a tripod unless it is in the brightest of light.  The zoom feature is on a toggle switch and not like SLR which would be on the lens.  Therefore, it is a little slower to change focal length.  The glass monitor is pretty large and bright.  The pictures are sharp as you should expect.  I am no connoisseur, just a hobbyist so I cannot give you a very sophisticated review on the optics.  Be aware that this camera, unlike many Lumix camera, does not carry the Leica lens designation.  On the other hand, that really isn't that important these days, from what I hear.  All in all, it is a versatile camera for those wanting a little more than a point and shot with a goodly wide range from wide angle to zoom.

review: Perhaps, shame on me - but I didn't notice in ANY review back several months ago now, that there is NOTHING but the view screen to see what you are taking a picture of.  No eyepiece.  In general daylight, with 50+ year old eyesight, this ... isn't good.  The screen resolution may be great, but basic daylight will give you no idea what the camera is actually seeing, light, polarizing, focus- wise.  I LOVE my SX50HS and thought, this is smaller, has wifi etc - how can I lose?  Let me tell you - you do.  I almost simply returned it - but have decided to just use it as an inside function camera. Set it on auto,  let the kids use it at parties and you get great photos.

product_name: Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with 18-55mm IS II Lens Bundle + Canon EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens and 500mm Preset Lens + 32GB Memory + Filters + Monopod + Spider Tripod + Professional Bundle
review: I bought this for my husband who is getting back into photography after about 20 years. We usually use our iPhones when we travel for photos but the quality is never as good as Apple advertises unless you want to spend hours photoshopping you pictures. Yes this is an older model but if has great flexibility as it takes high quality photos and will record video in full 1080p HD.,There are plenty of presets to point and shoot a variety of photos as well as full manual control for the more advanced photographers.,There is a long list of accessories that come in this package and I won’t go into them. The two smaller lenses are Canon the telephoto lenses is an off brand but appears to be well made.,If you are looking for a starter setup I highly recommend this package. One recommendation I do make is to buy a camera backpack as the bag that comes with this package does not hold everything.

product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: Bought this camera for my wife for our vacation to Utah. She took hundreds of great pictures. We had some enlarged and the quality of the photographs is excellent. This is a excellent camera that you can carry in you pocket and have ready in seconds. We bought a spare battery as she takes a lot of pictures. That worked well as we needed it. If you don't take a lot of pictures one battery will certainly work. We recharged both batteries every night and were ready to go every morning. When all is said and done - the pictures are what remains to remind you of those special moments. And this camera takes great pictures. This is the second Sony camera of this size we have purchased. I got her old one and it still works well - but this one is better!

review: Good prices and small portable camera easy to put in our purses or pockets. Pretty good pictures can not ask more with this prices. Thanks .

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought this camera because I needed a new one (my old 5mp camera broke) and was looking forward to getting higher resolution pics.  My prior camera had produce pics at 480dpi.  This camera produces huge pics - but at 180 dpi at best.,Combined with the need to get out the card reader, remove the card and put in the card reader every time I need to download photos (I usually take 1-2 photos at a time so this is close to every photo) rather than just plugging in as with the prior camera, it is quite inconvenient.,I thought I was getting a camera that takes higher resolution photos and I did not.  Unfortunately for various reasons I had no need to use it until after the take-back date, so did not realize the problems until too late and I'm stuck with it now.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought one a few wks ago.  Grainy and blurry when you use zoom all the way out even if balancing camera against a tree.  Close ups of flowers are also blurry unless about 2 ft away.  Had a Fugi point and shoot,  Dropped it and it broke so thought I was upgrading to this one.  Would love to find another Fugi as much better quality.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Bought this before reading the reviews I am sorry to say. When I went on a trip and tried to take scenery photos it would not focus most of the time. I tried to capture sunsets, and the auto focus kept switching to macro......and photos were very blurry. Wish I had my old Sanyo which took great photos, but the battery door finally broke off. I will be trying to return this Canon when I return from my trip

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I was looking for a camera to take some better macro photos than my DSLR would.  I remember the good old days when I had an Olympus point and shoot that took amazing macros.  So far I've been disappointed.  It takes OK photos, but doesn't capture the detail I'm looking for.  I am going to give a few more chances by fiddling with some of the settings, but if it doesn't improve I'll be returning it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: This camera was purchased for a preschool to capture images of all our wonderful friends.. Easy to use, great result.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: There is an obvious defect in this camera where it doesn't take clear pictures and doesn't want to focus.,I am an insurance adjuster and so I use the camera almost daily.  I called Canon and they said that I needed to send it in...which means I have to purchase another camera so I can continue working.  I read through the reviews and there are others complaining about it so I'm glad to know it's not just me.  I bought it because I needed a basic camera to take pictures and nothing more...I didn't realize that Canon now made garbage unless you spent more money.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I have only used Canon cameras my whole life, both personal and professional. This is the first camera that I have owned that takes terrible pictures (all are blurry or out of focus) . Maybe one out of ten pictures come out clear. What a waste of money on this one. It hasn't turned be away from Canon cameras yet. Now my grand-kids have a new play toy (an expensive one). If I could, I would have given it a zero - stars.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: The camera is a nice replacement for an older model from another brand. The time stamp can be customized to display date and time the picture was taken, which is a nice feature. Video recording could be a bit better, but it does the job. Very happy with this purchase.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: First BAD Canon I've owned!  I bought this camera for my son's wedding.  So many pictures are so out of focus that we can not use them.  A once in a lifetime event and most of my pictures are trash!!

I am a smallish person and had some trouble holding it properly to take pictures with.,Still need to take more pictures and use proper techniques, but this camera is a pretty safe bet for getting something that will do the job.

review: I'd give this no stars at all if that were an option.  Took it out of the box, inserted the battery, charged it.  Then turned it on to the first screen to select language.  Only to discover that the select/set button is completely non-operational.  No reponse to it at all.,So, having had it for two hours, my next step is to send it back.,Incidentally, my Nikon Coolpix has an 800 number in several places in the instructions as well as in the warranty information in the Amazon listing.,No information at all for contacting Sony when there's a problem, so I'm thinking they're not seriously eager to provide support.  So I'm done with this.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Only had this a few days, but so far I am impressed. I wanted a small camera that I could carry at all times, with a descent optical zoom and not pay to much for. Picture quality is great for this size of camera and it is very easy to use.Has some great settings on it to get some cool effects and the video quality is brilliant. I transfer pictures straight to my IPad.Which means I can put pictures straight onto FB or send pictures to friends and family straight away. I have not had a chance to test all of the camera functions, but the ones I had needed have worked well

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: I love that it has a wrist strap and little bag to store the camera in. She's having a grand time taking photos. We bought an SD card for 10 bucks to store the photos on; I'm not sure the camera would store them without it. Since it isn't marketed for children with a colorful kid-proof body or built-in games (which I really didn't want), it feels like the grown-up item that it is. It's easy enough to operate without reading the manual although some of the butttons are tiny and hard to see without reading glasses. The pictures are clear. I'd even recommend this for an adult who wants a basic camera with few frills.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: I’m a fairly lazy person when it comes to returns, but I’m actually returning this purchase. To be fair to the company, shipping was much faster than expected which was great since I purchased this for my impatient 6 year old. However, quality of the product is FAR below the reviews. The camera is very cheaply made and feels like it’ll break in your hands at any moment. There is a switch on the side of the camera that changes between close up and scenic views that feels like it’s going to break the whole camera every time I use it. The camera never focused for any image (I’m experienced with photography and couldn’t get it to focus) and after fully charging the battery for over 15 hours it died after only 3 pictures. I would strongly urge you to reconsider purchasing this product and go with a better known proven point and shoot. For the time being my 12 year old Olympus point and shoot is still a significantly better option for my son and I’m disappointed that I even gave this a try.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: I purchased this camera as a gift for my daughter-in-law to take pictures of my new grandson. The only camera she had was her phone. This camera is small enough to fit inside a diaper bag or small purse. The only thing is it does have to be periodically charged and one may forget to check it before that "must have" picture. Still, it's a good camera & she loves it!

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Got this camera to use on vacation. The image stabilization is good if you only have minor movement and the zoom works pretty well. The camera struggle a little in low lighting but most shot footage outside which worked great. Overall, this camera was exactly what we were looking for. It was something cwe could take over seas to capture memories with but wouldn't hurt the bank if it was lost, broken or stolen.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: I used this camera from previous employer. I am no longer at that company so off I went to my local Amazon and now I am the proud owner of this wonderful camera! Size of camera is GREAT! Easily slips into my purse or pocket. Removable memory card (need to purchase separately). Quickly down loads all images and videos on computer.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: This is such a cute camera. It is similar in size to my phone so I can carry it around with me.The pictures it takes are pretty good! Not the highest quality digital camera, but I got this for the nostalgia feel and the instant photos. The camera acts more like a printer where the images come out fully developed compared to the slow develop of older instant photos.I love the fact that I can have a digital copy of the photos so I can give them away to friends.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: This will make a perfect birthday gift for my 11-year-old nephew, who enjoys taking "professional" photos and videos for his family and friends. 18 Mega Pixels,1080P high definition resolution, and a LCD display, this camera is a professional device. And extended storage should be enough for him to take many photos and videos. I've played with it for a little bit. It was easy to operate, and the picture/video quality were great. I'm sure he'll be very excited and happy to receive this gift.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: My daughter who is 7 took pics of all the family, the pictures are so retro ( and flattering) , yes the film can be pricey but the pictures everyone was admiring! We will keep them forever in a lovely pink album!,The chunky, easy to use design means all ages can manage it- not a lot can go wrong! Would definitely recommend a present that keeps on giving and encourages creativity

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Got this for my 8 year old daughter for birthday gifts as she loves taking pictures. She was so happy with it and has taken lots of pictures. Some aren’t always great but the majority of them are great for the size. I think she will capture lots of memories with this.

review: I bought the 180 as a pocket walk around camera that I can take with me on a daily basis vs my dslr(s). I've only had it a couple of days so far, but it's a pretty nice little camera.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Very tiny,  not a 5" screen! Returned.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I *CANNNOT* recommend this camera.  The day after purchasing the Canon PowerShot ELPH 180, I was taking pictures in a museum with family.  Everything was going well and it appeared the camera was pretty good (I left everything on the factory settings).  Every now and then I'd review the pics I took.  Then at one point in the day the camera suddenly gave a 'memory card lock' error and wouldn't take any more pictures.  I was also unable to review any pictures already taken.  I figured maybe it was feature of the camera that once you hit the memory card limit it would 'lock' the card or something.  So I didn't worry as I figured the pictures were still there and I could just transfer them onto my PC or Mac.  When I got home and tried that, both my PC and MAC didn't recognize the SC card.  Nothing.  Zip.  Not only did I lose all of my pictures but the camera fried the SD card to the point that it isn't recognized anymore and can't be reformatted.  I had some IT folks check the card out too thinking maybe I was missing something and they also confirmed, after trying two separate machines, that the SD card was ruined.  The SD card was only three months old and had been working perfectly until used in the camera.  Needless to say, I returned the camera and am very disappointed.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA and would give it zero stars if I could!

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Good camera for my Animation student to do stop motion with.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Autofocus does NOT always work.: several times I had to power it off and then power it back on to focus a shot.,Also, telephoto/indoor photos are too grainy.,Too many confusing options.  I've accidentally selected an unknown option and could not figure out how to undo it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I can't get enough of how well the camera shots video.  The HD video is just wonderful.  The only problem I see with the camera is the microphone on it.  The microphone will pick up wind and make the audio hard to hear.  But overall it's a great starter camera for vloggers.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: I bought this camera as a travel camera for a recent vacation. I own 2 other Canon Cameras (Rebel and 7D) so I had faith that this would be an easy, good quality camera. I returned this item after using it for 4 days. I tried it in low light (poor quality, difficult to focus, blurry) and daylight (over-saturated, but not terrible), and shade (difficult to focus, slow). If I were taking photos only of outdoor, well lit subjects, this camera would be fine for someone who wasn't going to edit or resize the photo.  Also, the focus on the camera is not in the center. Even when I was taking a portrait, with the subjects face taking up 70% of the screen, the camera would still chose to focus on the top left or right of the background.  Even for vacation snapshots, the quality wasn't good enough for me so I returned it.

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Got it as a gift for low tech MOL. She loves it. It's small and lightweight and takes great pics. Perfect alternative to filling up the phone space with pics and videos of your grand children ;-)

product_name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 180 Digital Camera w/Image Stabilization and Smart AUTO Mode (Red)
review: Feels like low quality all plastic product.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: There is no charge/sync cable included.  You cannot upload pictures to your computer without it.  Rip off!  They are not easy to find either.  It is not a simple mini display adapter cable.

product_name: Canon PowerShot SX420 Digital Camera w/ 42x Optical Zoom - Wi-Fi & NFC Enabled (Black)
review: Love the camera! It took great pictures while attending a concert since I was not permitted to bring my professional camera. I wished I had familiarized myself a little more with the camera first before shooting, so I got frustrated at times. Otherwise, it is a great camera to have.

It tells you what it wants to give you the best quality pictures...anyway me that's my opinion...I spent my money so I would not tell what is not worth my hard work. Canon sx 420  is what I wanted and I love it. Elegant ,light and beautiful like a lady I I'm ....especially that I got the red one in color 👍.

review: When deciding on a camera to purchase I wanted something that would be simple to use with a high picture resolution. This camera has been great so far, I am very pleased with it. product_name: Sony DSCW830 20.1 MP Digital Camera with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
review: This camera was purchased mostly to take pictures of rooms in a house, utilizing as much wide angle as I could get.  For that, it did an acceptable job, although I wish it had an even greater wide angle capability.  Resolution is more than needed, so no problem with that, but the lens was not as crisp and sharp as I had hoped for.  But what can one expect in a low-price point-and-shoot camera?  For top quality pictures, I use other cameras, but I didn't have one with interchangeable lens capability, and could not afford to get what I really wanted.  This camera was an adequate compromise, and will be O.K. for my purpose.

review: Bought this camera to replace an old snapshot camera. Really like this one! Great photos. Takes pictures quickly so you don't lose that special shot. Good quality too. Telephoto works great and is intuitive. Pull the lever toward you to get closer to your subject, push to decrease. Takes video too although I haven't used it for that yet. Lightweight, slim and compact. Great all around snapshot camera!

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: or snapshots use the auto settings.zoom in on them and you see the oil painting ISO boost artefacts.for perfect pictures go to program mode and limit ISO to 200it is in my pocket or camera bag all the time.for full zoom my shaky grip needs a lightweight tripod but it pays off in buckets.battery life incredible, I only charge it when I am bored!video is amazing for the size and pricethe motion shot function is not a real option, get the app for your phone instead.never use it with phone link or wifi so not much to say.

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: This camera is perfect for trips, parties, and really any thing that you would love to have a portable memory of. The pictures are credit card sized and are actually pretty cool because you can fit them into your wallet, but just as easily combine them for a collage or scrapbook or something. Every single place I've brought this thing, it's been a hit, and people love taking instant pictures that they can carry around with them everywhere. Almost like a portable photo booth. The only downside to this camera is that if you use it a whole lot, the film packs can get pretty expensive, and they sort of fluctuate on pricing from time to time. But hey, if a picture is worth a thousand words, then the memories made from the pictures are absolutely priceless!

product_name: HD Mini Digital Cameras,Point and Shoot Digital Cameras for Kids Teenagers Beginners-Travel,Camping,Outdoors,School (Black 2)
review: Ok some photos are a mass of white or dark but isn’t that part of the art when trying to get the shot. It’s all learning.,This camera is owned by an 8 year old and she loves it.
